name: Wat Pho
address: Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang,  Phra Nakhon,  Bangkok 10200
description: Wat Pho is also known as the Temple of the Reclining Buddha, it is located near the Grand Palace on Rattanakosin Island. The temple complex covers 80,000m² and is Bangkok's largest temple as well as being one of the oldest, it also has the most extensive collection of Buddha images out of all Thailand temples (over 1,000).

name: The Grand Palace
address: Na Phra Lan Rd, Phra Nakhon, Bangkok, 10200, Thailand
description: This is Bangkok's number one attraction. The Grand Palace complex was the official home of the King since 1782, however today the present King Rama IX lives at Chitralada Palace and the Grand Palace is used for important events and ceremonies.

name: Wat Arun
description: A Thai temple is called a Wat, this one is the Temple of Dawn and is named after the Indian God of Dawn. The temple is on the edge of the Chao Phraya River and is best seen from the east side of the river, especially at sundown.

name: Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall
description: Bangkok's Ananta Samakhom Throne Hall is located in the Dusit Palace, the hall was commissioned by King Rama V in 1906 and construction commenced in 1907 of the new reception hall. It took 8 years to complete and by that time Rama VI was the king.

name: Rose Garden
description: The Rose Garden Cultural Center is located about 30km out of Bangkok, it covers 75 acres and consists of landscaped gardens, a lake, picnic areas and restaurants on the water's edge. A visit to the Rose Garden gives you a chance to see typical rural life in Thailand.

name: Wat Benchamabophit
description: This Buddhist Temple Compound is also called the Marble Temple because of the Carrara marble used in the construction of the main temple. The temple has elements of European and Eastern architecture. The temple's name literally translates as the temple of the fifth king, as it was founded during the reign of Rama V.

name: Bangkok National Museum
address: 4 Na Phra That Alley, Bangkok 10200, Thailand
description: This museum is located in the 18th century former palace (Wang Na) or Front Palace of the Vice King. King Rama V opened the museum in 1874 to display his father (King Rama IV – Mongkut)'s private collection of antiques and art. The museum holds the largest collection of Thai art and artifacts in the country.

name: Siam Square
description: For shopping, accommodation, dining and entertainment head for Bangkok's Siam Square which is often referred to as the center of the city. The first of the large buildings which surround the Square was built in 1965 on property belonging to the nearby Chulalongkorn University.

name: Wat Traimit
address: 661 Chaoren Krung Road, Talad Noi, Samphanthawong, Bangkok 10100, Thailand
description: This temple is home to the Golden Buddha, it is situated in Bangkok's Chinatown. The Golden Buddha is the biggest solid-gold, seated Buddha in the world. It is almost 5 meters tall and weighs 5 and half tons.

name: Asiatique
address: 2194 Charoenkrung Rd., Wat Prayakrai, Bangkoleam, Bangkok 10120, Thailand
description: This is a night bazaar mall along the riverfront; it is a unique blend of a mall and the Asian nighttime bazaar experience. The shopping complex is located where the old trading port once stood and for this reason the designers chose the theme of riverside warehouses, and also used some of the original warehouse structures.

name: Lumpini Park
description: This park was established in 1920 and intended as an exhibition venue for Thai handcrafts and flower displays. It is Bangkok's green lung bringing a breath of fresh air and a break from the urban jungle and noise. The park is named after Buddha's birthplace in Nepal.

name: Siam Paragon
description: This shopping center promotes itself as the "Pride of Bangkok" it is one of the most popular malls in the city offering both shopping and entertainment opportunities to wealthy shoppers. The Siam Paragon is one of the largest shopping complexes in Asia.

name: Wat Suthat
description: This temple is one of 10 royal temples in Bangkok and is of the highest grade of temples. It is fames for being one of the oldest and largest of the city's temples and for the ornate roof silhouette; large golden Buddha statue; the tall red swing in front of the temple and the temple's intricate 2565m² of frescoes.

name: Museum of Siam
address: National Discovery Museum Institute,  Phra Borom Maha Ratchawang,  Phra Nakhon,  Bangkok 10200
description: This museum shows the development and history of the Thai culture, innovative interactive displays, games and storytelling techniques were used in the museum. The museum building is a neoclassical house, once the Commerce Ministry building.

name: Chatuchak Weekend market
address: Kampaengphet 3 Road, Khwaeng Lat Yao, Khet Chatuchak, Bangkok, Thailand
description: The largest market in Thailand, and one of the largest weekend markets in the world, is spread over 0.14km² and has approximately 15,000 stalls. The stalls line multiple lanes and narrow walkways. Although it is a weekend market the western section, called Jutujak Plaza is also open during the week.

name: Wat Saket
address: Ban Bat, Pom Prap Sattru Phai, Bangkok 10100
description: This temple stands out with its 58 meter high golden chedi on the artificial hill top of the Golden Mount overlooking the temple complex at the base of the mound. The Wat dates back to the Ayutthaya period and was later restored by King Rama I.

name: Wat Phra Singh
address: Thanon Samlarn Lane 1, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
description: Wat Phra Singh dates back to the 14th century and is considered one of the most beautiful and revered temples in the walled city. The temple houses a couple of medieval Buddha statues that attract thousands of visitors every year.

name: Wat Chedi Luang
address: 141/6 Soi Thonon Rachadamnoen, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
description: You may miss out some of the Buddhist temples in and around the historic city of Chiang Mai while exploring North Thailand, but do not miss out the magnificent Wat Chedi Luang. The name denotes Temple of the big stupa. Located at the heart of the city, this grandiose ruined temple was set up possibly in the 14th century.

name: Wat Suan Dok
address: Sriwichai Rd, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
description: Wat Suan Dok lies on the West of Chiang Mai and is one of the oldest temples in the history of mankind. It is famous for its numerous pagodas or white chedis. Wat Suan Dok simply means ‘flower garden temple’. This temple was once used as a royal flower garden by the many rulers of the city.

name: Wat Chiang Man
address: 270 Ratchapakhinai Rd, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
description: Wat Chiang Man also known as Wat Chiang Mun is a Buddhist temple located in one of the oldest city in the Northern end of Thailand. Wat Chiang Man was built by Mangrai, back in the 1297 CE. This was the first temple in Wiang Nopburi a popular neighborhood in Chiang Mai.

name: Wat Umong
address: Su Thep, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200, Thailand
description: Wat Umong is a unique tunnel temple which attracts heavy footfalls despite the presence of several other Buddhist temples in the vicinity. Its origins date back to the 13th century. The temple that is barely a few feet away from the picturesque Doi Suthep Mountain is surrounded by lush green forest on all sides.

name: Warorot
address: Chang Moi, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50300, Thailand
description: Talat Warorot or the Warorot is one of the most popular markets in Chiang Mai renowned for its stalls selling sumptuous Thai snacks.

name: Elephant Nature Park
address: 209/2 Sridom Chai Road, Chiang Mai 50100, Thailand
description: Beyond the concrete jungle of high rise buildings lies a beautiful lush green jungle that is home to a number of animals and birds. Within this beautiful forest is Chiang Mai’s Elephant Nature Park – a tranquil and serene camp where you can interact with the majestic elephants in their own habitat.

name: Doi Pui
description: Doi Pui is a village which is a part of Doi Suthep - Pui National Park and lies at a height of 1.685 meters above sea level which makes it the number one highest peak in the National Park of Doi Suthep - Pui.

name: Doi Inthanon
address: 2 Tambon Ban Luang, Amphoe Chom Thong, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50160, Thailand
description: Don Inthanon is a National Park which is vast in terms of surface area and takes up a staggering 482 square kilometers.

name: Huay Tung Tao
description: Situated North-West of Chiang Mai city, in Mae Rim district, Huay Tung Tao is one of the most popular destinations of Chiang Mai, and for good reason. You will be enveloped with peace and calm from the minute you arrive at the banks of this beautiful water body.

name: Angkor Wat
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Angkor Wat is one of the seven modern wonders of the world. Situated nearly 6km north of Siem Reap, the huge complex was constructed in the 1100s and thought to have taken 30 years to finish. The temple is a sign of dedication to the Hindu god Vishnu. It is the biggest memorial of the Angkor group.

name: Banteay Kdei
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Banteay Kdei is located southeast of Ta Prohm and denotes ‘A Citadel of Chambers.’ The temple dates back to mid 12th century and was erected during the reign of Jayavarman VII. Built in Bayon style of architecture, Banteay Kdei is designed on the lines of Preah Khan and Ta Prohm.

name: Bayon Temple
address: Angkor Thom, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: One of the most iconic monuments in Cambodia, Bayon Temple is located in the city of Angkor Thom. The tower of the Bayon is accessible through the east entrance. The temple is exactly in the middle of Angkor Thom. Unlike most temples, Bayon does not have any moat or wall around it.

name: Preah Khan
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Preah Khan is one of most prominent temple complexes in Angkor. It is located on the northern corner of the Angkor Thorn. The temple was constructed in 12th century at the behest of King Jayavarman VII. It is spread over 56 hectares. It was earlier known as Nagara Jayasri, meaning Holy City of Victory.

name: Ta Prohm
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: One of the most prolific temples in Cambodia, Ta Prohm is located one kilometer east of Angkor Thom and is on the southern side of the East Baray. It is well known for its surrounding flora and the trees growing out of its ruins. The temple was included in the UNESCO World Heritage List in 1992.

name: Pre Rup
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: This Hindu temple located in Angkor was the state temple of Khmer King Rajendravarman. It is built in traditional temple mountain style and combines sandstone, laterite and brick for the construction purpose. The temple dates back to 10th century.

name: Angkor National Museum
address: Charles De Gaulle, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Angkor National Museum is a repository of artifacts dating back to the Khmer empire. It is home to artifacts borrowed from several museums, thus offering you a unique opportunity to experience the region’s rich history and culture.

name: Landmine Museum
address: Angkor Vat Archeological Park, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Landmine Museum is a part of the Cambodian Landmine Museum and Relief Facility, located in the city of Siem Reap. The museum is around 25km north of Siem Reap and is on the south of the Banteay Srey Temple complex. You can visit this museum on a trip to Angkor National Park. The museum was officially opened in May, 2007.

name: Baphuon
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Located in Angkor Thom, this temple was built in the 11th century. This three tiered temple was designated as the state temple of Udayadityavarman II and is dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva. However, the bas reliefs of the temple depict the carvings of several other gods as well such as Vishnu.

name: Ta Som
description: The temple of Ta Som is located north east of Angkor Thom and east of Neak Pean. It was built in the 12th century under the reign of King Jayavarman VII. This monument may seem small in terms of size but has prominent historical significance.

name: Phnom Bakheng
address: Peach Palace Ln, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Bakheng is Hindu-Buddhist temple built in traditional mountain temple style. The temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is believed to have been built in the 9th century under the reign of King Yasovarman. It is located on the top of a hill which offers an excellent view of a spectacular sunrise and stunning sunset.

name: Neak Pean
description: Neak Pean is an artificial island that features a Buddhist temple. The site was built during the reign of Jayavarman VII. It is also known as the Mebon of the Preah Kahn baray due to the similarity between the two.

name: Banteay Srei
description: Banteay Srei is a 10th century temple dedicated to the Hindu God Shiva. The temple is located near the hill of Phnom Dei, 25 kilometer to the main group of temples. The temple has a unique look with its red sandstone construction. It also features elaborate carvings on the walls.

name: Roluos Group
address: Peach Palace Ln, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: The Roluos Group of temples consists of Lolei, Preah Ko, Prei Monti and Bakong temples. The group is situated 11 kilometers southeast of Siem Reap Market. The cluster is spread over the area of 3 kilometer on the eastern edge of the Great Lake.

name: Tonle Sap Lake
description: No visit to Siem Reap is complete without visiting Tonle Sap Lake. Surrounded by five different provinces, Tonle Sap not only is a scenic tourist destination, but also a source of livelihood for people in the surrounding areas. It is also the largest fresh water lake in South East Asia.

name: Beng Melea
description: Beng Mealea is located around 68km northeast of Siem Reap. This temple is roughly based on the same floor plan as is seen in Angkor Wat but yet has a unique appeal. It was built in the 12th century under the reign of King Suryavarman II.

name: Ta Keo
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Ta Keo is one of the hidden gems of Cambodia. Unlike other temples in the country, it is still off the beaten path and hence offers you a more relaxed time. Here you can explore the cultural and historical heritage in a relatively calm manner. The temple also provides a stunning view of its surroundings from its top.

name: Angkor Thom
address: Unnamed Road, Krong Siem Reap, Cambodia
description: Angkor Thom has the distinction of being the last capital city of the Khmer empire. The city was founded in the twelfth century by King Jayavarman VII. It spans 9 square kilometer area and has several notable monuments including the Bayon and Jayavarman’s state temple.

name: East Mebon
description: East Mebon was built in the 10th century by King Rajendravarman and is situated on an island in Eastern Baray. It is built in a mountain temple style, in line with other monuments in the area. However, the temple of East Mebon is only accessible via boat.

name: Burj Khalifa Observation Deck
address: 1 Mohammed Bin Rashid Blvd., Downtown Dubai Access from the lower ground level of Dubai Mall
description: On the southern end of Sheikh Zayed Road rises the Burj Khalifa but you don't need to be standing near it to see it. The stunning building is the tallest in the world. After five years of construction it reaches 828 meters and looks like a shinny needle.

name: Dubai Fountains
address: Burj Khalifa Lake,  Lower Ground Waterfront outside Dubai Mall
description: The Dubai Fountain show is the world's largest fountain show of its kind. It is located on the 12 hectare man-made Burj Lake outside the Dubai Mall on the Lower Ground Waterfront Promenade. The fountain was devised by the same team which created the Las Vegas fountains outside the Bellagio Hotel.

name: Dubai Mall
address: Downtown Dubai near Souk Al Bahar Bridge, Dubai between Sheikh Zayed Road and Financial Centre Road
description: Dubai Mall is just one of the mind boggling malls in Dubai where you could spend the entire day shopping, dining and enjoying amazing places of entertainment. This is the world's largest mall in terms of total area (1,124,000m²) and it has 1,200 stores including the world's largest candy store.

name: Dubai Aquarium
address: The Dubai Mall, Doha Street, off 1st interchange - Sheikh Zayed Road, Dubai
description: Not to be confused with Dolphin Bay at The Palm where there are only dolphins and activities involving one-on-one encounters with the creatures. This site is located in the Dubai Mall and is home to over 33,000 species of aquatic creatures.

name: Dubai Gold Souk
address: Khalid bin Waleed Road, Al Dhagaya, Deira, Dubai
description: Shopping in general is one of the top activities for visitors to Dubai and visiting the Dubai markets is another. Dubai is famous for its low cost gold and you can really find bargains here.

name: Bastakia-Al Bastakiah
address: Between Bur Dubai waterfront and Al Mankhool Road, Al Fahidi Historic District, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
description: Al Bastakiya or Bastakia is a delightful historical quarter of Dubai with many narrow winding lanes, traditional wind tower architecture and old buildings. Bastakiya was renamed the Al Fahidi Historic District in 2012 and is situated on the Bur Dubai side of the Dubai Creek.

name: Dubai Spice Souk
address: Sikkat Al Khail Road, Al Ras, Dubai
description: This market is also called the Grand Souq, Deira Old Souq or Deira Spice Souq as it is located in Deira next to the Gold Souq. The market is a covered group of narrow lanes with many small shops spilling out on to the walkway with sacks of every kind of spice you can imagine.

name: Centre for Cultural Understanding
address: 26 Al Mussallah Road, Al Fahidi District, Bur Dubai
description: This is a great place to start if you want to understand the Islamic culture and specifically the culture of the Gulf and the UAE.

name: Grand Mosque
address: Ali bin Talib Street, Bur Dubai; between the Textile Souq and the Dubai Museum
description: This mosque is certainly not the most beautiful and unfortunately non-Muslims cannot enter. However it is special because the original version of the mosque was the oldest of all the mosques in the UAE.

name: Dubai Museum at Al Fahidi Fort
address: Al Fahidi Road, Dubai, opposite Grand Mosque
description: The Dubai Museum is the city's primary museum. It is housed within the historic Al Fahidi Fort which was constructed in 1787 and is the oldest building in the city. The fort was built to defend the city from attacks.

name: Emirates Towers
description: The Emirate Towers are two of the magnificent buildings worth seeing in Dubai. They are located on Sheikh Zayed Road. One of the towers hold a business hotel managed by the Jumeirah hotel group and the other is the Emirate Office Tower. The hotel offers luxury service and accommodation to business travelers.

name: Heritage and Diving Village
address: Al-Shindagha Road, towards the mouth of the Creek, Dubai
description: The Heritage Village is a recreated traditional Emirate village located next to the Diving Village which highlights the traditional pearl diving trade of Dubai. The site is in the Al Shindagha Historical Neighborhood on the bank of the Dubai Creek. In the Heritage Village thatch roofed mud brick buildings have been erected.

name: Burj Al Arab
description: The Tower of the Arabs calls itself a 7 star hotel; it is of course a luxury 5 star hotel and is managed by the Jumeirah Group. The Burj Al Arab is the 3rd tallest hotel in the world and is best known for its aesthetic shape resembling the sail of a traditional dhow boat.

name: Global Village
address: Exit 37, Sheikh Mohammed Bin Zayed Road and Emirates Road, Dubailand, Dubai
description: Global Village is a fantastic attraction in Dubai but take note it is only open each season from November to April. During the open season the village is open daily. The Global Village was first launched in 1997 in a different location and since 2005 has been at its present location on Sheikh Mohammad bin Zayed Road, exit 37.

name: Mall of the Emirates
description: In Dubai shopping is one of the major pastimes but Dubai malls are also places of entertainment with attractions to keep you busy the entire day. The Mall of the Emirates cost an estimated AED 800 million to construct and was opened in 2005.

name: Jumeirah Mosque
address: 45 Jumeria Road, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
description: This is the city's most photographed mosque and the only one where non-Muslim visitors can take a tour inside. Tours are arranged by the Sheikh Mohammed Center for Cultural Understanding. All you need to do is arrive at the mosque at 9:45am Saturday-Thursday.

name: Al Ahmadiya School
address: Al Ahmadiya St, Deira, Al Ras, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
description: This historic school building is one of the few remaining examples of fine Emirati architecture. It is located walking distance from the Heritage House and the Gold Souk in the Al Ras area. The former school is now home to a museum focused on the educational history of Dubai.

name: Wild Wadi
address: Jumeirah Beach Road, Umm Suqeim 3, Dubai
description: This is Dubai's main water park, it is outdoor and located close to the Burj Al Arab and Jumeirah Beach Hotel. The water park theme is an Arabian adventure called the tale of Juha and includes the familiar figure of Sinbad the Sailor. The park has 30 rides for all ages.

name: Ski Dubai
address: Mall of Emirates, Shiekh Zayed Road, Dubai
description: Ski Dubai is an indoor snow resort at the Mall of the Emirates; the site offers all the exciting activities that you would find in a European ski resort. The theme of the site is wintery snow-covered mountains. The attractions include tube slides, a sightseeing chairlift, tobogganing, and snow to play in.

name: Madinat Jumeirah
description: Madinat Jumeirah is a huge resort complex which includes two boutique hotels, 29 private summer houses, more than 40 restaurants, bars, conference facilities, a 1,000 seat amphitheatre, the Madinat Arena entertainment venue, spas and Souk Madinat Jumeirah.

name: Dubai Ice Rink
address: Dubai Mall, Downtown Dubai, near Souk Al Bahar Bridge
description: The Dubai Ice Rink is located in the Dubai Mall and is a multi-purpose venue, its massive size can accommodate up to 2,000 people when converted to its maximum size. The ice itself is Olympic size; the facilities are of world-class standard and skate hire is free.

name: The Lost Chambers Aquarium
description: The Lost Chambers Aquarium is one of the many attractions at the Atlantis, The Palm resort. The aquarium theme is the lost city of Atlantis and it is home to 65,000 marine animals. The site has a maze of tunnels which visitors can walk through seeing the aquarium tanks.

name: Aquaventure
address: Crescent Road, Palm Hotel, Atlantis Monorail Station, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
description: Aquaventure is part of Atlantis, The Palm resort and guests of the hotel get to use the park for free. Within the resort you can also visit the Dolphin Bay, Lost Chambers Aquarium, Sea Lion Point and the Marine Animal Adventure.

name: Dubai Creek Park
address: Between Al Maktoum and Al Garhoud Bidge, Bur, Dubai. Several entrances including off Riyadh Rd., Umm Hurair.
description: Creekside or Creek Park is located alongside Dubai Creek on the Bur Dubai side in the heart of the city. This is one of Dubai's oldest parks and it is very popular.

name: Dubai Creek
address: Near Dubai Creek Park, Dubai. Creek cruises usually have hotel pick-up service.
description: The saltwater Creek which cuts through Dubai dividing it into the older section of Dubai Bur and the section where the luxury skyscraper hotels are in Deira is an integral part of the city and all visitors will cross it at some point. The Creek runs from the Ras Al Khor Wildlife Sanctuary to the sea.

name: Osaka Castle
description: The famous 16th century Osaka Castle, situated on grounds which cover 15 acres, is known as one of Japan’s most famous landmarks. Work started on the castle by the orders of Toyomoto Hideyoshi, the great warrior and politician from the Sengoku period on the site of an Ikko-ikki temple.

name: Dotonbori
description: One of Osaka’s busiest, brightest and most bustling tourist attractions is Dotonbori neighborhood, running parallel to the Dotonbori canal from the Dotonboribashi Bridge to the Nipponbashi Bridge.

name: Floating Garden Observatory
description: Located between the two towers which make up Osaka’s Umeda Sky Building, the Floating Garden Observatory (also known as the Sky Garden) provides visitors with one of the best views of the city.

name: Shitennoji Temple
address: 1-11-18 Shitennoji, Tennoji Ward, Osaka, Osaka Prefecture 543-0051, Japan
description: One of oldest temples in Japan, Shitennoji was built in 593 by Prince Shotoku who was in favor of introducing Buddhism to the country. The original 6th century design and architecture has been lovingly preserved, and at time reconstructed over the years since the temple’s buildings have burned down a number of times.

name: Nakanoshima
address: Japan, 〒530-0005 Osaka Prefecture, Osaka, 北区中之島１丁目
description: Dividing the Kyu-Yodo River into the Tosabori River and the Dojima River is a 3 km long sandbank known as Nakanoshima (“Island in the Center”).

name: Osaka Aquarium
description: One of the largest aquariums in the world, the Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan showcases the aquatic creatures of the Pacific Rim in an excellent recreation of their natural habitats.

name: Universal Studios Japan
address: 2 Chome-1-33 Sakurajima, Konohana Ward, Osaka, Osaka Prefecture 554-0031, Japan
description: Similar to the Universal Orlando Resort, Universal Studios Japan is a theme park located in Osaka which attracts around 8 million visitors each year, and is the fifth most popular amusement or theme park in the world.

name: Sumiyoshi Taisha
description: The ancient Shinto shrine of Sumiyoshi Taisha was founded in 211 and is considered the main shrine of all Sumiyoshi shrines in the country – of which there are about 200.

name: Museum of History
description: Opened in 2001, the Osaka Museum of History offers visitors a fascinating glimpse into the history of the city.

name: Tennoji Park
description: Tennoji Park is a large park situated in Tennoji-ku, Osaka, sprawled across 28.8 hectares of land. The public park was created in 1909 and incorporates the Keitakuen traditional Japanese garden, the Osaka Municipal Museum of Art and the Chausuyamba Tomb.

name: Shinsaibashi
description: Considered the best area to shop in Osaka, Shinsaibashi attracts tourists and locals from morning to night. The area lends its name from the landmark Shinsaibashi Bridge that was built in 1622, and rebuilt and improved on over the centuries.

name: National Museum of Art
description: Known by its English acronym NMAO, or the National Museum of Art Osaka, this innovative Japanese institution is located on the island of Nakanoshima.

name: Nara Park
description: Located around one hour from Osaka is Nara Park, home to over 1,200 free roaming deer and a number of important religious and historic landmarks.

name: The Imperial Palace
description: The imperial residence is a complex of buildings spread out across 3.41km² of lush landscaped gardens and grounds, it includes the palace itself, a museum, archive, administrative offices and the private residence of the present imperial family.

name: Shibuya
description: The name Shibuya hasn't got the word "buy" in it for nothing! The area is one of Tokyo's shopping Meccas. The popular shopping and restaurant district centers around the Shibuya train station but the large ward extends to include sites like Yoyogi Park, Takashita-Dori, Meiji Jingu, Harajuku, Sendagaya and Omotesando.

name: Imperial Palace East Garden
description: The Imperial Palace East Gardens are located in the inner palace area where Tokugawa Shogun (1603-1867) and later emperor Meiji (1868-1888) once resided in Edo Castle.

name: Sensoji Temple
description: This is Tokyo's oldest temple and it holds a special place in the heart of the people. The history of the temple begins in 628 when a statue of the Bodhisattva Kannon Buddha was drawn up in fishermen's nets in the then capital of Asuka.

name: Meiji Jingu Shrine
description: Meiji Jingu is a Shinto shrine, Shinto is considered Japan's most ancient religion based on harmony and traditional values. In the Shinto faith the divine spirit or Kami is found in nature and righteous people.

name: Ueno Park
description: Located in the Ueno district this is one of the city's most important parks. The park was opened in 1873 on land that had been part of the Kan'ei-ji Temple grounds. It was one of the first public parks in the city, and like many things during the early Meiji Period there were Western influences.

name: Shinjuku Gyoen
description: This public park was constructed as the garden of a feudal lord's mansion during the Edo Era; it was completed in 1906 and is Tokyo's largest park and perhaps most beautiful park. Following WWII the 144 acre park was open to the public.

name: Tokyo Tower
description: This is a telecommunications tower and site of an observation deck in the Minato district. The tower is a landmark of the city and symbol of ingenuity and triumph, it was constructed in 1958.  The tower rises 333 meters from the ground and is the 2nd tallest structure in Japan.

name: Mt Fuji
address: Mount Fuji, Kitayama, Fujinomiya, Shizuoka, Japan
description: Mount Fuji is the highest mountain in Japan reaching a height of 3,776 meters. It is situated on the border of Shizuoka and Yamanashi prefectures just 100km west of Tokyo. Fuji is part of the Fuji-Hakone-Izu National Park and is surrounded by five lakes and pristine countryside.

name: Akihabara
description: This is an area in Tokyo best known for its high-tech shops, entertainment venues and dining opportunities. Akihabara is nicknamed "Electric Town" as the stores here are predominantly electronic and gadget stores. Akihabara is located in the Chiyoda ward.

name: Tsukiji Fish Market
description: This market has been around since the 16th century, and was once responsible for providing fresh fish to Edo Castle. It is the largest wholesale seafood market in the world; each day 400 types of seafood are handled amounting to over 700,000 metric tons of seafood a year.

name: HamaRikyu Garden
description: These beautiful gardens were a branch of Edo Castle during the reign of Tokugawa Shogunate and served as hunting grounds.

name: Tokyo National Museum
description: This museum was established in 1871 as a section of the Ministry of Education. It has changed names and location several times and in 1882 arrived at the present location in Ueno Park. It is the oldest and largest museum in Japan.

name: Harajuku
description: Harajuku is not only a shopping district it is also the name of a specific fashion style associated with young Japanese girls. Harajuku is located between Shinjuku and Shibuya from Harajuku Station to Omotesando area.

name: Tokyo Skytree
description: This is the tallest building in Japan; it rises 634 meters from the ground and functions as a television broadcasting tower and observation point. It is the tallest tower in the world and the 2nd tallest structure after Burj Khalifa. The tower is located in Tokyo SkyTree Town in Sumida City Ward.

name: Ginza
description: Ginza is one of Tokyo's many shopping areas; it is distinctively up-market, boasts the most expensive real estate in Tokyo and is packed with all the big names of fashion. The area is centered on the Ginza 4-Chrome intersection in the Chuo ward not far from the Imperial Palace.

name: Shinjuku
description: Shinjuku is one of the 23 wards of Tokyo, an important commercial, entertainment and transportation hub as well as a hot spot for shopping. The area is a cacophony of bright neon lights, traffic and people. The world's busiest train station is located here at Shinjuku Station.

name: Edo-Tokyo Museum
description: This museum was opened in 1993 to preserve the historic heritage of Edo-Tokyo.  The museum exhibits focus on Tokyo's Edo period, culture and history; it follows the city's progress through the Meiji and Showa periods up until recent years.

name: Yasukuni Shrine
description: This Shinto shrine is located in central Tokyo and is dedicated to fallen soldiers. The shrine was originally erected in Kudan, Tokyo in 1869 on the orders of Emperor Meiji, it was renamed Yasukuni Shrine in 1879 and intended to honor those who have died fighting for Japan.

name: Mori Art Museum
description: This contemporary art museum is situated on the 53rd floor of Roppongi Hills Mori Tower. The museum was founded by Minoru Mori, a real estate developer who was responsible for the Roppongi Hills complex where the Mori Tower is located. The interior architecture of the galleries was designed by architect Richard Gluckman.

name: National Art Centre
description: This art exhibition facility in Roppongi is one of 5 institutions under the umbrella of the Independent administrative Institution. The center has one of the largest exhibition areas in Japan covering 14,000m² of exhibition space spread over 3 floors and a basement level. All of this space is used for temporary exhibitions.

name: Kinkaku-ji
description: Kinkaku-ji Temple or the Temple of the Golden Pavilion is one of 17 monuments on the Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto list and one of the most popular temples in Japan. It is a Zen Buddhist temple built towards the end of the 14th century as the retirement villa of the shogun, Ashikaga Yoshimitsu.

name: Nijo Castle
address: Takeya-cho Dori, Nij?j?ch?, Nakagy?-ku, Ky?to-shi, Ky?to-fu 604-8301, Japan
description: The Nijo Castle (Nijo-jo) in Kyoto was built by Tokugawa Ieyasu, the first Shogun of the Edo Period, in 1603. It was completed by his grandson 23 years later. After the Tokugawa Shogunate fell in 1867, the castle was used as an Imperial Palace. Later it was converted into a historic site and opened to the public.

name: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
description: Officially known as Otowa-san Kiyomizu-dera (Pure Water Temple in English), this is a temple in the eastern part of Kyoto. It is one of the most popular temples in all of Japan and recognized by UNESCO as a World Heritage site since 1994. Founded in 778 in the early Heian Period, the current main hall was built in 1633.

name: Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine
address: 68 Fukakusa Yabunouchicho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture 612-0882, Japan
description: The Fushimi Inari-taisha Shrine is one of the most important Shinto shrines in Japan and is located in Southern Kyoto on the mountain of Inari-san. It is considered one of the most popular, and definitely one of the most important, shrines dedicated to the Shinto god of rice, Inari.

name: Yasaka Shrine
description: The Yasaka Shrine is a popular tourist destination in Kyoto and located between the Gion and Higashiyama districts. The shrine is also known as the Gion Shrine and was built over 1350 years ago. This is the shrine where the immensely popular Gion-Matsuri festival is held in July every year.

name: Chion-in
description: The Chionin Temple is the main temple of one of the most popular Japanese Buddhist sects, the Jodo sect. This massive temple is located in Higashiyama district of Kyoto and a number of structures here have been declared Important Cultural Properties of Japan.

name: Nishiki Market
description: Referred to as Kyoto’s Kitchen, Nishiki Market or Nishiki Ichiba is a must-visit tourist destination for all in Kyoto. This market has a history that is centuries old – some estimate it to be over 400 years old – and is spread currently across 5 lively blocks.

name: Kyoto Imperial Palace
description: The Kyoto Imperial Palace or Kyoto Gosho is one of the most important monuments in Kyoto and all of Japan. It was where the family of the Emperor of Japan resided till 1868, when Kyoto was the capital of Japan. The Imperial Palace can be found in the Kyoto Imperial Park (Kyoto Gyoen).

name: Sanjusangendo Hall
description: The Sanjusengen-do Temple is a well-known temple located in the Higashiyama ward of Kyoto. The temple name means ‘Hall with Thirty Three Spaces between Columns’ and was built in 1164 by Taiji no Kiyomori as per the decree of Emperor Go-Shirakawa. It is officially known as Rengeo-in (The Hall of the Lotus King).

name: Otagi Nenbutsuji Temple
address: 2-5 Fukatani-cho, Saga-Toriimoto, Ukyo-ward, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture 616-8439
description: Along with the large number of very famous shrines in Kyoto there are a few smaller and equally beautiful shrines; one of the latter is the Otagi Nenbutsuji Temple. Located close to the Arashiyama area, this temple is quite old and is steeped in the history of the place.

name: Pontocho Alley
description: Pontocho is a lively neighborhood in Kyoto on the banks of the Kamo River. The district was established way back in 1670 during the time of the Edo government. When you walk through the main alley that forms Pontocho today, you see on either side an unending line of restaurants, cafes, bars, and shops.

name: Kyoto National Museum
description: The Kyoto National Museum is a very popular tourist attraction in Kyoto. It was founded in 1897 for the purpose of restoring and conserving art in Japan. It is one of the oldest museums in Japan and showcases a massive collection of Japanese and Oriental art works; there are over 12,000 works on display here.

name: Kyoto Tower
description: Kyoto Tower is an iconic landmark of Kyoto that stands out in sharp and reasonable contrast against the beautiful ancient heritage of the city. The tower is built in the shape of a candle and stands a staggering 131 meters tall. It is located just across Kyoto Station and is visible from any part of Kyoto.

name: Toji
description: The Toji Temple (originally named Kyo-o-gokukuji) of Kyoto is located close to Kyoto Station and is an important landmark of Kyoto. The temple was built in 794 at the start of the Heian Period towards fulfillment of an Imperial Decree.

name: Petronas Twin Towers
address: Persiaran Petronas, Kuala Lumpur City Centre, 50088 Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The Petronas Twin Towers are the world’s tallest twin towers reaching a height of 451.9 meters and with 88 above-ground floors and 39 elevators. The buildings were designed by Argentinean architect Cesar Pelli and cost US$5.6 billion to complete.

name: Petaling Street
address: Jalan Petaling, 50000 Kuala Lumpur, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: Petaling Street is a famous shopping area in Kuala Lumpur’s China Town. This is the place to come for great ethnic food, cheap eats, bargain shopping, groceries, fresh produce, cheap clothing, unusual souvenirs and interesting Chinese items.

name: Kuala Lumpur Bird Park
address: 920  Jalan Cenderawasih, Taman Tasik Perdana 50480, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The place to see Malaysia’s amazing feathered friends is here at Kuala Lumpur Bird Park. The park is set within a tropical paradise in Lake Gardens Park (Perdana Botanic Gardens). The park has the largest free-flight walk-through aviary in the world and covers 20.9 acres.

name: KLCC Park
address: Jalan Ampang, Kuala Lumpur  City Center, Kuala Lumpur, 50450, Malaysia
description: KLCC Park is a 50 acre tropical landscaped green space in the city center adjacent to the Petronas Twin Towers and Suria KLCC shopping center. The park was created to provide greenery for the towers. The park has a unique theme and concept which focuses on water features and public works of art.

name: Aquaria KLCC
address: Kuala Lumpur Convention Center Complex, Kuala Lumpur City Center, 50088, Malaysia
description: This popular aquarium is situated on the basement level of the Kuala Lumpur Convention Center. The aquarium has over 5,000 different exhibits of aquatic animals and some land-bound animals from Malaysia and around the world. The aquarium is spread over 5574m² on two levels and features a 90 meter long underwater tunnel.

name: Sultan Abdul Samad Building
description: By far one of the most stunning buildings in the city this magnificent architectural gem is located on Merdeka Square. It was constructed in 1897; named in honor of the Sultan of Selangor at that time.

name: Merdeka Square
description: Also known as Independence Square or Dataran Merdeka this is a centrally located public square close to the Gombak River and the Jamek Mosque. Many of the buildings facing on to the square played a role in Kuala Lumpur history.

name: Perdana Botanical (Lake) Garden
address: Tun Abdul Razak Heritage Park, Jalan Kebun Bunga, Tasik Perdana, 55100, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
description: This attraction was formerly known as the Kuala Lumpur Lake Gardens and the Taman Tasik Perdana. It is located in Heritage Park of Kuala Lumpur forming an important green oasis in the urban jungle.

name: National Mosque
address: Jalan Perdana, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The city’s main mosque can accommodate 15,000 worshipers and covers 53,000m² including landscaped gardens, reflecting pools, fountains and the structure itself. The mosque was built in 1965 following the independence from Britain in 1957and a boom in construction of public buildings.

name: Islamic Art Museum Kuala Lumpur
address: Jalan Lembah Perdana, 50480, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
description: This museum is often overlooked by tourists but it is still ranked the second most visited attraction in Kuala Lumpur. The museum exhibits the art of the predominant religion in Malaysia – Islam. The museum galleries have a unique design as they all flow into one another in a continual open space.

name: Batu Caves
address: Batu Caves, Sri Subramaniam Temple, 68100 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The Batu Caves are in a limestone outcrop 13km north of Kuala Lumpur. The caves are said to date back 400 million years and were originally used as primitive homes for the indigenous Temuan people. Today the caves are used as Hindu temples dedicated to the Lord Murugan.

name: Kuala Lumpur Tower
address: Menara Kuala Lumpur, #2 Jalan Puncha, off Jalan P. Ramlee, 50250, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: KL Tower or Menara Kuala Lumpur is a broadcasting and telecommunications tower which soars 421 meters from the ground. It is built on Pineapple Hill (Bukit Nanas) which makes it appear even taller than it actually is.

name: Royal Selangor Visitor Center
address: Royal Selangor Visitor Center, 4 Jalan Usahawan 6, Setapak Jaya, 53300, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia.
description: Royal Selangor is one of the world’s largest manufacturer of pewter. The company was founded in 1885 by a Chinese immigrant, Yong Koon and went on to become an industrial giant. The factory now has a Visitor Center where you can learn about Malaysia’s traditional crafts including pewter.

name: Rumah Penghulu Abu Seman
description: The historic house is on the grounds of the Heritage Malaysia Society - Badan Warisan Malaysia, an organization which works to conserve and preserve Malaysian heritage properties. Together with the Rumah Penghulu abu Seman house the main building on the grounds is a colonial bungalow now housing the Heritage Center.

name: Jamek Mosque
address: Jalan Tun, Perak, Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The Jamek Mosque or Masjid Jamek stands where the Sungei Klang and Sungei Gombak rivers meet; it is also where Kuala Lumpur history began. It was here that the original settlers built their huts before trekking into the jungle to mine for tin.

name: Sri Mahamariamman Temple
address: 163, Jalan Tun H S Lee, 50000 Kuala Lumpur, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: Kuala Lumpur’s oldest Hindu temple was founded in 1873 and was rebuilt in 1968 but the Raja Gopuram from the original structure was preserved and is the main attraction of this temple. The Raja Gopuram is a tower of sculptures in bright colors positioned above the entrance of the temple.

name: Sin Sze Si Ya Temple
description: This beautiful structure is a temple and a cultural hall; it is said to be the oldest Taoist temple in the city and is also known as the Sze Yah Temple. This landmark was constructed in 1864 thanks to Kapitan Yap Ah Loy (1837-1885), a prominent Chinese businessman and founding father of Kuala Lumpur.

name: Thean Hou Temple
address: 65 Persiaran Endah, off Jalan Syed Putra (Formerly Lornie Road), Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: This is one of the largest temple complexes in Southern East Asia; it covers 1.67acres and is home to the 6 storey Thean Hou Temple. The temple is a modern addition to Kuala Lumpur; it was completed in 1989 and dedicated to the sea goddess Mazu giving it the additional name Temple of the Goddess of Heaven.

name: Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park
description: Located next to the Lake Gardens and the Bird Park this attraction is perfect for the whole family. Here you can enter butterfly free-flight aviaries featuring species from around the world. The site covers 7432m² of landscaped gardens with exotic plants and is home to more than 5,000 butterflies representing 120 species.

name: Kuala Lumpur City Gallery
address: 27 Jalan Raja, Dataran Merdeka, 50050 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
description: The gallery is housed within an historic building dating back to 1899 located between the City Library and History Museum on Merdeka Square. Here you can visit the Tourist Information Center housed in the building and enjoy a number of exhibits and attractions. The gallery focuses on past and future Kuala Lumpur.

name: Hagia Sophia
address: Sultanahmet Mh., Ayasofya Meydani, Fatih/Istanbul, Turkey
description: This is Istanbul’s top attraction; the Church of the Holy Wisdom (Hagia Sophia) began as a Byzantine church, then it became a mosque during the Ottoman Era and today is a museum. It is without doubt a great architectural wonder.

name: Topkapi Palace
description: In 1453 Mehmed the Conqueror took Istanbul and in 1460 began the construction of his grand palace complex which was completed in 1478.The complex covers 700,000m² and stands on the same site as an earlier Byzantine Acropolis between the Golden Horn, Bosporus and Marmara Sea.

name: Blue Mosque (Sultan Ahmed)
address: Sultanahmet Mh., At Meydani #7, 34122, Fatih/Istanbul, Turkey
description: The Sultan Ahmed Mosque or Sultanahmet Camii is nicknamed the Blue Mosque because of the beautiful blue tiles which adorn the interior walls. The mosque was constructed between 1609 and 1616 during the reign of Ahmed I who is also buried here. The mosque complex includes the Sultan’s mausoleum, a hospice and a madrasa.

name: Grand Bazaar
description: The Grand Bazaar Istanbul, Kapali Carsi or Buyuk Carsi is a large covered market where you can shop for almost anything. The market has almost 4,000 stores, restaurants, cafes and service stores spread over 61 covered streets. The market is located in the Fatih District between the Beyazit and Nuruosmaniye mosques.

name: Basilica Cistern
address: Yerebatan Cad. Alemdar Mah. 1/3 34410 Sultanahmet-Fatih/Istanbul, Turkey
description: In the southeast section of Hagia Sofia is this underground water reservoir (Yerebatan Sarayi) which was constructed for Byzantine Emperor Justinianus I (527-565). It would have been one of hundreds of subterranean cisterns used in Istanbul at the time. The site is called “basilica” cistern as a basilica once stood here.

name: Galata Bridge
address: Galata Köprüsü Kemankeş Karamustafa Paşa 34425 Beyoğlu/İstanbul Turkey.
description: The Galata Bridge or Galata Koprusu spans the Golden Horn, a naturally inlet and protected harbor in the Bosphorus River where it meets the Sea of Marmara.

name: Suleymaniye Mosque
address: Suleymaniye Camii, Sifahane Sokak, Beyazit, Istanbul.
description: Suleiman Mosque is a 16th century structure built during the reign of Suleiman the Magnificent. It was designed by famed Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan and stands on Istanbul’s 3rd hill. This is the city’s largest mosque; it took 7 years to build and was completed in 1557.

name: Galata Tower
description: This tower was built to replace the Great Tower (Megalos Pyrgos) a Byzantine tower which was destroyed in 1204 and no longer stands. The Galata Tower or Tower of Christ was constructed in 1348 by the Genoese during the Middle Ages. The tower was built to guard the entrance to the Golden Horn.

name: Spice Bazaar
description: Misir Carsisi or the Egyptian Market is one of Istanbul’s largest bazaars and second in fame only to its neighbor the Grand Bazaar. The Spice Market is situated in the Eminonu neighborhood of Fatih District at the southern end of the Galata Bridge near the docks. The market covers an area of 384 city blocks.

name: Rüstem Pasa Külliyesi
address: Rüstem Paşa Mahallesi, Hasırcılar Cd. No:62, 34116 Fatih/İstanbul, Turkey
description: This mosque (Camii) complex (Külliyesi) is often overlooked by tourists but is one of the most beautiful of the Istanbul mosques. The mosque was originally constructed in 1560; it stands in the Eminonu District near the Golden Horn. The mosque was the first project of Ottoman architect Mimar Sinan.

name: Dolmabahçe Palace
description: The palace is located on the edge of the European coastline of the Bosphorus strait on the site of a former bay where the Ottoman fleet would dock. It is the largest palace in the country covering 45,000m² and one of the most opulent.

name: Istiklal Street
description: Istiklal Caddesi (Independence Street) is a popular pedestrian shopping street running for 1.4km in the Beyoglu District. During its heyday the avenue was the heart of Constantinople when it was known as the Paris of the East.

name: Chora Church
address: Kariye Camii Sokak #26 Edirnekapi, Istanbul, Turkey.
description: The first church which stood here was constructed in the 4th century as the Church of the Holy Savior Outside the Walls. The name “Chora” means “in the country” as the church was outside the old city walls in the countryside. In 413 the church came within the city walls under Emperor Theodosius II.

name: Hippodrome
address: Sultan Ahmet Meydani, Fatih, Istanbul, Turkey
description: The Hippodrome of Constantinople was once the entertainment and social hub of the Byzantine Empire. Today Sultanahmet Meydani (Sultan Ahmet Square) and a park stand where the Hippodrome once stood in front of the Blue Mosque. Only a few sections and monuments of the original hippodrome structure remain.

name: Istanbul Modern
address: Meclis-i Mebusan Cad. Liman Isletmeleri Sahasi Antrepo #4, 34433 Karakoy, Istanbul, Turkey.
description: At this museum you can see a selection of modern and contemporary art with an emphasis on work by Turkish artists. The museum building is fittingly a converted warehouse overlooking the city. The museum is spread over two floors covering 8,000m² and features a permanent collection and space for temporary exhibits.

name: Little Hagia Sophia
description: The Eastern Orthodox Church of the Saints Sergius and Bacchus was constructed in 530 under Emperor Justinian I (527-565) and converted to a mosque (camii) after the Ottoman conquest in 1453.

name: Mihrimah Sultan Mosque
description: This is a small mosque but one of the most beautiful in the city and often overlooked by tourists. It was constructed during the Ottoman Era in the Edirnekapi neighborhood on one of the city’s seven hills.

name: Miniatürk
address: Sutluce Mahallesi, Imrahor Caddesi, 34445 Sutluce-Beyoglu/Istanbul, Turkey
description: It is a great idea to visit this attraction with kids before setting off to “conquer” Istanbul. The attraction is a to-scale miniature 3D recreation of famous landmarks from Istanbul and other Turkish cities in miniature. Paths lead in and out between the models of Istanbul’s famous buildings.

name: Rumeli Fortress
address: Yahya Kemal Caddesi 42, Rumelihisari, Sariyer, Istanbul, Turkey
description: Rumelihisari was built under Sultan Mehmet the Conqueror in 1451 and 1452 before he had conquered the city. The fortress took only four months to construct and stands on a hill opposite the Anadoluhisari Fortress overlooking the narrowest point of the Bosphorus.

name: Eyüp Sultan Mosque
address: Islambey, Eyup Sultan Bulvari, Eyup Sultan Meydani, 34050, Eyup/Istanbul, Turkey
description: This mosque complex dates back to 1458; it was the first mosque constructed in Istanbul 5 years after the Ottomans conquered the city.  It suffered extensive damage from earthquakes and was completely demolished in 1798 except for the minarets and then rebuilt.

name: Camlica Hill
description: Camlica Hill or Camlica Tepesi is one of the most beautiful of Istanbul’s seven hills of Istanbul. It is located in Uskudar and is the highest point in the city. From here you can see the city laid out before you including views of the Bosphorus Bridge and the Fatih Sultan Memhet Bridge.

name: Taipei 101
address: 89F, 7 Hsin Yi Road, Sec. 5, Taipei 110, ticket booth and entrance at 5th floor of the adjacent Taipei 101 shopping Mall
description: Dominating the skyline of Taipei is this tall skyscraper in the Xinyi District. The building was briefly the tallest building in the world in 2004 but it is still the largest green building in the world having being designed with the environment in mind. The building was designed by C.Y.

name: Chiang Kai-shek Memorial
address: 21, Zhōngshān South Road, Zhongzheng District, Taipei City, Taiwan
description: In 1975 President Chiang Kai-Shek passed away and it was decided to build a memorial in his honor. The memorial was constructed in Taipei following submission of 43 proposed designs from around the world. The design of Yang Cho-Cheng was chosen. The site covers 250,000m² and includes the National Opera House and Concert Hall.

name: Maokong Gondola
address: Zoo Station - 8, Sec 2, Xinguang Road, Wenshan District, Taipei City 116, Taipei Zoo South - 30, Sec. 2, Xinguang Road, Zhinan Temple Station - 200, Ln. 157, Sec. 3, Zhinan Road, Maokong Station - 35, Ln. 38, Sec. 3, Zhinan Road
description: This gondola service runs for 4.03km over the hills of south Taipei and rises 275.2 meters from the first to last station. The circulatory cable car route is roughly in the shape of a number 7. There are 4 towers which support the cable.

name: Longshan Temple
address: No. 211, Guangzhou St, Wanhua District, Taipei City, Taiwan 10853
description: Not to be confused with Tamsui Longshan Temple this temple is in Taipei City in Manka District. It was established in the 18th century and is devoted to the Goddess of Mercy – Kuan-in or Avalokitesvara. In 1738 immigrants from the Nan-an, Chin-chiang and Hui-an counties in the Chinese province of Fukien arrived in Manka.

name: Shilin Night Market
address: In the area of Dadong Road, Danan Road, Wenlin Road and Jihe Road in Shilin District, Taipei City 111, Taiwan
description: This is one of the city’s largest night markets and the most popular. It is centered on Yangming Theatre and the Cicheng Temple and stalls are set up along the streets as well as in a permanent building. The permanent building is comprised on three basement floors and a ground floor.

name: Taipei Confucius Temple
address: 275, Dàlóng Street, Datong District, Taipei City, Taiwan 103
description: This beautifully temple is one of Taiwan’s largest Confucius temples it is also the only one on the island with southern Fujian-style ceramic adornments. The temple slowly grew from its origins in 1879 during the Qing Dynasty when the city of Taipei was established and the entire complex was completed in 1884.

name: National Palace Museum
address: No. 221, Section 2, Zhìshàn Road, Shilin District, Taipei City, Taiwan 111
description: This site consists of several sections, the main building where the exhibition is, the library, Chang Dai-chi’en Memorial Residence, Zhishan Garden, Zhide Garden and the Children’s Gallery. The palace is in Shilin, Taipei and is one of the country’s national museums.

name: Baoan Temple
address: 61, Hāmì Street, Datong District, Taipei City, Taiwan 103
description: The Baoan Temple also known as the Dalongdong Temple was first established as early as 1742 as a simple wooden structure. By 1830 it had been turned into a more elaborate and permanent structure. Today it is one of the largest temples in the city and one of the most beautiful.

name: Xingtian Temple
address: No. 109, Section 2, Minquan E Rd, Zhongshan District, Taipei City, Taiwan
description: This temple is also called En Chu Kong Temple, Hsing Tian Kong Temple and Xingtian Temple. In the late 50s and early 60s Hsuan Kung used his private funds to construct the main Hsing Tian Kong in Downtown Taipei and two additional temples in Sanxia, New Taipei City and Beitou, Taipei City.

name: National Taiwan Museum
description: This is the country’s oldest museum established in 1908 as the Taiwan Governor Museum under the Japanese-colonial government. At the time the museum held 10,000 items. In 1949 the Taiwan Provincial Government renamed the museum the Taiwan Provincial Museum.

name: Yangmingshan National Park
address: 1-20 Zhuzihu Road, Beitou District, Yangmingshan, Taipei City 11292, Taiwan
description: Millions of years ago this breathtaking landscape was formed by a collision of the Philippines Oceanic plate and the Eurasian continental plate. Volcanoes were created from the pressure and they became the 20 or more volcanoes which cover the northern coastal region.

name: Chih Nan Temple
address: 115 Wanshu Road, Wenshan District, Taipei, Taiwan
description: This temple is also called the Zhinan Temple and the Xiangong (Immortal Grandfather) Temple. The temple is nestled among the green trees on Zhinan Mountain east of Muzha in the Wenshan District. The temple complex covers 80 hectares and clings to the side of the mountain.

name: Taipei Eye
address: 3F, 113, Sec 2,  Zhung Shan N Road, taipei (Jinzhou Street entrance)
description: The Taipei Eye presents traditional Chinese performing arts in a 90 or 60 minute performance. The show includes a multi-sensory encounter with Chinese culture.

name: N Seoul Tower
description: The N Seoul Tower (also known as the YTN Tower, Namsan Tower and Seoul Tower) stands on Mount Namsan and is the highest point in the city at 236 meters. The communications tower doubles as an observation tower where visitors can ride an elevator to the top and get views across the city.

name: Gyeongbokgung
description: This is one of the five great palaces; it was built in 1483 during the reign of King Sejong. The palace was later renovated and expanded in 1483 under King Seongjong who gave the palace its present name.

name: Namsan Park
description: Namsan Park is located on Mount Namsan (South Mountain) and is the site of Seoul Tower. This is Seoul’s largest park and because of its elevated position it offers panoramic views across the city. During the reign of King Taejo, the first king of the Joseon Dynasty the mount was considered sacred.

name: Changdeokgung Palace and Secret Garden
description: The Changdeokgung Palace or Eastern Palace is located east of the Gyeongbokgung Palace and is one of five grand palaces dating back to the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1897). The palace is a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Changdeokgung was built in 1405 during the reign of King Taejong.

name: Bukchon Hanok Village
description: Bukchon is a village with traditional Korean houses called hanoks. Visitors can come here to see what life would have been like in Korean about 600 years ago in the Joseon Dynasty.

name: Cheonggyecheon
address: Cheonggye Plaza, 148 Seorindong, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea
description: Cheonggyecheon Stream runs through a public square in downtown Seoul. The area was created through an urban renewal project. During the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1910) the Gaecheon Stream was used as a drainage system and work was done building bridges across the stream and creating support for the stream banks.

name: War Memorial of Korea
description: Korea’s War Memorial was founded in 1994 on the site of the former military headquarters. The memorial commemorates the history of Korean military and consists of a memorial building with exhibition rooms as well as an exhibition on the grounds and commemorative statue.

name: National Museum of Korea
description: The museum covers a wide range of areas related to Korean history and culture. It is housed in a unique modern building which reinterprets the traditional architectural spirit of Korea. An open plaza connects the museum’s two wings and the plaza is a gateway to all areas of the museum.

name: Namdaemun Market
description: This is the oldest and largest traditional Korean market in Seoul with about 10,000 stores employing about 50,000 people and visited by approximately 0.3 million people a day. The market is open 24/7, 365 days a year and is always bustling no matter what time it is night or day.

name: The Leeum, Samsung Museum of Art
description: This museum exhibits modern and traditional art work by Korean artists and international artists but the museum building is a work of art in itself and one of the reasons people come to this site. It encompasses two buildings designed by renowned architects.

name: Dongdaemun Design Plaza
description: DDP – Dongdaemun Design Plaza is a unique cultural complex founded in 2014 and a venue for special events, fashion shows, shows, exhibitions, forums, product launches, conferences and educational programs.

name: Jogyesa
description: This is the main temple and headquarters of the Korean Buddhist Jogye Order. Jogye is a Korean Zen sect and the largest sect of Korean Buddhism. The central location means that many foreigners and locals come here to experience Buddhism. The temple was established in 1395 but it has undergone many changes since then.

name: Deoksugung
description: Deoksugung is one of Seoul’s five surviving grand palace complexes from its last dynasty, the Joseon Dynasty (1392-1910). It is the smallest of the palaces best known for its Stone Wall Road.

name: Myeongdong Cathedral
description: Myeongdong was Korea’s first Roman Catholic church and the first structure to be built in the Gothic-style in Korea. It is a designated Historical Site, the seat of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Seoul and dedicated to the Virgin Mary.

name: Gwanghwamun Square
address: Gwanghwamun Square, Jiha 172, Sejong-daero, Jongno-gu, Seoul, South Korea.
description: Gwanghwamun Square or Plaza runs from Gwanghwamun Gate to Sejongno Sageori intersection.

name: Namsangol Hanok Maeul
description: At this site you can see a traditional Korean village. It is located in Seoul so you don’t have to go far to see the authentic traditional houses (hanoks) which have been fully restored and preserved. The village welcomes visitors who are introduced to traditional crafts and shown how life used to be in Korean.

name: National Folk Museum of Korea
description: The Folk Museum is located in the Gyeongbokgung Palace complex and the museum building has a traditional Korean multi-story pagoda. This museum focuses on the daily life and culture of Korea so that visitors can better understand the Korean lifestyle and traditions.

name: Insadong
description: “dong” means neighborhood and this neighborhood consists of a main street with several alley ways veering off into a labyrinth of lanes. Insadong is located in the Jongnno-gu district and was once the site of the largest antique and art market in the city.

name: Gyeonghuigung
description: This is one of the surviving five palaces built during the Joseon Dynasty. It was regarded as a secondary palace to be used during emergencies. Construction began on this palace in 1623 and was later used by ten Joseon kings from King Injo to King Cheoljong.

name: Seoul Olympic Park and Museum
description: OlPark was built for the 1988 Summer Olympic Games. The Olympic Park has sporting facilities including a handball gymnasium, gymnastics arena, Olympic swimming pool, tennis courts and an Olympic Velodrome.

name: Bukhansan National Park
address: Goyang-si, Gyeonggi-do, Seongbuk-gu, Gangbuk-gu, Jeongno-gu, Eunpyeong-gu, Seoul-si, South Korea
description: The national park is spread across Mount Bukhansan; “Bukhansan” means “big mountain in the north.” The mountain has many smooth curves, sharp peaks, valleys and rivers. The main peaks are Baegunbong; Baekundae; Insubong Peak and Mangnyeondae. The park is home to about 1,300 species of animals and plants.

name: Han-gahng
description: Hangang Park runs along the bank of the Hangang River; it was created in the 1980s as part of a development project. The park covers a large area parallel to the river and is dedicated to providing recreational space for residents. There are paths used for walking, running, cycling and skating.

name: Lotte World
description: Lotte World is the ultimate theme park located right in the city center. The park has many attractions and is divided into Lotte World Adventure indoors and Magic Island outdoors. Magic Island is on an artificial island on a lake and is linked to Lotte World by a monorail.

name: Bongeunsa
description: This Buddhist temple was originally founded in 794AD by monk Yeon-hoe. When the temple was built it stood isolated at the foot of Sudo Mountain but the city has gradually spread to encompass the area. In the 16th century the temple was moved to its present location.

name: Gwangjang Market
description: This is one of Korea’s largest traditional markets; it is best known for the silk goods, linen and hand-made items. There is also a popular vintage clothing arcade which attracts celebrities and stylists.

name: Trick Eye Museum
description: This museum has art work which you can “step into” and create a 3D illusion as if you are part of the picture which becomes a real scene. This technique of “trompe l’oeil’ or tricking the eye is great fun especially as you can take selfies posing with the pictures.

name: Forbidden City
address: Forbidden City, #4 Jingshanqian Street, Dongcheng District, Beijing 100009, China
description: From 1420 to 1912 the Forbidden City (Gu Gong in Chinese) was the Imperial home of 24 emperors of the Ming Dynasty and Qing Dynasty. The Forbidden City is now called the Palace Museum as it no longer functions as a royal residence.

name: Tiananmen Square
address: Tiananmen Square, West Chang'an Ave., Dongcheng District, Beijing, China
description: You are likely to see this attraction on your way to the Forbidden City or one of the other attractions which surround it. Tiananmen Square is named after the Tiananmen Gate (Gate of Heavenly Peace) constructed in 1415 which once marked the entrance to the Imperial City and stands on the northern edge of the square.

name: Great Wall of Badaling
description: The Great Wall can be visited at several access points along the length of the Wall. This particular one, the Badaling section is the most popular section for tourist; it is the best preserved section; the most complete; close to downtown Beijing (70km) and easily accessed using public transport.

name: Beihai Park
address: Beihai Park, 1 Wenjin Street, Xicheng, Beijing, China, 100034
description: This is one of the oldest royal gardens in the world and one of the largest in the country covering over 171 acres. The park was originally established in 938 during the Liao Dynasty and was restored and renovated in subsequent dynasties. The park was first opened to the public in 1925.

name: Ming Tombs
address: Ming Shishan Ling, Changling Town, Changling District, Beijing 102213, China
description: The Ming Tombs are closer to the Badaling Great Wall than the city of Beijing (50km away) so they are often included in a Great Wall visit. The tombs (Ming Shishan Ling) are a group of mausoleums for 13 emperors of the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644).

name: Temple of Heaven
address: Temple of Heaven, Tiantan Park, Yongding  East Ave., Dongcheng District, Beijing, 10005, China
description: This was the holiest of the imperial temples; it was used by the Emperors to worship during the Winter Solstice when they would come here to pray for a successful harvest.

name: National Museum of China
address: National Museum of China, 16 East Chang'an Avenue, Dongcheng District, Beijing, 100006 China
description: Perfectly located for easy access on Tiananmen Square opposite the Great Hall of the People. This museum is housed in one of the 10 building constructed in celebration of the 10th anniversary of the establishment of the People’s Republic of China in the 1950s.

name: Lama Temple
address: The Lama Temple, 12 Yonghegong Dajie, Beixinqiao, Dongcheng District, Beijing, China, 100007
description: This is one the largest Tibetan Buddhist Lama temples in the world. It is spread over 66,400m² and has more than 1,000 temple rooms. The monks of the temple monastery follow the Gelug school of Tibetan Buddhism and the art and decoration in the temple is Han Chinese and Tibetan.

name: Summer Palace
address: Yiheyuan, 19 Xin-jian-gong-men Road, Haidan District, Beijing, 100084 China.
description: Not to be confused with the Old Summer Palace this site is dominated by Kunming Lake and Longevity Hill. The soil from the man-made lake was used to create Longevity Hill. The Summer Palace site covers just over 3km² of which ¾ is taken up by the lake while the historic structures are on the hill side among lush forests.

name: Old Summer Palace
address: 28 Qinghuan West Road, Haidian District, Beijing, China, 100091 (north of Peking University)
description: Not to be confused with the (new) Summer Palace this site is the remains of Yuanmingyuan which means the Garden of Perfection and light. The palace was constructed in 1709 during the Qing Dynasty (1644-1911) and it was used as a private pleasure garden for the Chinese emperors.

name: Wangfujing Street
address: Wangfujing Street, Dongcheng District, Beijing, 100006, China
description: This is Beijing’s modern pedestrian shopping street lined with high end stores, many of which are international brand chains. If you are looking for a glimpse at modern China this is the place.

name: Gate of Heavenly Peace
address: Tian'anmen, Chang'an Blvd., Dongcheng, Beijing, China
description: During the Ming and Qing Dynasties this elaborate and massive gate was the entrance to the Imperial City. Imagine concentric rectangles with the Forbidden City as the central rectangle and the Imperial City a larger rectangle with the Forbidden City at its heart.

name: Olympic Park & Bird's Nest
address: Aquatic Center: Olympic Park, 11 Tianchen Road (E), Chaoyang District, Beijing Shi, China
description: The Olympic Park or Olympic Green was the site of the 2008 Olympic Games and Paralympics Games. The complex was purpose-built to accommodate the needs of the Olympics.

name: Jingshan Park
address: Jingshan Gongyuan, #44 Jing Shan West Street, Xicheng District, Beijing, China, 100009 (opposite Forbidden City north gate)
description: Jing Shan Gongyuan was a former garden of the Forbidden City; in 1928 it was separated from the palace and today it is located at the back of the Forbidden City separated by the palace moat and New Jingshan Street. The park is opposite the Forbidden Palace’s Gate of Divine Might north of New Jingshan Street.

name: Houhai Lake
address: Houhai Lake, Shichahai, Xicheng, Beijing, China
description: HouHai literally means “Back Lakes”, a chain of three lakes behind the Forbidden City in the Xicheng District. The term HouHai also refers to the neighborhood surrounding the lakes and the park they are in.

name: White Cloud Temple
address: #9 Baiyunguan Street, Xicheng District, Beijing, 100045, China
description: This Taoist temple (also called the Monastery of the White Clouds and Bai Yun Guan) is a little off the usual tourist route; it is thought to have been constructed in 739AD during the Tang Dynasty and at one time was one of the most influential Taoist temples in the country.

name: Niujie Mosque
address: 18 Ox Street, Xuanwu District, Beijing, China
description: Niujie Ox Street Mosque The Ox Street Mosque is unique in its architecture which adopts the local Oriental style similar to a temple. IT is the oldest mosque in Beijing. Its name comes from the location on Niujie Street (Ox Street) in the Xuanwu District.

name: Capital Museum
address: Capital Museum, #16 Fuxinngmen Outer Street, Xicheng, Beijing, China, 100045
description: This museum was originally housed in the Confucian Temple but due to an expanding collection the museum moved to a new building with interesting architectural features and reopened in 2006. The site has a floor area of 63,390m² and is spread over five levels.

name: Beijing Zoo
address: 137 Xizhimenwai Street, Xicheng District, Beijing, China.
description: The main reason to visit the Beijing Zoo is to see the pandas in the Panda House which was built in 1989. The Panda House covers 10,000m² and has been created to resemble a traditional Chinese garden.

name: Qianmen Street
address: Qianmen Dajie, Dongcheng District, Beijing, China, 100051 (South end of Tian'an Men Square)
description: Qianmen is a pedestrian street along the central axis of the city in the Dashilar District running south from the end of Tiananmen Square (Archery Tower of Zhengyangmen) in the north to Tiantan Park in the south. The street is 840 meters long and 21 meters wide.

name: Ritan Park
address: Ritan Park,  6 Ritan Bei Lu, Chaoyang District, Beijing, China
description: The Ritan Park is home to the Altar of the Sun which gives the park its name. It is one of four royal shrines in the city; built in 1530 and used by Emperors during the Ming (1368-1644) and Qing (1644-1911) Dynasties for sacrificing to the Sun God. The altar itself has three white stone gates and ornate glazed tiling.

name: The Bund
address: Waitan, Zhongshan Road, Huuangpu, Shanghai, 200000, China.
description: The Bund or Waitan is in Shanghai’s Old Town on the west bank of the Huangpu River facing Pudong District across the river. The main street of The Bund is a section of Zhongshan Road which is within the former Shanghai International Settlement which was formed by joining of the US and UK concessions.

name: Nanjing Road
description: Nanjing Road is the most popular shopping street in Shanghai; it runs for 5-6km from the Bund in the east to Yan’an West Street where the Jing’an Temple stands. It is the world’s longest shopping street.

name: Yu Garden
address: 218 Anren Street, Huangpu District, Shanghai, China (near Fuyou Road)
description: The Yu Gardens was planted in 1577 during the Ming Dynasty (1368-1644) and was originally a private garden belonging to a government official, Pan Yunduan. He built the garden for his parents to have a beautiful place to enjoy in their old age.

name: Oriental Pearl TV Tower
address: 1 Century Avenue, Pudong District, Shanghai, China, 2000120
description: This TV and radio tower stands out on the Shanghai skyline opposite the Bund in the Pudong District. The tower was designed by Huan Chen Benlin and Zhang Xiulin and completed in 1994. It stands at 468 meters high and is one of the tallest structures in the city and the 6th tallest structure in the world.

name: French Concession
address: Huaihai Road, Shanghai, China (French Concession, Xuhai and Luwan Districts)
description: From 1849-1943 this area was the French Concession, a French settlement granted by the Chinese government. It was primarily a residential area and the center for Catholic life in the city.

name: Jade Buddha Temple
description: This beautiful temple was established in 1882 and founded by Hui Gen, a former abbot from Mount Putuo. Hui Gen made a pilgrimage to Tibet via Burma where he got 5 jade Buddhas. When passing through Shanghai he left two of these statues here and had a temple built to house the statues.

name: Longhua Temple
address: Longhua Temple, 2853 Longhua Road, Xuhui, Shanghai, China
description: This is the largest temple complex in Shanghai and when built the seven-storey pagoda was the tallest building in the city. The temple complex was first built in 242AD but over the years has been damaged and reconstructed several times. The present structures date back to the Song Dynasty.

name: Shanghai Museum
address: 201 Ren Min Da Dao, Shanghai, China
description: This museum is housed in a beautiful building and displays a magnificent collection of ancient Chinese art. The museum was originally founded in 1952 and moved to its new purpose-built building on People’s Square in 1996. The ultra-modern building has five levels and covers 39,200m².

name: Riverside Promenade
address: Eastern bank Huangpu River, Pudong District, Shanghai, China, 200000
description: One of the must do things when in Shanghai is to take a stroll along the Riverside Promenade in the Pudong District across the Huangpu River from the Bund promenade. The Riverside Promenade runs for 2.5km along the east bank of the river from Dongchang Road and the river ferry terminal to Taidong Road in the north.

name: Jing'an Temple
address: Jing'an Temple, West Nanjing Road, Jing'an, Shanghai, China, 200040 (corner of Huashan Lu)
description: The ancient Temple of Peace and Tranquility is in the Jing’an District; it was originally built in 247AD but was moved to its present location during the Song Dynasty (c.1216). The present structure is from the 19th century Qing Dynasty. During the Cultural Revolution the temple was used as a plastic factory.

name: People's Square and People's Park
address: RenMin GuangChang, Huangpu Qu, Shanghai Shi, China, 200000
description: At the heart of Shanghai is this large pedestrian area bordered by Nanjing W Road to the north; Yan’an Road to the south; Huangpi N Road to the west and Xizang Street to the east.

name: Urban Planning Exhibition Hall
address: 100 Renmin Main Street, Huangpu District, Shanghai, 200003, China (near Xizang Lu)
description: The Exhibition Center is located in a large building on People’s Square. The building itself is an attractions. It is a six storey contemporary structure 43 meters high and with aluminum panels on the façade and a membrane-looking structure on the roof.

name: Xintiandi
description: Xintiandi is a popular shopping and entertainment pedestrian area in Shanghai. Xintiandi has restored traditional Shikumen (Stone Gate) houses lining narrow lanes. The Shikumen homes were once part of the French Concession built to accommodate Chinese in the 1860s.

name: History Museum
address: Oriental Pearl Radio & TV Tower, 1 Century Ave, Pudong, Shanghai, China
description: The Shanghai History Museum (also called the Shanghai Municipal History Museum) focuses on the last 6000 years of Shanghai history. The museum is at the base of the Oriental Pearl Radio and TV Tower and also displays part of the collection at other venues.

name: 50 Moganshan Road
address: 50 Moganshan Road, Jingan District, Shanghai, China. (near Xi Suzhou Lu, Putuo)
