description: M50 is an art district on the banks of the Suzhou Canal. The site is within a former textile mill and has grown into a complex housing galleries, artists’ studios, exhibition spaces, cafes and restaurants in the surrounding industrial buildings.

name: World Financial Center
address: Financial Trading District Z4-1, 100 Century Ave, Lujiazui, Pudong, Shanghai, China, 200120
description: The Shanghai World Financial Center is a noted tourist attraction for its architecture and height but mostly for the observation deck on the 100th floor. The building is the 10th tallest building in the world and the 5th tallest structure in Mainland China.

name: City God Temple
address: 1 Yicheng Road, Huangpu, Shanghai, China, 200010. (Huangpu neighborhood; Old Town Bazaar, north side of Fangbang Zhong Lu near Anren Lu)
description: Chenghuangmiao is the name of a popular shopping area as well as a well known Tao temple.

name: Jewish Refugees Museum
address: 62 Changyang Road, Tilanqiao Historical Area, Hongkou District, Shanghai, China
description: During WWII as Jews were trying to escape Europe, China became one of the countries which took in refugees. From 1933 to 1941 Shanghai accepted about 33,000 Jewish refugees and housed them in the Designated Area for Stateless Refugees in the Tilanqiao District.

name: Shanghai Circus World
address: Shanghai Circus World Theatre, 2266 Gonghexin Road, Zhabei, Shanghai, China, 200072
description: One of the city’s top attractions is a permanent indoor circus covering 22,500m² and with room for an audience of 1638. The building takes the form of a giant golden vault which looks a bit like a golden golf ball from the outside.

name: Fuxing Park
address: 516-524 Fu Xing Zhong Lu, Huangpu Qu, Shanghai Shi, China, 200000 (Luwan neighborhood. West entrance Gaolan Lu, north entrance Yandang Lu, southeast entrance Chongqing Nan Lu off Fuxing Zhong Lu)
description: Fuxing Park or Fuxing Gongyuan is a green space in the former French Concession in the Luwan District. It has several entrances with the main entrance on the corner of Fuxingzhong Road and Chongqingnan Road. The park was first planted in 1909 by the French and covers approximately 24 acres.

name: China Art Museum
address: 161 Shangnan  Road, People's Square, Pudong, Shanghai, China, 200000(Shangnan Lu neighborhood near Guozhan Lu)
description: The China Art Museum or China Art Palace was opened in 2012 in the former Chinese Pavilion of World Expo 2010. It covers approximately 64,000m² and has 27 exhibition halls. The museum displays pieces to illustrate the origin and development of modern Chinese art.

name: Jing'an Park
address: (Main Entrance) 1649 Ninjing West Road, Jing'an, Shanghai, China, 200000 (neighborhood; south of Jing An Temple)
description: Jing An Park covers 57 acres; there are several entrances but the main one is on Nanjing West Road opposite the Jing’an Temple. This is not the same park as the Jing’an Sculpture Park which is also in the area. The park stands on the site of the former Bubbling Well Road Cemetery and dates back to 1898.

name: Qibao Ancient Town
address: Qibao Town, Minhang District, Shanghai 201101, China
description: About 18km from central Shanghai is the ancient town of Qibao. The town is a pedestrian-only town with no pollution or hustle and bustle of the big city. The town was built about 1,000 years ago and reached its peak in the Song Dynasty (960-1126).

name: Zhujiajiao Ancient Watertown
address: Zhujiao Watertown, Qingpu District, Shanghai, China
description: Zhujiajiao is a watertown located in Shanghai’s Qingpu District on the banks of Dianshan Lake. It was founded in approximately in the 330s AD and there is also archaeological evidence of a settlement here 5,000 years ago.

name: Propaganda Poster Art Center
address: Rm BOC, Basement Block B, #868 Huashan Road, Shanghai, China, 200000 (west of Wukang Lu)
description: Through the historic propaganda posters on display at this museum you can get insight into the country’s Communist past. The museum is in the basement of a residential building in the former French Concession.

name: Disneyland Shanghai
address: 310 Huangzhao Road, Pudong Xinqu, Shanghai, China
description: Shanghai Disneyland is the newest attraction in Shanghai and was opened in June 2016. It is the only Disneyland on Mainland China although there is a Disneyland in Hong Kong. The theme park is part of the Shanghai Disney Resort which includes Shanghai Disneyland Hotel and Toy Story Hotel.

name: Ben Thanh Market
address: Lê Lợi, Bến Thành, Quận 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam.
description: The Ben Thanh Traditional Market (Cho Ben Thanh) is the most famous shopping destination in the city. This is not the cheapest market in the city but it has a good reputation, a central location and a history.

name: Notre Dame Cathedral
address: Nguyen Du Street, Paris Square, District 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
description: Ho Chi Minh City has quite a large Catholic community who worship at this historic cathedral. The Saigon Basilica of Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception was built between 1863 and 1880 under the French colonists.

name: Reunification Palace
address: 106 Nguyen Du, District 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
description: The present palace on this site was designed by Ngo Viet Thu and completed in 1966. The history of grand palaces on this site goes back to 1858 when the French invaded Vietnam (then Cochinchina) and the foundation stone of the palace was laid in 1968.

name: Central Post Office
address: 2 Cong xa Paris Nghe, Quan 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.
description: The central post office building has become a tourist attraction because of its beautiful architecture and history. It is Vietnam’s largest post office. The building was completed in 1891 when Vietnam was part of French Indochina.

name: War Remnants Museum
address: 28 Võ Văn Tần, phường 6, Quận 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
description: The main focus of this museum is the Vietnam War (1955-1975) but there are also exhibits about other conflicts in the region including the First Indochina War (1946-1954) which involved the French colonialists.

name: Bitexco Financial Tower - Saigon Skydeck
address: 36 Ho Tung Mau Street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.
description: This impressive tower stands 262 meters high with 68 floors and is the tallest building in Ho Chi Minh City. The building was designed by American architect Carlos Zapata; construction began in 2007 and was completed in 2010.

name: Ho Chi Minh Square
address: Ho Chi Minh Square, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam. (The square is bordered by Ly Tu Trong Street, Pasteur Street, Le Thanh Ton Street and Dong Khoi Street)
description: This central square can be reached from the Ben Thanh Market along Le Thanh Ton Street going north-east. The square is bordered by Ly Tu Trong Street, Pasteur Street, Le Thanh Ton Street and Dong Khoi Street.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum
address: 65 Ly Tu Trong, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
description: This museum (formerly The Museum of the Revolution) is housed in a beautiful French colonial palace called Gia Long Palace which was the former home of the French Governor and the final residence of the South Vietnamese President Ngo Dinh Diem.

name: Saigon Opera House
address: 7 Cong Truong Lam Son Square, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City
description: The Opera House is also called the Municipal Theatre of Ho Chi Minh City. The theatre auditorium can seat 500 in the audience. There are no official tours of the Opera House so the only way to see inside is by attending a show. The building was designed by Eugene Ferret and built in 1898 in the French colonial style.

name: Emperor Jade Pagoda
address: 73 Mai Thi Luu, District 3, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
description: Chua Ngoc Hoang, Phuoc Hai Tu, the Lucky Sea Temple or the Tortoise Pagoda is a Taoist pagoda built by the city’s Chinese immigrants from Guangzhou Province in China in 1909. It is one of the five most important Taoist shrines in the city. The temple is still in use and visited by followers of the Taoist faith.

name: Cu Chi Tunnels
address: Ben Dinh: 741 TL15, Nhuận Đức, Hồ Chí Minh, Nhuận Đức Củ Chi Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam; Ben Duoc:
description: About 40km northwest of Ho Chi Minh City in the Cu Chi District is this labyrinth of underground tunnels and rooms which covers 250km. During the French occupation in the 1940s the tunnels were dug using elementary tools and bare hands.

name: Giac Lam Pagoda
address: 118 Lac Long Quan Street, Tan Binh District, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam
description: This is one of the oldest pagodas in the city; it was built in 1744 by Ly Thuy Long as a gathering place for the Lunar New Year. The temple overlooked the Gia Dinh Market (before it was overdeveloped) and was named after Monk Thich Lam Quang who visited the pagoda.

name: Museum of Traditional Vietnamese Medicine
address: 41 Hoang Du Khuong Street, Ward 12, District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.
description: Saigon’s museum of traditional Vietnamese medicine takes a look at traditional healing which is influenced by Chinese medicine and philosophy. The museum displays potions and remedies through the centuries and through several ethnic Vietnamese cultures including the Cham.

name: Vietnam History Museum
address: 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street, District 1, Hồ Chí Minh, Vietnam (in Botanical Gardens)
description: Until 1979 this museum was called The National Museum of Vietnam in Saigon. Auguste Delaval designed the beautiful French-era building which houses the museum and it was built in 1926 by the Societe des Etudes. The architecture is typical of the Indochinese era.

name: Old Town
description: Hanoi's Old Town is a historic district in the city center comprised of nearly 40 old-style streets. Traditionally an area where merchants and artisans sold their wares, the Old Town has seemingly resisted the passage of time and retained much of its old world charm and flavor.

name: Hoan Kiem Lake
description: Hoan Kiem Lake is a natural body of water located in the Old Quarter, close to Hanoi's city center. One of the city’s most notable landmarks, the lake is a great place to get a glimpse of the city’s rich and diverse culture.

name: Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum
description: The Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum is a memorial to one of Vietnam's most beloved revolutionary leaders. Located in Ba Dinh Square, the mausoleum stands at the site where Ho Chi Minh read the country’s Declaration of Independence in September 1945. Ho Chi Minh is one of the most revered figures in Vietnam's history.

name: Hoa Lo Prison
description: Hoa Lo Prison is a Vietnamese museum that serves as a sobering reminder of the horrors of war, as well as a memorial to those who lost their lives during some of the most tragic periods in Vietnamese history.

name: Temple of Literature
address: 58 Quốc Tử Giám, Văn Miếu, Đống Đa
description: An 11th century temple dedicated to the life and works of Confucius. A remarkably well-preserved example of Vietnamese architecture. The Temple of Literature is an 11th century structure originally built in honor of Confucius.

name: One-Pillar Pagoda
address: Chùa Một Cột, Đội Cấn, Ba Đình
description: The One Pillar Pagoda is a Buddhist temple built during Emperor Ly Thai Tong’s dynasty from 1028 to 1054. Legend has it that the temple was built after the emperor–who had up until then been unsuccessful in producing an heir–dreamed of meeting Quan The Am Bo Tat, the Vietnamese Goddess of Mercy.

name: Vietnam Museum of Ethnology
address: Nguyễn Văn Huyên, Nghĩa Đô, Cầu Giấy
description: Offers a comprehensive collection of exhibits detailing the multicultural social and historical fabric of Vietnam. The Vietnam Museum of Ethnology is a Hanoi attraction that houses a spectacular array art, artifacts, and common household implements from Vietnam's various ethnic groups.

name: Bach Ma Temple
description: Bach Ma Temple is considered one of the oldest temples in Hanoi, dating back to the middle of the 11th century. Located in the city’s famous Old Quarter, the temple is located only a few minutes’ walk away from many of Hanoi's main tourist attractions.

name: Ancient House
address: 87 Ma May Street | Hoan Kiem District
description: Ancient House is a tourist attraction modeled after a traditional Hanoi home. Located in the city’s Old Quarter, the house bears the trademark architectural touches typical of ancient homes all over the country.

name: Ho Chi Minh Museum
address: 19 Ngoc Ha St | Ba Dinh District
description: Ho Chi Minh Museum was built in honor of one of Vietnam's most revered historical figures. Located on the premises of Ho Chi Minh complex, the museum is located close enough to other attractions in the area–such as the One-pillar Pagoda, the War Memorial, and Ba Dinh square–that they could all be visited in a single day.

name: Dong Xuan Market
address: Dong Xuan and Hang Chieu Streets
description: Đồng Xuân Market is located in the Hoàn Kiếm district of Hanoi. Built in 1889 by the French administration, the market has undergone renovations several times, the most recent of which was in 1994, after large portions of the market were ravaged by a fire.

name: Trấn Quốc Pagoda
address: Thanh Niên, Trúc Bạch, Ba Đình
description: The oldest Buddhist temple in Hanoi, the pagoda is located on a small island near the southeastern shore of the West Lake. Trấn Quốc Pagoda is a Hanoi landmark located on West Lake, on a small peninsula on the lake’s east side. One of the oldest pagodas in the city, the structure has been standing for more than 1,500 years.

name: National Museum of Vietnamese History
description: The National Museum of Vietnamese History is a national attraction housed in a building that dates back to the French occupation of the country. Construction of the structure began in 1925, and was completed in 1932, with the design combining the best elements of French and Chinese architecture.

name: Museum of the Revolution
description: The Museum of the Revolution is a Hanoi attraction that covers the revolutionary history of Vietnam in extensive detail. The museum is housed in what was formerly the Trade Department Building, only a short walk away from the opera house.

name: West Lake
description: Hanoi’s largest lake, it is a popular leisure spot with several shops, restaurants, hotels, and gardens. West Lake is the largest freshwater lake in Hanoi with a circumference of more than 17 kilometers.

name: Moscow Kremlin
description: The Moscow Kremlin Museum is not to be confused with the complex ‘The Moscow Kremlin’ which is essentially the official residence of the Russian president. The museum also has the same name, but it is actually situated inside of the Moscow Kremlin complex.

name: Red Square
description: Red Square is a city plaza in the Russian capital of Moscow and is widely considered to be the central square of the city. The square derives its name from the Russian word Krasnaya, which means both Beautiful and Red.

name: Saint Basil's Cathedral
description: Saint Basil's Cathedral is a church and an iconic landmark situated at the Red Square in Moscow, Russia. The site was built between 1555 and 1561 on the orders of Ivan Vasilyevich, the first Tsar of Russia.

name: Gorky Park
description: Gorky Park is one of the first and, till date, one of the most popular parks in the Russian capital city of Moscow. The park is located in the heart of Moscow and it is named in honor of Maxim Gorky who was a celebrated writer, and a political activist.

name: Lenin's Mausoleum
description: In the heart of Russia’s capital city, inside the famous Red Square is what is called Lenin’s Mausoleum, which is essentially Lenin’s Tomb where the remains of the USSR leader Vladmir Lenin currently rests. His body was moved here not long after his death in 1924, and has been preserved and put up for public view.

name: Kremlin Armoury
description: The Kremlin Armory Chamber is one of the major attractions in the Grand Kremlin Palace's complex. It is a part of the Moscow Kremlin Museums and is located in an impressive mid 19th century building constructed by Konstantin Ton, one of the famous architects of the time.

name: Cathedral of Christ the Saviour
description: Located just blocks away from the Kremlin to the southwest is an Orthodox cathedral known as The Cathedral of Christ the Savior. The construction of this gargantuan cathedral came to an end in 1997. This building holds the record for being the tallest Orthodox Christian church anywhere in the world.

name: Novodevichy Convent
description: Novodevichy Convent is one of the best known cloisters in Moscow. It is also known as Bogoroditse-Smolensky Monastery and has remained intact since the 17th century. Novodevichy Convent is located in the south-western side of the city. The premises of the convent may be accessed from the north side and the south side.

name: The Pushkin State Museum of Fine Arts
description: Pushkin Museum is also known as the Pushkin State Museum of Fine Arts. It is amongst the largest museums of European art in Russia. Despite its name, the museum has no direct association to famous Russian poet Alexander Pushkin.

name: Tretyakov Gallery
description: Tretyakov Gallery is officially known as the State Tretyakov Gallery and it is located in Moscow. The gallery is considered to be one of most prominent depositories of Russian fine art. A major portion of the gallery’s collection came from a wealthy Moscow merchant Pavel Mikhailovich Tretyakov.

name: Poklonnaya Hill
description: Poklonnaya Hill used to be one of the highest spots in Moscow and is now home to several tourist attractions such as Victory Park. The hill offers stunning panoramic views of the Russian capital. Victory Park, located on the hill, was envisaged as part of an open air museum to commemorate the Russian victory over Napoleon.

name: State Historical Museum
description: State Historical Museum is located between the Red Square and Manege Square in Moscow. The museum has a vast range of collections including prehistoric tribal items. It is believed that the museum is home to over a million artifacts. State Historical Museum stands on the site of a former Principal Medicine Store.

name: Mikhail Bulgakov Museum
description: This museum is basically the apartment where the celebrated writer Mikhail Afanasyevich Bulgakov lived. Many parts of his novel ‘The Master and Margarita’ is also based on this apartment. It has now been converted into a museum to give you an insight into this writer’s life and works.

name: Garage Museum of Contemporary Art
description: This museum is home to a collection of abstract, modern and contemporary art and this collection seems to be ever-growing. This is regarded as one of the most trending art galleries in the Russian capital city and it draws locals and tourists alike.

name: GUM Department Store
description: The GUM Department Store is the biggest shopping complex in the capital city. This shopping mall gets its name ‘GUM’ from the abbreviation of the Russian translation for ‘State Department Store’, however the name has officially changed since the USSR days, and it is now called the ‘Main Department Store’.

name: Diamond Fund
description: The Diamond Fund is a collection of artefacts such as diamonds, natural nuggets, precious stones and jewelry items. The collection is well maintained and is open for public viewing. This collection goes back all the way to 1719 which is when it is said to have been founded by the Emperor Peter the Great.

name: Memorial Museum of Cosmonautics
description: As the name of this museum suggests, it is all about outer space and space exploration. For those interested in astrophysics and the wonders of the universe and outer space, this is a true haven. The museum opened its doors to public on 10th April 1981.

name: VDNKh
description: Vystavka Dostizheniy Narodnogo Khozyaystva (VDNkH ) or Exhibition of Achievements of National Economy is an amusement park in Moscow, which also doubles up as a permanent trade show site. The park was built in between 1991 and 2014. It was known as the All Russia Exhibition Centre during this time period.

name: Cathedral of the Archangel
description: Built in Honor of Michael the Archangel, The Cathedral of the Archangel is Russian Orthodox Church in Moscow. For hundreds of years, this cathedral served as not only a burial site for tsars, but was also used from time to time for the purposes of coronations and weddings.

name: Alexander Garden
description: Alexander Garden is located in Moscow, Russia. In fact, this park was among one of the very first public parks to have been built in Moscow and dates back to the year 1821, which is when it was founded by an architect named Osip Bove.

name: Novodevichy Cemetery
description: Novodevichy Cemetery is one of the most prominent cemeteries in Moscow. The cemetery is situated adjacent to the southern side of the Novodevichy Convent. Novodevichy Cemetery was opened in 1898 and was designed by Ivan Mashkov.

name: Jewish Museum and Tolerance Center
address: ul. Obraztsova, 11, стр.1, лит. А, Moskva, Russia, 127055
description: Founded in 2012, the Jewish Museum and Tolerance center is located in the capital city of Moscow, Russia. This museum is the biggest Jewish museum in the world by a mile. It is said that President Putin himself gave away his one - month salary to add to the $50 million which was the estimated cost of construction.

name: Bolshoi Theatre
description: This iconic theater is situated in Moscow and its design is the handiwork of architect Jose Bove. Prior to the October Revolution, this theater was one amongst what was known as the Imperial Theatres belonging to the Russian Empire.

name: Moscow Museum of Modern Art
description: Moscow Museum of Modern Art’s doors were opened to public in December 1999 because the President of the Russian Academy of Arts took it on as a pet project. The building that the collection or the museum is located in is actually a classical 18th century merchant’s house.

name: Church of the Savior on Spilled Blood
address: Griboyedov Canal Embankment, 2A, St. Petersburg, 191011, Russia
description: This is one of St. Petersburg’s top attractions; it is also called the Church on Spilled Blood, Cathedral of the Resurrection of Christ and the Temple of the Savor on Spilled Blood. The church stands on the spot where the Emperor Alexander II was assassinated in 1881.

name: St. Isaac's Cathedral
address: Isaakiyevskiy sobor, Isaakiyevskaya Square, 4, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 190000
description: The Saint Isaac’s Cathedral was built between 1818 and 1858 and at the time was the city’s main church and largest cathedral in the country. Today it is still the largest church in St. Petersburg and the 3rd largest domed cathedral in the world standing at 101.5 meters high.

name: State Hermitage Museum
address: Main Museum Complex, 2, Dvortsovaya, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 191186
description: The State Hermitage Museum of Art and Culture is one of the oldest museums in the world; it was founded in 1764 by Catherine the Great and opened in 1852. The collected works of the museum number over 3 million and are displayed across 233,345m².

name: Bronze Horseman
description: This monument commemorates the founder of Saint Petersburg, Peter I (Peter the Great). The statue stands on Senatskaia Ploschad (Senate Square)and faces the Neva River. It is surrounded by Saint Isaac Cathedral, the Admiralty Building and buildings from the former Senate and Synod of pre-revolutionary Russia.

name: Palace Square
description: This is Saint Petersburg’s version of Moscow’s Red Square. It is the site of the most important public events, concerts and historic events including Bloody Sunday in 1905 and the October Revolution in 1917. The square is surrounded by some of the city’s most monumental architecture including the Baroque Winter Palace (1762).

name: Nevsky Prospect
address: Nevsky Prospekt, Saint Petersburg, Russia. (from Vosstanyia Square to Admiralty Building).
description: Nevsky Prospekt is Saint Petersburg’s main street; it was designed by Alexandre Jan Baptiste LeBlond during Peter the Great’s planning of the city. The street was named the Great Perspective Road up until 1738 and under the Soviets was renamed 25th October Avenue.

name: Peter and Paul Cathedral & Fortress
address: Peter and Paul Cathedral, Peter and Paul Fortress, Hare's Island/Zaichy Ostrov, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 197101
description: Confusingly this cathedral shares its name with another beautiful cathedral in St. Petersburg in the area called Peterhof. However this cathedral is the more famous of the two and located within the Peter and Paul Fortress on Hare’s Island.

name: Russian Museum
address: State Russian Museum, 4 Inzhenernaya St., Saint Petersburg, Russia, 191186
description: The Russian Museum was founded by Emperor Alexander III and later in 1895 Emperor Nicholas II assigned the Mikhailovsky Palace and all its surrounding grounds to house the collection. The palace was reconstructed to accommodate the collections.

name: Summer Gardens
address: nab. Lebyazhyey kanavki, Saint Petersburg, Russia (Entrance from Kutuzov Embankment or Panteleimon Bridge)
description: The Summer Garden occupies an island between the Palace Embankment of the Neva River, the Fontanka River, Ul. Pestelya and the narrow Swan Canal which separates the gardens from the Field of Mars and Lebyazhyey Kanavki.

name: Peterhof Palace
description: Peterhof Palace and gardens are the Russian Versailles and together with the Peterhof town center is a UENSCO site. The palace estate comprises much more than one palace but the Grand Palace is the star attraction.

name: Faberge Museum
address: Fontanka River Embankment, 21, Saint Petersburg, Russia.
description: Here you can see the world’s largest collection of Faberge eggs displayed in the Shuvalov Palace. This museum is dedicated to the work of master jeweler Peter Carl Faberge (1846-1920) and several of his contemporaries and prodigies.

name: Erarta Museum
address: 2, 29th Line of Vasilievsky Ostrov, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 199106
description: This is considered the largest privately run museum of contemporary art in the country. The museum is spread over five floors and includes 2,300 contemporary works of art covering the period from 1945 to present day. The collection represents the work of 170 artists from across 20 regions of Russia.

name: Kazan Cathedral
description: Our Lady of Kazan Cathedral began as a small church and bell tower built by architect Mikhhail Zemtov in 1733-1737.  The church fell into disrepair and Paul I decided to build a new church here in its place resembling St. Peters’ in Rome.

name: Yusupov Palace
description: The Yusupov Palace on the Moika River embankment is one of only two existing properties in St. Petersburg formerly owned by the affluent Yusupov family. This palace is best known as the site where Grigory Rasputin, mystic faith healer and confidant of Nicholas II was assassinated.

name: Mariinsky Theatre
address: Mariinskiy theatre, Theatre Square, 1, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 190000
description: For more than two centuries this theatre has been home to one of Russia’s best opera and ballet companies. The Opera and Imperial Ballet Company were founded in 1783 and performed in various theatres before finding their permanent home.

name: Catherine Palace
address: Sadovaya Street, 7, Ekaterininskiy Park, Pushkin, Saint Petersburg, 196601, Russia.
description: Catherine Palace was originally a small palace gifted to Catherine I from her husband Peter the Great. In 1743 during the reign of Elizabeth, daughter of Catherine I and Peter the Great,  the palace was enlarged under architect Bartolomeo Francesco Rastrelli.

name: National Pushkin Museum
address: Moika River Embankment, 12, Saint Petersburg, Russia, 191011
description: This museum is part of a group of six museums each related to the famous Russian literary figure Alexander Pushkin (1799-1837). The main museum (and the one referred to in this article) is the Memorial Apartment Museum of Alexander Pushkin located on the Moika Embankment.

name: Museum of Russian Vodka
description: Russia is synonymous with Vodka and Saint Petersburg has a museum devoted to the history and story of Russian Vodka. Vodka plays a role in Russian celebrations, it has become a part of Russian folklore and in the past has even been used as currency.

name: Grand Choral Synagogue
address: Grand Choral Synagogue, Lermontovskiy, 2, Saint Petersburg, Russia.
description: Under the Tsars Jews were persecuted and lived under strict restrictions. It was Tsar Alexander II who allowed certain Jews to live within the city limits and not in the Pale of Settlement along the western Russian border where all other Jews were forced to reside.

name: Victoria Peak
description: Victoria Peak is the name of a mountain on the main island of Hong Kong; it is also called Mt. Austin and "The Peak." The mountain reaches 552 meters and is the island's highest peak. The main attraction of the mountain is the view from the slopes.

name: Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade
description: The Tsim Sha Tsui area is on the tip of Hong Kong's Kowloon Peninsula, the area is a popular tourist attraction with plenty of restaurants, museums and stores. The Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade runs from the Star Ferry Pier and Clock Tower to Hung Hom along the Victoria Harbor shore looking out towards Hong Kong Island.

name: Clock Tower
address: Star Ferry pier, Kowloon Point, Tsim Sha Tsui, Kowloon
description: The clock tower is a declared monument located along the Tsim Sha Tsui Promenade, at the end of Salisbury Road overlooking Victoria Harbor on Kowloon's south shore. The clock is all that remains of the Kowloon-Canton Railway Terminus which was the final stop along the Kowloon-Canton Railway.

name: Kowloon Park
description: This park was established in 1970 on the former site of a British military base. The redevelopment cost $300 million and covers 33 acres. Apart from the beautiful trees, grass lawns, walking and jogging paths there are several points of interest, recreational facilities and public works of art.

name: Temple Street Night Market
address: Temple Street, Yau Ma Tei, Kowloon
description: This is the city's largest and most popular night market, located parallel to Nathan Road close to the Jordan metro station in Kowloon's Yau Ma Tei area. The market gets its name from the Tin Hau Temple situated in the heart of the market road.

name: Ngong Ping 360
address: Ngong Ping, Lantau Island, Outlying Islands, Hong Kong
description: The Lantau Island cable car together with an entertainment and shopping area at the upper station of the cable car called Ngong Ping Village constitutes this site.

name: Museum of History
address: 100 Chatham Road South, Tsim Sha Tsui East, Hong Kong
description: The Hong Kong Museum of History began as part of the City Museum and Art Gallery which was split up into a separate Art Museum and the History Museum in 1975. The museum covers 17,500m² with 8 galleries spread over two floors.

name: Victoria Harbour
description: The establishment of Hong Kong as it exists today can be credited to the spectacular natural harbor, Victoria Harbor, which lies between Hong Kong Island and Kowloon Peninsula. It is China's largest harbor and the 3rd largest in the world.

name: Madame Tussauds
address: Shop P101, The Peak Tower, No. 128 Peak Road, The Peak, Hong Kong Island
description: This is a branch of the world famous wax museum established by Madame Tussaud, with its most famous location in London, England. The museum holds over 100 magnificently crafted life-size replicas of famous personalities and historical figures.

name: Causeway Bay
description: Causeway Bay is an area on Hong Kong Island concentrated around Tung Lo Wan Road, it is one of the most expensive real estate locations in the world and known for its shopping district. The area began as a fishing village, evidence of this can be seen in the typhoon shelter and the Tin Hau Temple.

name: Hong Kong Park
address: 19 Cotton Tree Drive, Central, Hong Kong Island
description: Hong Kong Park opened in 1991; it covers an area of 80,000m² and is located along Cotton Tree Drive in central Hong Kong. The design of the park aimed to blend the natural landscape into the green space and also provide modern recreational facilities and cultural points of interest.

name: Tai O
address: Tai O, Lantau Island, Outlying Islands, Hong Kong
description: This quaint village is located on the coast of Hong Kong's largest island, Lantau Island. The small village is framed by a backdrop of mountains. Tai O is a traditional fishing village inhabited by the Tanka people, fishermen by trade who live in unique homes along the water's edge.

name: Hong Kong Disneyland
address: Hong Kong Disneyland, Lantau Island, Outlying Islands
description: Hong Kong Disneyland opened in 2005, it covers 68 acres and is an American-style Disney themed amusement park. There are seven zones or "lands" in the park each with its own theme and amusement park rides.

name: Ladies Market
address: Tung Choi Street, Mong Kok, Kowloon
description: This popular Hong Kong market is located in Kowloon in an area known as Mongkong. The market is a public street market and the vendors here are independent traders. The hours are roughly from noon until midnight but the stalls start setting up as early as 10am and the market opens daily except for Chinese New Year.

name: Mongkog Markets
description: Mong kok or Mongkok is an area in the center of Kowloon; it is thought to be the most densely populated area in the world with approximately 130,000 people per km². Mongkok was once where the triad gangs based themselves and a place where foreigners rarely set foot.

name: Maritime Museum
address: 3 Queen's Road Central, Central, Hong Kong
description: This museum is aptly located on Pier 8; it explores the maritime history of China, the Canton sea trade, the Pirate Coast, Hong Kong Harbor and the maritime communications and foreign relations with traders in China. The museum looks back at the past but also at present maritime trends and Hong Kong's shipping economy.

name: Landmark
address: 15 Queen's Road Central, Central, Hong Kong Island
description: The Landmark center consists of office space and retail space; it is a huge complex that consists of 4 main buildings: Landmark, Atrium, Alexandra, Chater and Prince's. It holds restaurants, cafes, entertainment venues, 208 stores office space and a hotel.

name: Sheung Wan
description: This is an exciting neighborhood known for its hip and trendy stores as well as the eccentric and diverse shopping opportunities. The area consists of the Western Market, an historic area where you can find craft stores and a mall.

name: Nan Lian Garden
description: This classic Chinese garden is located on Diamond Hill in Kowloon, Hong Kong. It covers an area of 35,000m² and was designed in the traditional Tang Dynasty style using the Shanxi Province's Jiangshouju Garden as its model.

name: Esplanade Park
description: This centrally located Singapore park is bound by Connaught Drive, Esplanade Drive, Stamford Road and the left bank of the Singapore River. The historic park was established in 1943 and was redeveloped in 1991. The park is home to several landmarks and points of interest.

name: Merlion Park
description: This park gets its name from the famous statue which adorns its lawns. The Merlion is a fish and lion mix and the national symbol of Singapore. The park is located near Marina Bay and is home to two of the famous Merlions, the mother Merlion and her cub.

name: Night Safari
description: Night Safari is a unique safari park which is only open at night (7:30pm to midnight) and offers visitors the opportunity to experience the animals at night.

name: Singapore Flyer
description: This must-do attraction is a huge observation wheel where you can get 360° views of the city and on a clear day see as far as Malaysia and Indonesia. It is located in Marina Bay and is the largest observation wheel in Asia. The wheel's highest point is 165 meters above ground.

name: River Safari
description: The River Safari covers 12 hectares and is located between the Singapore Zoo and Night Safari. It is a zoo and aquarium but with the added attractions of having a river theme. In addition to the animals you will see you can also take river cruises and enjoy theme park rides.

name: ArtScience Museum
description: At the base of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel is a structure resembling a lotus flower or the welcoming hand of Singapore. Through the tip of each "finger" natural light filters into the exhibition space of the ArtScience Museum. The structure holds 21 galleries spread over three floors with floor space of 4645m².

name: Marina Bay Sands
description: Rising from the Singapore skyline is this man-made wonder, a building comprised of three towers spaced widely apart and connected together at the very top by a long floor which spans all three of the towers and the gaps between them.

name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple
description: This beautiful Tang-style Chinese Buddhist temple holds the sacred tooth of Buddha. The temple was constructed in 2007 and although a recent addition to the temples of Singapore it lacks nothing in style and ornamentation.

name: Asian Civilizations Museum
description: This museum aims to present an integrated view of pan-Asian cultures. The museum highlights the civilizations which make up the nation's multi-ethnic community. The collections reflect the country's ancient history and the cultures which settled here over the last 200 years from other parts of Asia.

name: Chinatown Heritage Centre
description: Chinatown's unique heritage in Singapore is kept alive in the Heritage Centre which is housed within three restored shophouses. The memories, traditions and history of Singapore's Chinese community are preserved here.

name: Clarke Quay
description: This quay is one of three quays on the Singapore River it lies upstream from the river mouth and Boat Quay.

name: CHIJMES
description: CHIJMES or chimes in Chinese is a complex of historic buildings which began as a catholic convent known as the Convent of the Holy Infant Jesus. It was designed by G.D. Coleman for the magistrate clerk H.C. Caldwell in 1841.

name: Sentosa Island
description: This mega attraction is located on the island of Sentosa. It includes multiple sites and places of entertainment as well as nine hotels and other forms of accommodation, spas and more than six restaurants. The integrated resort covers 49 hectares and is divided into central, west and east areas.

name: Singapore Art Museum
address: 71 Bras Baash Road and 8 Queen Street, Singapore 188552
description: This museum was originally called the Fine Art Museum in 1996 when it opened as one of five museums in the Art and Heritage District.

name: Peranakan Museum
description: This museum is a component of the Asian Civilizations Museum. It focuses on the Peranakan culture and communities in Southeast Asia. Peranakan means "locally born" in Malay and refers to the descendents of foreigners who came to Southeast Asia from countries like India and China and married local women.

name: Jurong Bird Park
description: This outstanding bird park first spread its wings in 1971, it is Asia's largest bird park and is spread over 20.2 hectare. The park is home to 5,000 birds representing 380 species. The park is dedicated to conservation and the birds are well looked after and displayed in recreated natural habitats.

name: Fort Canning Park
address: Junction of Fort Canning Road and Canning Rise, Singapore 179872
description: The park is on a 60 meter high hill and covers 18 hectares. The hill has a long and eventful history. Ancient Malay folklore considers the hill a site of ancestral palaces. Later excavations revealed that the folklore could in fact have been right as remains of brick structures were uncovered.

name: Science Centre Singapore
description: This 35 year old establishment promotes interest and creative learning of science and technology. It inspires and excites visitors of all ages with the largest collection of science educational material in the country.

name: Singapore Discovery Centre
description: The aim of this center is to share the Singapore story and inspire others to contribute to the city's future. It is located on the grounds of the SAFTI Military Institute and the original intension was to create a site which showcased the history of the Singapore Armed Forces.

name: Madame Tussauds Singapore
address: Imbiah Lookout, 40 Imbiah Road, Sentosa Island, Singapore 099700
description: Commence your full experience at Images of Singapore LIVE as you uncover the red dot’s extraordinary story told through a unique mix of live actors & special effects. The journey on lands leads to water where you embark on the all new Spirit of Singapore boat ride that celebrates everything unique about Singapore.

name: Singapore Zoo
description: Wildlife Reserves Singapore runs the Jurong Bird Park, Night Safari, River Safari and the Zoo. You can get combo tickets to more than one of these attractions. The Singapore zoo is a rainforest zoo and has been chosen as Trip Advisor's Travelers' Choice and won the prize for the best zoo in Asia.

name: Gardens by the Bay
address: 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953; Entrance to Bay East Garden from Marina Barrage 24/7 or via Tanjong Rhu Road;
description: The Gardens are an expansive attraction consisting of multiple things to see and do.  It covers 101 hectares on reclaimed land adjacent to the Marina Reservoir. The site includes three gardens along the Singapore waterfront.

name: Raffles Landing Site
description: Near Boat Quay there is a 6 meter tall white polymarble statue of Raffles standing in his tail coat, arms folded looking majestic. This is a replica of the original bronze statue which now stands in front of the Victoria Memorial Hall at Empress Place and was made by Thomas Woolner in 1887.

name: Fort Siloso
description: This is a former coast artillery battery. Singapore used to have twelve of these batteries placed in strategic positions which comprised "Fortress Singapore" at the beginning of WWII. Fort Siloso is the only remaining battery which has been restored.

name: Boat Quay
description: Boat Quay is one of three quays along the Singapore River together with Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. It is located upstream from the river mouth on the southern bank. Boat Quay has been turned into a pleasant waterfront leisure and commercial area and popular walkway.

name: National Museum of Singapore
description: Singapore's oldest museum was established in 1849, it settled into its current location in 1887 within the Museum Planning Area. The National Museum of Singapore is one of four national museums and specializes in the history of the country. It is officially called the Singapore History Gallery.

name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
description: The idea for the Singapore Botanic Gardens was conceived in 1822 by Sir. Stamford Raffles a representative of the British East India Company, one of the founding fathers of modern Singapore and a keen botanist. He started creating the Gardens at Fort Canning and in 1859 the Gardens were moved to the present site.

name: City Hall
description: The City Hall is located opposite the Padang field or former cricket ground and adjacent to the Singapore Supreme Court. It was designed by F.D. Meadows and A. Gordans and completed in 1929, it was originally called simply Municipal Building.

name: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple
description: This temple in Little India is dedicated to the Hindu Goddess of power Kali. It was constructed in 1855 by Tamil laborers and has distinct Southern Indian Tamil architecture. Like with most South Indian temples this one has a beautiful and elaborate gopuram or tower above the entrance way.

name: Sultan Mosque Singapore
description: Singapore's primary mosque is a landmark building in Kampong Glam Malay Heritage District. It is also called Masjid Sultan. The history of the mosque goes back to 1824 when a brick structure was erected in honor of the Sultan Hussein Shah, the first Sultan of Singapore.

name: Singapore City Gallery
address: 45 Maxwell Road, The URA Centre, Singapore 069110
description: This is an interactive museum focused on the urban planning of Singapore and showing the development of the city and its transformation over the last half a century. The museum highlights the policies of the city-state and how they are implemented in the urban environment.

name: Changi Museum
description: The museum is dedicated to the inspiring and courageous stories of the people who endured, lived or died during WWII and who were held at Changi Prison. The museum uses documentation of the major events during the Japanese Occupation.

name: East Coast Park
address: East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road, Singapore 449878
description: This beautiful recreational area and beach is located on the southeastern coast of Singapore and runs from Fort Road to Changi airport. It was first opened to the public in 1970. The entire park consists of reclaimed land and a 15km long man-made beach. The park covers 185 hectares.

name: The Padang
description: In 1819 Sir Stamford Raffles raised the British flag on the Padang (Malay for field or open ground) which Raffles declared a recreational area. Since then the open green has remained the site of the Singapore Cricket Club and the Singapore Recreation Club. The space has been the site of several major historic events.

name: Red Fort
address: Lal Qila, Netaji Subhash Marg, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006, India
description: The Red Fort or Lal Qila was constructed as the residence of Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in 1648 and remained the home of Mughal leaders for 200 years until 1857. The fort was also used for imperial business, political and ceremonial events.

name: Qutb Complex & Qutub Minar
address: Qutub Minar Monument Complex, Ladha Sarai, Mehrauli, New Delhi, Delhi, 110030, India
description: The Qutb Complex encompasses a number of monuments and buildings which are all part of a UNESCO site. The complex includes its most famous structure the Qutb Minar which was constructed under Qutb-ud-din Aibak (1150-1210) who went on to become the first Sultan of Delhi during the Mamluk Dynasty.

name: Humayun's Tomb
address: Humayun's Tomb, Bharat Scouts and Guides Marg, Nizamuddin East, New Delhi, Delhi 110002, India
description: Humayun’s Tomb dates back to the Mughal Empire (16th-18th century) and is the final resting place of Humayun (1508-1556) second Mughal Emperor and ruler over what is now Afghanistan, parts of northern India and Pakistan. Humayun’s son commissioned the tomb which was designed by Mirak Mirza Ghiyas.

name: Lotus Temple
address: Bahapur Kalkaji, New Delhi, Delhi, 110019, India
description: Among all the ancient attractions of New Delhi this is one of the more recent additions. The Lotus Temple is a place of worship for followers of the Baha'i faith. Baha’i is a monotheistic faith which focuses on the spirituality of all humankind.

name: India Gate
address: India Gate, Eastern end of Rajpath, New Delhi, Delhi, 110001, India.
description: The India Gate (All India War Memorial Arch) is New Delhi’s version of the Arc de Triomphe. The grand archway stands at the eastern end of Rajpath surrounded by gardens. The arch commemorates the sacrifice of 70,000 Indian soldiers who died in conflicts between 1914 and 1921.

name: Swaminarayan Akshardham
address: NH24, Akshardham Setu, New Delhi, Delhi, 110092, India
description: This complex is a Hindu mandir – a place where human beings and gods can join together helped by the symbols and structures representing Hindu beliefs and ideas. This complex welcomes people and allows them to explore Hindu values, art and traditions through a variety of presentations and sites.

name: Chandni Chowk
address: Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: This famous market has been doing business for the last three centuries; it is located in Old Delhi and the Red Fort is within the market. It is said that the market gets its name from a time when the Red Fort was connected to Fatehpuri Mosque by a canal and canals ran through the area.

name: Jama Masjid
address: Esplanade Road, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi, India (off Netaji Subhash Marg, west of Red Fort)
description: The Friday Mosque is the largest in India; its massive courtyard can accommodate 25,000 devotees. Construction of the mosque began in 1644 under Shah Jahan, the same Mughal Emperor who built the Taj Mahal and the Red Fort.

name: Raj Ghat
address: Mahatma Gandhi Marg (Ring Road), New Delhi, Delhi, India
description: This site marks the place where Mahatma Gandhi was cremated, and today it is a memorial to the man who is considered the “Father of the Nation.” Raj Ghat means Royal Steps; ghat generally means steps leading down to a body of water, usually holy water.

name: Rajpath
address: Rajpath, New Delhi, Delhi, India (running from the President Palace to India Gate.
description: Rajpath is a wide avenue or boulevard running east to west from the National stadium through India Gate and Vijay Chowk (Victory Square) and ending at the Presidential Palace (Rashtrapati Bhavan) on Raisina Hill; the Rajpath crosses Janpath (People’s Way). Rajpath was part of the British city plan designed by Edwin Lutyens.

name: Rashtrapati Bhavan
address: (Visit entry through Gate #2 Rajpath and Gate #37 via Dalhousie Road) Changing of the Guard at Gate #2.
description: This is the President of India’s official residence. The building is a symbol of Indian democracy.

name: Chhatarpur Temple
address: Chhatapur, Main Chhatapur Road, Mehrauli Area, New Delhi, Delhi 110074,  India (near Chatarpur metro station)
description: Chhatarpur Temple (Shri Adhya Katyani Shakti Peeth Mandir) is a Hindu place of worship dedicated to the warrior goddess Katyayani; it is the second largest temple complex in India covering 60 acres.  The temple was founded in 1974 by Sant Shree Nagpalji whose shrine is within the temple complex.

name: Gurudwara Bangla Sahib
address: Ashoka Road, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi, 110001, India
description: A gurudwara is a place of worship for Sikhs and this is the most important gurudwara in New Delhi. It is associated with Guru Har Krishan, the eighth Sikh Guru who stayed here during his visit to Delhi in 1664.

name: ISKCON Temple
address: Hare Krishna Hill, Sant Nagar, East of Kailash, New Delhi, Delhi, 110065, India
description: ISCON is the International Society for Krishna Consciousness, a Hare Krishna spiritual institute founded in 1966. It is a monotheistic tradition within the Hindu culture and the religion is based on the 5,000 year old Sanskrit texts of Bhagavad-gita.

name: Purana Qila
address: Mathura Road, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: This is one of the oldest forts in the city built between 1538 and 1545 by Mughal Emperor Humanyun. When Sher Shah ousted Humanyun he had most of the structures within the fort destroyed; Humanyun recaptured the fort city from Sher Shah’s son and rebuilt the city. The fort is a rectangular shape and covers roughly 2km.

name: Birla Mandir
address: Mandir Marg, DIZ Area, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: Lakshmi Temple or Laxmi Temple was built in the 1930s by industrialist J.K.Birla and his family and so is also called Birla Mandir (Temple) like several other temples which this family built in India.

name: The Taj Mahal
description: The Taj Mahal (Crown Palace) is perhaps the best known attraction in the whole of India; it is a UNESCO site and is considered one of the eight wonders of the world. The iconic white marble structure is a mausoleum which stands majestically on the edge of the Yamuna River in Agra.

name: Gandhi Smriti
address: 5 Tees January Road, New Delhi, Delhi India.
description: Gandhi Smriti (Gandhi Remembrance) is one of the largest museums dedicated to Mahatma Gandhi; it holds a library of approximately 60,000 books and 6,000 original photographs of Gandhi. Also on display are Gandhi’s personal belongings, sculptures, paintings and relics.

name: National Museum
address: Janpath Road, New Delhi, Delhi, 110011, India
description: The National Museum of India holds 200,000 works of art from the pre-historic era and up to modern day and from India and other countries. It is one of the country’s largest museums, established in 1949 and is run by the Ministry of Culture.

name: Jantar Mantar
address: Parliament Street, Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: The astronomical observatory of Jantar (instruments) Mantar (formula) was built in 1724 by Maharaja Jai Singh of Jaipur to study celestial bodies. The Maharaja went on to build a total of 5 observatories in Northern India (Ujjain, Delhi, Mathura and Varanasi) between 1721 and 1730.

name: Lodi Gardens
address: Main Lodi Road, New Delhi, Delhi, India (next to the India International Center)
description: This urban park covers 90 acres and encompasses Mohammed Shah’s Tomb (1444), Shish Gumbad Tomb, Big Dome and the Tomb of Sikandar Shah constructed during the Lodi Dynasty (1451-1526) and Sayyid Period. These monuments were constructed between 1433 and 1533 on the land of Khairpur village.

name: Spice Market
address: Khari Baoli Street, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi, Delhi 110006 India
description: If you’re looking for loads of color and to experience the raw character of India then take a walk though this vibrant market where the aroma of spices fills the air.

name: Agrasen ki Baoli
address: Hailey Lane, off Haily Road, near Connaught Place, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: The official name of this site is Ugrasen Ki Baoli and it is also called Agar Sain Ki Baoli. The meaning of “baoli” is stairwell. This ancient site is nestled in the heart of Delhi’s urban jungle hidden by the surrounding tall buildings. It is central Delhi’s oldest monument and one of the best preserved baolis in Delhi.

name: National Rail Museum
address: Shanti Path, Chanakyapuri, New Delhi, Delhi, 110021, India
description: This museum focuses on the history of railways in India; it is spread over 10 acres with indoor and outdoor exhibits. There are over 100 real size exhibitions plus models, rail signals, equipment, historical photographs, train furniture and related literature.

name: Tomb of Safdarjung
address: Intersection of Lodhi Road and Sri Aurobindo Marg, New Delhi, Delhi, India
description: The Tomb of Safdarjung is the last surviving garden tomb in Delhi. This is a magnificent marble and sandstone mausoleum resembling the Taj Mahal. The tomb was constructed in 1754 as the final resting place for Safdarjung, Viceroy of Awadh and Prime Minister of the Mughal Empire from 1748.

name: Mehrauli Archaeological Park
address: Mehrauli Archaeological Park, Delhi Development Authority, Rules & Regulations, Mehrauli Gurgaon Road, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: The archaeological park is also known as Jamali Kamali and covers 200 acres in Mehrauli alongside the Qutub Minar and Qutb Complex. The park is dotted with the ruins of over 100 structures and monuments from the Middle Ages to 19th century.

name: Nizamuddin Dargah
address: Mathura Road, Old Nizamuddin Bazaar, New Delhi, Delhi, India.
description: This place of worship encompasses the dargah (mausoleum) of the Sufi saint, Nizamuddin Auliya (1238-1325). The Sufi believe in helping and serving the needy. They welcome people of all religions who come here to learn about their philosophy and history.

name: Fisherman's Wharf
address: 314 Jefferson Street, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: Fisherman's Wharf is San Francisco's historic fishing neighborhood encompassing the northern waterfront and stretching up to Ghirardelli Square and Van Ness Avenue. The wharf has been the docking point for the last three generations of fishermen and you can still see their descendants tying up their fishing boats nearby.

name: Pier 39
address: 39 Pier 39 Concourse, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: Located on the waterfront in the Fisherman's Wharf area just 2 blocks from Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39 is an entertainment, commercial and dining venue. A wooden pier was constructed in 1910 and in 1977 given a new lease on life with reconstruction and the erection of a new structure with two levels and landscaping.

name: Chinatown
address: China Town, San Francisco, CA, United States
description: There is a Chinatown in most large American cities but San Francisco's is the oldest and largest. The first Chinese immigrants arrived in the city in 1848; by 1853 the first Presbyterian Church for Asians was erected in Chinatown. A Chinese school was opened in 1859 as they could not legally attend public schools.

name: Union Square
address: Union Square, San Francisco, CA, United States
description: Union Square is both a public plaza and the name of the surrounding area spreading out several blocks. The area is known for its nightlife, theatre, shopping and hotels. The square was named for the many rallies held there in support of the Union Army during the Civil War.

name: Alcatraz
address: Unnamed Road, Golden Gate National Recreation Area, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: Alcatraz Island is located in the San Francisco Bay, 2.41km offshore; the island covers 9 hectares and is a former federal penitentiary.

name: Lombard Street
description: San Francisco is known for its steep hilly roads, but the steepest and most famous of them all is Lombard Street famed for having the most number of hairpin turns as the street descends the hill. The street is nicknamed the Crookedest Street in the World.

name: Ghirardelli Square
address: 851 Beach Street, Ghirardelli Square, San Francisco, CA 94109, USA
description: This public square is on the San Francisco waterfront in the Fisherman's Wharf district, the site offers fine dining, wine tasting, bars, spas, entertainment, ice-cream shops and a famous chocolate shop.

name: Transamerica Pyramid
address: 600 Montgomery St, San Francisco, CA 94111, United States
description: San Francisco's tallest building was constructed in 1972; it is 260 meters tall, has 48 floors and an addition 64 meter long spire on top. It is located in the Financial District on Montgomery Street and is no longer the headquarters of the Transamerica Corporation.

name: Aquarium of the Bay
address: 2 Beach Street, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: The aquarium is located at Fisherman's Wharf near Pier 39, it covers 4645m² and it highlights local water creatures from the San Francisco Bay and surrounding area.

name: Golden Gate Bridge
address: 1415 El Camino Real, San Francisco, CA, USA
description: The iconic landmark of the city of San Francisco, the Golden Gate Bridge crosses the Golden Gate Strait and joins California's northern Marin counties to the city of San Francisco. The straits lie between the Pacific Ocean and the San Francisco Bay; on either side of the bridge are Golden Gate National Parks.

name: Coit Tower
address: Coit Tower, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: The Lillian Coit Memorial Tower is on Telegraph Hill, it was constructed in 1933 as a welcoming beacon to visitors and residents. Lillian Coit was an rich, eccentric San Francisco resident and patron of the San Francisco firefighting force.

name: Golden Gate Park
address: Golden Gate Park, San Francisco, CA, United States
description: This enormous park covers 1,017 acres; it has a rectangular shape, 4.8km long and 0.8km wide. The park was first mapped out in 1870 by future State engineer, William Hammond Hall. He developed the planning and planting of the space.

name: City Hall
address: 1 Dr Carlton B Goodlett Pl, San Francisco, CA 94102, United States
description: The city's municipal offices occupy a Beaux-Arts building designed by Arthur Brown Jr. It is a replica of an earlier City Hall from 1899; the new building was constructed after the 1906 earthquake and completed in 1915.

name: California Academy of Sciences
address: 55 Music Concourse Drive, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
description: At this major San Francisco attraction you can visit a planetarium, aquarium and natural history museum all under one roof. The site is located in the Golden Gate Park, and is one of the world's largest natural history museums.

name: De Young Museum
address: 50 Hagiwara Tea Garden Drive, San Francisco, CA 94118, USA
description: This museum is located in Golden Bridge Park and housed within the redesigned former Fine Arts Building constructed for the California Midwinter International Exposition of 1894.

name: The Exploratorium
address: 15 The Embarcadero, San Francisco, CA 94111, USA
description: This unique museum is a learning laboratory, a place to play, create and be explored. For over 40 years the venue has welcomed young and old to discover science, technology and nature through exhibits, interactive activities and special programs.

name: Twin Peaks
address: Twin Peaks, San Francisco, CA, United States
description: The Twin Peaks have an elevation of 282 meters above sea level making them a great place to enjoy the views across the city. The two mountains, Eureka Peak in the north and Noe Peak in the south are about 200 meters apart and are circumvented in a figure 8 by the Twin Peaks Boulevard.

name: Embarcadero Center
address: 4 Embarcadero Center, San Francisco, CA 94111, United States
description: The Embarcadero Center consists of 5 multi-purpose towers situated on 9.8 acres of land between the Financial District and waterfront. The towers cover 4454, 900m² and include office space, places of entertainment, restaurants and retail space.

name: North Beach
description: North Beach is traditionally associated with the Italian community and is also referred to as Little Italy. In addition to stores there are nighttime entertainment venues, jazz clubs, art galleries, traditional Italian bakeries, delis, inns and Italian restaurants.

name: Cable Cars
address: 39 Pier 39 Concourse, San Francisco, CA 94133, USA
description: Cable cars have been an important part of hilly San Francisco's transport system since 1873, they have become an iconic part of the city and every visitor should enjoy at least one ride on the cable cars; whether it is to get somewhere or just for the thrill.

name: Lincoln Memorial
address: Lincoln Memorial Circle Northwest, Washington, DC 20037, USA
description: The memory of Abraham Lincoln, the sixteenth President of America is preserved with this temple-like memorial located at the National Mall’s West Potomac Park opposite the Washington Monument. The memorial was inaugurated in 1922.

name: The Capitol
address: Capitol Visitor Center, 1st Street and East Capitol Street,  Washington, DC 20016, USA
description: The iconic US Capitol is not only a monument it is a place of work and symbol of democracy. The Capitol is where the nation’s legislature meets; the building houses a valuable collection of American art and it is an architectural attraction in itself.

name: Washington Monument
description: The Washington Monument stands at the center of the National Mall, east of the Reflecting Pool and the Lincoln Memorial. The monument was erected in memory of the first president of the United States George Washington (1732-1799).

name: The White House and Visitor Center
address: White House Visitor Center: 1450 Pennsylvania Avenue. White House: 1600 Pennsylvania Ave. Northwest, Washington, DC 20500, USA
description: The home of the President of the United States, an international landmark, office building and iconic structure, the White House is a massive and beautiful structure seeped in history and holding outstanding art and interior decoration.

name: Jefferson Memorial
address: 13 East Basin Drive Southwest, Washington, DC 20242, USA
description: This memorial is located in West Potomac Park on the shores of the Tidal Basin directly opposite the White House and is part of the National Mall and Memorial Parks.

name: National World War II Memorial
address: 1750 Independence Ave, SW, Washington, DC 20024, USA
description: 16 million Americans served in the armed forces during World War II, and more than 400,000 died. This monument honors the commitment, sacrifice and spirit of the American’s both in service and at home during WWII. It is the only 20th century event commemorated on the National Mall.

name: Martin Luther King, Jr. National Memorial
address: 1850 West Basin Drive SW, Washington, DC 20024, USA (street address: 1964 Independence Ave. SW)
description: Standing in West Potomac Park together with the memorials of national heroes and American Presidents is this memorial to Martin Luther King Junior (1929-1968).

name: Franklin Delano Roosevelt Memorial
address: 400 West Basin Drive Southwest, Washington, DC 20242, USA
description: This memorial commemorates President Franklin Delano Roosevelt and the era he played a part in. It is located along the shore of the Tidal Bain and is part of the National Mall and Memorial Parks. The site was inaugurated in 1997  and is spread over 7.9 acres.

name: National Museum of Natural History
address: National Mall, 10th Street and 1000 Constitution Avenue Northwest, Washington, DC 20224, USA
description: This is one of the Smithsonian museums located on the National Mall; it is the most visited natural history museum in the world. The museum opened its doors in 1910 and has grown over the years.

name: National Museum of American History
address: National Mall,  14th Street and 1400 Constitution Avenue Northwest, Washington, DC 20001, USA
description: The heritage of the United States of America is preserved and displayed here through the use of artifacts, art, film footage, photographs and interactive displays.

name: Vietnam Veterans Memorial
address: 5 Henry Bacon Drive Northwest, Washington, DC 20245, USA
description: This is one of the most visited war memorials on the National Mall (actually it is located in the adjacent Constitution Gardens); it is dedicated to the US soldier who fought and died in the Vietnam War (1955-1975). The memorial has three sections: Three Servicemen Memorial; the Vietnam Women’s Memorial and the Memorial Wall.

name: National Air and Space Museum
address: Independence Avenue at 6th Street SW, Washington, DC 20560, USA
description: The Smithsonian’s museum dedicated to aircrafts and spacecrafts holds the largest collection of its kind in the world with 61 aircrafts and 51 large space artifacts. It is displayed in a huge exhibition space covering 14,970.9m². The museum first opened in 1946 and today is one of the most visited museums in the world.

name: Korean War Veterans Memorial
address: 10 Daniel French Drive Southwest, Washington, DC 20245, USA
description: This memorial commemorates the men and women who served in the US army during the Korean War (1950-1953). It is situated in West Potomac Park on the National Mall and together with the WWII Memorial and the Vietnam Memorial it makes up a pyramid dedicated to honoring army veterans.

name: The Supreme Court of the United States
address: 1st Street NE, between East Capitol Street and Maryland Ave., Washington, DC 20036, USA
description: The Supreme Court is the highest federal court authority in the country; it was established in 1789 and has the final word and veto over federal and state court cases involving federal law.

name: Library of Congress
address: 10 First Street Southeast, Washington, DC 20540, USA
description: The Library of Congress’ main function is as a research library for the United States Congress but it has grown into something much more than that. The library is now a national library serving the nation and even the world.

name: National Archives Museum
address: 700 Constitution Avenue Northwest, Washington, DC 20408, USA
description: The building which houses the National Archives Museum is the original headquarters of the National Archives and Records Administration and was designed by John Russell Pope who also designed the Jefferson Memorial.

name: International Spy Museum
address: 800 F Street Northwest, Washington, DC 20004, USA
description: This interactive and multi-media museum takes a look at espionage and spies. The museum was established by Milton Maltz who was a code breaker in the Korean War. Visitors get to go undercover, try breaking codes and test their potential spy skills.

name: Smithsonian American Art Museum and National Portrait Gallery
address: 8th and F Streets NW, Washington, DC 20001, USA
description: The Portrait Gallery and Smithsonian American Art Museum share an historic building together with the Lunder Conservation Center (where you can see works being restored), Nan Tucker McEvoy Auditorium, Luce Foundation Center and the Kogod Courtyard. Together these spaces constitute the Donald W.

name: Madame Tussauds
address: 1001 F Street NW, Washington, DC 20004, USA
description: As with Madame Tussauds museums across the globe the standard of this attraction is extremely high. Madame Tussaud (1761-1850) came from humble beginnings but perfected her art and opened her first wax museum in London before passing away. Today there are 12 Madame Tussauds museums in the world.

name: National Gallery of Art
address: 401 Constitution Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20565, USA (National Mall between 3rd and 9th Streets 6th Street and Constitution Ave. NW)
description: In 1937 the National Gallery of Art was established in Washington today it is housed in two buildings – the original neo-classical West Building designed by John Russell Pope (designer of the Jefferson Memorial) and the more recently constructed East Building designed by I.M Pei (Designer of Paris Louvre pyramid).

name: Newseum
address: 555 Pennsylvania Avenue Northwest, Washington, DC 20001, USA
description: This museum is dedicated to news and journalism; it is spread over five floors and includes many interactive displays and activities. Visitors can experience the top media stories of the past and present through the eyes of the media while celebrating the 1st Amendment which promises freedom of speech.

name: Arlington National Cemetery
address: 1 Scott Circle Northwest, Washington, DC 20036, USA (entrance at Arlington Memorial Bridge, Arlington VA 22211)
description: Although located in Pennsylvania across the Potomac River this is a Washington DC attraction due to its proximity to the capital. The cemetery covers 624 acres and has been the burial ground for American military since the American Civil War. In addition the grounds hold reinterred dead from wars prior to the Civil War.

name: Hollywood Sign
address: Southern slope of Mount Lee in Griffith Park; viewpoints from Hollywood and Highland junction, Mulholland Drive, Griffith Observatory; Shuttle from Greek Theatre, 2700 North vermont Ave
description: The most recognizable iconic landmark in Los Angeles is the Hollywood Sign. The sign is located on the southern slope of Mount Lee in the Hollywood Hills overlooking the city. The word “Hollywood” is spelled out in 14 meter high white letters forming a 110 meter long word.

name: Venice Beach
description: Venice Beach is a district of LA and is best known for its boardwalk although there is a lot more to do than just stroll along the edge of the beach. The area was conceived in 1905 by Abbott Kinney who wanted to recreate Venice by building a complex system of canals,, today only a few of the original canals have survived.

name: Rodeo Drive
address: Sunset Blvd to Bevwil Drive. Famous section from Wilshire Blvd to Little Santa Monica Blvd., start at the intersectoin of Rodeo Drive and Dayton Way
description: Although there is little to do on Rodeo Drive for tourists except people watch and ogle at the super-rich it is still a must-see attraction. We have all seen Rodeo Drive on numerous TV programs and films. This is where Julia Roberts got turned away in a fancy store in Pretty Women.

name: Warner Bros. Studios
description: The historic Warner Bros Studios is one of the major movie, TV and media companies in America. It was founded in 1903 and was responsible for producing many famous movies, including Harry Potter, The Hobbit, Matrix, The Hangover, The Lego Movie and Batman.

name: Natural History Museum
description: This is one of the largest natural history museums in the USA, it holds a collection of almost 35 million specimens and artifacts some of which go back 4.5 billion years.

name: Griffith Park
address: 4730 Crystal Springs Drive, Los Angeles, CA, 90027
description: This is a huge public park which covers 4,310 acres and is one of the largest in North America. The land which formed the initial area of the park was donated to the city in 1896 by Colonel J. Griffith a local land owner. The park has several sites which are attractions in themselves.

name: Santa Monica Beach
address: Ocean Ave at Colorado Ave, Santa Monica, CA
description: Santa Monica is not in Los Angeles city but is in Los Angeles County and bordered on three sides by the city of Los Angeles and Santa Monica Bay on the fourth side. The beach area is home to many celebrities and affluent families. The well-maintained beach runs for 5.6km (3.5 miles) and is very wide.

name: La Brea Tar Pits
description: This is an excavation site dating back to the Ice Age. Up until 11,000 years ago Los Angeles was home to large exotic wildlife. These animals became extinct and the prehistoric history of Los Angeles was preserved as fossils in the La Brea Tar Pits.

name: California Science Center
address: 700 Exposition Park Drive, Los Angeles, CA 90037, USA
description: This attraction combines exhibits with an on-site Science Center School but for visitors to LA it is the permanent exhibits that are important. The huge facility covers 37161m² and there are four major exhibitions. World of Life covers the commonalities of living from the smallest single-cell organism to human beings.

name: Disneyland
address: 1313 Disneyland Drive, Anaheim, CA 92802; Downtown Disney District between the two parks.
description: You could spend multiple days having fun at Disneyland LA or squeeze as much as possible into a day trip. Disneyland Resort has two theme parks – Disney California Adventure Park and the original Disneyland Park both located in Anaheim, a short drive from central Los Angeles.

name: Madame Tussauds
address: Hollywood & Highland, 6933 Hollywood Blvd, LA, CA 90028
description: This is one of the world famous wax museums as found in London, New York and other capitals. The Hollywood Madame Tussauds was the 9th to join the international group of wax museums. The museum covers three floors and took 8 years to build.

name: Olvera Street
address: Olvera Street, 845 N Alameda Street, LA, CA 90012
description: This was LA’s first street and it is in fact the site of many of the oldest buildings and a lot of history. This was LA’s original center when the city was still under the Spanish. Olvera Street branches off of a plaza which used to be the heart of the Spanish town. Olvera was formerly Wine Street.

name: Los Angeles City Hall
address: 200 North Spring Street, Temple and Main Streets Los Angeles, CA 90012
description: The building of the city hall was constructed in the 1920s. It has 27 floors above ground and reaches a height of 138.38 meters. For many years no building in LA was allowed to be higher than the City Hall.

name: Bradbury Building
address: 304 South Broadway Street, Los Angeles, CA 90013
description: This is one of LA’s architectural landmarks; it is the oldest commercial building left in central Los Angeles. The building was commissioned by real estate and mining millionaire Lewis Bradbury and designed by Sumner Hunt. Bradbury asked him to design a magnificent office building. Sumner Hunt was soon replaced by George H.

name: Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels
address: 555 West Temple Street, Los Angeles, CA 90012
description: This cathedral opened in 2002, it is known for its interesting architecture, Catholic shrines and the great modern art which it holds. The cathedral replaced Cathedral of Saint Vibiana which was built here in 1876. The new structure cost $189.7 million to construct.

name: Japanese American National Museum
description: This is a Smithsonian museum focused on the Japanese American culture and fittingly located in LA’s Little Tokyo neighborhood. The museum covers the 130 year history of Japanese in America.

name: Faneuil Hall Marketplace
address: Faneuil Hall Marketplace, 4 South Market Street, Boston, MA 02109, USA/ 5 Broad Street
description: This hub of activity is four attractions in one – the historic Faneuil Hall and the restored 19th century buildings behind the hall which now hold the Faneuil Hall Marketplaces.

name: Boston Common
address: Bound by Tremont, Beacon, Charles, Park and Boylston Street, Boston, MA 02108, USA; Freedom Trail Information Center, 139 Tremont Street.
description: This large green space is the starting point on the Freedom Trail, a route through the city which passes by 16 points which played a role in US history. Boston Common is the oldest park in the city having been established in 1634.

name: Old State House Museum
description: This building is one of the highlights of the Freedom Trail as a significant location of events relating to the American Revolution. For 300 years the State House was the central point of the city’s community. After its construction in 1713 it became the home of the Massachusetts General Court until 1798.

name: Boston Massacre Site
address: Freedom Trail, Boston, MA 02109, USA; intersection of Devonshire and State Street.
description: The Boston Massacre or Incident on King Street (now State Street), occurred on March 5th 1770. British soldiers killed 5 civilians and injured another six. Patriots Paul Revere and Samuel Adams used the incident to fuel the hatred of the British among the settled colonial population.

name: Paul Revere House
description: This historic house is best known as the former home of American Revolution hero Paul Revere. It is the oldest surviving structure from the Revolution era in downtown Boston. The house is part of the Freedom Trail and is the only residence on the Trail which connects landmark locations from the American Revolution.

name: Old North Church
address: 193 Salem Street, Boston, MA 02113, USA; (The Clough House - 21 Unity Street).
description: The official name of this historic church is Christ Church and it is still a functioning church of the Episcopal Diocese of Massachusetts. It is the oldest church in the city having been completed in 1723.

name: Bunker Hill Monument
description: This monument commemorated the Battle of Bunker Hill which took place on June 17, 1775. It was the first large scale battle of the American Revolution.

name: USS Constitution Museum and ship
address: Museum: Charlestown Navy Yard, Building 22, Charlestown, MA, 02129; Ship: (in dry dock for restoration until 2018) 1 Constitution Road, Charlestown, MA, 02129
description: The USS Constitution museum and ship are run by separate organizations but they stand alongside each other so can easily be visited at the same time. Visitors to the ship are on a first-come-first-serve basis during operating hours. All visitors above 18 years old must show photo ID on entering the ship.

name: Massachusetts State House
