description: The State House was designed by Charles Mulfinch and completed in 1798 constructed on John Hancock’s former cow pasture on Beacon Hill. The State House still serves as the place where Massachusetts representatives, senators and the governor meet to do business.

name: Granary Burial Ground
address: 99 Tremont Place, Boston, MA 02108, USA (between Park and School Streets)
description: This cemetery is one of the 16 Freedom Trail sites which relate to US history; the burial ground was founded in 1660 and here you can find some of the city’s most famous historic figures laid to rest. The cemetery gets its name from the building for grain storage which stands next to it.

name: Boston Public Garden
description: This historic green space is one of the main parks together with The Commonwealth Avenue Mall and The Boston Common. It is the last park in Boston’s “Emerald Necklace” of green spaces bordered by Boylston Street, Arlington Street, Beacon Street and Charles Street which separates the Public Garden from the Common.

name: Skywalk Observatory
description: Get a view from the top of “Pru” across the skyline of Boston from the Skywalk Observatory. You can get 360° views of all the famous sites from the 50th floor of the Prudential Center. The building is the second tallest skyscraper in the city, second only to the John Hancock Tower.

name: Boston Tea Party Ships and Museum
description: This is an action packed dynamic “Boston Experience”; it is in no way like a stuffy museum but rather an interactive adventure. In addition to seeing historic artifacts you will be taken into the world of Boston in 1773 in an all-encompassing experience.

name: New England Aquarium
description: The center piece of this aquarium is the Giant Ocean Tank, a large 4-storey high circular tank which holds a replica of a Caribbean coral reef. Visitors get a 360° view of sea turtles, bonnethead sharks, stingrays, tarpons, tropical fish, barracuda, eels and other reef creatures.

name: Boston Trinity Church
description: The congregation of this church numbers 3,000 households, the church was established in 1733 and today offers religious services to the parish, provides community services and has several well known choirs including the Trinity Schola, Trinity Chamber Choir, Trinity Choristers and Trinity Choir.

name: North End Neighborhood
address: North End, Boston, MA; bordered by Charlestown/Charles River, East Boston, Boston Harbor, South Boston, Financial District/Chinatown, Financial District/Beacon Hill, West End, Charlestown.
description: If you are looking for a small quaint community to explore then this is it. North End is thought to be the oldest continuously-occupied residential community in the county. Although very small at only 0.93km² (0.36 miles) it is packed with attractions, businesses and the finest Italian restaurants in the city.

name: Boston Public Library
address: 700 Boylston Street, Copley Square, Boston, MA 02116, USA
description: The Boston Public Library is the second largest library in the US after the Library of Congress. The library was established in 1848 and today boasts a collection of about 23 million item in many different forms including digital information, books, visual materials and musical scores.

name: Fenway Park
description: Red Sox fans will not want to miss a visit to this iconic arena where the Fenway Park Museum collection is on display. The collection includes over 170,000 artifacts related to the history of Fenway Park and the Boston Red Sox.

name: Museum of Fine Arts
description: The extensive art collections include more than 450,000 items divided into diverse categories. The collections cover the ancient world, contemporary art, photography, prints, drawings, textiles, fashion art, jewelry, musical instruments and pieces from the Americas, Europe, Asia, Africa and Oceania.

name: Museum of Science
description: MoS can be found in the Boston Science Park, it boasts more than 700 hands-on exhibits and several live demonstrations and presentations. In addition to the science museum the site is also home to the Mugar Omni Theatre, the Charles Hayden Planetarium and a domed IMAX theatre.

name: Harvard Museum of Natural History
address: 26 Oxford St, Cambridge, MA 02138, United States
description: The HMNH was founded in 1998 and exhibits the collections of three research museums – Harvard University Comparative Zoology, Herbaria and Mineralogical and Geological. It is located on the Harvard University campus and is connected to the building of the Peabody Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology.

name: Mirage Hotel
description: The Mirage Hotel is one of the iconic buildings along the Las Vegas Strip. The hotel has 3,044 rooms and is owned by the MGM group. The Mirage has a Polynesian theme and is connected to the Treasure Island Hotel by a free tram.

name: Venetian Hotel
address: 3377 Las Vegas Strip, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
description: As the name suggests the theme of this exquisite hotel is the city of Venice, Italy. The luxury hotel and casino is situated on the site of the former Sands Hotel on the Las Vegas Strip. The building has 36 stories and is connected to the Sands Expo Convention Center and The Palazzo Hotel and Casino Resort.

name: Eiffel Tower Experience
address: 3655 Las Vegas Strip, Le Boulevard at Paris, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
description: One of the beautiful hotel facades along the Las Vegas Strip belongs to the Paris Las Vegas Hotel. The hotel is owned by the Caesars Entertainment group. The most dominant feature of the hotel façade is a half-scale replica of the Eiffel Tower.

name: High Roller
address: 3545 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
description: From the LINQ shopping promenade on the Las Vegas Strip, opposite Caesars Palace rises this state-of-the-art Ferris wheel. This is the world’s tallest observation wheel at 167.7 meters, with a diameter of 158.5 meters. The giant wheel has 28 egg-shaped capsules evenly spaced and attached to the outer rim of the wheel.

name: The Mob Museum
address: 300 Stewart Avenue, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
description: The National Museum of Organized Crime and Law Enforcement is housed within the building where the Kefauver Committee hearings were held on organized crime in 1950. The building’s courtroom has been recreated to look as it did then.

name: The Neon Museum
address: 770 Las Vegas Boulevard North, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
description: One of the things that Las Vegas is most famous for is the bright lights. This museum is where old Vegas neon signs come to retire. It was started in 1996 at a different location and grew into a site which collects, preserves and exhibits the iconic signs.

name: Fremont Street Experience
address: 128 Fremont Street, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
description: Fremont Street is a covered pedestrian mall in downtown Las Vegas taking up 5 blocks on Fremont Street. The street has been covered with a vaulted canopy 27 meters high called Viva Vision. This is the world’s largest video screen.

name: Graceland Wedding Chapel
address: 619 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89101, USA
description: This wedding chapel has been around for over 60 years. It has been the site of many historic weddings and celebrity visits. It was here that the idea of an “Elvis wedding” was born. Not that Elvis was married here but that the theme of your wedding can be Elvis with either the minister or the couple dress up as The King.

name: Grand Canyon
address: South Rim - on the Arizona side; 90min drive on Interstate 40 from Williams or Flagstaff. On the Utah side; 30miles south of Jacob Lake on Highway 67
description: The Grand Canyon is a long day trip (5 hour drive there and back) from Las Vegas and a must-see site if you are in the area. The Canyon is a UNESCO site and is located in northern Arizona. The Canyon is huge and has several distinct areas.

name: Bellagio Hotel
address: Bellagio Hotel, 3600 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89109, USA
description: This is one of the famous luxury hotels on the Las Vegas Strip which offers entertainment for the guests and visitors. The elegant hotel was constructed on the site of the former Dunes Hotel and is owned by MGM Resorts. The hotel offers guests fitness facilities, pools, spas, courtyards, concierge services and golf.

name: New York New York Hotel
address: 3790 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89109,USA
description: This is one of the city’s famous hotels run by MGM Resorts International where you can stay, gamble or visit for the many attractions. The theme of the hotel is New York City and the décor goes all out to take you to the iconic East Coast city.

name: Shark Reef at Mandalay Bay
address: 3950 South Las Vegas Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89119, USA
description: Shark Reef is home to a wide range of marine animals including endangered green sea turtless, giant rays, sawfish, jelly fish, piranha, rare golden crocodiles and more. The animals are well cared for and the site is dedicated to conservation, education and research.

name: The Strip
address: Sahara Ave to Russell Road, along South Las Vegas Blvd. NV 89109, USA
description: The Strip is the one place where every visitor will visit; in fact it is usually the first place that people head to when they arrive in Sin City. The Strip is a stretch of road along South Las Vegas Boulevard which runs for about 6.8km (4.2 miles).

name: Red Rock Canyon
address: 3205 Nevada 159, Northwest and Summerlin; West of Las Vegas via Charleston Blvd.
description: Just 17 miles from the Las Vegas Strip is this beautiful expanse of large red rock formations, sandstone mountains and the Keystone Thrust walls or Wilson Cliffs set within 195,819 acres. The walls are 910 meters (3,000 feet) high and are a popular destination for climbers and hikers.

name: Lion Habitat Ranch
description: The owner of this attraction, Keith Evens used to supply lions to the lion habitat at MGM Grand Hotel. The lion attractions at MGM closed in 2012 and Evens opened this site. The ranch is spread over 8.5 acres and is home to 50 African lions. It is only a few miles from Las Vegas in Henderson next to the M Resort.

name: Hoover Dam
address: 35 miles from Las Vegas, Boulder City, Nevada on the US93 Highway
description: This incredible dam is one of the top construction accomplishments of the 20th century. It is located on the border of Arizona and Nevada. Construction began in 1930 and continued for 5 years finishing 2 years ahead of schedule and under budget.

name: Springs Preserve
address: 355 South Valley View Boulevard, Las Vegas, NV 89107, USA at US 95
description: At this site you can explore the valley’s history through interactive science and nature exhibits and see botanical gardens, go hiking, follow nature trails and see live animal shows.

name: Old Montreal
description: The oldest area of Montreal is known, not surprisingly, as Old Montreal or Vieux-Montreal in French. This historic center was once walled and still boasts delightful cobbled stones from the 17th – 19th centuries and the Old Montreal Port on the banks of the Saint Lawrence River.

name: Mount Royal Park
address: Chemin Olmsted, Montréal, QC H3H 1A2, Canada
description: Montreal’s spectacular Mount Royal Park (Parc du Mont-Royal) was inaugurated in 1876 as a place where city people could enjoy acres of green space and take part in different outdoor activities.

name: Saint Joseph's Oratory
address: 3800 Chemin Queen Mary, Montréal, QC H3V 1H6, Canada
description: Oratoire Saint-Joseph du Mont Royal, built in Italian Renaissance style, is Canada’s largest church. The basilica, dedicated to Saint Joseph, is best known for its link to the legendary “Brother Andre”, one of the most popular Quebecois of the 20th century who reportedly performed miraculous healings on the sick or injured.

name: Montreal Biodome
address: 4777 Avenue Pierre-de Coubertin, Montréal, QC H1V, Canada
description: The Montreal Biodome (Biodome de Montreal) takes you on a fascinating walk through four unique ecosystems found on the Americas. Visit the lush, humid Tropical Forest, feel the changing seasons of the Laurentian Maple Forest, see the Gulf of St.

name: Old Port of Montreal
address: 333 Rue de la Commune O, Montréal, QC H2Y 2E2, Canada
description: Vieux-Port de Montreal, or the Old Port of Montreal, was officially opened in 1830, although it was used as early as 1611 as a trading post among French fur traders who ventured into the region. Today, the Old Port of Montreal, which stretches 2km along the shores of the St.

name: Jean-Talon Market
description: One of the oldest public markets in Montreal is Jean-Talon Market (or Marche Jean-Talon in French).

name: Lachine Canal
description: The 14.5 km canal which passes through the Island of Montreal’s southwest is called Lachine Canal or Canal de Lachine in French.  The canal begins at the Old Port of Montreal and meanders through several boroughs to Lake Saint-Louis.

name: Montreal History Centre
address: 335 Place D'Youville, Montréal, QC H2Y 3T1, Canada
description: Housed in a former central fire station, the Centre d’Histoire de Montreal examines the fascinating history of the city.

name: Grevin Museum
address: 705 Rue Ste-Catherine O, Montréal, QC H3B 4G5, Canada
description: Canada’s premier waxwork museum is the Musee Grevin, opened by the same company which runs the Grevin Museum in Paris, France. The museum was opened in April, 2013 and allows visitors to come face to face with true-to-life wax figures of famous people.

name: Bonsecours Market
address: 350 Rue Saint Paul E, Montréal, QC H2Y 1H2,Canada
description: Bonsecours Market (Marche Bonsecours in French) is a domed public market dating from 1844 and strategically located in one of Montreal’s busiest areas.

name: St. Louis Cathedral
address: 615 Pere Antoine Alley, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
description: The cathedral is one of the most famous New Orleans landmarks. It towers above Jackson Square next to the Mississippi River with its white façade and three dark steeples. The cathedral is flanked by the Cabildo and the Presbytere. The church was designed by Adrien De Pauger and has been a place of worship since 1727.

name: The French Market
address: 2 French Market Place, New Orleans, LA, 70116
description: This open-air market has the feel of a typical European market. It offers shopping, restaurants, cafes and entertainment. The market runs near Jackson Square to the opposite end of Esplanade Ave for six blocks.

name: Garden District
address: St. Charles Street, 1st Street, Magazine Street, Toledano Street
description: Take a stroll, bus ride or drive through this neighborhood where you’ll see the best preserved historic southern mansions in the country. The area is a National Historic Landmark and covers about 0.5km² bordered by St.

name: The Cabildo
address: 701 Chartres Street, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
description: This is one of the fine historic buildings on Jackson Square. It is a Spanish colonial building standing adjacent to the St Louis Cathedral. The building is now used to hold precious artifacts from American history. The Cabildo was completed in 1799 after the Great New Orleans Fire in 1788.

name: The 1850 House
address: 523 Saint Ann Street, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
description: Unlike other house museums this one does not represent a particular family’s home but rather a typical home of the mid-19th century. Through the museum you can learn about the lifestyle, tastes in fashion and décor as well as the art, furniture and people of the time.

name: City Park
address: 1 Palm Drive, New Orleans, LA 70124, USA
description: City Park is both a New Orleans neighborhood and an actual park which is located in that part of the city. The 1,300 acre park is one of the largest in the country, almost one and a half times the size of Central Park in New York. This is a public park but not municipal as it is financially self-supporting.

name: National World War II Museum
description: This WWII museum is focused on America’s contribution to the liberation of Europe. It highlights the major battles where the Allies were victorious like the Battle of Normandy. The highly regarded museum is affiliated with the Smithsonian and is listed by Trip Advisor as New Orleans’ top attraction.

name: New Orleans Museum of Art
address: 1 Collins Diboll Circle, New Orleans, LA 70124, USA
description: NOMA is one of the many attractions in City Park, it is the city’s oldest fine arts museum dating back to 1911 when it began as the Delgado Museum of Art. The museum’s collection includes approximately 40,000 pieces dating from 600sBC to modern times and coming from across the globe.

name: St. Louis Cemetery No. 3
address: 3411 Esplanade Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70119, USA
description: This is the third of the three Saint Louis Cemeteries in the city. It is located about 3.2km from the French Quarter near Bayou St. John. The cemetery was established in 1854 and although not as famous as #1 and #2 it has many ornate and beautiful headstones, crypts and tombs.

name: St. Louis Cemetery No. 1
address: 401-499 Basin Street, New Orleans, LA 70112, USA
description: This is one of the 3 St. Louis Cemeteries in New Orleans, each has its own charm and highlights. Since March 2015 this cemetery can only be visited by tourists with a guided tour. The tours are run daily by Save our Cemeteries and should be booked online.

name: Audubon Aquarium of the Americas
address: 1 Canal Street, New Orleans, LA 70130, USA
description: This is one of four Audubon animal related attractions. It is located on the edge of the French Quarter facing the Mississippi. The highlights of the aquarium include the walk-through tunnel which takes you through the Great Maya Reef tank  where the scene of the sunken Maya city of the Yucatan peninsula has been recreated.

name: Lafayette Cemetery No. 1
address: 1400 block of Washington Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70130, USA
description: Located in the Garden District this cemetery is on land that was once the Livaudais family plantation. The property was sold in 1832 and subdivided forming part of what would become the City of Lafayette. In 1833 the cemetery was established.

name: Audubon Park
address: 6500 Magazine Street, New Orleans, LA 70117, USA
description: This green lung in the urban jungle runs from St. Charles Ave to the Mississippi River right in the middle of the historic uptown area. The land that the park occupies was originally a plantation. The land was annexed by the municipality in 1870 and a year later the city purchased the parcel of land.

name: Audubon Zoo
address: 6500 Magazine Steet, New Orleans, LA 70118, USA
description: This is one of several Audubon animal related attractions which can be visited separately or on a combo ticket although they are in different locations. Visitors can take a special Double-Decker bus between the Audubon sites.

name: Preservation Hall
address: 726 Saint Peter Street, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
description: One of the things most associated with New Orleans is jazz music and this is the ultimate venue for enjoying some real authentic Big Easy jazz. Preservation Hall was opened in 1961 and since then has focused exclusively on the local music and culture.

name: Presbytere
description: This impressive building was constructed in 1791 to stand adjacent to the St Louis Cathedral and match the Cabildo on the other side of the church. Originally the building was named Casa Curial (Ecclesiastical House) as it was constructed on the former site of the Capuchin monks’ residence – the Presbytere.

name: Old Ursuline Convent
address: 1100 Chartres Street, New Orleans, LA 70116, USA
description: Ursulines are groups of Catholic Church institutions named after their patron saint, Saint Ursula. The Ursuline Convent in New Orleans is the oldest in the Mississippi Valley, it is a group of buildings the first of which was constructed in 1727 when 12 Ursuline nuns arrived in the city from France.

name: Degas House
address: 2306 Esplanade Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70119, USA
description: Degas House, Home, Courtyard and Inn (also the name of an adjacent B&B) is on Esplanade Avenue where there are many beautiful 19th century mansions. One of these beautiful houses is where artist Edgar Degas stayed during his time in the city.  Degas (1834-1917) was a French impressionist artist who worked in several medium.

name: Millennium Park
address: 201 East Randolph Street, Chicago, IL 60601, USA (bounded by Michigan Ave., Randolph St., Columbus Drive and East Monroe Drive)
description: Originally established to celebrate the 2000 millennium year the site was opened 4 years later in 2004. The site consists of a civic center and huge park covering 99,000m² with many points of interest and open green lawns.

name: Navy Pier
address: 700 East Grand Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611, USA
description: It could take you several days to cover all the exciting attractions and sites on Navy Pier which juts out into Lake Michigan.

name: 360 Chicago
address: 875N Michigan Ave., John Hancock Center, 94th Floor, Chicago, IL 60611, USA
description: The former John Hancock Observatory is an observatory deck at the top of the John Hancock Center on Chicago’s Magnificent Mile. The observation deck is 304.8 meters (1,000 feet) off the ground overlooking the city and Lake Michigan and with views as far as the neighboring four states.

name: Lakefront Trail
address: Chicago Lakefront Trail, between Ardmore Street and 71st Street, Chicago, IL, 60611, USA
description: Follow the shore of Lake Michigan along the Lakefront Trail, it is an eco-friendly way to see the city on foot or bike. The trail or promenade stretches for 29km following the lakeshore. The paved pathway travels from Ardmore Street on the North Side to 71st Street on the South Side.

name: Willis Tower Skydeck
address: 320 West Jackson Boulevard, Chicago, IL 60606, USA
description: If you want a place to see the city from above then this is it. The Willis Tower offers you the Skydeck Experience with 360° views of the city. On a clear day you can see as far as four states (Illinois, Indiana, Michigan and Wisconsin).

name: Field Museum of Natural History
address: 1400 South Lake Shore Drive, Chicago, IL 60605, USA
description: The Field Museum was founded in 1893 and has continuously grown. Today it houses 17 permanent exhibitions and many temporary exhibitions as well as presenting science and natural history related 3D movies.

name: Art Institute of Chicago
address: 111 South Michigan Avenue, Chicago, IL 60603, USA
description: The art held at this museum is truly some of the best in the world. The permanent collection consists mainly of impressionist and post-impressionist work but there is also a fantastic collection of American art, decorative arts, modern, contemporary and Asian art as well as European Old Masters.

name: Lincoln Park Zoo
address: 2001 North Clark Street, Chicago, IL 60614, USA
description: This is considered one of the best zoos in the country. The zoo is nestled among apartment buildings and the urban jungle of Chicago. Your visit to the zoo should begin with the Gateway Pavilion where there is an Information Desk, lockers and stroller rental as well as first aid if you should need it.

name: Lincoln Park Conservatory
address: 2391 North Stockton Drive, Chicago, IL 60614, USA
description: The highlight of this botanical garden is the Victorian era glasshouse or conservatory which dates back to 1890. It is split into four display houses each holding rare exotic plants. The conservatory was designed to grow and supply the city parks with plants but also as a showcase of these beautiful plants.

name: Adler Planetarium
address: 1300 South Lake Shore Drive, Chicago, IL 60605, USA
description: When founded in 1930 this was America’s first planetarium. The architect Ernest A. Grunsfeld won the American Institute of architect gold medal for the building’s design and it became a National Historic Museum. The site has three large theatres, exhibition space and the Doane Observatory.

name: Chicago History Museum
address: 1601 North Clark Street, Chicago, IL 60614, USA
description: The focus of this museum is on the history of Chicago and America in general; it was called the Chicago Historical Society until 2006.  The society was established in 1856 but in 1871 most of the society’s collection was destroyed including hand written documents penned by Abraham Lincoln.

name: Museum of Contemporary Art
address: 220 East Chicago Avenue, Chicago, IL 60611, USA
description: MCA Chicago is one of the largest contemporary art museums in America, the art on display dates back to 1945 and up to present day. The forms of art covered include paintings, installations, sculptures, photography, video art, film and performance.

name: Museum of Science and Industry
address: 5700 South Lake Shore Drive, Chicago, IL 60637, USA
description: This museum is housed in the former Palace of Arts constructed for the 1893 World’s Columbian Exposition and is the largest museum in the western hemisphere. The museum exhibits are numerous and include huge recreations. Many of the exhibits are hands-on.

name: Wrigley Field
description: This is a legendary baseball park, home to the Chicago Cubs, one of Chicago’s two Major League baseball teams. The arena was constructed in 1914 and at the time was called Weeghman Park after one of the founders of the Federal League which existed from 1914 to 1915.

name: Chicago Theatre
address: 175 N. State Street, Chicago, IL, USA
description: Chicago is a real theatre city with many famous venues however one theatre stands out as the granddame of Chicago theatre. The original theatre was opened in 1921 and was called Balaban and Katz Chicago Theatre. The theatre marquee has become a symbol of the city and the building is a registered National Historic Place.

name: Chicago Botanic Garden
address: 1000 Lake Cook Road, Glencoe, IL 60022, USA
description: The garden is extensive with 25 display gardens and four natural habitats, each cared for to perfection. You can spend hours here enjoying a diverse range of gardens, art, architecture and water features.

name: Chicago Cultural Center
address: 78 East Washington Street, Chicago, IL 60602, USA
description: This Chicago landmark building dates back to 1897; it was the city’s first Public Library building and free cultural center and offers a wide range of cultural activities to the general public. It is a designated Chicago Landmark and listed on the national Register of Historic Place.

name: CN Tower
address: 301 Front Street West, Toronto, ON M5V 2T6, Canada
description: Perhaps Toronto’s most famous landmark, the 553.33 meter high CN Tower is the world's 6th tallest free-standing structure and was named one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World. This iconic tower was completed in 1976 and has welcomed millions of visitors since then (approximately 1.5 million annually).

name: Distillery District
address: 10 Trinity Street, Toronto, ON M5A 3C4, Canada
description: Toronto’s Distillery Historic District is spread out over 13 acres, comprising 40 heritage buildings and 10 streets.  This precinct is an excellent example of historical preservation combined with contemporary entertainment options.

name: St. Lawrence Market
address: 92- 95 Front St East Toronto, Ontario, M5E 1C3
description: A major public attraction in Toronto is St. Lawrence Market, situated in the city’s Old Town district. Since 1803, a public market has been held at his venue, with several buildings added to house the expanding offerings. Today, St. Lawrence Market comprises of three main buildings, namely St.

name: Ripley's Aquarium of Canada
description: Ripley’s Aquarium of Canada is located in downtown Toronto, near the CN Tower. There are more than 450 species of both sea and freshwater fish totaling about 13,500 specimens. The aquarium opened to the public in October 2013.

name: Hockey Hall of Fame
address: 16 The PATH - Bay Wellington-BCE-Canada Trust, Toronto, ON M5E 1X8, Canada
description: The Hockey Hall of Fame pays tribute to the sport which Canada is best associated with– ice hockey. It operates as a museum and hall of fame honoring the country’s best male and female players in history.

name: Casa Loma
description: Casa Loma, a Gothic Revival style castle and gardens in downtown Toronto, Ontario, is a stunning museum, a cherished landmark and one of the largest private residential structures in Canada. Construction of the majestic castle began in 1911 and ended in 1914.

name: Royal Ontario Museum
address: 100 Queens Park, Toronto, ON M5S 1W2, Canada
description: Toronto’s Royal Ontario Museum (ROM) ranks among the finest museums of natural history and world cultures in the world. Situated in the University of Toronto district, the museum attracts over 1 million visitors each year. It is home to six million items, with collections displayed in 40 galleries.

name: Yorkville
address: Between Bloor Street and Davenport Road, and from Yonge Street to Avenue Road.
description: A trip to Yorkville is a trip into a different world inside Toronto. This exclusive shopping district offers both internationally acclaimed upscale boutiques alongside upscale Canadian boutiques. Yorkville is host to luxury hotels, cafes, restaurants, popular bars, and fine architecture in this European style village.

name: Chinatown
description: Your visit to Toronto is not complete without heading down to Chinatown, located just west of the city centre. While there are another six Chinatowns in the Toronto area, the Chinatown located between Dundas Street West and Spadina Avenue, along with East Chinatown, has grown into one of the largest North American Chinatowns.

name: Toronto Islands
address: 55-57 Avenue of the Island, Toronto, ON M5V, Canada
description: The Toronto Islands are one of the top attractions in the city, hosting over 2 million visitors per year. Located in the western part of Lake Ontario, the islands are the perfect destination for those looking for a relaxing and exciting day out.

name: Yonge-Dundas Square
address: 33 Dundas Square, Toronto, ON M5B 1B6, Canada
description: Yonge-Dundas Square is an exciting place to meet in downtown Toronto for both tourists and residents of the city. The square is formed at the intersection where Yonge Street meets Dundas Street East. The idea to create a public square sparked to life in 1997, with construction beginning in 1998.

name: Niagara Falls
description: A drive to Niagara Falls is a popular side-trip for those visiting Toronto, with these world-famous falls located 80 miles out of the city.  The Niagara Falls is the name used for three waterfalls that sit on the United States and Canadian borders.

name: Fort York
address: Gardiner Expressway, Toronto, ON M5V, Canada

name: High Park
address: 180 Colborne Lodge Drive, Toronto, ON M6S 2X4, Canada
description: Toronto’s largest public park is located in the southwestern part of the city and is considered a true gem by locals and visitors alike.

name: Space Needle
description: The 606 ft tall Space Needle is no doubt one of Seattle’s most iconic landmarks. This observation tower was originally constructed for the 1962 World’s Fair as part of Seattle Center, based on the sketches of Edward E.

name: Pike Place Market
description: One of the oldest continuously operated farmers’ markets in the United States and the 33rd most visited tourist attraction in the world, Pike Place Market is a vibrant, community-minded venue in Seattle’s downtown.

name: Waterfront Park
description: Waterfront Park was built on the site of the former Schwabacher Wharf, or Pier 58. The park covers the area from Pier 57 to Pier 59 and is known for its spectacular views. Around the park, you will find benches, and lamps to light up the evenings.

name: Chihuly Garden and Glass
description: The Chihuly Garden and Glass exhibit showcases the work of famous glass artist, Dale Chihuly.

name: Seattle Art Museum
description: The Seattle Art Museum, fondly known as SAM, is made up of a number of campuses, the main one located in downtown Seattle.

name: Pioneer Square
description: Pioneer Square is a popular neighborhood where Seattle’s original downtown was located since 1852. Galleries, cafes, restaurants, nightclubs, parks and bookstores are found in Pioneer Square and it attracts locals and visitors both day and night.

name: Future of Flight Aviation Center
address: 8415 Paine Field Blvd, Mukilteo, WA 98275, United States
description: The Future of Flight Aviation Center is both an aviation museum and the starting point of the Boeing Tour. It is a massive display of static and interactive exhibitions and displays spreading over 28,000 square foot. It also houses a theatre, cafeteria and shops.

name: Museum of Flight
address: 9404 E Marginal Way S, Seattle, WA 98108, USA
description: Seattle’s Museum of Flight is located at King County International Airport south of the city. This nonprofit air and space museum acquires, preservers and exhibits historically significant air and space artifacts.

name: Kerry Park
description: Kerry Park, also known as Franklin Place, has a spectacular view of both Elliott Bay and downtown Seattle, some of which is offset with a Mount Rainier backdrop. Views include Bainbridge Island, and the West Seattle peninsula. The park, covering 1.26 acres, is located on Seattle’s Queen Anne Hill.

name: Tillicum Village
description: Take a four-hour scenic boat-ride from Seattle across Puget Sound to visit Tillicum Village on Blake Island.  This village is known as the birthplace of Chief Sealth in 1786, after whom the city of Seattle is named.  Blake Island has been named a Washington State Park and can only be accessed by boat.

name: Columbia Center
description: Located in downtown Seattle, Columbia Center is the tallest skyscraper to grace the Seattle skyline. The 943,000 ft building is also the tallest skyscraper in the State of Washington. The 76-storied building covers most of the block between Cherry and Columbia Streets, and Fourth and Fifth Avenues.

name: Stanley Park
address: Wren Trail, Vancouver, BC V6G, Canada
description: This Vancouver park has been voted the top attraction in the city on reputable travel websites. It is the city’s largest park and one of the best loved as well as a designated national historic site. The park covers 400 hectares with rainforest, mountains, coastlines and the park’s Seawall.

name: Robson Square
address: 800 Robson Street, Vancouver, BC V6Z 2E7, Canada
description: One of Vancouver’s landmarks is this public plaza together with the Provincial Law Courts, the Vancouver Art Gallery, Asia Pacific Center and UBC Robson Square. The space was designed by renowned architect Arthur Erikson.

name: Vancouver LookOut
address: 555 West Hastings Street, Vancouver, BC, Canada
description: From the top of the 28 floor Harbor Center in Downtown Vancouver you can get brilliant 360° views of the city. The building is one of the tallest in the city and a 40 second glass elevator ride takes visitors 168.6 meters above the ground to the panoramic observation deck.

name: Vancouver Aquarium
address: 845 Avison Way, Vancouver, BC V6G 3E2, Canada
description: Located in Stanley Park this aquarium is one of Vancouver’s top attractions and a research, rehabilitation and conservation facility. The site covers about 9,000m² and has 166 display tanks as well as various galleries.

name: Capilano Suspension Bridge Park
address: 3735 Capilano Road, Vancouver, BC V7R 4J1, Canada
description: The Capilano suspension bridge was constructed in 1889 and spans the Capilano River in North Vancouver. The original ropes were replaced by wire cables in 1903 and completely rebuilt in 1956.  It stretches for 140 meters and is 70 meters above the water.

name: Grouse Mountain
address: 6400 Nancy Greene Way, North Vancouver, BC V7R 4K9, Canada
description: Just 15 minutes from Downtown Vancouver is this top attraction. The outdoor site offers activities in all seasons. The Grouse Mountain Skyride is North America’s largest aerial tram and it travels above a beautiful wilderness paradise.

name: Vancouver Art Gallery
address: 750 Hornby Street, Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H7, Canada
description: The VAG is one of Canada’s largest art galleries; it holds approximately 10,000 works of art, some by top artists from around the world. The work includes a range from historic masters to contemporary art. The collection is always being added to as several hundred additional paintings are added to the collection each year.

name: Police Museum
address: 240 East Cordova Street, Vancouver, BC V6A 1L3, Canada
description: Vancouver has North America’s oldest Police Museum; it is located in the former Coroner’s Court, City Morgue, Crime Lab and Autopsy facility building. Here you can see more than 20,000 artifacts, documents and photos relating to the Vancouver police force.

name: Granville Island
address: 1661 Duranleau Street, Vancouver, BC, V6H 3S3, Canada
description: Granville Island is a peninsula across False Creek beneath the south end of Granville Street Bridge. Up until the 1970s the area was an industrial wasteland then it was transformed into the beautiful destination that it is today.

name: Museum of Vancouver
address: 1100 Chestnut Street, Vanier Park, Vancouver, BC V6J 3J9, Canada
description: Over the course of 100 years MOV has accumulated a collection of artifacts related to the civic life of Vancouver. The historic, ethnographic, archaeological, natural history and artistic aspects of Vancouver are used to tell the story of the city’s past, present and future.

name: Vancouver Maritime Museum
address: 1905 Ogden Avenue, Vanier Park  Vancouver, BC V6J 3L7, Canada
description: Vancouver’s maritime museum holds more than 15,000 artifacts and 100,000 images. It tells the story of the Pacific Northwest, BC and Canadian Arctic maritime history. The museum is located on the waterfront in Vanier Park and as both indoor and outdoor exhibits. Its main exhibition is St.

name: Pacific Spirit Regional Park
address: 4915 W 16th Avenue, Vancouver, BC V6N 2C4, Canada; also access from Marine Drive.
description: Pacific Spirit Regional Park is located on the western side of Vancouver along the edge of BC University.  The park covers about 763 hectares of thick forest, marshes and foreshore which is criss-crossed with 73km of hiking trails of varying levels of difficulty.

name: Queen Elizabeth Park
address: 4600 Cambie Street, little Mountains, Vancouver, BC V5Y, Canada; off 33rd Ave. between Cambie and Main Street.
description: This beautiful park covers 130 acres at an elevation of 152 meters on Little Mountain, Vancouver’s highest point. The site is a former quarry which was transformed into a park dedicated to Queen Elizabeth (the present queen’s mother) who visited Vancouver with her husband King George VI in 1939.

name: Lynn Canyon Park Suspension Bridge
address: 3663 Park Road, North Vancouver, BC, V7J 3G3
description: One of the popular attractions in North Vancouver is this park that covers 617 acres and has thick forests of 80-100 year old trees. The various hike trails throughout the park link to other adjacent parks.

name: English Bay Beach
description: This is the most popular beach in Vancouver, primarily because of its convenient location close to downtown Vancouver. The beach runs between Bidwell Street and Gilford Street along Beach Avenue. Along the east side of the beach runs the Stanley Park Seawall, a promenade along the water’s edge.

name: Lighthouse Park
address: 4902-4912 Beacon Lane, West Vancouver, BC V7W 1K5, Canada; access through Beacon Lane off Marine Drive.
description: Located on the coastline of the Burrard Inlet in West Vancouver this park covers 190 acres with rugged terrain and untouched rainforest. The landmark Point Atkinson Lighthouse which gives the park its name is located at the outermost point of the peninsula.

name: Old Quebec
description: Quebec City’s Vieux Quebec (Old Quebec) is an historical neighborhood and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: La Citadelle
address: 1 Côte de la Citadelle, Québec City, QC G1R, Canada
description: This active military installation and the official residence of the Governor General of Canada is considered the oldest military building in the country.

name: Château Frontenac
address: 1 Rue des Carrières, Québec City, QC G1R 3Y8, Canada
description: One of the most photographed hotels in the world is located in Quebec and has an impressive presence on the city’s skyline due to its 177 ft elevation point. The luxury hotel was originally designed to accommodate tourists for the 1893 Chicago World’s Fair but was not competed in time.

name: Place Royale
description: Located in the heart of Quebec City, Place Royale is considered the birthplace of French America.

name: Musée de la Civilisation
address: 85 Rue Dalhousie, Québec City, QC G1K 8R2, Canada
description: One of the most visited museums in Quebec City is Musee de la Civilasation. Through interactive exhibitions, the museum presents the culture and history of Quebec.

name: Montmorency Falls
description: Just a few minutes’ drive from Quebec City lie Montmorency Falls. At 275 ft high and 150 ft wide, these falls are the highest in Quebec and nearly 100 ft higher than Niagara Falls. The falls – also known by their French name Chutes Montmorency – are located within the Montmorency Falls Park.

name: Cathedral of the Holy Trinity
address: 31, rue des Jardins Quebec City Canada
description: Quebec City’s Cathedral of the Holy Trinity, or Sainte-Trinite in French, was built in the years between 1800 and 1804 and declared a historic monument in 1989.  The building was designed by William Robe and William Hall, two military officers, and was the first Anglican cathedral built outside of Britain.

name: Old Port
description: Vieux-Porte, as Quebec’s Old City Port is known, is a key tourist attraction to what was once a bustling area for ship merchants transporting supplies to the new settlers of the town. The Old Port was once one of the five biggest ports in the world and is still considered a popular cruise destination.

name: Museum of French America
address: 2, côte de la Fabrique Québec City
description: Located in Old Quebec City, the Museum of French America (Musee d’Amerique Francophone) is housed in the 1663 Seminaire de Quebec.

name: Ryman Auditorium
description: Ryman Auditorium, included in the National Register of Historic Places in 1971, is a massive live performance venue with over 2,300 seats for guests.  From 1943 until 1974 it hosted the Grand Ole Opry’s weekly performances and became a national icon.

name: The Parthenon
address: 2500 West End Ave, Nashville, TN 37232, USA
description: Located in the center of the Centennial Park, the Parthenon operates as an art museum.  Built in 1897, the Parthenon is a full-scale re-creation of the ancient Parthenon found in Athens, Greece.  It was built as a centerpiece for the Tennessee Centennial Exposition.

name: Centennial Park
description: One of the most famous and popular parks in Nashville, Centennial Park is located on 132 acres of land, and is filled with a plethora of entertaining activities and beauty for its visitors to enjoy.  This park is visited by tens of thousands of people every year due its impressive statutes, museum and festivals.

name: Bicentennial Capitol Mall State Park
description: Listed in the top ten public places in the U.S., Bicentennial Capital Mall State Park (Bicentennial Mall) is an urban park opened in 1996 as a celebration of Tennessee’s bicentennial anniversary.

name: The Grand Ole Opry
description: The Grand Ole Opry started out as a weekly one hour radio show dedicated to the history and sounds of country music in 1925.  Thereafter, it quickly expanded to a four hour show, airing a variety of folk, gospel and bluegrass shows and comedy acts that has attracted millions of listeners.

name: Historic RCA Studio B
address: 1611 Roy Acuff Pl, Nashville, TN 37203, USA
description: A legacy landmark and preserved by the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum, Studio B is the recording home of some of the greatest musicians of our times.  Known as the “temple of sound” – Studio B was key in the revitalization of country music and establishment of what is commonly referred to as the “Nashville Sound”.

name: The Hermitage
description: A National Historic Landmark, the Hermitage was the plantation and home of the 7th President of the United States, Andrew Jackson and his wife Rachel Jackson.

name: Belle Meade Plantation
description: Belle Meade is a historic mansion built by John Harding in 1820, located on 30 acres of land exhibiting what life was like on a successful plantation in the mid 1800’s.  The grounds include the original carriage house, slave quarters, dairy, stable and winery for visitors to explore.

name: Tennessee State Museum
description: Located in the James K.

name: Tennessee State Capitol
address: Tennessee State Capitol, 600 Charlotte Ave, Nashville, TN 37219, USA

name: The Mansion at Fontanel
description: Built in the 1980’s by Barbara Mandrell and her family, the Fontanel Mansion is located on 132 acre property. It was designed and built by Tuck-Hinton who built many of Nashville’s finest structures including the Bicentennial Mall Stage Park and the County Music Hall of Fame.

name: Musicians Hall of Fame and Museum
USS Midway Museum
address: 910 N Harbor Dr, San Diego, CA 92101, USA
description: An interesting maritime and aviation museum in downtown San Diego is the USS Midway Museum, situated onboard the aircraft carrier, Midway a CV-41 which was commissioned at the end of WWII and was the largest ship in the world until 1955. Approximately 200,000 sailors served onboard the carrier between the years 1945 to 1992.

name: Gaslamp Quarter
description: San Diego’s Gaslamp Quarter comprises of just over 16 blocks in the downtown part of the city. Listed as an historic district on the National Register of Historic Places, the area began to develop in 1867.

name: La Jolla Cove
address: Coast Blvd, San Diego, CA 92037, United States
description: The small but stunningly beautiful La Jolla Cove is situated in the San Diego La Jolla Underwater Park Ecological Reserve. It is hugely popular among swimmers, snorkelers and scuba divers due to the protection that marine life enjoys in the reserve.

name: San Diego Zoo
address: 2920 Zoo Drive, Balboa Park, San Diego, CA 92101, USA
description: Located on 100 acres of parkland in Balboa Park, the San Diego Zoo has developed a world-wide reputation and was recently voted the Best Zoo in the World. Its history spans back over a century to the 1915 Panama-California Exposition and over the years has become one of the city’s most visited attractions.

name: SeaWorld San Diego
address: 500 Sea World Dr, San Diego, CA 92109, USA
description: Over four million people visit the animal theme park, oceanarium and marine mammal park known as SeaWorld San Diego each year. The park is spread over 190 acres and incorporates 26 animal habitats, 20 shows, play areas and what is termed “premier experiences” such as swimming with dolphins.

name: Cabrillo National Monument
address: 1800 Cabrillo Memorial Dr, San Diego, CA 92106, USA
description: The Cabrillo National Monument marks the spot where the first European, Juan Rodriguez Cabrillo set foot on the US West Coast in 1542. The park covers 58.2 hectares, with about 900,000 people visiting each year.

name: Natural History Museum
address: 1788 El Prado, San Diego, CA 92101, USA
description: The oldest known scientific institution in southern California is the San Diego Natural History Museum, fondly known as ‘theNat’. The museum has always been housed in Balboa Park, albeit in different buildings until it moved to its permanent building in 1933.

name: Mount Soledad
description: Mount Soledad is an 822 foot hill which lies within the community of La Jolla, San Diego. The hill is home to several landmarks and attractions, including the 29 foot tall Mount Soledad Easter Cross which was built in 1913 and was declared a Korean War memorial in the 1980s. Today the cross is maintained by the Mt.

name: Birch Aquarium
address: 2300 Expedition Way, La Jolla, CA 92037, USA
description: Opened in 1903, the Birch Aquarium at Scripps is the public outreach center for University of California’s Scripps Institution of Oceanography. Nearly 500,000 people visit the aquarium each year.

name: Torrey Pines State Reserve
address: Torrey pines park Rd, La Jolla, CA 92037, USA
description: Torrey Pines State Natural Reserve is a 2,000 acre wild strip of land on the Southern California coast, located within San Diego’s city limits. Designated a National Natural Landmark in 1977, the reserve attracts locals and visitors who come to enjoy the clean, undeveloped environment, peaceful trails and stunning views.

name: Maritime Museum
address: 1492 N Harbor Dr, San Diego, CA 92101, USA
description: Established in 1948, the Maritime Museum of San Diego is home to one of the largest collections of historic sea vessels. The museum’s collection of historic ships includes the world’s oldest active ship, Star of India.

name: Mission Bay Park
address: 1511-1799 Fiesta Island Rd, San Diego, CA 92109, USA
description: The largest man-made aquatic park in the United States, Mission Bay Park spans across over 4,200 acres, over half of which is water.

name: Museum of Art
address: 1450 El Prado, San Diego, CA 92101, USA
description: Inspired by the appreciation of the public for an exhibition of temporary art works at the 1915 Panama-California Exposition, civic leaders began planning for a permanent art museum in 1922. The Fine Arts Gallery of San Diego opened its doors in 1926, with the name changed to the San Diego Museum of Art in 1978.

name: San Diego Zoo Safari Park
address: 15500 San Pasqual Valley Road, Escondido, California ,  92027, USA
description: Formerly known as the Wild Animal Park, the San Diego Zoo Safari Park is located in the San Pasqual Valley and is spread over 1,800 acres.

name: Balboa Park
description: Balboa Park stretches across 1,200 acres and is home to museums, theatres, walking paths and gardens in San Diego.  The park is also home to the San Diego Zoo.

name: Coronado Bridge
description: The San Diego-Coronado Bridge crosses over San Diego Bay and links the two cities. It is more commonly known as Coronado Bridge.

name: Legoland California
description: Legoland in San Diego is one of two parks based on this iconic block brand, the other one located in Florida. This family oriented amusement park has over 60 rides and attractions suitable for kids aged 2 – 12.

name: Pearl Harbor Visitor Center
address: 1 Arizona Memorial Place, Honolulu, HI, 96818, USA
description: Your exploration of the World War II Valor in the Pacific National Monument begins at the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center. The Pearl Harbor sites include the USS Arizona, Pacific Aviation Museum, USS Missouri Memorial, Bowfin Museum and USS Oklahoma Memorial all of which can be reached from the Pearl Harbor Visitor Center.

name: Diamond Head Crater
address: 4204 Diamond Head Rd, Honolulu, HI 96816, USA
description: Diamond Head Crater is on the eastern edge of the Waikiki coastline. The site has an interesting military history and an iconic hiking trail leading to the summit where there are amazing sea views. The crater is within the Diamond Head State Monument area which covers 475 acres.

name: Hanauma Bay State Park
address: 100 Hanauma Bay Drive, Ueber Kalanianaole Hwy, Honolulu, Oahu, HI, 96825
description: Just east of Honolulu is this magnificent horse-shoe shaped bay or tuff ring. Today the bay is within the Hanauma Bay State Park and is a protected marine life conservation area and underwater park. The bay is the perfect way for visitors to get to know the marine life and gorgeous nature of Hawaii.

name: Pacific Aviation Museum
address: 319 Lexington Blvd, Ford Island, Honolulu, HI 96818, USA
description: This is one of four Pearl Harbor Historic Sites on the island – USS Missouri, Arizona Memorial, USS Bowfin Submarine Museum and this museum. The museum and Missouri Memorial are on Ford Island an active military base and only accessible with the shuttle bus from Pearl Harbor Visitor Center.

name: Waikiki Aquarium
address: 2777 Kalakaua Ave, Kapiolani Park, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA
description: Founded in 1904 this is the 2nd oldest aquarium in the United States. The aquarium has a unique location next to a living coral reef. The aquarium is home to more than 3,500 creatures representing almost 500 species.

name: Ala Moana Beach Park
address: 1201 Ala Moana Blvd, Honolulu, Oahu, HI, 96814, USA
description: This site boasts the largest open-air shopping center in the world but is also famous for its beautiful beach and jogging path. The beach is a free, public beach located between Waikiki and Honolulu.

name: Bishop Museum
description: This is the officially designated state museum of natural and cultural history. It is the state’s largest museum and one of the oldest as it was established in 1889. The museum is famed as holding the largest collection of Polynesian cultural and natural history artifacts in the world.

name: Waimea Valley
address: Waimea Valley, 59-864 Kamehameha Hwy, Haleiwa, HI 96712, USA
description: This is an area of cultural and historic significance covering 1,875 acres. It has been a sacred site for the last 700 years. The valley has also been called the Valley of the Priests since 1090 when the ruler of the island gave the land to descendants of the high priests who lived and worked the land until 1886.

name: Iolani Palace
address: 364 S King St, Honolulu, HI 96813, USA
description: This is the former official royal residence of the Hawaiian Monarchy which reigned from 1795 to 1893. The cornerstone of the palace was laid in 1879 with full Masonic rites and King Kalakaua and Queen Kapiolani moved in 1882.

name: Kailua Beach
address: Kailua Beach Park, 526 Kawailoa Road, Kailua, Oahu, HI, 96734, USA
description: Located on the windward coast northeast of Honolulu with Lanikai Beach to the east and Kalama Beach to the west. The crescent shaped beach is narrow and runs for 4km (2.5 miles); some consider this one of the nicest beaches on the island. From the water’s edge the beach slopes gently downward and reaches deep water rapidly.

name: Polynesian Cultural Center
description: Visit this theme park/outdoor museum where the focus is on the cultures of the Polynesia. The 42 acre park  is set in lush green gardens with a lagoon and “river” running through it. There are recreated traditional villages representing the Polynesia cultures.

name: Waikiki Beach
address: Accessed from Kalakaua Ave., Waikiki, Oahu, HI, USA (between Sheraton Boardwalk and Waikiki Wall)
description: On the southern shore of Honolulu in the neighborhood of Waikiki is this famous beach; in fact it is a collection of five smaller beaches. From east to west the beaches which make up the Waikiki coastline are Sans Soucci Beach, Kapiolani Beach, Kuhio Park Beach, Fort DeRussy Beach and Kahanamoku Beach.

name: Kapiolani Park
address: 3840 Paki Ave, Honolulu, HI 96815, USA (eastern end of Waikiki, between Honolulu Zoo and Diamond Head)
description: In 1887 King Kalakaua gifted this park to the people of Hawaii. He named the park after his wife Queen Kapiolani. The public park covers 500 acres and many of the trees here date back 100 years.

name: Valley of the Temples
address: 47-200 Kahekili Hwy, Kaneohe, HI 96744, USA (across the street from Temple Valley Shopping Center)
description: At the foot of Koolau Mountain lies this picturesque and quaint memorial park where thousands of Shinto, Catholic, Protestant and Buddhists from the islands are buried. The park is nestled in a lush valley and the tombs are scattered on the undulating landscape.

name: National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific
description: The cemetery is within a dramatic natural setting; in a natural “punch bowl” formed thousands of years ago by volcanic activity. The site is also called Puowaina (punch bowl) and Hill of Sacrifice as the crater used to be used for sacrifices to pagan Gods.

name: Freedom Tower
description: This National Historic Landmark was designed by Shute and Weaver and completed in 1925 in the Mediterranean Revival style mixed in with some architectural elements from the Giralda in Seville, Spain.

name: Wynwood Walls
address: 2520 NW 2nd Avenue, Miami, FL 33127 (between Joey's Italian Café on 25th Street and Wynwood Kitchen & Bar on 26th Street)
description: The Wynwood Walls feature a constantly changing display of large scale art work in a neighborhood which used to be a warehouse district. The idea was conceived by Tony Goldman in an effort to revitalize the community. The massive outdoor murals are spread across six main buildings from NW 25th Street to 26th Street.

name: Gesu Catholic Church
description: This is Miami’s oldest church and one of the most photogenic. The church was established because of the large local Catholic community. Originally the church was built of wood on a plot gifted by Henry Flagler in 1896.

name: HistoryMiami
address: Miami-Dade Cultural Center, 101 West Flagler Street, Miami, FL 33130, USA
description: The former Historical Museum of Southern Florida displays exhibitions related to the history of southeastern Florida which includes the Florida Keys, Everglades and the Greater Miami area. The museum covers 3,700m² spread over two floors. There are both permanent and temporary exhibitions.

name: Key Biscayne
address: 88 West McIntyre Street, Suite 100, Key Biscayne FL 33149
description: Going out on the water and exploring one or two of the nearby islands around Miami is a part of any travel itinerary. Perhaps one of the most beautiful and convenient to reach is Key Biscayne.

name: Pérez Art Museum Miami
description: The Perez Art Museum has changed names and locations several times since its initiation in 1983. Today it is part of a new complex called Museum Park which includes the Patricia Frost Museum of Science and a city park. The museum building has three stories and state-of-the art display space with intricate lighting.

name: Vizcaya Museum and Gardens
address: 3251 South Miami Avenue, Miami, FL 33129, USA
description: The Vizcaya villa is the former home of agricultural industrialist James Deering; the estate was built in the early 20th century and includes extensive gardens designed in the Italian Renaissance style, untouched woodlands and the historic mansion. Today the villa and gardens are open to the public as a museum.

name: The Art Deco Historic District
description: This district full of interesting buildings is also called the Miami Beach Architectural District and the Old Miami Beach Historic District. This was the first 20th century neighborhood to be placed on the National Registry of Historic Places.

name: Lincoln Road
address: Lincoln Road Mall, Miami Beach, FL, 33139 (between Alton Road and Washington Road)
description: Lincoln Road is part of the vibrant and trendy South Beach, it is a pedestrian mall lined with restaurants, cafes, unique boutiques, bars and galleries. The pedestrian-only promenade stretches for a mile (1.6 meters) and is always buzzing with locals and visitors shopping, dining and being entertained by street performers.

name: Holocaust Memorial
address: 1933-1945 Meridian Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA
description: This site is officially named the Holocaust Memorial of the Greater Miami Jewish Federation. The idea for the memorial was devised by a group of Holocaust survivors in 1984. It was designed by sculptor Kenneth Treister and opened in 1990 with a ceremony dedicated by Holocaust survivor and Nobel Laureate Eilie Wiesel.

name: Bass Museum of Art
address: 2111 Collins Avenue, Miami Beach, FL 33139, USA (until fall 2016 - 227 22nd Street, Miami)
description: Exhibitions of contemporary art are regularly displayed in this popular venue. The museum was established in 1963 thanks to the donation of Baroque and Renaissance art from Johanna and John Bass. The museum is housed in the historic Miami Beach Library, a magnificent building which Russell Pancoast designed in 1930.

name: Zoo Miami
address: 1 Zoo Blvd. 12400 SW, Miami, FL 33177, USA
description: The former Miami MetroZoo or Miami-Dade Zoological Park and Gardens is Florida’s oldest and largest zoo. It is also the only tropical zoo in the country. The zoo is home to more than 3,000 animals and is spread over 750 acres of land.

name: Little Havana
address: Calle Ocho Street, (8th Street) Miami, FL 33125, USA
description: Miami’s Spanish neighborhood is home to Cuban immigrants and others from Central and South America. The neighborhood has its own distinct character which has made it a tourist stop especially during the annual festivals like Calle Ocho Festival, The Three Kings Parade and Viernes Culturales.

name: Jungle Island
description: This attraction used to be called Parrot Jungle and it originally opened in 1936, since then millions of people have visited this attraction including several famous personalities like Steven Spielberg, Jimmy Carter and Sir Winston Churchill.

name: Miami Children’s Museum
description: The museum’s motto is “play, learn, imagine, create” and that is what kids can do here as they explore exhibits designed to complement the formal school curriculum. The exhibits each have a dominant goal and specific objective to bring learning material to life for the kids on many levels.

name: Miami Seaquarium
address: 4400 Rickenbacker Causeway, Key Biscayne, FL 33149, USA
description: Seaquarium is a marine-life entertainment park with four marine animal shows (Top Deck Dolphin; Golden Dome Sea Lion; Flipper Dolphin Show and Killer Whale and Dolphin). Seaquarium is located on the island of Virginia Key in Biscayne Bay and covers 38 acres.

name: Everglades National Park
address: Shark Valley Visitor Center, 36000 SW 8th Street Miami, FL 33194. (Highway 41)
description: The natural region of the Everglades is a tropical wetland with interdependent eco-systems including sawgrass marshes, tropical hardwood hammocks, mangrove swamps, prairies and cypress swamp.

name: Venetian Pool
address: 2701 De Soto Boulevard, Coral Gables, FL 33134, USA
description: If you want to cool off then this public swimming pool is a really unique way to do it. The pool is a National Registered Historic Place, and the only pool on the registry. located in Coral Gables it was planned by Phineas Paist and designed by Denman Fink in 1924.

name: Kennedy Space Center
description: One of a number of NASA field centers, the John F.

name: Gatorland
description: Since 1949, Gatorland has been offering visitors and locals in Orlando the chance to meet literally thousands of alligators and crocodiles.

name: Blue Spring State Park
address: 2100 W. French Avenue; Orange City, FL 32763
description: The popular tourist destination of Blue Spring State Park is situated in Volusia County, Florida and covers more than 2,600 acres. The park’s name is derived from the largest spring on the St.

name: Orlando Science Center
address: 700-810 E Princeton St, Orlando, FL 32803, USA

name: Universal Studios
description: Universal Studios® is the world’s leading theme park based on the movies and TV series from Universal Studios. This theme park is a real production facility that has a large number of exciting rides, numerous shows, and attractions from some of the blockbuster movies from Universal Studios.

name: Universal’s Islands of Adventure
description: Get set for the adventure of a lifetime when you come to Universal’s Islands of Adventure. There is an adventure every step of the way as you enjoy some of the most spectacular rides, interactive attractions, shows, and so much more.

name: Walt Disney World Magic Kingdom
address: 1180 Seven Seas Dr, Lake Buena Vista, FL 32830, United States
description: One of the best theme parks in all of Orlando, actually in all of Florida, is the Walt Disney World Magic Kingdom.

name: Orlando Museum of Art
address: 2416 N Mills Ave, Orlando, FL 32803, USA
description: The Orlando Museum of Art (OMA) is considered a leading cultural institution in the State of Florida.

name: WonderWorks
description: Wonderworks is one of the most interesting amusement parks in all of Orlando. Managed by Attractions Support Services, Wonderworks is an amusement park for the mind, and that is about as cool as it can get. There are more than 100 interactive exhibits for you to check out here.

name: SeaWorld
description: One of the most amazing places to visit in Orlando is SeaWorld. You get to see the best of marine life, and there are rides, shows, exhibits, and exclusive park experiences involving some of the finest animals the sea has to offer.

name: Forever Florida
address: 4755 N Kenansville Rd, St Cloud, FL 34773, USA
description: Situated just a short one-hour drive southeast of Orlando, Forever Florida offers “ziplines and adventures in the wild”.

name: iFly
description: One of 37 locations around the world in the US, Canada, Europe and Asia, iFly Orlando invites you to enjoy the experience of indoor skydiving and to help you make your dream of flying a reality.

name: Titanic The Experience
description: Titanic Artifact Exhibition, a historic buff’s paradise, is one of a series of exhibits of historic and well-known events run by Premier Exhibitions in different prominent cities of the USA.

name: Holy Land Experience
description: The Holy Land Experience is an Orlando-based Christian theme park which creates an interactive experience for visitors to enjoy the sights and sounds of the Bible. The HLE takes visitors on a 2,000 year adventure back in time as they pass through the gates of the walled city and into ancient Jerusalem.

name: Red Sand Beach
address: Kauiki Head off Uakea Road, Hana, Maui, HI (near Travasa Hotel)
description: Hawaii is famous for the many different shades of sand on its beaches. There are black sand beaches, golden yellow beaches, white sand beaches and even this red sand beach.

name: Maui Ocean Center
address: 192 Maalaea Rd, Hwy 30, Wailuku, HI 96793, USA
description: Hawaii’s award winning aquarium located in Maui focuses on Hawaiian marine life including Hawaiian sharks, green sea turtles, humpback whales and tropical fish. The exhibits are spread over 3 acres and include the largest tropical reef aquarium in the Western Hemisphere.

name: Hookipa Beach Park
address: Hookipa Beach Park, Mile #9, Hana Highway, Paia, Maui, HI 96779, USA
description: Hookipa is located on the north shore of Maui along the Hana Highway. It is best known as a venue for windsurfers and windsurfing competitions as well as one of the best places to surf in Maui. The beach is the venue for the Aloha Classic and Red Bull surfing competitions.

name: Maui Tropical Plantation
description: Learn first-hand about Maui’s agricultural past at this working plantation in Waikapu which covers 60 acres. Here you can see 14 of the state’s most important flowers, crops and fruits including coconuts, papayas, mango, coffee, macadamia nuts and guava.

name: Bailey House Museum
description: The Old Bailey House is a house museum focused on the art and history of Hawaii. It was located within the royal compound of Kahekili II, the last ruling Chieftain of Maui and is one of the buildings in the Wailuku Historic District. The Bailey House was constructed in 1833 in a western style.

name: Haleakala National Park
address: Kipahulu Area: Mile Market 41, Hana Hwy, Hana, HI 96713; HI 96790, USA; Summit Area: 30,000 Haleakala Hwy, Kula, HI 96790 (add 10 miles to reach park entrance)
description: Haleakala Park covers 33,265 acres of which more than half is wilderness. It is a designated International Biosphere Reserve. Within the park is the dormant Haleakala Volcano. Some of the wildlife living in the park exists nowhere else in the world.

name: Molokoni Crater
address: Off the coast of Makena, Alalakeiki Channel, Maui, HI, USA  (boats leave from Makena Beach, Kihei Boat Ramp, Maalaea Harbor and Lahaina Harbor)
description: The Molokoni Crater is a volcanic atoll (ring-shaped coral reef) off the south coast of Maui. The crater is one of only 3 similar sites in the world and is the state’s only island marine sanctuary.

name: Kaanapali Beach
address: Off Kaanapali Pkwy, Lahaina, HI 96761, USA
description: This is west Maui’s signature beach located on the northwestern shore of the island. The beach of soft white sand runs for 4.8km (3 miles) along the edge of translucent water. It is consistently in the list of America’s top beaches. Facing the beach is a line of large hotels and beach resorts.

name: Wailea Beach
address: Wailea Alanui Drive, Wailea, Maui, HI 96753, USA (Between Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons Hotel, Kihei, Maui, HI
description: This beach is in front of a row of prestigious vacation resorts and hotels including the Grand Wailea and the Four Seasons. Although the hotels have access to the beach and sometimes it can appear to be a private hotel beach it is in fact a public beach.

name: Hana Highway
description: This highway or rather the Hana Millennium Legacy Trail is a route which starts in Paia and continues for 64.4 miles (103.6km) along route #36 and #360 on Maui’s eastern coastline. It takes you through the largest tropical rain forest in the USA.

name: Fairmont Empress Hotel
address: 721 Government St, Victoria, BC V8W 1W5, Canada
description: Also referred to as the Empress, the Fairmont Empress Hotel is a landmark in Victoria as it is one of the oldest and grandest hotels here. Its iconic presence near the Inner Harbour has led to it being declared a National Historic Site of Canada.

name: British Columbia Parliament Buildings
address: 501 Belleville St, Victoria, BC V8V 2L8, Canada
description: The British Columbia Parliament Buildings house the legislative assembly of British Columbia. The Parliament Buildings were between 1893 and 1898 based on designs created by Francis Rattenbury, then a 25-year old architect.

name: Royal BC Museum
address: 675 Belleville St, Victoria, BC V8W 1A1, Canada
description: The Royal BC Museum was founded in 1886 and is considered one of the greatest treasure troves of Canadian culture ever. The Archives of the museum are ancient too and were founded in 1894. This museum showcases extensively a unique range of exhibits that help you learn about the natural and human history of British Columbia.

name: Inner Harbour
description: The Inner Harbour is a part of the Victoria Harbour, which is said to be among the world’s most beautiful harbours. The harbor was used initially by First Nations and is used even today, mostly by small cruise ships and also recreational ships.

name: Craigdarroch Castle
address: 1050 Joan Crescent, Victoria, BC V8S 3L5, Canada
description: Craigdarroch Castle is a legendary castle in Victoria that was built between 1887 and 1890 by Robert Dunsmuir, a rich Scottish immigrant. The wealth of the Dunsmuir family can be easily seen in the entire structure of the castle, from the 4 floors that comprise it to the furnishings and beautiful woodwork.

name: Butchart Gardens
address: 800 Benvenuto Ave, Brentwood Bay, BC V8M 1J8, Canada
description: Butchart Gardens is a garden complex that is the creation of Jenny Butchart, wife of one of the pioneers of the cement industry of North America, Robert Pim Butchart.

name: Victoria Butterfly Gardens
address: 1461 Benvenuto Ave, Brentwood Bay, BC V8M 1J5, Canada
description: The Victoria Butterfly Gardens are among the most popular attractions in the entire Victoria region. At this unique attraction you get to see and learn about one of those insects that has always been associated with beauty, the butterfly. However, there are other animals and insects too that you get to see when you are here.

name: Beacon Hill Park
address: 21 Bridge Way, Victoria, BC V8V, Canada
description: Located along the shores of Victoria’s San Juan de Fuca Strait, Beacon Hill Park is spread across 200 acres. Considered the crowning glory of the park system in Victoria, it has numerous features that you can check out.    Explore the numerous shoreline trails when you are at Beacon Hill Park.

name: Miniature World
address: 649 Humboldt St, Victoria, BC V8W 1A7, Canada
description: Enter Miniature World to view interactive animated miniature scenes from different stories across genres – fact, fantasy, fiction, you name it and it is there. Press the different buttons near each exhibit to get it to animate and do different things like move, zoom in, and much more.

name: Chinatown
description: One of the most popular areas to visit when you are in Victoria is Chinatown. The Chinatown of Victoria is the oldest in the whole of Canada and also the second largest in North America.

name: Beale Street
description: Beale Street is an iconic street with major historical significance in Downtown Memphis. It runs from the Mississippi River to East Street and is just under 2 miles long.

name: Graceland
description: Graceland is the famous mansion of Elvis Presley, the King of Rock ‘n’ Roll. Serving as a museum since 1982, it is one of the most visited private homes in the United States with over 650,000 visitors passing through its gates annually. Graceland was declared a National Historic Landmark in 2006.

name: National Civil Rights Museum
description: The museum is part of a complex located in downtown Memphis which includes the Lorraine Motel, the actual museum and other buildings and facilities.

name: Sun Studio
description: Opened in 1950, Sun Studio is the famous recording studio started by Sam Phillips a major rock and roll celebrity. In 1951, Sun Record Studio recorded Rocket 88, which has come to be known as the first Roll N Roll single of all time.

name: Stax Museum of American Soul Music
description: The Stax Museum, opened in 2003, is a replica of the original Stax recording studio dedicated to soul music recorded by Stax and other major record labels of the time.  Stax recorded music from 1957-1975, a time of great change in America. While racial tensions were escalating in the mid-South resulting in Dr.

name: Elvis Statue
description: There is no doubt that if you are an Elvis Presley fan, a visit to Memphis is an absolute must. A major part of the musical and cultural history of Memphis can be discovered by simply visiting Graceland and Beale Street alone.

name: Memphis Rock 'N' Soul Museum
description: In August, 2004, the Memphis Rock ‘n’ Soul Museum became one of the city’s most prominent museums when it became a part of FedEx Forum. Over 200,000 visitors from all over the world have come to the museum to learn about the history and development of rock ‘n’ roll.

name: Mud Island River Park
description: Mud Island is a small peninsula located in Memphis and surrounded by the Mississippi River on one side and the Wolf River Harbor on the other. On the south side of the island visitors can find Mud Island River Park built in 1982, with a museum, restaurants, amphitheater and Riverwalk.

name: Mississippi River Museum
description: Located on Mud Island, the Mississippi River Museum is devoted to the research, conservation and advancement of the history of the Lower Mississippi River Valley.

name: Brooks Museum
description: Founded in 1916 in the original Beaux-Arts building, Memphis Brooks Museum of Art is considered Tennessee’s oldest art museum.  The building was donated by Bessie Vance Brooks in honor of her late husband.

name: Memphis Pyramid
description: The Memphis Pyramid built in 1991 was a 20,142 seat arena located on the banks of the Mississippi River.  Its shape is a replica of the Great Pyramid built in Memphis, Egypt and it is considered the tenth tallest pyramid in the world.

name: Memphis Zoo
description: Memphis Zoo, created in 1906, is located in Midtown Memphis and is home to more than 3,500 animals which represent more than 500 various species. The zoo, which is set on 76 acres of land and received the highest ranking for a zoo in the US based on visitors’ opinions.

name: Woodruff-Fontaine House Museum
description: Built in 1870, the Woodruff-Fontaine House is a French Victorian mansion comprised of three floors and 16 rooms. Today, visitors can view the mansion and its elaborate decorations with the original furnishings and heirlooms of the old wealthy mid-South families.

name: Gibson Guitar Factory
address: 145 Lt. George W Lee Ave., Memphis

name: International Rose Test Garden
description: The oldest rose testing program in the United States is located in Portland, Oregon’s Washington Park, having opened in 1917. The garden is one of 24 official testing sites for the All-America Rose Selections association which provides its seal of approval on new rose varieties.

name: Lan Su Chinese Garden
description: Bang in the heart of Portland, in the Old Town Chinatown neighborhood, you will find a walled Chinese garden sprawled over a full city block.

name: Pittock Mansion
description: After arriving in the muddy village of Portland in the 1850’s, Henry Pittock slowly worked his way up from typesetter at the weekly newspaper to becoming The Oregonian’s owner and publisher. Pittock and his wife Georgiana eventually built their home, Pittock Mansion in 1914, moving in with eight family members.

name: Portland Art Museum
description: The oldest museum in the Pacific Northwest – and the seventh oldest in the US overall, the Portland Art Museum was founded in 1892. Today, this monumental institution is recognized around the world for its highly acclaimed permanent exhibitions, as well as its ever-changing and ambitious special exhibitions.

name: The Grotto
address: The Grotto 8840 NE Skidmore Street Portland, Oregon 97220
description: The world acclaimed Catholic shrine and botanical garden, the Grotto is a popular tourist destination and spiritual retreat, attracting over 200,000 people each year from all walks of life.

name: Pioneer Courthouse Square
description: The 40,000 square foot public space in downtown Portland, Pioneer Courthouse Square is also locally known as Portland’s living room.

name: Portlandia
description: The American sculptor, Raymond Kaskey was commissioned by the city of Portland’s Metropolitan Arts Commission to build a sculpture over the entrance of the Portland Building, which he completed in 1985.

name: Forest Park
description: Portland’s Forest Park is considered one of the country’s largest urban forest reserves, stretching over 13 kms on hillside territory which overlooks the Willamette River. The park is popular for its many trails, wildlife, panoramic views of nearby peaks and creeks.

name: Columbia River Gorge
description: One of the most dramatic landscapes in the United States is found a short distance from Portland, incorporating deserts, rain forests, alpine meadows and more. The Columbia River Gorge canyon, a protected National Scenic Area, stretches around 80 miles of extremely diverse terrain and a range of ecosystems.

name: Oregon Zoo
description: Founded in 1888 by local Portland pharmacist, Richard Knight, Oregon Zoo is considered the oldest of its kind west of the Mississippi.

name: Pearl District
description: Portland’s Pearl District is an urban neighborhood which once housed warehouses and factories, but is now considered one of the city’s most desirable areas.
