name: Washington Park
description: The heart and soul of Portland is undoubtedly Washington Park, a 410 acre public urban park that incorporates wild forest trails, a zoo, several museums, the city’s famous Japanese Gardens, memorials, picnic grounds, play areas, sports grounds and more.

name: Independence Hall
address: Independence Hall, 520 Chestnut St, Philadelphia, PA 19106, USA                                      Phone Number:
description: Considered the birth place of the American nation, Philadelphia’s Independence Hall is the spot where representatives from 12 states gathered in 1787 to shape the US Constitution.

name: Eastern State Penitentiary
address: 2027 Fairmount Ave, Philadelphia, PA 19130, USA                                                                    Phone Number: (215)- 236-3300
description: Once considered one of the world’s most famous and well-designed prisons, Eastern State Penitentiary now stands empty from prisoners and is considered one of Philadelphia’s most visited tourist attractions.

name: Philadelphia Museum of Art
address: 2600 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy, Philadelphia, PA 19130, USA                                     Phone Number: (215) 763-8100
description: Originally created for the 1876 Centennial Exposition, the Philadelphia Museum of Art incorporates collections that number over 240,000 objects.

name: City Hall
description: Designed by the architect John McArther Jr, the Philadelphia City Hall was inaugurated at the turn of the 20th century as a seat for the city’s government.

name: Reading Terminal Market
description: Pennsylvania’s Reading Terminal Market is one of the city’s most popular enclosed public vending areas, with a rich history that is intertwined with the city’s roots. Most of the area that the Reading Terminal Market occupies (12th and Arch streets) once had its roots in the Butchers’, Farmers’ and Franklin markets.

name: Rodin Museum
address: 185 N 22nd St, Philadelphia, PA 19130, USA                                                                         Phone Number:  (215)-763-8100
description: You will find the largest collection of works by the French sculptor, Auguste Rodin outside of France at the Rodin Museum, located in Parkway, Philadelphia. The museum was gifted to the city by Jules Mastbaum in 1929, to house his extensive collection of works by the famous sculptor.

name: Rittenhouse Square
description: During the late 17th century, Quaker and founder of the Province of Pennsylvania, William Penn, planned five open-spaced parks in central Philadelphia, together with his surveyor Thomas Holme. Rittenhouse Square is one of these five parks and is considered one of the best urban public spaces in the entire country.

name: Fairmount Park
description: The biggest municipal park in Pennsylvania is Fairmount Park, spread over thousands of acres and made up of two distinct sections that are divided by the Schuylkill River. Fairmount was the city’s first park, and grew out of Henry Pratt’s Lemon Hill estate that was purchased by Philadelphia in 1844.

name: Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts
address: 1300-1399 Cherry St, Philadelphia, PA 19107, USA                                                                  Phone Number: (215) 972-7600
description: The Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts (PAFA), was founded in 1805 and is the oldest art museum and art school in the country.  It was the realization of an idea first thought up by the artist and scientist Charles Willson Peale, William Rush and other civic-minded businessmen and artists.

name: Christ Church
address: 22 N 2nd St, Philadelphia, PA 19106, USA                                                                                       Phone Number: 215.922.1695
description: Founded in 1695, Christ Church in Philadelphia is known as the ‘Nation’s Church’ because of the number of famous Revolutionary-era leaders, including Benjamin Franklin, William Penn, William White and Absalom Jones, who worshipped there. Christ Church was the first Anglican Church in Pennsylvania.

name: Academy of Natural Sciences
address: 1900 Benjamin Franklin Pkwy, Philadelphia, PA 19103, USA                                      Phone Number: (215) 299-1000
description: The oldest natural science research institution and museum in the Western Hemisphere is the Academy of Natural Sciences (of Drexel University), founded in 1812 and considered one of the world’s leading institutions.

name: Betsy Ross House
address: 239 Arch St, Philadelphia, PA 19106, USA                                                                        Phone Number:  215-686-1252                                                Admission: Adult $5, Child $4
description: Betsy Ross was a local 18th Philadelphian seamstress who is best known for the legend that she sewed the first American flag. The house where she reportedly lived and where the famous flag was sewn is located on Arch Street, a few blocks away from Liberty Bell and Independence Hall.

name: Benjamin Franklin Museum
address: 1500 PA-3, Philadelphia, PA 19102, USA                                                                                         Phone Number: (215) 965-2305
description: Franklin Court refers to the complex of historic sites and museums that form part of Independence National Historical Park, where one of the Founding Fathers of the United States, Benjamin Franklin, had his residence for over 40 decades until he died in 1790.

name: Elfreth's Alley
description: Elfreth’s Alley is the name given to the alley that stands between Second Street and Delaware River in Philadelphia. Designated a National Historic Landmark since 1966, the cobbled alley is home to 32 Federal and Georgian residences that still stand from the city’s early days.

name: Independence Seaport Museum
address: 211 S Christopher Columbus Blvd, Philadelphia, PA 19106, USA
description: The Independence Seaport Museum started its life as the Philadelphia Maritime Museum when it was founded in 1961.

name: The Sixth Floor Museum
address: Dallas County Administration Building, 411 Elm St, Dallas, TX 75202, USA
description: The Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza is located at the intersection of Houston and Elm Streets in Dallas Texas. The museum is dedicated to the life and death of President John F. Kennedy, and is located at the same spot where he was shot and killed on November 22, 1963.

name: Nasher Sculpture Center
description: The Nasher Sculpture Center is located in the Dallas Arts District. Raymond Nasher began collecting sculptures in the 1950s, and in 1997, he acquired the land on which the museum is now built.

name: Reunion Tower
description: The Reunion Tower, often referred to as “The Ball” by locals, is a 561 ft high observation tower. The tower is named for and located in the Reunion District in downtown Dallas, Texas. It was completed in 1978, and has a high-speed elevator ride to the top that takes 68 seconds.

name: Dallas Museum of Art
description: The Dallas Museum of Art, known as the DMA, is located along Woodall Rodgers Freeway in the Arts District of downtown Dallas between Harwood and St. Paul.

name: Dealey Plaza
description: Dealey Plaza is most well known as the location in which John F. Kennedy was assassinated on November 22nd, 1963. The area has been named as a National Historic Landmark in order to preserve the areas of the plaza that are in any way connected to the assassination.

name: George W. Bush Presidential Library and Museum
description: The George W. Bush Presidential Library and Museum is the 13th Presidential Library. It is located inside the George W. Bush Presidential Center on the Southern Methodist University campus, and is administered by the National Archives and Records Administration.

name: Perot Museum of Nature and Science
address: 2201 N Field St, Dallas, TX 75201, USA
description: In December 2012, the Perot Museum of Nature and Science moved to its current location in Victory Park, Dallas. The museum covers 180,000 square feet and has six floors, one of which houses the museum offices, with the other five floors split between six learning labs and 11 permanent exhibit halls.

name: Dallas Zoo
description: The Dallas Zoo covers 106 acres and is located in Marsalis Park, 3 miles to the south of Downtown Dallas. The zoo was first opened with two mountain lions and two deer in 1888, making it the oldest zoological park in Texas. The Dallas Zoo is the largest zoo in Texas, and had more than 1 million visitors in 2015.

name: Phoenix Art Museum
address: 1625 N Central Ave, Phoenix, AZ 85004, USA
description: The Phoenix Art Museum opened its doors in 1959 and is today the biggest art museum in the southwestern USA. The numbers speak for themselves: over 18,000 works of art and more than 400 exhibitions in the last 50 years.

name: Camelback Mountain
address: 5700 N. Echo Canyon Parkway Phoenix, AZ 85018, USA
description: Camelback Mountain is an amazing natural attraction in Phoenix, Arizona. The mountain gets its name from its unique shape. For the most part, it looks like the hump and head of a camel on its knees. It is located in the Camelback Mountain Echo Canyon Recreation Area and is a well-known landmark near metropolitan Phoenix.

name: Wrigley Mansion
address: 2501 E Telawa Trail, Phoenix, AZ 85016, USA
description: If you want a grand and spectacular view of the mountains around and the land below, visit Wrigley Mansion. This amazing mansion was built in 1932 by chewing gum baron William Wrigley Jr. and is at the top of a hill. It was originally a gift to his wife on their 50th wedding anniversary.

name: Papago Park
address: 625 N Galvin Pkwy, Phoenix, AZ 85008, USA
description: Papago Park in Phoenix is a municipally operated park that draws thousands of visitors annually. This park has been designated a Phoenix Point of Pride. The park is spread across 1200 acres and is located very close to Van Buren St and Galvin Parkway.

name: Goldfield Ghost Town
address: 4650 N Mammoth Mine Rd, Apache Junction, AZ 85119, USA
description: Goldfield was a gold mining town to the north-east of Apache Junction, which is now a ghost town. It developed during the Gold Rush and then later died down as the Rush ended and people moved on. When you visit Goldfield you get to experience several different aspects of life during the Gold Rush.

name: Old Town Scottsdale
address: 4101 N Scottsdale Rd, Scottsdale, AZ 85251, USA
description: Scottsdale has a reputation for being the most ‘Western town of the West’, and embodying this title completely is Old Town Scottsdale. Old Town Scottsdale is in the heart of Downtown, and takes you back straight to the West of Old.

name: Musical Instrument Museum
address: 4725 E Mayo Blvd, Phoenix, AZ 85050, USA
description: One of the most exciting attractions for music lovers and the layman alike is the Musical Instrument Museum, located in Phoenix and founded by Robert J.

name: Montezuma Castle National Monument
address: Montezuma Castle Rd, Camp Verde, AZ, USA
description: The Montezuma Castle National Monument is one of the most well-preserved cliff dwellings in the whole of North America. The monument is 5-storied and has 20 rooms in all. It consists of a set of ancestral Puebloan cliff dwellings and is located near Camp Verde in Arizona.

name: Apache Trail
address: State Rt 88, Apache Junction, AZ 85219, USA
description: Apache Trail is a historic road that connects Apache Junction near Greater Phoenix to Theodore Roosevelt Lake. It traverses through Superstition Mountains and the Tonto National Forest.

name: Parliament Hill
address: Wellington St, Ottawa, ON K1A 0A4, Canada
description: Located on the southern bank of the Ottawa River in downtown Ottawa, Parliament Hill is home to the Parliament of Canada. Its elaborate gothic revival buildings are an arresting site, and have come to be regarded a symbol of national importance.

name: National Gallery of Canada
address: 380 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON K1N 9N4, Canada
description: The National Gallery of Canada is Canada’s largest and most impressive art collection.

name: Canadian War Museum
address: 1 Vimy Pl, Ottawa, ON K1A 0M8, Canada
description: The Canadian War Museum in downtown Ottawa charts Canada’s vast military history through a series of permanent and temporary exhibition spaces.

name: Rideau Canal
description: Connecting the Canadian capital city of Ottawa to Lake Ontario and the Saint Lawrence River is the immense Rideau Canal, spanning an impressive length of 202 kilometers. Opened in 1832, its original purpose was to secure a reliable trade and supply route in the event of military tensions with the United States of America.

name: ByWard Market
address: 55 ByWard Market Square, Ottawa, ON K1N 9C3
description: The ByWard Market is a buzzing shopping, dining, arts and entertainment district in Lower Town, Ottawa. It is the largest market in the city, encompassing 260 artisan stalls and over 600 small business ventures in total, with an estimated 50 000 visitors every weekend.

name: National War Memorial
address: Wellington St, Ottawa, ON K1P 5A4, Canada
description: Ottawa’s National War Memorial is a tall memorial arch commemorating all Canadian soldiers who have died in the service of war, past and future. Unveiled for the first time in 1939 after a nation-wide competition for its design, the memorial’s initial intention was to commemorate the Canadian casualties of World War I.

name: Canadian Museum of History
address: 100 Rue Laurier, Gatineau, QC K1A 0M8, Canada
description: The Canadian Museum of Nature is Canada’s première natural history and sciences museum. Covering the areas of botany, mineralogy, paleontology and zoology, it offers comprehensive insight into the wonders of the natural world both on Canadian soil and abroad.

name: Rideau Hall
address: 1 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON K1A 0A1, Canada
description: Located on a pristine 79-acre estate in downtown Ottawa, Rideau Hall has been the official residence of every governor general in Canada since it was first established in 1867. It is a grand neo-classical structure with an impressive stone pediment, offering tours of its opulent interiors.

name: Rideau Falls
description: Located on a pristine 79-acre estate in downtown Ottawa, Rideau Hall has been the official residence of every governor general in Canada since it was first established in 1867. It is a grand neo-classical structure with an impressive stone pediment, offering tours of its opulent interiors.

name: Gatineau Park
address: Chemin Scott, Chelsea, QC J9B 1R5, Canada
description: Nestled in the junction between the Ottawa and Gatineau Rivers, Gatineau Park is one of Ottawa’s largest conservation parks, spanning over 36 000 hectares of pristine natural landscape.

name: Dow's Lake
description: Dow’s Lake is a scenic man-made lake located on Ottawa’s historic Rideau Canal. Named after the American settler, Abram Dow, it was built and established in conjunction with a nearby dam in the early 19th century.

name: Royal Canadian Mint
address: 320 Sussex Dr, Ottawa, ON K1A 0G8, Canada
description: Founded in 1908, the Royal Canadian Mint is the crown organization responsible for all of the special edition and Maple gold Leaf bullion investment coins in circulation in Canada, along with medallions and sports medals. It no longer deals with ordinary cash.

name: Hog's Back Falls
address: Prince of Wales Falls, Ottawa, ON, Canada
description: The Hog’s Back Falls are a number of man-made waterfalls located on Ottawa’s Rideau River at the junction where it splits off into the historic Rideau Canal. Prior to the canal’s construction in 1832, they were merely a few gentle rapids.

name: Las Olas Boulevard
description: Las Olas Meaning The Waves in Spanish, Las Olas is Fort Lauderdale’s most popular thoroughfare, with the boulevard running from Andrews Avenue in the CBD to Fort Lauderdale Beach.

name: Fort Lauderdale Beach
description: Situated along three miles of sparkling turquoise water and golden sand, Fort Lauderdale beach is one of the city’s most popular destinations for locals and visitors alike. The distinct Wave Wall marks the beach and extends along the famous brick paved promenade.

name: Hugh Taylor Birch State Park
address: 3300 NE 15th Ct, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304, USA

name: Museum of Art Fort Lauderdale
description: The NSU Art Museum in Fort Lauderdale, associated with Nova Southeastern University, is one of the state’s leading destinations for exhibitions that showcase civilization’s visual history from all angles.

name: Riverwalk
description: Located in Fort Lauderdale’s historic downtown district next to the New River, Riverwalk is a beautiful mile of rich tropical landscape and winding walkways through a relaxing park.

name: Everglades National Park
description: Everglades National Park is known as the largest subtropical wilderness in the United States. This 1.5 million acre World Heritage Site and International Biosphere Reserve is visited by over 1 million people each year who enjoy an unparalleled landscape which provides a safe home to a number of endangered species.

name: Flamingo Gardens
address: 3750 S Flamingo Rd, Davie, FL 33330, United States
description: West of Fort Lauderdale lie Flamingo Gardens, encompassing a wildlife sanctuary, botanical gardens and an aviary.

name: Hollywood Beach
description: Voted one the US’s cleanest, safest and most user-friendly beaches, Hollywood Beach, nestled between Fort Lauderdale and Miami, boasts a fantastic 2.5 mile beachside Broadwalk along the Atlantic.

name: Martin Luther King Jr. National Historic Site
address: 450 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
description: Martin Luther King Jr. National Historic Site consists of a series of buildings, roughly in the same district that famous civil rights activist and the voice of an entire nation, Martin Luther King Jr. grew up in.

name: World of Coca-Cola
address: 121 Baker St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
description: The World of Coca Cola as the name suggests is a museum in Atlanta dedicated to the beverage, where the Coca Cola Company has its headquarters. The museum is constructed in a way as to showcase the history of the globally renowned soft drink since its inception till date, through a tour of the facility.

name: Atlanta Botanical Garden
address: 1345 Piedmont Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
description: Atlanta Botanical Garden is located in Midtown Atlanta. It was founded in 1976 and is known for its collection of rare species of flora from around the world. The garden is spread over 35 acres of land with a single mission to raise and conserve flora varieties for display education research and enjoyment.

name: Georgia Aquarium
address: 225 Baker St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
description: Georgia Aquarium is a public observatory that is home to various marine life specimens. It was the largest public aquarium since its inception until 2012 when it was surpassed by Marine Life Park in Singapore.

name: Zoo Atlanta
address: 800 Cherokee Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30315, USA
description: Zoo Atlanta is a zoological park in Atlanta, accredited by the Association of Zoos & Aquariums. It is one of the four zoos in America that houses the giant panda in its premises.

name: Piedmont Park
address: 400 Park Dr NE, Atlanta, GA 30309, USA
description: Piedmont Park is an expansive stretch of land within the urban landscape of Atlanta City which at present serves as a park.

name: Atlanta History Center
address: 76 Peachtree St NW, Atlanta, GA 30303, USA
description: Atlanta History Center is a history museum situated in the Buckhead district of Atlanta. Spread over 33 acres, it is a vast establishment and is home to several historical monuments and gardens located on its premises. It also boasts the largest collection of historical artifacts from the Civil War in the USA.

name: National Center for Civil and Human Rights
address: 100 Ivan Allen Jr Blvd NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
description: The National Center for Civil and Human Rights is a museum dedicated to the civil rights movement in the United States and the global human rights movement. The museum was opened to the public in 2014. It holds a number of permanent and temporary exhibitions, which cover the various facets of civil rights movement in the US.

name: College Football Hall of Fame
address: 250 Marietta St NW, Atlanta, GA 30313, USA
description: One of the biggest sports attractions in Atlanta, College Football Hall of Fame is a football themed museum and a hall of fame. It was founded in 1951 by the National Football Foundation to honor players and coaches involved in college football.

name: Oakland Cemetery
address: 248 Oakland Ave SE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
description: Oakland Cemetery is believed to be one of the largest cemeteries and green spaces in Atlanta. It was founded in 1850 as ‘Atlanta Cemetery’ and was renamed in 1872 to acknowledge the presence of a large number of oak trees in the area.

name: CNN Center
description: CNN Center is the headquarters of the world’s most famous news network in Atlanta, Georgia. The CNN Center houses its main newsrooms and multiple studios. Located adjacent to the Centennial Olympic Park, the center is a popular tourist spot. The CNN Center came into focus as a part of the Omni International Group.

name: The King Center
address: 449 Auburn Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
description: The King Center is considered a National Historic Site and was built in honor of none other than Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. These grounds are open to public and are self guided so there is no need to make any bookings or reservations in advance. However, if you are interested in touring Dr.

name: Pemberton Place
address: 126 Ivan Allen Jr Blvd NW, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
description: Pemberton Place is named after John Pemberton who happens to be the inventor of the soda beverage Coca - Cola. Back in the day, Pemberton place was nothing but a block of houses, shops and other businesses that were all economically struggling during the mid-20th century.

name: Central Park
address: 400 Merritts Ave NE, Atlanta, GA 30308, USA
description: Atlanta has several parks but Central Park, located in the Fourth Ward West neighborhood of Old Fourth Ward, is the most well-known. The park was known as Bedford - Pine Park prior to 1999. This open space was created due to the great fire in Atlanta in 1917.

name: Ebenezer Baptist Church
address: 101 Jackson St NE, Atlanta, GA 30312, USA
description: Ebenezer Baptist Church is a part of the famous Martin Luther King Jr. National Historic Site. The church was the home to Martin Luther King Jr. Baptized at this very church as a child, Martin spend his childhood and a part of his adult life in the church.

name: Waterfront Park
description: Located close to the Cooper River in Charleston, Waterfront Park is a 5 hectare park which exudes the character and history the city’s architecture and gardens. Opened in 1990, it is one of the most visited parks in South Carolina which offers amazing views of the Charleston Harbor.

name: City Market
description: The City Market, also known as the Center Market is a historic market complex in central Charleston. It is one of the major and oldest public markets in the United States and home to more than 300 entrepreneurs. The market is open year round and offers something for everyone regardless of the time or season.

name: South Carolina Aquarium
description: The South Carolina Aquarium was opened 2000 on the historic Charleston Harbor. The aquarium is home to over 10,000 aquatic plants and animals like river otters, alligators, green moray eels, sea stars, sharks, loggerhead sea turtles, jellyfish, horseshoe crabs, and lined seahorses.

name: Rainbow Row
address: e, 83 E Bay St, Charleston, SC 29401, USA
description: Rainbow Row together refers to a group of 13 historical houses in Charleston, South Carolina. The buildings are the longest cluster of Georgian row houses in the United States of America.

name: Charleston Museum
description: One of the oldest museums in the USA, the Charleston Museum in South Carolina was founded in 1773. It was originally opened to the general public in 1824. In 1920, the museum’s director Laura Bragg became the first woman in the US to direct a publicly funded art museum.

name: Morris Island
description: Morris Island has a unique mixture of history and natural beauty to offer, making it an ideal tourist spot. This uninhabited island is spread across an area of 840 acre and is accessible only by boat. The island played a major role in American Civil War as it was used to defend Charleston’s harbor.

name: Joseph Manigault House
description: Joseph Manigault House is one of the most prominent museums in Charleston. The building is fashioned in antebellum style and offers unique insight into the Adam style of architecture. The house was built in 1803 and is a magnificent example of the urban lifestyle of affluent people of that era.

name: Charleston Historic District
description: The Charleston Historic District or the Charleston Old and Historic District in South Carolina was declared as a national historic landmark in 1960 for its architectural significance. The region possesses an unparalleled collection of 18th- and 19th-century architecture.

name: Heyward-Washington House
description: The Heyward-Washington House in Charleston is owned and managed by the Charleston Museum. Built in 1772, the historic house museum was once the residence of revolutionary patriot and signer of the US Declaration of Independence, Thomas Heyward, Jr.

name: Forsyth Park
address: Drayton St & W Gaston Street, Savannah, GA 31401
description: A historic park in the city of Savannah, Georgia, this large estate is one of the largest open areas in Savannah spread over 30 acres. This park is surrounded by Park Avenue towards the south, Whitaker Street towards the west and Gaston Street on the north. It is a popular park with plenty of activities to look forward to.

name: Cathedral of St. John the Baptist
address: 222 E Harris St, Savannah, GA 31401, USA
description: The Cathedral of St. John the Baptist is one of the most beautiful and historic monuments in Savannah, Georgia. This is a beautiful French Gothic Cathedral that towers over Lafayette Square in the Historic District where visitors are sure to enjoy each minute spent there.

name: Bonaventure Cemetery
description: Bonaventure Cemetery in Savannah, Georgia is indeed a historical marvel. It rose to the spotlight when it was highlighted in the novel, Midnight in the Garden of Good and Evil by John Berendt and also in a movie of the same name.

name: Old Fort Jackson
address: 1 Fort Jackson Rd, Savannah, GA 31404, USA
description: Old Fort Jackson was built in 1808 and named after James Jackson, who was considered a hero of the American Revolution. Located on the eastern side of Savannah, Georgia on the Islands Expressway, the fort was built to protect the city from outside attack. It is oldest standing fort in Georgia and a National Historic Landmark.

name: City Market
description: Dating back to 1755, Savannah’s City Market is located two blocks away from River Street. This historic market is where fishermen and farmers used to bring their goods to sell. It still remains the hub of all activities in Savannah’s historic district.

name: Mercer Williams House Museum
description: Mercer Williams House is one of the biggest tourist attractions in the area. It was commissioned by General Hugh Weedon Mercer and designed by John S. Norris. The construction was started in 1860 and completed in 1868, owing to interruptions due to the American Civil War.

name: First African Baptist Church
description: First African Baptist Church is not only a place of religious significance, but is also of historic importance. The church was officially constituted as a body organized believers in 1777 and grew further under the leadership of the 3rd Pastor Reverend Andrew C.

name: Pin Point Heritage Museum
address: 9924 Pin Point Ave, Savannah, GA 31406, USA
description: Pin Point Heritage Museum, run by the Coastal Heritage Society, is one of the major tourist attractions in the area. It is located in the Gullah-Geechee community of Pin Point and is blessed with abundance of natural beauty. The museum is housed in a building which earlier served as AS Varn & Son Oyster Seafood Factory.

name: Savannah History Museum
address: 303 Martin Luther King Jr Blvd, Savannah, GA 31401, USA
description: Savannah History Museum is one of the biggest tourist attractions in Savannah, Georgia. The museum is housed in the old Central of Georgia Railway passenger shed. The building also serves as the Visitor Information Center.

name: Andrew Low House
description: Andrew Low House is a prominent part of the architectural heritage of Savannah, Georgia. It is located close to Lafayette Square. The house is a delight for people who are looking to soak in the local history of art and culture.

name: Denver Art Museum
address: 100 W 14th Ave Pkwy, Denver, CO 80204, USA
description: Located in the Civic Center of Denver, the Denver Art Museum had its beginnings as the Denver Artists Club in 1893. The museum grew and evolved over the years, and moved to its current location in 1948. The Denver Art Museum houses 70,000 artworks.

name: Denver Zoo
description: The Denver Zoo covers an area of 80 acres. The zoo was founded in 1896, and is owned by the City of Denver, and is located in the Denver City Park. The zoo had its beginnings when an orphaned American black bear cub was given to Thomas S. McMurry, the mayor of Denver at the time.

name: Denver Botanic Gardens
description: The Denver Botanic Gardens are located at York Street, and cover a 24-acre area. There are a number of themed gardens with plants from around the world that show great diversity.

name: Larimer Square
description: Larimer Square is located in Denver’s first designated historic district. It is the oldest block in Denver, which was first designed by William E Larimer. Today, the downtown area has top quality boutique shopping, and high-end restaurants.

name: History Colorado Center
description: History Colorado Center is a museum located in Denver that covers the history of the entire state of Colorado. The museum opened in 2012 just one block away from where the Colorado History Museum was located before its closure in 2010.

name: Calgary Tower
address: 101 9 Ave SW, Calgary, AB T2P 1J9, Canada
description: Located in downtown Calgary, Calgary Tower stands against the city’s skyline at 525 feet tall. The magnificent concrete and steel structure provides 360° views of the cityscape, all the way to the majestic Rocky Mountains. Every guest who visits the Tower is entitled to a multimedia tour.

name: Fort Calgary
address: 750 9 Ave SE, Calgary, AB T2G 5E1, Canada
description: Fort Calgary marks the original location where the North West Mounted Police first constructed a fort in 1875. This is considered to be the founding of the city of Calgary. Although the fort no longer stands, the location has become a National Historic Site.

name: Dinosaur Provincial Park
description: Located in the valley of Red Deer River in southeastern Alberta, Dinosaur Provincial Park is renowned for its beautiful riverine, badlands and prairie habitats.

name: Canada's Sports Hall of Fame
address: 169 Canada Olympic Rd SW, Calgary, AB T3B 6B7, Canada
description: Established in 1955, Canada’s Sports Hall of Fame stands to both preserve and promote Canada’s long standing history and heritage of sport. As part of the WinSport complex, the Hall stands on the site of the 1988 Olympic Winter Games in Calgary, and hosts hundreds of historical artifacts.

name: WinSport
address: 88 Canada Olympic Road SW Calgary, AB T3B 5R5
description: WinSport is a world class sport institute, most famously known for hosting the XV Olympic Winter Games of 1988. Many of Canada’s most famous winter sports athletes were trained, and continue to train in the park. The park also offers numerous exhilarating sporting activities for visitors in both the summer and winter.

name: Halifax Citadel National Historic Site
address: 5425 Sackville St, Halifax, NS B3J 3Y3, Canada
description: The Halifax Citadel National Historic Site is a fort dating back to the 19th century. The British fort was strategically located on higher ground, and now gives visitors an excellent view of downtown Halifax.

name: Halifax Public Gardens
address: 5665 Spring Garden Rd, Halifax, NS B3J 3S9, Canada
description: In 1874, the Halifax Public Gardens was created when a public park and the Nova Scotia Horticultural Society Garden were combined. Between 1872 and 1915 the bandstand, the huge wrought iron gates, statues, and fountains were built under the guidance of the superintendent of the Gardens, Richard Power.

name: Halifax Waterfront
address: Lower Water St, Halifax, NS B3H 4P8, Canada
description: The Halifax Waterfront covers an area in which you will find a number of attractions. Included in these attractions is part of historic Halifax with the Canadian Museum of Immigration, and the Halifax Seaport Farmers’ Market, which is the oldest farmers’ market that has been in continuous use in North America.

name: Point Pleasant Park
address: 5718 Point Pleasant Dr, Halifax, NS B3H 1B5, Canada
description: The historic Point Pleasant Park is located on the south end of the Halifax peninsula. It covers a huge 75 hectares and has 39km of trails throughout the park. The park is rented from the British government for one shilling a year with a lease that lasts for 999 years.

name: Historic Properties
address: 1869 Upper Water St, Halifax, NS B3J 1S9, Canada
description: Historic Properties, also known as the Privateers Wharf, is a quaint shopping district on the Halifax Boardwalk. The Historic Properties area covers three city blocks. It was originally made up of waterfront warehouses. The warehouses were restored, maintaining the original facades where possible.

name: Naval Museum of Halifax
address: 2729 Gottingen St, Halifax, NS B3K 5X5, Canada
description: The Naval Museum of Halifax, formerly known as the Maritime Command Museum, is located inside a naval base. The museum is located in the formal official admiral’s residence, which was built by the Royal Canadian Navy. The residence was declared a National Historic Site of Canada in 1974, and is also known as Admiralty House.

name: San Antonio River Walk
address: 849 E. Commerce Street, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: The San Antonio River Walk is one of the biggest attractions in the region. It is a network of cypress-lined paved walkways and stone bridges that offer a unique way to enjoy the best part of the city.

name: The Alamo
address: 300 Alamo Plaza, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: The Alamo in San Antonio is also known as The Alamo Mission. It was founded in the 18th century and was originally known as Misión San Antonio de Valero. The Roman Catholic mission is now part of the San Antonio Missions World Heritage Site.

name: San Antonio Museum of Art
address: 200 W Jones Ave, San Antonio, TX 78215, USA
description: The San Antonio Museum of Art is one of most visited museums that opened to the public in 1981 and is known for its wide range of collections. The museum is located on the northern section of the River Walk. It initially specialized in art of the Americas and its range has expanded considerably since then.

name: Institute of Texan Cultures
address: 801 E César E. Chávez Blvd, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: The Institute of Texan Cultures serves both as a museum and a library and is a part of the University of Texas in San Antonio. The venue offers multicultural education along with the display of exhibits, events and programs. The facility was established in 1965 and is located near the River Walk in the HemisFair.

name: Six Flags Fiesta Texas
address: 17000 IH-10 West, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA
description: Six Flags Fiesta Texas is an amusement park and is one of the most popular hangouts for families. The park was opened to the public in 1992 and is spread over the area of 200 acres. The site of the park is a former limestone quarry.

name: SeaWorld San Antonio
address: 10500 Sea World Dr, San Antonio, TX 78251, USA
description: SeaWorld San Antonio is one of the biggest tourist attractions that offer a different perspective of marine life. The park is located around 10 miles from the city and offers a combination of thrill rides, interactive animal exhibits, aquariums and much more.

name: San Antonio Zoo
address: 3903 N St Mary's St, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA
description: The historical San Antonio Zoo is home to over 3,500 animals from as many as 750 different species, spread over 35 acres. It traces its history back to 1914 and was known as Brackenridge Park and Golf Course. An aquarium was added to the zoo in 1948 while the Hixon Bird House was opened in 1966.

name: Brackenridge Park
address: 3910 N St Mary's St, San Antonio, TX 78212, USA
description: Brackenridge Park is one of the most prominent public parks in San Antonio that traces its history back over 11,000 years. The 343 acre park which is located in the Broadway Corridor traces its history back to 1899.

name: Cathedral of San Fernando
address: 115 W Main Plaza, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: The Cathedral of San Fernando has the distinction of being the first church built in San Antonio. It is the mother church of the Archdiocese of San Antonio and the seat of its archbishop.

name: Hemisfair
address: 434 S Alamo St, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: HemisFair is a beautiful, well maintained urban park in San Antonio that was originally built to host the 1968 World’s Fair. The year was special as it also marked the 250th year anniversary of San Antonio, which was founded in 1718.

name: Buckhorn Saloon & Museum
address: 318 E Houston St, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: Buckhorn Saloon & Museum is a privately-owned museum situated in downtown San Antonio. The museum is a famous tourist destination due to its unique and out of the world collections & displays.

name: San Antonio Aquarium
address: 6320 Bandera Rd, Leon Valley, TX 78238, USA
description: The San Antonio aquarium houses a variety of animal species like jellyfish, sea horse, sharks, stingrays, crocodiles, tortoise, octopus, sea anemones, and rare corals. Not a typical aquarium, the place is also home to various other reptiles and tropical birds besides for marine animals.

name: Morgan's Wonderland
address: 5223 David Edwards Dr, San Antonio, TX 78233, USA
description: Morgan’s Wonderland is a theme park spread over 25 acres in San Antonio. The theme park was created keeping in mind individuals who need special care. The builder of the theme park, Gordon Hartman, drew inspiration from his daughter, Morgan, to create the park.

name: Travis Park
address: 311 E Travis St, San Antonio, TX 78205, USA
description: Travis Park is an award-winning park and one of the oldest municipal parks in the US established in 1870. Back then, the 2.6-acre land used to hold concerts, community gatherings etc. While doing so, Travis Park was also a stunning green patch amidst the buzzing downtown San Antonio.

name: Cathedral Basilica of Saint Louis
address: 4431 Lindell Blvd, St. Louis, MO 63108, USA
description: The Cathedral Basilica of Saint Louis is a Roman Catholic cathedral located in St. Louis’s Central West End. Also known as the Saint Louis Cathedral, it is the seat of the St. Louis archbishop and the mother church of the local Archdiocese. The cathedral was built in 1914, and named for Saint Louis.

name: National Blues Museum
address: 615 Washington Ave, St. Louis, MO 63101, USA
description: The National Blues Museum is a St. Louis attraction dedicated to the history and cultural significance of blues music. As much an educational resource as an entertainment center, the museum is a great place to learn more about this widely respected and enduring American music form.

name: Recoleta Cemetery
description: The Recoleta Cemetery or Cementerio de la Recoleta is located in the downtown area of Recoleta in Buenos Aires. This is the cemetery of the rich and famous in Buenos Aires, and has been called one of the best cemeteries in the world by BBC in 2011.

name: Casa Rosada & The Presidential Museum
address: Av. Pres. Roque Sáenz Peña 991, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: La Casa Rosada or The Pink House, also known as Casa de Gobierno – House of Government, is a must-visit tourist spot in Buenos Aires, Argentina. It is the executive house and also the office of the Argentinian president. It is not the house of the President: the President’s official residence is at the Quinta de Olivos.

name: Plaza de Mayo
address: Reconquista, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Plaza de Mayo is located at the center of Buenos Aires. It is the main square in the area of Monserrat Bario and is a very important part of the city of Buenos Aires both historically and still today. While the modern plaza can be said to have taken shape in 1884, the origins can be traced back to 1580.

name: National Museum of Fine Arts
address: Av. del Libertador 1473, C1425AAA CABA, Argentina
description: The Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes or the National Museum of Fine Arts is an attraction worth visiting, regardless of whether you are an art lover or not.

name: Metropolitan Cathedral
address: Calle Rivadavia s/n, 1004 Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Catedral Metropolitana is a significant landmark in Buenos Aires that is worth visiting regardless of religious affiliation.

name: Teatro Colon
description: The Teatro Colón is considered one of the important tourist attractions in Buenos Aires. A rich history is not the only thing it has going; it also has some of the best acoustics and architectural elements that make for a very satisfying audio-visual experience.

name: Obelisco
address: Av. 9 de Julio s/n, 1043 CABA, Argentina
description: The Obelisco de Buenos Aires is located in the Plaza de la República of the city of Buenos Aires. Standing 67 meters high and with a base of 49 square meters, it was designed to commemorate the 4th centenary of the first but unsuccessful foundation of the city by Pedro de Mendoza.

name: Floralis Generica
address: Av Pres. Figueroa Alcorta 2263, 1425 CABA, Argentina
description: Floralis Generica is a steel and aluminum sculpture you will find in the area between Plaza de las Naciones Unidas and Avenida Figueroa Alcorta in Buenos Aires, next to the Buenos Aires Law University.

name: Rose Garden Walk
address: Av Infanta Isabel & Iraola, Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: The Paseo del Rosedal or Rose Garden Walk is a fantastic rose garden in the heart of the Parque Tres de Febrero. It is easily the most popular of all attractions within the Parque Tres de Febrero and has a very scenic location. The Paseo del Rosedal was designed by Charles Thays in 1914.

name: Cabildo
address: Av. de Mayo 502-528, C1084AAN CABA, Argentina
description: Your trip to Beunos Aires cannot be complete without a visit to the Cabildo de Buenos Aires. This small white building is the last remnant of colonial-style architecture of what is today the Plaza de Mayo. The proposal for the construction of the Cabildo was made on 3rd March, 1608 by mayor Manuel de Frias.

name: Palacio Barolo
address: Av. de Mayo 1324-1400, C1085ABQ CABA, Argentina
description: The Palacio Barolo is a historic building in Buenos Aires located on the Avenida de Mayo near Monserrat. At the time of its construction it was the tallest building not only in Buenos Aires but all of South America. It was constructed in 1919 and completed in 1923. Since 1997 it has been a National Historical Monument.

name: Puerto Madero
address: Rosario Vera Penaloza, Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Puerto Madero is a district known today for its high rises, fine dining, excellent parks, and the superb Puente de la Mujer Bridge. It covers a major portion of the Rio de la Plata riverbank and is also the place where you get to see some great architectural elements from Argentina’s present.

name: Museum of Latin American Art
address: San Martín de Tours 3001-3099, C1425DNE CABA, Argentina
description: The Museum of Latin American Art or Museo de Arte Latinoamericano de Buenos Aires (MALBA) is a must-see tourist attraction in Buenos Aires. It is one of the cultural hotspots of the city today and draws tourists in large numbers.

name: Ecological Reserve
description: Reserva Ecológica de Buenos Aires is also known as Reserva Ecológica Costanera. Spread over 865 acres on the riverbank of Rio de la Plata, this nature reserve is a great place for nature lovers and home to hundreds of species of animals and plants.

name: Evita Museum
address: Juan María Gutiérrez 3892, Cdad. Autónoma de Buenos Aires, Argentina
description: Museo Evita is dedicated to one of the most well-known and powerful women in all of Argentina – Evita Peron. We all know about Eva Peron – from the media, books, movies and more – but that is not all there was to the lady. You find much more about her in this museum dedicated to her.

name: Palermo
description: Palermo is the largest and one of the most well-known districts, or neighborhoods, in Buenos Aires. It borders the Rio de la Plata River to the east, the Villa Crespo and Colegiales to the west, Almagro and Recoleta to the south, and Belgrano to the north.

name: Presidential Palace
description: The Palacio de Gobierno, or the Palace of Government, is a much-popular tourist destination in Buenos Aires. This building is actually two buildings that adjoin each other. The building stands out because of its grandeur and majestic architecture. The Palacio de Gobierno is located on the corner of Rivadavia and San Martin.

name: Chapultepec Park
address: Calz. Mahatma Gandhi 2600, Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, 11100 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Bosque de Chapultepec covers nearly 1,700 acres in Mexico City – one of the largest urban parks in the Western Hemisphere and the largest in Latin America. Its name is derived from the Nahuatl word meaning ‘the grasshopper hill’ and the area was considered sacred in pre-colonial days.

name: National Palace
address: Plaza de la Constitución 29, Centro Histórico, Centro, 06000 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico

name: Metropolitan Cathedral
address: Calle República de Guatemala 18, Centro Histórico, Centro, 06000 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico

name: Chapultepec Castle
address: Plaza de la Constitución 29, Centro Histórico, Centro, 06000 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: The fascinating Museo Nacional de Historia, or Mexico’s National Museum of History is located inside the Castillo de Chapultepec on top of Chapultepec Hill, which was once a sacred spot for Aztecs.  The building of the castle was commissioned by Viceroy Bernardo de Galvez in 1775 and was bought over by the government in 1805.

name: National Anthropology Museum
address: Paseo de la Reforma 203, Bosque de Chapultepec I Secc, 11100 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Mexico’s National Museum of Anthropology attracts over 2 million people each year and is the most visited museum in the country.

name: Templo Mayor
address: Seminario 8, Centro Histórico, Cuauhtémoc, 06060 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico

name: Zócalo
address: Plaza de la Constitución 29, Centro Histórico, Centro, 06000 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: The Zocalo (base in Spanish) is the colloquial name given to the Plaza de la Constitucion, so called from the 19th century when plans for the building of a giant monument in the square did not materialize and only a pedestal base was constructed.

name: Palace of Fine Arts
address: Av. Juárez, Centro Histórico, 06050 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Mexico City’s prominent Palace of Fine Arts was built on the site of the country’s first national theater, with plans to have it ready in time to celebrate the centennial of the Mexican War of Independence in 1910.

name: Museo Mural Diego Rivera
address: Calle de Balderas 12, Colonia Centro, Centro, 06000 Ejido del Centro, D.F., Mexico
description: After a fatal earthquake hit Mexico City in 1985, one of the worst affected buildings was the Hotel del Prado.

name: Angel of Independence
address: Plaza de la Constitución 29, Centro Histórico, Centro, 06000 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: The Monumento a la Independence, also more commonly known as El Angel is located at the center of a major thoroughfare in Mexico City. The 150 ft victory column was built to commemorate the centennial of the start of the country’s War of Independence and was completed in 1910.

name: Floating Gardens of Xochimilco
address: Rayito 10, San Cristóbal, 16080 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Located at the southern edge of Mexico City, Xochimilco is an area of canals and chinampas (floating gardens), the last vestiges of Tenochititlans, once the Aztec city on a lake which was called the Venice of the New World by conquering Spaniards.

name: Teotihuacan
description: The Pre-Hispanic holy city of Teotihuacan (meaning ‘The Place Where the Gods were Created) was once the largest city in the pre-Columbia Americas and home to over 125,000 people. Declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1987, Teotihuacan is located around 30 miles out of Mexico City.

name: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe
address: Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe, Villa Gustavo A. Madero, 07050 Mexico City, Federal District, Mexico
description: Locally known as Basilica de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe, this Mexico City-based Roman Catholic church was consecrated in 1976 and has the capacity to hold 10,000 worshippers. The current basilica is built next to an older 16th century church, known as the Old Basilica.

name: Frida Kahlo Museum
address: ILondres 247, Del Carmen, Coyoacán, 04100 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Frida Kahlo is considered Mexico’s foremost artist of all times, and it is only fitting that a museum dedicated to her life and works is located in Mexico City. The Frida Kahlo Museum, known also as the Blue House (Casa Azul) due to its brilliant blue walls, is located in a house in which Kahlo was born in 1907.

name: Coyoacan
description: Coyoacan refers the historic center of the Mexican City borough of the same name. Meaning ‘place of coyotes’ in Nahuatl, the area was once a pre-Hispanic village on the shores of Lake Texcoco.

name: Popular Art Museum
address: Calle Revillagigedo 11, Cuauhtémoc, Centro, 06050 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Mexico City’s Popular Art Museum is located in the city’s historic area within an old fire house, and aims to promote and preserve part of the nation’s handcrafts and folk art.  The collection includes pieces made of pottery, glass, textiles and furniture, as well as piñatas.

name: Plaza Garibaldi
address: Caminito S/N, Cuauhtémoc, Centro, 06010 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: Originally known as Plaza Santa Cecilia until the 1920s, Plaza Garibaldi was renamed in honor of Lt. Col. Jose Garibaldi, an important figure in the Mexican Revolution.  The square is the mecca of mariachi music in Mexico City, with bands playing at any time of the day or night.

name: Square of Three Cultures
address: Lázaro Cárdenas 4025, Tlatelolco, 06900 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico
description: The Square of the Three Cultures in Mexico City’s Tlatelolco neighborhood was constructed by the Mexican architect Mario Pani in 1966.

name: Historic Center
description: Centro Historico de la Ciudad de Mexico, or Mexico City’s Historical Center, was built by the conquering Spanish on the ruins of the Old Aztec capital Tenochtitlan.

name: Church of San Francisco
address: Río Tuxpan 1, El Rodeo, Iztacalco, 08510 Ciudad de México, D.F., Mexico

name: Corcovado
address: Estrada do Corcovado - Santa Teresa, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, Brazil
description: The Corcovado is the name given to the 2,330 ft mountain located in central Rio de Janeiro in the Tijuca Forest national park.

name: Selaron Steps
address: R. Joaquim Silva, S/N - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20241-110, Brazil
description: The Selaron Steps or Escadaria Selaron were created by the Chilean-born artist Jorge Selaron as a tribute to the Brazilian people, and have become world-famous for their vivid colors and symbol of the artist’s tenacity and passion.

name: Botanical Garden
address: R. Jardim Botânico, 1008 - Jardim Botânico, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22460-030, Brazil
description: Rio de Janeiro's botanical gardens, Jardim Botancio is the ideal showcase for Brazil’s vast range of flora. The 54 hectare gardens, located in the city’s South Zone, is home to over 6,500 species. The garden has multiple greenhouses, as well as works of artistic, historical and archaeological importance.

name: Santa Teresa
description: Perched on the top of the Santa Teresa Hill, this neighborhood originated around the Carmelite Santa Teresa Convent which was built in the 1750s. Up until the early 20th century, the area was considered an upper class neighborhood and some of the original grand mansions are still standing.

name: Copacabana
description: The beach best associated with Rio de Janeiro is undoubtedly Copacabana Beach - a 4 km stretch of sand hugging the Atlantic, flanked by two forts on either side and running parallel to one of the world's most famous promenades.

name: Ipanema Beach
description: Adjacent to the famous Copacabana Beach in Rio de Janeiro is Ipanema Beach, within the distinct and upmarket neighborhood of Ipanema. The beach is characterized by the two mountains - the Dois Irmaos, or Two Brothers - which rise at its western end.

name: Rio de Janeiro Cathedral
address: Av. Chile, 245 - Centro - Rio de Janeiro

name: Parque Lage
address: R. Jardim Botânico, 414 - Jardim Botânico, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22461-000, Brazil
description: Parque Enrique Lage, known more locally as Parque Lage, is located in Rio de Janeiro’s Botanical Gardens neighborhood at the foot of the Corcovado Mountain.

name: Ruins Park
address: Rua Murtinho Nobre, 169 - Santa Teresa, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20241-050, Brazil
description: Located in the hillside neighborhood of Santa Teresa in Rio de Janeiro, Parque das Ruinas incorporates the ruins of the mansion which once belonged to the Brazilian heiress Laurinda Santos Lobo.  The house set the tone for the ambiance of Santa Teresa at the beginning of the 20th century.

name: Sugarloaf Mountain
address: Av. João Luís Alves, 378 - Urca, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 22291-090, Brazil
description: The peak situated at the mouth of Guanabara Bay in Rio de Janeiro is known as Sugarloaf Mountain, so named for its resemblance to the conical molds of clay used to transport blocks of sugar by the Portuguese during the 16th century.

name: Municipal Theater
address: Praça Floriano, S/N - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20031-050, Brazil
description: Rio de Janeiro’s Municipal Theatre (Teatro Municipal) is known as one of the most impressive theaters in Brazil.

name: Tijuca National Park
description: Rio de Janeiro's famous Tijuca National Park incorporates the world's largest urban forest, as well as the Cordova mountain peak, home to the iconic Christ the Redeemer statue.

name: Church of Our Lady of the Candelaria
address: Praça Pio X, s/n - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20040-020, Brazil
description: One of Rio de Janeiro's top attractions is the Church of our Lady Candelaria, which was built over a long span of time, beginning in 1775 and ending in the late 19th century. The church is notable for its Baroque façade and different interior architectural elements, combining Neoclassical and Neo-Renaissance styles.

name: Morro da Urca
description: While most tourists are familiar with Rio’s iconic mount Sugar Loaf Mountain, its smaller relative Morro da Urca is no less impressive.  This turtle shaped rock is a point of stop over for the cable car which takes visitors to the top of Sugar Loaf Mountain, and at 720 feet high is fully deserving of its popularity.

name: National Museum of Fine Arts
address: Av. Rio Branco, 199 - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, Brazil
description: The Rio-based National Museum of Fine Arts (Meseu Nacional de Belas Artes, or MNBA), was established by then-minister Gustavo Capanema in 1937. The core of the museum’s permanent collection, however, is part of the Portuguese Royal Collection, transferred by King John VI to Brazil in the early 19th century.

name: Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil
address: R. Primeiro de Março, 66 - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, Brazil
description: The Bank of Brazil Cultural Center (or Centro Cultural Banco do Brasil) has several centers across Brazil, including Rio de Janeiro. The Rio center is considered one of the top hundred most visited art museums around the globe and around 2 million visitors pass through its doors each year.

name: Maracanã Stadium
address: Av. Pres. Castelo Branco, s/n - Maracanã, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20271-130, Brazil
description: One of Rio de Janeiro’s icons, the Maracanã Stadium was originally opened to host the 1950 FIFA World Cup. The government-owned stadium has since hosted football matches between top clubs in Rio, as well as a number of concerts and other sporting events.

name: National Library
address: Av. Rio Branco, 219 - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20040-009, Brazil
description: Located in Rio de Janeiro’s Cinelandia Square, the Biblioteca Nacional do Brasil – or the National Library of Brazil – is the world’s seventh largest library and by far the largest in Latin America.

name: Rio Art Museum
address: Praça Mauá, 1-95 - Saúde, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20081-210, Brazil

name: National Historical Museum
address: Praça Mal. Âncora, s/n - Centro, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20021-200, Brazil
description: Rio de Janeiro’s Museu Historico Nacional – the National  History Museum – was founded in 1922 and is considered one of the most important cultural institutes in Brazil. The museum is home to nearly 350,000 items, including the largest numismatic collection on the continent.

name: Rio Zoo
address: Quinta da Boa Vista, s/n | Sao Cristóvao, Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
description: The Zoological Gardens of Rio de Janeiro City – better known as Rio Zoo – is located inside the Quinta da Boa Vista Gardens next to the National Museum of Natural History. The zoo brings visitors a real taste of the Amazon with its green and leafy feel.

name: Museum of Modern Art
address: Avenida Infante Dom Henrique, 85 - Glória, Rio de Janeiro - RJ, 20021-140, Brazil
description: Rio de Janeiro’s Museum of Modern Art (also known as Museu de Art Moderno or MAM), is based in Flamengo Park, an urban planning project near the city’s coast which was built during the 50s and 60s.  MAM was designed by Alfonso Eduardo Reidy as a Modernist concrete building and was completed in 1955.

name: Arpoador Beach
description: Considered the birthplace of surfing in Brazil, Arpoador Beach is strategically located between the Copacabana and Ipanema beaches in Rio de Janeiro. Compared to its famous neighbors, Arpoador – at just a 500 m stretch – is considered small, although it has some of the best waves and finest views in Rio.

name: Imperial Museum
address: Rua da Imperatriz, 220 - Centro, Petrópolis - RJ, 25610-320, Brazil
description: One of the most visited museums in Brazil is the Museu Imperial de Petropolis or the Imperial Museum of Brazil.

name: Old San Juan
address: Viejo San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
description: This is the oldest settlement in Puerto Rico and one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in San Juan. Viejo San Juan is a National Historic Site and a UNESCO site.

name: Castillo San Felipe del Morro
address: 501 Calle Norzagaray, Old San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
description: El Morro is a citadel from the 1500s; a San Juan National Historic Site and UNESCO site located on the north-western end of the Islet of historic San Juan. El Morro (the promontory) was named after the Spanish King Philip II and built to protect San Juan Bay from enemies approaching by sea.

name: Fort San Cristóbal
address: San Cristobal, 501 Calle Norzagaray, PR-25, San Juan, San Juan 00901, Puerto Rico
description: This is the largest fort ever built by the Spanish in the Americas. The massive fort (actually a fortified castle) sits at the northern edge of Old San Juan 45.7 meters above sea level.

name: San Juan Cemetery
address: West end of Calle Norzagaray, San Juan, Puerto Rico 00901
description: Sant Maria Magdalena De Pazzis Cemetery San Juan is a picturesque seaside cemetery at the foot of the walls of San Juan’s Fort San Felipe del Morro and the final resting place for many of Puerto Rico's most famous personalities.

name: La Fortaleza
address: 1 Fortaleza Street, San Juan, Puerto Rico
description: La Fortaleza is identified with the National Historic Site of San Juan; today it is the Governor’s official abode. La Fortaleza was one of the structures built to protect San Juan and bay under Spanish rule.

name: El Yunque
address: PR-191, Rio Grande, Naguabo 00745, Puerto Rico (35 miles East of San Juan off route #191)
description: The tropical rain forest of El Yunque is small in comparison to other similar forests; it covers a crescent-shaped band on the windward side of the El Yunque Mountains near San Juan. The entire forest is within the El Yunque National Forest Reserve.

name: Botanical Garden
address: Calle Juan Ponce De Leon, San Juan 00926, Puerto Rico
description: The Botanical Garden of the University of Puerto Rico was first conceived as a place for research into the many indigenous plants and birds of the country but it is also an attraction for visitors. The garden covers almost 300 acres and includes native plants in thematic gardens.

name: Luis Muñoz Marín Park
address: Pinero Avenue/Central Avenue, San Juan, Puerto Rico 00920
description: Luis Munoz Marin Park was named after Jose Luis Alberto Munoz Marin (1898-1980) and is not to be confused with Luis Munoz Rivera Park which was named after a different person. The natural oasis of Parque Luis Munoz Marin is complete with artificial lakes, native flora and plenty of activities.

name: The Colosseum
description: The Colosseum is the most recognizable and iconic monument of Rome, if you see no other site in Rome you should see this structure. This grand stadium was constructed by the Flavian emperors.

name: The Pantheon
description: The Pantheon in Rome was built on the orders of Hadrian between 118AD and 125AD, it functioned as a temple to all the Roman Gods. The temple was built to replace Marcus Agrippa's temple which had burnt down in 80AD.

name: Piazza Navona
description: Piazza Navona is an elongated oval-shaped public square in Rome, it was built on the former Stadium of Domitian (the remains of which can still be seen on guided tours from Piazza Tor Sanguigna13). The original name was Circus Agonalis or Circus Agonalis.

name: St. Peter's Square
description: The expansive St. Peter's Square is located within Vatican City in front of St. Peter's Basilica. In the 1600s the plaza was designed by Bernini who also had a hand in designing the adjacent basilica.

name: St. Peter's Basilica
address: Piazza di San Pietro in Vincoli,  4/a,  00184 Rome
description: St Peter's Basilica is perhaps the holiest and most important church in Christendom, located within Vatican City on Vatican Hill; it is the heart of the Catholic Church.

name: Piazza Venezia
description: Although this is not the most beautiful of Rome's squares it is the most central with several major routes converging here including Via Corso and Via dei Fori Imperiali. It is located at the foot of Capitoline Hill next to Trajan's Forum.

name: The Sistine Chapel
description: The Sistine Chapel is part of the Vatican Museums and is named after Pope Sixtus IV (pope from 1471 to 1484).

name: Trevi Fountain
description: The Fontana di Trevi is the largest baroque fountain in the world. The fountain is well known from the Fellini film "La Dolce Vita" and "Three Coins in The Fountain." Legend has it that if you throw a coin into the fountain and make a wish to return to Rome, your wish will be granted.

name: Roman Forum
description: The Roman Forum is located in a valley between Piazza Venezia and the Colosseum, between the Palatine Hill, Capitoline Hill and Esquiline Hill.

name: Vatican Museums
description: The Vatican Museums are within Vatican City and comprise several exhibitions housed within several museum galleries. The collection began with the purchase by Pope Julius II of the statue of Laocoon and his Sons in 1506.

name: Castel Sant'Angelo
description: The Castel Sant'Angelo, also known as The Hadrian Mausoleum, was constructed 130AD-139AD on the edge of the River Tiber by Emperor Hadrian for himself, his family and his successors interment.

name: Vatican Gardens
description: Vatican City is a walled sovereign city-state within Rome it covers 110 acres it is the headquarters of the Catholic Church and the home of the Pope. The Vatican Gardens, as the name suggests, are gardens within this walled enclave.

name: Spanish Steps
description: In the 17th century the French had initially proposed a plan to build the Spanish Steps and top it off with a statue of King Louis XIV. However there was opposition from the pope and the plan was only carried out in 1723-1726, but without the addition of the statue.

name: Piazza di Spagna
description: The Piazza di Spagna is the Spanish Square from which the Spanish Steps (Scalinata della Trinita dei Monti) dramatically sweep up towards a higher level where the French Church or Trinita dei Monti is located. The 18th century square has an irregular shape and extends to the foot of Pincio Hill.

name: Villa Borghese
description: Although English speakers may expect this to be a villa – house, it is actually a garden, the largest public landscape park in Rome. The park is situated where a vineyard grew until 1605 when Cardinal Scipione Borghese decided to have it made into a park. He employed Domenico Savino da Montepulciano, a well known landscaper.

name: Galleria Borghese
description: This art museum is housed within the Villa Borghese Pinciana, designed by architect Flaminio Ponzio as the suburban home of Cardinal Scipione Borghese.

name: Circus Maximus
description: Circus Maximus or Circo Massimo was the first and biggest arena/stadium in ancient Rome where the citizens would gather to watch chariot races, gladiator fights, processions and major events. The stadium was constructed in the valley between the Palatine Hills and the Aventine Hills.

name: Capitoline Hill
address: Piazza del Campidoglio, Roma Rome, Italy Phone: +39 06 0608
description: This is one of the famed seven hills upon which Rome was built and it was considered the most sacred. The English word "capital" is derived from Capitoline.

name: Victor Emmanuel Monument
description: This monument is also called Altare della Patria, Monumento Nazionale a Vittorio Emanuele, Altar of the fatherland or just Il Vittoriano. However the locals have nicknamed the monument  "the typewriter", "the wedding cake" and a few other names.

name: Pyramid of Caius Cestius
description: The ancient pyramid of Cestius stands near the Porta San Paolo on the Via Ostiensis it was the final resting place of Caius Cestius Epulonius, a rich magistrate and priest who died in 12BC.

name: Imperial Forums
address: Via dei Fori Imperiali, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
description: The Imperial Forums or Fori Imperial constituted the center of Ancient Rome's political and religious activities, they were a series of public squares surrounded by buildings and each one created by a different emperor to show off his wealth, power and superiority.

name: Piazza del Popolo
description: Literally translated this is the People's Square, located inside the Aurelian Walls between the Pincio and the Tevere, this is a large ellipse-shaped square surrounded by beautiful buildings, and home to monuments, fountains and grand memorials.

name: Via del Corso
description: Via del Corso was called Via Lata during the Ancient Roman Era and it was the urban stretch of the Via Flaminia which brought travelers from the Adriatic Sea. In Ancient Rome the road was used for horse racing, which was done without riders, this accounts for the road being ramrod straight.

name: Buckingham Palace
address: Buckingham Palace Rd., St. James's, London
description: This is the official residence of the British monarch, Queen Elizabeth II; it is used for official events, State occasions and ceremonies by the Royal Family. The palace is conveniently located close to central London and accessible by the London underground. The palace is surrounded by public Royal Parks: Green Park, St.

name: Westminster Abbey
description: This religious edifice is where royal British coronations and burials are held, it is officially a place of worship owned by the royal family.

name: Trafalgar Square
description: Trafalgar Square is a traffic intersection in central London, the large square at its center is used for many major events and celebrations in London. During the 14th to 17th century the square was the courtyard of the Great Mews stables for Whitehall Palace.

name: St. Paul's Cathedral
address: St. Paul's Churchyard, The City, London
description: This landmark cathedral was designed by Christopher Wren and construction took 36 years until its completion in 1711. However there were five previous churches which stood on this site, the first dating back to 604AD.

name: British Museum
address: 18 Great Russell St., Bloomsbury, London Phone: 020 7323-8299
description: This museum has been open to the public for 255 years; the collections span more than two million years of human history from a number of cultures and include about 8 million pieces.

name: Hyde Park
description: This is London's largest public park covering 360 acres; it opened in 1637 and is joined to Kensington Gardens, Green Park and St. James Park. For years the parkland was used for royal hunting until 1637 when King Charles I opened the park to the general public. In 1825 Decimus Burton designed the park layout.

name: London Eye
address: Millennium Jubilee Gardens, SE1, South Bank
description: Among all the historic attractions of London the London Eye is one of the more recent and contemporary attractions. The Eye is a huge Ferris wheel located on the edge of the Thames River in the Jubilee Gardens.

name: Natural History Museum
description: This museum is dedicated to life, nature and science, it holds more than 70 million items and covers botany, mineralogy, paleontology, zoology and entomology. The huge and rich collection has been built up over many years with some items having been collected by Charles Darwin.

name: Covent Garden
description: Today Covent Garden is a London district located between Martin's Lane and Drury Lane; but Covent Garden is best known as the site of the city's oldest market where there are now boutique stores, classy restaurants, theatres, a place to see street performers and shop in typically English markets.

name: Churchill War Rooms
address: Clive Steps, King Charles St., Westminster, London
description: Churchill War Rooms are one of the five branches of the well-known Imperial War Museum. The museum reveals the Cabinet War Rooms, an underground structure that  was used by the command center of the British government through the Second World War.

name: Tower Bridge
address: Tower Bridge Rd., The City, London
description: Tower Bridge, London crosses the Thames River next to the Tower of London, the stunning iconic drawbridge is often confused with another Thames bridge referred to in the children's song "London Bridge" is falling down.

name: Victoria and Albert Museum
description: This museum is named after Queen Victoria and her husband Albert, it is the largest museum of decorative arts and design on the planet and holds more than four and a half million pieces displayed over 51,000m². The museum was established in 1852 and came to its present location in 1857.

name: Tate Modern
description: London's top museum of modern art houses works of art representing a range of modern art movements including fauvism, surrealism, abstract, impressionism, Op Art, minimal art, conceptual art, pop art and more.

name: Shakespeare's Globe Theatre
description: The Shakespeare’s Globe Theater is a replication of the theater where the greatest playwright of our times used to put up his shows.

name: HMS Belfast
description: There are quite a number of important attractions you could visit along the Thames. One would be the surviving naval vessel of world war II – the HMS Belfast.

name: London Bridge Experience
description: This attraction was inspired by the many gory and scary historic events which London Bridge has witnessed.

name: Piccadilly Square
description: Also known as Picadilly Circus, Piccadilly Square is one of London’s most iconic locations. This major street junction forms a large open space with easy access to main shopping and entertainment areas. Interestingly, this is not a location for an actual circus as we know it today.

name: Hampton Court Palace
address: Hampton Court Rd., East Molesley, Surrey
description: This royal palace is located 18.8km from central London, the palace originally belonged to Thomas Wolsey, Archbishop of York, during the reign of Henry VIII but in 1529 Wolsey fell from favor and the palace was handed over to the king.

name: Imperial War Museum
description: There are five Imperial War Museums in Manchester, Cambridgeshire and three locations in London, the Imperial War Museum London, Churchill War Rooms and HMS Belfast. The main branch in London is housed within the building erected in 1812 and intended as the Bethlem Royal Hospital (Bedlam insane asylum).

name: St. James's Park
description: This is the oldest of London's eight Royal Parks, it covers 58 acres and is surrounded by Buckingham Palace, The Mall, St. James s Palace, the Horse Guards, Clarence House and the Birdcage Walk.

name: Harrods
description: Harrods is one of London's most famous stores, it is not the kind of place where you'll find bargains or do a big shop-up but it is an iconic symbol of elite, high-end and high quality products. The Knightsbridge department store has 90,000m² of store space and is the biggest department store in Europe.

name: Somerset House
description: If you are looking for a unique collection of art in London then the Somerset House is a must visit. Set in a classic building situated in the heart of London, the Somerset House displays several contemporary art and design exhibitions alongside some family workshops.

name: Oxford Street
description: Perhaps London's most famous shopping street, Oxford Street stretches for 2.4km from Marble Arch to Charing Cross Road and Tottenham Court Road.

name: Piazza San Marco
description: This square is the central point of the city, the place all tourists arrive at at some point during their stay in Venice. The square has been a focal point of the city for centuries and is the only Venice "piazza"; the other squares are called "campi." The square has buildings on three sides and the fourth side is open.

name: Basilica di San Marco
description: St. Mark's Basilica is Venice's most famous church, known for its art work and history. The church overlooks St. Mark's Square on the edge of the Grand Canal and is joined to the Doge's Palace. In the 9th century merchants smuggled Saint Mark's relics out of Egypt and brought them to Venice.

name: Ponte dei Sospiri
description: The Bridge of Sighs spans the Rio di Palazzo or Palace River connecting the Doge's Palace with the Old Prison so that convicts could go straight from being sentenced in the palace courtrooms to their prison cell (or execution) across the bridge.

name: Palazzo Ducale
description: The Doges Palace is a monumental piece of architecture and perhaps the most important site in Venice. The building was originally founded in the 14th and 15th century with other elements being added over the years. There are three main areas of the structure, the oldest being the closest to St.

name: Riva degli Schiavoni
description: This Venice waterfront promenade is located between Piazza San Marco and the Arsenale and looks out across the island of San Giorgio Maggiore. The site dates back to the 9th century when it was created using silt brought up from the water.

name: Galleria dell'Accademia
description: This museum is one of the world's greatest museums and one of the city's top attractions. It is housed within the Scuola della Carita (1343), Convento dei Canonici Lateranensi (1561) and the Church of Santa Maria della Carita in the Dorsoduro Quarter.

name: San Zaccaria
description: The church is thought to have originally been constructed in the 9th century to house the relics of Saint Zaccaria, the father of John the Baptist. Although the original structure burnt down in 1105 a crypt still exists which holds the remains of 8 former doges (dukes of Venice).

name: Ponte di Rialto
description: The Rialto Bridge is arguably the most beautiful and definitely the most famous and oldest of the 4 bridges which cross Venice's Grand Canal. The site has always been an important crossing point as the Rialto market was nearby and traders needed to be able to cross the water easily.

name: Collezione Peggy Guggenheim
description: This is a modern art museum of paintings and sculptures which were collected by American Peggy Guggenheim. The museum is housed within the Palazzo Venier dei Leoni, Peggy Guggenheim's former home.

name: Scuola Grande di San Rocco
description: The Confraternity of St. Roch stands next to the Church of San Rocco, like other structures in the city it was built as a response to a plague which overtook the city in 1478. A confraternity is a group of Roman Catholic laymen who work towards promoting Christian charity.

name: Gondola Ride
address: Near Santa Maria del Giglio Square, central Venice
description: The sleek, romantic, flat bottomed  black gondolas which carry people along the canals of Venice have a long and important history. They date back to the 17th century when there were at least 10,000 on the water compared to the mere 500 today and they were a major form of transport.

name: Santa Maria dei Miracoli
description: This rather small renaissance church houses a portrait of the Madonna which is believed to be miraculous. It is located in the Cannaregio neighborhood, the city's historic Jewish Ghetto, on a quaint public square alongside a canal.

name: San Sebastiano
address: Universita' Ca' Foscari Di Venezia, Dorsoduro Campo San Sebastiano, 30123 Venice
description: The church of St. Sebastian in the Dorsoduro sestiere of Venice was built as an offering of thanks for the passing of a vicious plague. It was dedicated to St. Sebastian, a patron saint against plagues and pestilence. Although originally constructed as an Oratory in 1396, it was expanded and consecrated as a church in 1562.

name: Santa Maria della Salute
description: St. Mary of Health Church (La Salute) stands on a piece of land protruding into the lagoon between the San Marco Basin and the Grand Canal. This is one of the plague churches constructed to give thanks for the passing of a terrible plague.

name: Canal Grande
