description: As most people know Venice is composed of islands and canals, the Grand Canal is the largest and most important. If the various water ways are the equivalent of streets then the Canal Grand is the city's "main road" carving its way through the city in a large S-shape.

name: Museo Communità Ebraica
description: The Jewish Museum in Venice is located on Campo del Ghetto Nuovo, the former Venice ghetto which was also the first (or one of the first) Jewish ghettos.  On either side of the small museum are two ancient synagogues. The museum was founded in 1953.

name: Murano Island
description: Situated just 1.5 kilometers to the north of Venice and covering about 1.5 kilometers, Murano is actually a series of 7 islands that are connected to each other by bridges  Between these 7 islands are 8 channels. Murano is known for its glass-making, an art that is protected by government legislation.

name: Dam Square
description: The Dam square, Amsterdam's biggest square, has been around since the 13th century after the Amstel River saw the addition of a dam. The dam was constructed to make it impossible for the Zuiderzee Sea to come swarming into the city.  At Dam Square visitors will find various food stands, shops and trendy restaurants.

name: Sightseeing Cruise
description: A 60 minutes relaxing cruise through Amsterdam's peaceful canals.  Discover the highlights of Amsterdam from a different angle on a lovely boat with a glass roof.

name: Anne Frank House
description: The Anne Frank House is where Anne Frank was hiding along with 7 other people from 3 different families for 2 years during World War II. The hiding place that Otto Frank was able to find for his family, the van Pels family, and Fritz Pfeffer, is where they were hiding until the Nazis revealed their location.

name: Van Gogh Museum
description: The largest collection of artwork by Vincent Van Gogh in the world is housed at the Van Gogh Museum in Amsterdam.  It is conveniently located in Museum Square, and is one of the most popular art museums to visit in the world.

name: Leidseplein
description: Leidseplein, which translates to Leiden Square in English, is a square in southern Amsterdam. It is now the city’s transport hub and serves several tram lines and gives people access to the city’s shopping and nightlife. Known as an entertainment square, visitors will often find street performers located in east Leidseplein.

name: Rijksmuseum
description: The Dutch National Museum, or Rijksmuesem, is a grand four floor museum which leads visitors on an exciting chronological journey through the art and history of the Netherlands. The story of the country is told from an interesting international perspective so patrons get unique experience as they walk through history.

name: Vondelpark
description: Vondelpark is Amsterdam’s biggest city park and the Netherlands most famous park. Approximately 10 million people visit Vondelpark on a yearly basis, some come simply to rest while others come the park to enjoy one of its many free concerts.

name: Oude Kerk
description: An active church in the middle of the red light district in Amsterdam and the oldest building in the city, built in the 1200s. The building was originally a Roman Catholic Church which was dedicated to St. Patrick in which a miracle has occurred.

name: Rembrandt House Museum
description: The Museum Het Rembrandthuis is located in Jodenbreestraat, Amsterdam and is where the famous Rembrandt resided while he painted many of his famous paintings.

name: Heineken Experience
description: The Heineken Experience is a historical brewery located in the beautiful Amsterdam, Netherlands.

name: Stedelijk Museum
description: The Stedelijk Museum, or just Stedelijk, is the premiere contemporary and modern art museum in Amsterdam. Located in the heart of the Museum Quarter in the city, it displays international art from the twentieth and twenty first centuries.

name: Zaanse Schans
description: Located in the Netherlands, Zaanse Schans is an attraction that serves as both a museum and an outdoors conservative area. The windmills in the town of the same name have been there since the 1700s and 1800s.

name: Volendam
description: Volendam is a former fishing village that is now known for its small houses that surround its fishing port. The atmosphere of the Volendam is lively and visitors will want to take a walk and view the dike, the old center and the many churches found in Volendam.

name: Marken
description: Marken used to be an island on the Ijssaelmeer. In 1164 it was separated from the mainland after a high tide hit. Today the Marken is linked to the Nes promontory using a dike that was constructed in 1957. While Marken used to be a place where fisherman made their living, it is now supported by the tourism industry.

name: Amsterdam Museum
description: The Amsterdam Museum provides the history of the beautiful city of Amsterdam. For a crash course in the culture of the city, check out the DNA exhibit - it will tell you all you need to know about the things that those who live in Amsterdam value the most.

name: Museum Willet-Holthuysen
description: The Museum Willet-Holthuysen is a great place to see some beautiful period furnishings that won’t be found in other museums. In the basement of the museum is a kitchen that depicts what life was like for servants.

name: Delft
description: The Pleasant city Delft lies between Rotterdam and Den Haag and is famous for its tree-lined canals, red tiled houses and blue-white pottery. The tree-lined canals of the Delft often captivate visitors, as do the small houses, with their picturesque roofs.

name: Rotterdam
description: Rotterdam is a popular tourist attraction in the Netherlands that offers visitors plenty to see and do. It is the Netherlands second largest city and has one of the world’s largest ports.  Rotterdam is well known throughout the Netherlands for its architecture.

name: The Hague
description: The Hague is a Dutch city like no other - national institutions have focused on The Hague since as far back as the 16th century, there are many old buildings that visitors can enjoy and many Dutch monarchs live in The Hague.

name: Red Light District
description: Amsterdam’s Red Light District is world renowned for its sex shops and museums and has become a tourist attraction in its own right. The area leaves absolutely nothing to the imagination and caters to every whim and fetish, from peep shows to prostitutes in red-lit windows, from elaborate condom shops to exclusive brothels.

name: Ons' Lieve Heer op Solder
description: The Museum Ons’ Lieve Heer Op Solder translates to Our Lord In The Attic in English and is the second oldest museum in all of Amsterdam.

name: Westerkerk
description: Westerkerk is a Protestant church that was built in the city of Amsterdam, located in the Netherlands, around the year 1638. During this time, it was one of the biggest churches ever to be built in the entire world. It was even the place where famous Dutch painter Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn was buried in 1669.

name: Flower Market
description: Located on the Singel canal between the Koningsplein and the Muntplein in Amsterdam, you will find the world’s only floating flower market.

name: Ponte Vecchio
description: The Old Bridge is one of the most striking of Florence's six bridges; it is thought to date back as far as the Romans who constructed stone pillars and wooden planks on this spot where the Via Cassia crossed the river. Until 1218 it was the only bridge that crossed the Arno River.

name: Florence Cathedral
description: The Florence Cathedral, Basilica di Santa Maria del Fiore is the Roman Catholic mother church of the city. It was named for the lily (fiore), the city's symbol. The church was designed by Arnolfo di Cambio.

name: Piazza della Signoria
description: This is one of Florence's most popular squares, the historic L-shaped square got its name from the Palazzo Vecchi which is also called the Palazzo della Signoria and is just one of the important buildings lining the square.

name: Campanile di Giotto
description: Campanile means "tower" and this Florence tower was built as a bell tower for the adjacent cathedral on Piazza del Duomo and is part of a complex of buildings. The tower was created by Giotto between 1334 and 1337 when he died and Andrea Pisano took over the task until 1348.

name: Gallerie degli Uffizi
description: At this world famous art gallery you can see works by some of the top names in art history. The museum is one of the oldest in the world and has attracted visitors from around the world since it was officially opened to the public in 1765.

name: Palazzo Vecchio
description: With the rising success of the guilds of Florence, in 1293 the Priors and people of the city decided to commission the construction of a grand building which would be an impressive seat of the Signoria.

name: Palazzo Pitti
description: This palace was home to the rulers of Florence up until 1919 when the property became part of the state. The palace is situated in Oltrarno which lies across the River Arno from the rest of the historic center. Luca Pitti wanted to build a luxurious and opulent palace which would rival the Medici family's stately homes.

name: Battistero
description: The Baptistery of Saint John or the Baptistery di San Giovanni is one of Florence' oldest and most important religious buildings, it is dedicated to the city's patron, John the Baptist. The present building was constructed on the site of a former 1st century Roman edifice.

name: Galleria dell'Accademia
description: The Accademia di Belle Arti art school was opened in 1784 within the buildings of the Convent of San Niccolo di Cafaggio and the Hospital of San Matteo. The Galleria dell'Academia was established together with the school to exhibit the creations from the adjacent school.

name: Giardino Boboli
description: This is the garden adjoining the Medici villa, Pitti Palace, which now houses several museums. The garden was originally commissioned by Cosimo I for his wife Eleonora di Toledo. The villa garden was designed in 1549 by Tribolo (Niccolo Pericoli) who died a year later.

name: Orsanmichele
description: The name of this church translates as the "kitchen garden of St. Michael" as it was built where St. Michael convent's kitchen garden was once grown. The church remains but the convent has not survived.

name: Loggia dei Lanzi
description: Loggia dei Lanzi is more commonly known as Loggia della Signoria as it is on the corner of Piazza della Signoria. The definition of a loggia is a roofed or vaulted structure open on one side and free-standing or attached to the side of a building like a kind of covered corridor open on one side.

name: Piazza della Repubblica
description: This quadrangular shaped piazza is in the historic center of Florence. It is surrounded by pleasant restaurants and cafes and visitors can see street performers here. During the ancient Roman era this was the meeting point of two important routes, the Cardo and the Decumano.

name: Santa Croce
description: The Basilica of Santa Croce is the largest Franciscan church in the world; it is also called the "Temple of the Italian Glories" because many of the country's great heroes are buried here including Michelangelo, Machiavelli, Galileo and Rossini.

name: San Miniato al Monte
description: Saint Miniato Monte is believed to have been the city's first Christian martyr persecuted in the 3rd century and later beheaded. Legend has it that he then took his severed head and went to Monte alle Croci where he had lived in a cave.

name: Museo Galileo
description: The Galileo Museum which used to be called the Institute and Museum of the History of Science, was founded in 1927. The majority of the museum exhibits date back to between the 15th and 19th century and were pivotal in the advancements made in science during those years.

name: Museo Nazionale del Bargello
description: The National Museum of Bargello is located within one of the city's oldest buildings which was built in 1255. During the 1300s and 1400s the building was expanded and renovated which can be seen in the courtyard, balcony and 1st floor large hall.

name: Santo Spirito
description: This Renaissance-style church was established in 1250 but only took on its present form in the 15th century when it was redesigned by Brunelleschi and completed according to his plans after his death. The church's façade is just rough plaster as it was never completed. There is a bell tower designed by Baccio d'Agnolo (1503).

name: Santa Trínita
description: The Trinity Church was established by Benedictine monks in 1092 and the present church was built between 1258 and 1280. The original design was simple, reflecting the lifestyle of the monks, but by the 14th century the church was adorned with art, renovated and redecorated.

name: Santa Maria Novella
address: Piazza di Santa Maria Novella,  18,  50123 Florence
description: This was Florence's first major cathedrals; it is located opposite the railway station of the same name and is the principle Dominican church in the city. The church was completed in 1357 after 78 years in the making; it was built by Dominican friars.

name: Central Market
address: Piazza del Mercato Centrale, 50123, Florence, Italy
description: The Mercato Centrale or Central Market is a landmark in Florence that has been there since the late 19th century, in the year 1874. Designed by Giovanni Mengoni, this cast-iron building situated between via dell’Ariento, via Sant’Antonino, via Panicale, and Piazzo del Mercato Centrale.

name: San Lorenzo
description: This is one of Florence's oldest and biggest churches, it is located in the city's market district. The original building was constructed in 393AD and it functioned as the city's Basilica before being superseded by Santa Reparata.

name: Cappelle Medicee
address: Piazza di Madonna degli Aldobrandini, 6, 50123 Florence, Italy
description: The Chapel of the Princes, the New Sacristy and the Crypt make up the three Medici Chapels that are connected to the Church of San Lorenzo which the Medici family used as their personal church. The Crypt is the final resting place for several minor members of the Medici family.

name: San Marco
description: This is a church complex where several religious buildings are situated, including a former convent which is now a museum. The first religious building stood on this spot in the 12th century it was a Vallombrosan Monastery which was taken over by the Silvestrine order of Benedictine monks.

name: Hofburg Palace
description: The Hofburg Palace in Vienna provides an authentic view into the daily life of what was once the center of the powerful Hasburg dynasty, a family that once ruled the Austria-Hungry empire.

name: St. Stephan's Cathedral
description: St. Stephen's Cathedral, an impressive Catholic church located in Stephansplatz, right at the center of Vienna. As the most important and most recognizable church in Austria's capital, along with the recognizable colorful roof, it is seen and easily recognized practically from almost anywhere within the city.

name: Belvedere Palace
description: The Belvedere Palace is one of the best examples of baroque architecture in Europe. It also serves as a good museum. The place is actually made of two palaces. The upper palace is the more visited one that displays the richness of the architectural invention of that time.

name: Vienna State Opera
description: Located in the centre of Vienna, built in the 1860s , the Vienna State Opera is one of the greatest and most famous opera houses in the world. Since it was build it has been the scene of endless musical concerts, ballets and operas.

name: Imperial Treasury
address: Hofburg, Schweizer Hof,1st District, Vienna Phone: 01 525-240
description: The Imperial Treasury is part of the Hofburg Palace in Vienna and the largest and perhaps the most impressive treasury in the world. It holds two major displays that span over 1000 years of European history such as the crown jewels with the imperial crown created on 962 Studded with hundreds of gem stones.

name: Art History Museum
description: A must visit art museum, probably the top museum in Vienna and one of the best art museums in the world which in fact does not fall far behind the Louvre or the Prado in terms of the amount and scope of the works to be found here.

name: Stadtpark
address: Stadtpark, Vienna Contact: +43 1 4000-8042 Opening hours: open at all times
description: This lovely 65,000 square meters park is located on the edge of the old city of Vienna and is a good place for an afternoon break given its proximity to the tourist attractions.

name: Naschmarkt
description: Nachmarkt is Vienna’s largest, most famous and most busiest market. It is conveniently located in the city center near many of the city tourist attractions just between Karlsplatz and Kettenbrückengasse and provides many of Vienna's and international goods.

name: Schonbrunn Palace
description: The Schönbrunn Palace, one of the most popular tourist attractions in Vienna, is a Rococo style summer palace of the great Hofburg monarchy, a ruler of Europe and the Church for many decades.

name: Musikverein
description: The Musikverein in Vienna is a well-known concert hall in central Vienna and is the home to the world famous Vienna Philharmonic orchestra. The Musikverein is considered as one of the best concert halls in the world and attending a light-classical music performance is considered as the highlight of the visit to Vienna by many.

name: Spanish Riding School
description: The Spanish Riding School in Vienna is a world famous riding school and a major tourist attraction in Vienna. The performances of for Lipizzan horses take place to the sound of baroque music in the Winter Riding School which is located near the Hofburg Palace just between Michaelerplatz and Josefsplatz.

name: The Prater
description: The Prater in Vienna is a large park, open to the public and located just between the Danube River and the old city. The park includes an amusement park (The Wurstelprater), a 3 miles (4.5 km) long promenade and a 200-foot, well-known Ferris wheel.

name: Leopold Museum
description: The Leopold museum, with more than 5000 works, is one the largest museums of modern Austrian art. It is located in the Museumquartier alongside other impressive museums. The Leopold museum holds the works of artists such as Oskar Kokoschka, Egon Schiele, Richard Gerstl and the well-known Austrian artist - Gustav Klimt.

name: House of Music
description: A great demonstration of Vienna as the historical musical capital of Europe is provided in the interactive Haus der Musik ("House of Music") museum. This is an interactive Sound Museum with six floors which are all dedicated to the world of music and sound.

name: Danube Valley
description: The Danube Valley Day Trip from Vienna reveals the exquisite beauty of the Wachau Valley. You'll travel through gorgeous Austrian countryside and take a scenic boat ride down the Danube.

name: MUMOK
description: With Its 7,000 works of modern art collection, the MUMOK, located in the Museumquartier in Vienna holds one of the most impressive collections of modern art in Europe. It presents the works of artist such as  Andy Warhol, ,Joseph Beuys, Nam June Paik and Pablo Picasso.

name: Mozart House
description: The house, located in the old town of Vienna in a walking distance from St. Stephen's Cathedral is also known as the House of Figaro.

name: Kunsthalle Museum
description: The Kunsthalle Wien has two venues - Kunsthalle Wien Museumsquartier and Kunsthalle Wien Karlsplatz.   Kunsthalle Wien is Vienna's exhibition space for international contemporary art and discourse.

name: Secession
description: The secession building in Vienna was built in 1897 to provide a home for the exhibitions of the secession group, a group of artists that decided to break away from the formal Association of Austrian Artists. This group that included all type of artists was lead at the time by Gustav Klimt who was also its first president.

name: City Hall
description: Also called Neues Rathaus, Wiener Rathaus or Rathaus, Vienna is Vienna’s City Hall. This spectacular building is located on Rathausplatz and was constructed between 1872 and 1883 by Friedrich von Schmidt.

name: Budapest
description: Budapest, the capital of Hungary is the largest city in East-Central Europe, the heart of the city centers on the Danube River which separates Buda on the west bank and Pest on the right bank.

name: Prague Castle
description: On a hilltop west of the Vltava River, resided what is perceived by many as Prague’s number one tourist attraction – the Prague Castle. What is called “The Prague Castle” is actually a huge complex of buildings connected by internal courtyards and built throughout the last 1000 years.

name: Old Town Square
address: Old Town Square Starom?stské nám., 110 00 Praha 1-Staré M?sto, Czech Republic
description: At the heart of Prague’s Old Town, this majestic and extremely popular by tourists square with its colorful baroque houses is located just between the famous Wenceslas Square and Charles Bridge. The square presents several architectural styles such as gothic of the Týn Church or baroque architecture of the St.

name: Týn Church
description: Tyn church, also called the Church of Our Lady Before Tyn, is located in Prague’s Old Town Square while the towers or spires of the church can be seen from most everywhere in Prague.

name: Old Jewish Cemetery
description: A very popular tourist attraction in Prague is one of Europe's oldest Jewish cemeteries. It is located the Josefov, the Jewish Quarter, one block away from the famous Old-New Synagogue and holds around 12,000 visible tombstones in a small yard which are only a small part out of the thousands of graves buried below.

name: St. Vitus Cathedral
description: While in Prague, one of the must-see sites is the beautiful St. Vitus Cathedral originally called St Vitus, St. Wenceslas and St. Adalbert Cathedral. The cathedral is located on the hilltop overlooking the city within the Prague Castle Complex.

name: Wenceslas Square
description: Situated in the middle of Prague, this square is known for celebrations, public gatherings and shopping. Wenceslas Square is located just a few minutes of walk from the old town square. In the past the place was a Horse market, later it became the center of business and cultural activities.

name: Old-New Synagogue
description: Located in Josefov, the Jewish quarter in Prague, is this mid-13th century Gothic style synagogue. In fact, it is one of the earliest and most important Gothic buildings in Prague. The synagogue, which has survived events such as fires and the Nazi occupation, is still active which makes it Europe's oldest active synagogue.

name: Lennon Wall
description: The John Lennon Wall, or Lennon Wall, is located near the Prague French Embassy. The wall is filled with Lennon inspired graffiti, art and Beatles song lyrics. Police have attempted to paint over the wall several times over the years, but the wall is always re-painted with the Lennon-inspired art and words.

name: Franz Kafka Museum
description: A museum in Malá Strana (Lesser Town), Prague which is dedicated the work of this great Jewish author. Frantz Kafka was born here and although he actually wrote in German he did spend most of his life here and it is Prague that symbolizes best of all cities his unique attitude towards life.

name: Church of St. Nicholas
description: The Church of St. Nicholas located in Lesser Town Square in Prague is a 70 meters (230 ft) dome that was built between 1704 and 1755 by the famous architect Christoph Dientzenhofer.

name: Jewish Quarter
description: The Jewish Quarter in Prague attracts millions of tourists and researchers from all over the world each year. Though it has a sweltering history, particularly for the Jewish community, it has continued to hit the helm of some of the places to visit in Czech Republic.

name: National Museum
description: On the south-east corner of the Wenceslas Square, in a neo-renaissance building built in the late 1880 you can find the National Museum.

name: Alfons Mucha Museum
description: The works of the Chzech Art Noveau artist Alfons Maria Mucha (1860-1939), who was best known for his unique style in which he created many artistic and commercial works are presented in this museum.

name: Petrín Hill
description: Petrin Hill offers stunning sights, gorgeous gardens and some fun attractions like the miniature Eiffel Tower. Petrin Hill is located at the center of Prague and rises about 130m above the Vltava River’s left bank.

name: Dancing House
address: Rašínovo náb?eží 1981/80, 120 00 Prague 2-New Town, Czech Republic
description: The Dancing House is a visually stunning building located next to the Vltava River in Prague. It is a modern building, with a large amount of glass housed within a historical type of architecture.

name: Dvorák Museum
description: Located in a colorful baroque building that was designed by the architect Kilian Dientzenhofer around 1720, this museum is dedicated to the work and life of one of the well-known Czech composers - Antonín Dvorák  (1841-1904).

name: Kampa Museum
description: A modest modern art museum, located on Kampa Island. The place was opened by the Meda Mládková, a Czech-born American. Since the 50s of the previous century she was collecting art works of modern European artists.

name: National Technical Museum
description: Founded in 1908, this is the largest and most impressive technology museum in the Czech Republic with more than one million artifacts out of which 40,000 are displayed at a time and tell the story of the history of technology in the Czech Republic.

name: Museum of the City of Prague
description: A detailed miniature model of 18th-century Prague may just be the highlight of this lovely museum. The museum is located east to the old town square, 1 block north of the Florenc metro station and is it not exactly what you expect from a typical city-history museum.

name: Cesky Krumlov
description: Cesky Krumlov is a town in Southern Czech, and is downriver from Prague. The city is full of Baroque-inspired buildings, castles and many 18th-century built buildings.  The city and the castle were built around same time, in the 13th century.

name: National Theater
description: This golden-crowned landmark, one of the most significant cultural institutions in Prague is the National Theater, Completed in 1881 which symbolized the greatness of the Czech culture.

name: Vyšehrad
description: One of the most important historical monuments in Prague is the Vyšehrad. This awe-inspiring fortress on a rocky cliff above the river Vltava is a sight to behold, with its Gothic towers of the Church of St. Peter and Paul. This was the home of Vratislav II, the first King of Bohemia back in the 11th century.

name: Strahov Monastery
description: This abbey was founded in 1149 by the Bishop of Olomouc Jindrich Zdik and the Premonstratensian order founded by St. Norbert. The monastery survived fire in 1258, plundering by Prague citizens in 1420, Hussite raids and a period of inactivity before being renewed by Jan Lohelius who embarked on ambition building projects.

name: Reichstag
description: The Reichstag building, the location of the German Parliament, was first constructed in 1894. Originally, the Reichstag building consisted of four wings, two indoor courtyards and a chamber. After the fire in the building in 1933, its original hall was completely destroyed and had to be demolished, as the building’s dome.

name: Alexanderplatz
description: Named to honor the Tsar of Russia, Alexander the First, much of Berlin’s urban history can be reached through this square as centuries of politics, culture and architecture are captured. Today, the Alexanderplatz is mostly a shopping area and a transit junction.

name: Holocaust Memorial
description: The Memorial To The Murdered Jews Of Europe is a Holocaust monument located in the center of Berlin, very close to the Brandenburg Gate. The impressive iron monument was build by the architect Peter Eisenman and was presented on May 2005.

name: Berliner Dom
description: Built between 1894 and 1905, the Berliner Dom is located on Museum Island in Berlin and serves as a baroque Cathedral. It is Berlin’s biggest Protestant Church and it also functions as part of the dynasty of Prussian Hohenzollern. In the past, it has served as a link between German Protestantism and Hohenzollern.

name: Pergamonmuseum
description: The Pergamon Museum was originally built to hold items that were found during the excavation of the Berlin Museum. One of these items was the Pergamon Alter frieze, which was discovered in 1886.

name: Tiergarten
description: Tiergarten is Berlin’s oldest public park and is quite large as a park within a big city such as Berlin. It’s a good place to spend some time in while taking a break from the sightseeing. It is conveniently located near many of the city’s top attractions.

name: Unter den Linden
description: Unter den Linden is Berlin’s main thoroughfare going all the way from East Berlin to the West side. It got its name from the Linden trees planted all along the long avenue. This boulevard stretches from Museum Island’s Schlossbruke all the way to the Pariser Platz’s Brandenburger Gate.

name: Gendarmenmarkt
description: Gendarmenmarkt is one of Europe’s most beautiful squares surrounded by three beautiful landmarks - the Konzerthaus, the Franzosischer Dom and the Deutscher Dom. Located in this square’s center is a sculpture of the German poet Freidrich Schiller.

name: Checkpoint Charlie
description: Checkpoint Charlie is the most famous crossing point at the Berlin’s Wall from East Berlin and West Berlin during the Cold War. The Checkpoint Charlie Museum began in 1962 as a display that took up two-and-a-half rooms. Dr. Rainer Hildebrandt, a human rights activist felt that the display should be of the Berlin Wall.

name: East Side Gallery
description: The East Side Gallery can be found on the most significant remaining part of the Berlin Wall. It is over a kilometer long and can be found spread out along the Spree River’s banks. In fact, it is the world’s longest open air gallery.

name: Neues Museum
description: The Neuse Museum is the home of both the Museum of Prehistory and Early History, and the Egyptian Museum with its Papyrus Collection. It also houses artifacts in its Collection of Classical Antiquities.

name: DDR Museum
description: The DDR Museum in Berlin is a privately owned institution that serves as one of the most visited Berlin museums. Founded in 2005, the DDR Museum actually opened on July 15, 2006. The museum’s focus is the everyday life in GDR and is a place where visitors can get a glimpse into what life was like in East Germany.

name: Potsdamer Platz
description: Postdamer Platz is among Europe’s liveliest and busiest squares. During the 1920s and 1930s Postdamer Platz was one of the main transportation hubs in Europe but after being badly destroyed at World War II, it was renewed and reopened in 1998.

name: Topography of Terror
description: The Topography of Terror can be found where once the SS and the Gestapo Headquarters used to reside. The Museum provides an overview of the evolvement of the National Socialism in the last few decades and does not skip the crimes which this movement is responsible for. The museum holds a massive documentation center.

name: Museum Island
description: The Museum Island serves as Berlin’s sanctuary for the arts and sciences and in 1999 it was named a National Heritage site by UNESCO. The area is made up of five different museums while The Royal Museum was the first of the five to be built in 1830 for the German public to be able to view Germany’s royal treasures of art.

name: Madame Tussauds Berlin
description: The Madame Tussaud’s in Berlin is a popular destination for locals and tourists and the home for life like wax statues that from all areas of interest - famous entertainers, athletes and political figures. Madame Tussaud’s boasts an interactive library of items famously used by many public figures.

name: Bebelplatz
description: The Bebelplatz square in Berlin is located close to Humbolt University and is infamous as the place of the first book burning by the Nazis, which took place on May 10th in 1933 when books by authors such as Karl Marx, Thomas Mann and others were burnt.

name: Alte Nationalgalerie
description: Alte Nationalgalerie, translates to the Old National Gallery in English is a world famous art gallery in Berlin that holds sculptures and paintings of the 19th century.

name: Potsdam
description: Potsdam, a UNESCO World Heritage city, once the home of the Prussian royalty and today well known for its elegant palaces and stately homes.

name: Berlin Wall Memorial
description: The Berlin Wall Memorial was established during 1998 by The Federal Republic of Germany. It was established for the purpose of remembering the way in which Berlin was divided between August 13, 1961 and November 9, 1989.

name: Palacio Real de Madrid
description: Madrid's Royal Palace was constructed on the site of the old Alcazar fortress which was a Moorish castle. This is the city's largest building and Western Europe's largest royal palace. It is situated next to the Plaza de Oriente Square.

name: Plaza Mayor
description: Madrid's main square is also the most beautiful square, the Plaza Mayor is a rectangular-shaped square surrounded by historical buildings. The plaza was built under Felipe II and designed by Juan de Herrera in the 1560s.

name: Almudena Cathedral
address: 10 Calle Bailen, on corner of Mayor Street, Madrid, Spain
description: Madrid's cathedral stands adjacent to the Royal Palace on Bailen Street; it is the seat of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Madrid. In 1561 King Filipe II moved Spain's capital from Toledo to Madrid and the new capital needed a grand place of worship. Construction began in 1879 on the former site of Madrid's first mosque.

name: Real Basilica de San Francisco el Grande
description: The Basilica of St. Francis the Great was constructed in 1760 during the reign of Carlos III. The cathedral is thought to be located on the same spot where Saint Francis himself founded a Franciscan convent in 1217. The Roman Catholic church is located in La Latina neighborhood and looks onto Plaza de San Francisco.

name: Parque del Retiro
address: Plaza de la Independence, 7, 28009 Madrid, Spain
description: Retiro Park is Madrid's main green lung, it is one of the city's largest parks. The park's full name is Parque del Buen Retiro or Park of the Pleasant Retreat. The park covers 1.4km² and is surrounded by many of the city's main attractions like the Prado Museum.

name: Puerta de Alcala
address: Plaza de la Independencia, 10, 28001 Madrid, Spain
description: The Alcala Gate in Madrid stands in the center of Plaza de la Independencia, spanning Calle de Alcala; although this was not its original location. The gate was commissioned to replace the 16th century gate which stood at the eastern entrance to the city.

name: Museo Thyssen
address: Palacio de Villahermosa, Paseo Prado, 8, 28014 Madrid, Spain
description: This Madrid museum's collection of 1,000 pieces of 13th to late 20th century art covers all the genres of that period; the art comes from across the globe but is predominantly the work of European artists. The museum is housed within a neo-classical house built in 1806 in Madrid's Golden Triangle of museums.

name: Templo de Debod
address: Calle de Ferraz, s/n, 20008 Madrid, Spain
description: The Debod Temple is an authentic Egyptian temple dedicated to the gods Amon and Isis. It dates back to the 4th century BC and until 1960 stood in Egypt. When the Aswan Dam was under construction the temple and other monuments needed to be relocated.

name: Casa de Campo
address: Parque Casa de Campo, Avenida de Portugal, s/n, 28011 Madrid
description: Madrid's largest park covers 4200 acres (1,722 hectares) in the Moncloa-Aravaca district west of central Madrid. The park is actually an extension of Monte del Pardo and is one of the largest parks in Europe and the largest in Spain.

name: Mercado de San Miguel
address: Plaza de San Miguel, s/n, 28005 Madrid, Spain
description: In the heart of Madrid’s old quarter you will find the Mercado de San Miguel, one of the city’s oldest and most beautiful markets. The market is the last remaining iron market hall in the city, after most of the other original buildings of the Cebada and Los Mostenses markets were destroyed.

name: St Stephens Basilica
description: One of Budapest's greatest landmarks is this beautiful church which stands on the Pest side of the city. The church construction was completed in 1906 having taken 50 years to build. The long construction period accounts for the eclectic style of the architecture.

name: The Chain Bridge
address: Crosses the Danube between Clark Adam Square in Buda and Szechenyi Istvan Square in Pest, 1013 Budapest
description: The Chain Bridge is a 19th century suspension bridge which spans the Danube River connecting the Pest and Buda sides of the city. The Chain Bridge was the first permanent bridge crossing the Danube in Budapest.

name: House of Parliament
description: The governing powers of Hungary are housed in the third largest parliament building in the world. A competition was held to find a suitable design for the building and it was won by Imre Steindl who completed the building in 1904. His design was inspired by the English House of Parliament.

name: Central Market
description: The Central or Great Market Hall in Budapest was originally constructed in 1897. It is located on the bank of the Danube in Fovam Square near the Liberty Bridge. The market building was designed by Samu Pecz and is the largest indoor market in the city.

name: National Opera House
description: The ornate Opera House is designed in the Neo-Renaissance style and is located on elegant Andrassy Avenue. The building was designed by Miklos Ybl for the Millennium celebrations of 1900. It took 9 years to build and was completed in 1884.

name: Fisherman's Bastion
description: As a bastion this site should be more defensive than decorated but that is not the case. The ornate terraces were part of constructions made between 1895 and 1902 in celebration of the state's 1000th anniversary.

name: Matthias Church
description: This church is also known as the church of Our Lady or Nagyboldogasszony Templom. It is located in the Buda Castle District by the Fisherman's Bastion. It was originally built in 1255 and named after King Matthias Corvinus who reigned 1458-90 and was married here twice.

name: National Gallery
address: Buda Palace, Buildings A, B, C, D, H-1014 Budapest, Szent Gyorgy ter 2.
description: This is the largest public collection of Hungarian fine arts. The museum is housed within the Royal Palace of Buda's buildings A, B, C and D and presents Hungarian art work from the medieval era and up to the 20th century.

name: National Museum
description: This museum highlights the history, art and archaeology of Hungary and is housed in a distinctive Neo-Classical building. This is the country's oldest museum, founded in 1802. The museum building dates back to 1847 and was designed by Mihaly Pollack.

name: Heroes Square
description: Budapest's largest public square was created in 1896 to mark the 1,000 anniversary of the country's birth. The impressive square is located at the end of Andrassy Avenue and next to City Park. The neo-classical buildings of the Museum of Fine Art and the Kunsthalle (Hall of Art) can be seen on the edges of the square.

name: Vajdahunyad Castle
address: City Park Budapest (Varosliget), Vajdahunyadvar,  Zuglo District, 1146 Budapest
description: This fairytale castle is situated in City Park surrounded by green foliage and alongside a picturesque artificial lake. The castle itself is part of a complex of buildings. The castle was modeled on the original Vajdahunyad Castle which is located in Transylvania which was once part of Hungary.

name: Szechenyi Baths
address: Szechenyi Gyogyfurdo es Uszoda, 1146 Budapest, 14. Kerulet Allatkerti Korut 9-11. SItuated in the public park
description: This was the first 19th century thermal bath in Budapest, it was opened temporarily in 1881 and once its popularity was established the structure was made permanent. The medicinal bath was built in 1913 and the northern wing was added in 1927.

name: Holocaust Memorial Center
description: The Holocaust Memorial Center is housed within the former 1920s Pava Synagogue, the complex includes a research center, a memorial and a museum dedicated to Hungarian Jews who lost their lives in WWII. The architecture of the redesigned synagogue is meant to reflect the emotions and horror associated with the Holocaust.

name: Dohany Synagogue
description: The Dohany Street Synagogue, Central Synagogue, Tabakgasse Synagogue or the Budapest Great Synagogue is the largest synagogue in Europe and the second largest in the world. The synagogue was designed by Ludwig Forster and completed in 1859 to service the 30,000 Jewish residence of Pest.

name: House of Terror
description: Having survived two terror regimes, the Nazis and the Soviets Hungary fittingly opened a museum dedicated to those who died, suffered and survived those horrendous periods of Hungarian history. The museum is fittingly housed within the building where victims of the Soviet regime were captivated, tortured and killed.

name: Buda Castle
description: The Buda Castle is a complex of palaces and castles belonging to the Austro-Hungarian kings of the days gone by and was built first in 1265. It is located on the southern tip of Castle Hill and has the Castle District to its north.

name: Museum of Transport
description: Note: Museum is temporarily closed and will be rebuilt and totally renewed. The Budapest Transport Museum is housed in a Transportation Hall which was constructed for the 1896 Millennium Exhibition.

name: Shoes on the Danube
address: Budapest, Id. Antall József rkp., 1052 Hungary
description: Shoes on the Danube is one of the most moving memorials in Budapest. It is located on the Pest side of the Danube Promenade and close to the Hungarian Parliament, about 300 meters away.

name: Gellert Hill
address: South of Castle Hill, Buda, District 1, Budapest. Next to Citadella. Start ascent from Elisabeth Bridge or the Gellert Hotel
description: Gellert Hill rises 140 meters above Budapest overlooking the Danube River, the hill is the site of several points of interest and is also a great place to get a panoramic view across the city. The hill is named after Bishop Gellert Sagredo who is credited with bringing Christianity to Hungary.

name: Piazza del Duomo
description: Milan's most popular square is home to the Duomo, the city's cathedral and is the heart of the city. The rectangular square covers 17,000m² and is surrounded by several important buildings.

name: Milan Cathedral
description: The Duomo di Milano is the city's main Catholic place of worship, it is located in the center of Milan with the city streets radiating and circling the cathedral and the square where it is located. It is one of the largest and more famous cathedrals in the world.

name: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II
address: Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II, 20121 Milan, Italy
description: Milan's elegant shopping mall is within buildings lining two arcades which form a cross-shape. Giuseppe Mengoni designed the structure in 1877 when he was chosen to redesign the historic area between Piazza della Scala and the Duomo.

name: Royal Palace of Milan
description: The Palazzo Reale (once called the Royal Ducal) is located on Piazza del Duomo in central Milan; it is home to the Contemporary Art Museum and the Duomo Cathedral Museum. The palace covers 7,000m² and is one of the city's most important cultural centers and exhibition spaces.

name: Santa Maria delle Grazie
description: This church in the Piazza Santa Maria delle Grazie is home to Leonardo da Vinci's fresco The Last Supper which is within the Cenacolo Viniciano building. The artist spent from 1495 to 1497 painting the scene of Jesus last meal with the disciples before his arrest.

name: Teatro alla Scala
address: Piazza della Scala, Via Filodrammatici, 2, Milan
description: La Scala opera house is a world famous venue, the original building was designed by Giuseppe Piermarini and opened in 1778. In the 1800s the productions of Vincenzo Bellini and Rossini graced the stage and ballet was introduced to the theatre's repertoire.

name: San Maurizio al Monastero Maggiore
description: This Milan church was formally the church of a Benedictine convent today the convent is an archaeological museum and the church is used by locals and as a concert venue. The church interior is one of the most stunningly beautiful in the city with frescoes covering every surface and bursting with color.

name: Castello Sforzesco
address: Viale Petfi A. Petrovich, 20121 Milan, Italy
description: Sfarzo Castle is an historic fortress which houses several of Milan's best museums including the Pinacoteca del Castello Sforzesco. The original fortress on this site was constructed in 1368 and at that point it had four 80 meter long walls with square towers at the corners.

name: Pinacoteca di Brera
description: The Brera Art gallery holds paintings created by Italian artists spanning a period from the 14th to 20th century. The gallery shares the Palazzo di Brera with, the Academy of Fine Arts, the Lombard Institute of Science and Literature, the Botanical Garden, the Astronomical Observatory and the Braidense National Library.

name: Piazza Mercanti
description: This public square is not far from the Duomo and at one time was the center of Milan's commercial and governmental life. During the Middle Ages the square was surrounded by important civil buildings like the city hall, law courts and a prison. This was where a crier would announce weddings and where the city market was held.

name: Biblioteca Ambrosiana
description: The Ambrosia library is housed within the same building as the Pinacoteca Ambrosiana Museum. The two establishments were founded by Cardinal Federico Borromeo (1564-1631) and named after the patron saint of Milan. The library is famous for the structure as well as the books and manuscripts it holds.

name: Pinacoteca Ambrosiana
description: This is one of the city's oldest museums; it was founded in 1618 by Cardinal Federico Borromeo and is home to display his personal collection. The museum is adjacent to the Biblioteca Ambrosiana which houses written works by some of greatest historic writers, artists, inventors and historians.

name: Via Torino
description: Via Torino is a popular shopping street running from the Duomo to Largo Carrobbio in the Ticinese neighborhood and the Navigli District. The street is one of the oldest in the city and has a long tradition as a hub of commercial activity.

name: San Siro Stadium
description: Milan's primary sports stadium, Stadio Giuseppe Meazza is situated in the San Siro District. It is the home ground of A.C. Milan and F.C. Internazionale Milano. San Siro was first opened in 1926 and since then has undergone many structural changes enlarging the venue and adding more facilities.

name: Porta Ticinese
description: Porta Ticinese was one of 11 original gates in the Spanish Walls or Mura Spagnole built from 1546 to 1560 when the city was under Spanish rule. The gate faces south-west and spans the ancient Roman road which led to Pavia. It gets its name from the Ticino River which is in that direction.

name: Parthenon
description: The Parthenon is the main ancient structure on the Acropolis, a hill in the center of Athens. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site, the symbol of Athens and the most famous of the surviving structures from the world of ancient Greece. The building was originally built in honor of the goddess Athena, the city's patron.

name: The Acropolis
description: Athens' top must-see attraction and a UNESCO site is the Acropolis, High City or Sacred Rock, a hill overlooking the city and home to the most recognizable symbol of the city, the Parthenon. The Acropolis has been inhabited since the Neolithic period and has been used as both a religious cult site and a residential area.

name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
description: The remains of this massive temple stand southeast of the Acropolis. The temple of Zeus Olympios was the largest in ancient Greece. Construction began in 515BC and it was completed in the 2nd century during the Roman era. The building process had several stops and starts.

name: Plaka
address: Neighborhood northeastern side of Acropolis between Syntagma Square and Monastiraki Square
description: The Plaka will be one of the most enchanting places you visit in Athens even though it is geared towards tourists it has retained a charm and picturesque quality. Plaka is a neighborhood at the foot of the Acropolis constructed on the same site as ancient residential areas.

name: Hadrian's Arch
address: Amallias Ave, Athens (entrance to the site of Temple of Olympian Zeus, south of National Gardens)
description: This triumphal arch was erected in the 2nd century AD in honor of the Roman emperor Hadrian. The arch stands within walking distance of Syntagma Square. It was probably constructed before Hadrian's visit to Athens on 131/132AD.

name: Roman Agora
address: North of Acropolis, east of Ancient Agora. Main entrance from side street off Adrianou St. east of Stoa of Attalos.
description: Visitors to the Agora in Athens get to stroll between what remains of the Roman Forum or center of the city from 19 to 11BC. By the 1st century BC when Athens had become part of the Roman Empire the old marketplace or Agora was no longer efficient enough and so the new Roman Agora was built.

name: Ancient Agora
description: The Agora or "gathering place" was the heart of ancient Athens. People would come here to do business, shop, be entertained, hear philosophers expounding their views, attend court, go to school, socialize and conduct politics.

name: The Acropolis Museum
address: Entrance from Dionisiou Areopagitou 15,  Makriyianni, Athens 117 42
description: The Acropolis is a large hill in central Athens, the site is home to several priceless, UNESCO listed structures from ancient civilizations including the iconic Pantheon. Until the 17th century visitors could see the beautiful temples, gates and tombs on the Acropolis relatively intact.

name: Monastiraki
address: Avissynias (Abyssinia) Square, Athens 105 55 at the end of Hephaestou St.
description: The Monastiraki (little monastery) flea market is held in one of the oldest parts of the city at the foot of the Acropolis in the Monastiraki neighborhood on Avissynias Square. The neighborhood is known for its shops and open-bazaar type stores which line the streets but there is also the market which is not worth missing.

name: National Historical Museum Athens
address: Old Parliament Building, Kolokotronis Square, 13 Stadiou St., Athens
description: The building which houses this museum has a long and eventful history. The site used to be the residence of King Otto of Greece in 1813. In 1844 King Otto established a constitution and the building was allocated for sessions of the Greek Parliament.

name: Panathenaic Stadium
description: This stadium was originally built in 330-321BC to host the Panathenaic Games. The festival was held every four years and was part of a huge festival in honor of the Goddess Athena. The spectators sat on the slopes surrounding the stadium while dignitaries had wooden seats.

name: Syntagma Square
address: Square is bordered by Leoforos Vasilissis Amalias St. to the east; Othonos St. to the south; Vassileos Georgiou A St. to the north and Filellinon St. to the west.
description: On Syntagma Square the most impressive building is the Greek Parliament Building which used to be the Royal Palace. Up until 1843 when Greece became a constitutional nation the square was called Palace Square and today it is called Constitution Square or Plateia Syntagmatos.

name: Benaki Museum
address: 1 Koumpari St. & Vas. Sofias Ave,  Athens 106 74
description: The Islamic Collection is one of several branches of the Benaki Museum; it is housed in the Kerameikos building complex. The museum in the center of Athens comprises two neo-classical buildings which are both listed. The buildings have many ornamental features.

name: Kerameikos
description: Kerameikos is an area which was once the ancient potters' quarter of Athens (hence the word "ceramics" from Kerameikos). Visitors to Kerameikos can see an ancient cemetery, the ruins of the Athens city walls, ruins of two city wall gates and visit the Kerameikos Museum.

name: National Archaeological Museum
description: To see the largest collection of archaeological findings from Greece visit this centrally located museum. The huge neo-classical building was expanded in several stages to make room for the growing collection.

name: Athens City Museum
description: With so many of the city's sites devoted to the ancient civilizations of Athens it is refreshing to visit this museum which focuses on the modern history of the Greek capital. The museum is housed within two connected post-revolutionary buildings. A tour of the museum takes you through Athenian history and cultural life.

name: Mount Lycabettus
address: Athens 11471; Funicular lower station at Aristippou St., Kolonaki; Accessable from Paliggenesias St. and Sarantapichou St.
description: Rising up out of the urban skyline of Athena is Mount Lycabettus, a distinctly pointed mountain with forested slopes and a rocky summit. The mountain is 278 meters high and is a popular hiking spot for those seeking a breathtaking view across the city and the Acropolis.

name: Byzantine and Christian Museum
description: The origins of the Byzantine and Christian Museum (BCM) are strongly linked with the Christian Archaeological Society founded in 1884. The collection was amassed before the establishment of the museum which found its first home in 1890.

name: National Gallery
address: Michalakopoulou 1,  Athens 115 28. Entrance from Katechaki Ave.
description: The history of Greek and Western European art from the 14th century (post-Byzantine) to the 20th century is covered in this museum. The museum has been open to the public in its present form since 1976 although the history of the museum goes back to 1878. The museum is housed in two buildings.

name: Philopappos Hill
description: This hill is one of three located west of the Acropolis within a park. The other two hills are the Hill of Nymphs and the Hill of the Pnyx. Philopappos Hill is the highest of the three reaching 147 meters.

name: Temple of Poseidon
description: The temple stands in Sounion on a site that was inhabited as far back as the prehistoric era. The Sanctuary of Sounion is mentioned in the Odyssey as the place where Menelaos docked to bury his helmsman, Phrontes Onetorides on their return journey from Troy.

name: Jewish Museum of Greece
description: The Jewish community of Athens first proposed the idea for this museum in the 70s and by 1977 the museum was established in a small room adjoining the Athens synagogue. Most of the artifacts on display were salvaged from WWII. The collection expanded as artifacts were collected from the Jewish communities throughout Greece.

name: Marienplatz
description: This Medieval public square is the heart of the Munich, since its construction it has been the site of tournaments, executions, markets (the fresh produce market moved to nearby Viktualienmarkt in 1807) and public events. Originally the square was called Schrannen but was renamed, St.

name: Frauenkirche
description: The Dom zu Unserer Lieben Frau is Munich's official cathedral, located not far from Marienplatz. The construction of the church began in 1468 on the site of a former 13th century church which was in bad condition and too small to represent the city and hold the large congregation.

name: English Garden
description: This huge (900 acres), centrally located park was the first public park established in Europe, it is one of the world's largest urban parks and is even bigger than New York's Central Park.

name: Residenz
description: The Residenz Palace was home and seat of government for the rulers of Bavaria, the Wittelbach dynasty, from 1508 to 1918. The palace was built in 1385 and was first home to Duke Stephan III, each successive ruler who lived in the palace made changes or additions to the palace structure.

name: Neuschwanstein Castle
description: The New Swanstone Castle or Neuschwanstein is perched on a forest covered hill above a small town, the fairy-tale castle inspired Disney's castle of Sleeping Beauty. It truly is the typical story book castle.

name: Schloss Nymphenburg
description: Construction began on Nymphenburg Palace following the birth of Max Emanuel to the Bavarian Elector Ferdinand Maria and Henriette Adelaide of Savoy. At the time the chosen site was in the rural area near Munich.

name: BMW Museum
description: This museum focuses on the history and products of the car company BMW; it is situated in close proximity to BMW Welt, a product show room, conference space and also a museum in an innovatively designed building. The BMW Museum building was opened in 1972 and in 2008 underwent extensive renovations.

name: Bayerisches Nationalmuseum
description: The Bavarian National Museum was founded in 1867 by King Maximilian II; it is one of Europe's finest art and cultural history museums. Originally the art was housed in what is today the State Museum of Ethnology. The building which houses the museum today was designed by Gabriel Von Seidl, who also designed the Lenbachhaus.

name: Viktualienmarkt
description: This fresh produce market is located within walking distance of Marienplatz, just past the Old Town Hall. It is essentially an outdoor market although today there are a number of covered permanent stalls and small wooden stores along the rim of the market.

name: BMW Welt
description: BMW Welt (not to be confused with the nearby BMW Museum) is a conference center, show room and has permanent exhibitions. The building which houses the exhibits is just as famous, if not more, than what is inside. The architecture is open-style with a glass façade letting in lots of natural light and opening up the building.

name: Dachau Concentration Camp
description: Dachau is a small city on the edge of Munich, accessible by the Munich train system within 25 minutes. The city is infamous for being the site of Germany's first Nazi concentration camp which today is open to the public as the Dachau Concentration Camp Memorial Site.

name: Allianz Arena
description: The Allianz Arena is Munich's football stadium, one of the largest stadiums in the country and home turf to the city's football teams, TSV 1860 Munchen and FC Bayern Munich.

name: Olympiapark
description: The Olympiapark or Olympic Park of Munich was constructed 1972 when Munich was hosting the Olympic Games. The games remain in public memory for the sad act of terrorism that engulfed it, but the stadium complex itself remains as a symbol of that landmark event.

name: Manneken Pis
address: Corner Rue du Chene/Eikstraat and Rue de l'Etuve/Stoofstraat, Brussels, Belgium
description: This is definitely the top attraction in Brussels. In among the narrow lanes of the historic city center at 31 Rue de l'Etuve (lievevrouwbroersstraat) stands the statue of a little boy taking a pee. The statue is only 61cm high and is made of bronze, it is a fountain statue.

name: Belgian Royal Palace
description: The official residence of Belgian royals is now used for official audiences, visits by foreign Heads of State and houses the offices of the King and Queen, the Grand Marshal of the Court, the King's Head of Cabinet, the Head of the King's Military Household and State Rooms.

name: Hotel de Ville
description: The dominating building on the Grand Place is the Brussels' Town Hall. This Gothic structure was built in several stages beginning in 1402. Jacob van Thienen designed the first stage of the building which was complete by 1405. Today it makes up the left wing of the structure.

name: St. Michael and St. Gudula Cathedral
description: The Catholic Cathedrale Saint-Michel in Brussels was named in honor of the city's patron saints and is the country's most important church and the Episcopal see of the Archbishop of Mechlin-Brussels. It is the church where all of the country's royal weddings, christenings and funerals are held.

name: Magritte Museum
address: limou.be, Place Royale 1 Koningsplein, 1000 Brussels, Belgium
description: The Magritte Museum is located next to the Royal Museums of Fine Arts. The Magritte Museum covers 2,500m² and is dedicated to the work of Belgian surrealist artist Rene Magritte. Magritte is considered one of the top artists in the world and the top Belgian artist of the 20th century.

name: Atomium
address: asbl Atomium,  Square de l'Atomium, 1020 Brussels, Belgium
description: The Atomium is the most popular attraction in Brussels. The building was created by Andre Waterkeyn, Andre and Jean Polak. It was constructed in 1958 for the World Exhibition and was modeled on the atomic structure of an iron crystal but on a scale of 1: 165 billion.

name: Belgian Comic Strip Center
description: The Comic Center is housed in the art nouveau building Les Magasins Waucquez which was an historic department store built in 1906 and designed by Belgian architect Victor Horta. Belgium is closely associated with the art of comics; they even have the highest concentration of comic artists in the world.

name: Mini Europe
description: Right at the foot of the Atomium in Bruparck is this attraction devoted to Europe and its famous iconic landmarks. Miniature Europe is constructed on a scale of 1:25 and includes 350 models of famous European sites from about 80 European cities. Mini-Europe covers 24,000m².

name: Grand Place
description: Among all the tourist attractions in Brussels, one of the most important is the Grand Place. This is the central square of Brussels and has around it magnificent guild halls and other buildings. Two of the big buildings in its vicinity are the Town Hall and the Breadhouse building.

name: Museum of the City of Brussels
address: Maison du Roi, Grand-Place, 1000 Brussels, Belgium
description: Maison du Roi, Broodhuis or the Museum of Brussels covers every aspect of the city's origins, folklore and history. It covers the city's development over the years, major events, important residents, landmarks as well as outstanding works of art.

name: Autoworld
description: Autoworld is a venue for conventions, events and meetings but is also the site of an auto museum which displays over 250 vehicles from various countries and different historic periods. Through the exhibition you can trace the history of the automobile from antique classic cars to the latest models.

name: Cinquantenaire Museum
description: This museum is located in the heart of Cinquantenaire Park and is one of the Royal Museums of Art and History of Belgium.

name: Nyhavn
description: As the Nyhavn website states this is “gastronomy and good atmosphere in historical surroundings.” But in addition to that it is the place where you will take your most picturesque photos. Nyhavn runs from Kongens Nytorv to the harbor front south of the Royal Playhouse.

name: Christiansborg Palace
description: Christiansborg Palace is located on a small island in central Copenhagen, it is still used by the royal family for receptions and as their royal chapel and stables but it is now primarily the seat of the Danish Parliament, Supreme Court and the Prime Minister’s Office.

name: Rosenborg Castle
description: Rosenborg Castle is 400 years old, it was built in the renaissance style by Christian IV and the castle was his favorite home and place for throwing lavish parties.

name: Town Hall
description: The Radhus or Town Hall is a magnificent building on Radhus Square where the zero kilometer stone is located. At this granite stone you are in the exact center of the city. Next to the Zero Stone is a fountain dating back to 1925 and marking the point where the former West Gate of the city walls once stood.

name: National Museum
address: Prince's Mansion, Ny Vestergade 10, 1471 Copenhagen K, Denmark
description: See Denmark’s largest collection of cultural, ethnography, natural science, archaeology and numismatics from around the world. 14,000 years of Danish history are covered going as far back as the Ice Age and covering periods like the middle ages and Vikings.

name: Round Tower
description: The Round Tower is a beautiful and unusual cylindrical structure in the center of the city. The 17th century tower was constructed during the reign of Christian IV as an astronomical observatory. The tower was used as an observatory by the university until 1861 and continues to be used by amateurs.

name: Little Mermaid
description: Den Lille Havfrue may be overrated but you can’t leave Copenhagen without seeing it and taking a photo. This is the ultimate and most recognizable symbol of Copenhagen. The mermaid statue sitting on top of a small rock was inspired by Hans Christian Andersen’s fairy tale of the same name.

name: Amalienborg Palace
address: Amalienborg Slotsplads 5, 1257 Copenhagen, Denmark, museum is Christian VIII Palace, entrance gate closest to Frederiksgade
description: This large palace complex is the Danish royals’ winter home. Four identical palaces face onto an open courtyard where visitors can stand and gaze at the beautiful buildings, it is also where the Changing of the Guard takes place and where you can see a statue of King Frederik V (1771).

name: National Gallery of Denmark
description: The National Gallery of Denmark (SMK) is the country’s largest art museum and holds Danish and international works from the 14th century to present day. The works are arranged in chronological order and in theme areas.

name: Copenhagen Cathedral
description: Copenhagen’s official national cathedral is the Church of Our Lady. Having undergone several changes over the years the version of the building we see today was completed in 1829 and designed by Christian Frederik in the neoclassical style.

name: Carlsberg Glyptotek Museum
description: This is one of the top art museums in the country. It was established by Carl Jacobsen of Carlsberg Breweries in 1888 and the core of museum collection came from Jacobsen’s private collection. The word Glyptotek comes from the Greek “to carve.” Here you can see collections of antiquities, French art and Danish art.

name: Tivoli Gardens
description: Although one of the top 5 attractions in Copenhagen the Tivoli Gardens are not open year round. They close 3rd January to 1st April and are also closed 20th September to 9 October and 1st November to 14th November. The pleasure gardens hold an amusement park, 10 restaurants and gardens.

name: Copenhagen Zoo
description: Kobenhavns Zoo was established in 1859, it is one of Europe’s oldest zoos. The zoo covers 27 acres and is famed for its breeding programs, Savannah habitat and Elephant House which was designed by Sir Norman Foster.

name: National Aquarium
description: This national aquarium (Den Blå Planet) is not to be confused with the “Denmark Aquarium” (which is closed). The aquarium is one of the most innovative and beautiful aquarium buildings you could visit and is the largest in Northern Europe.

name: Copenhagen Museum
description: This is a non-traditional museum with some interactive displays and excellent exhibits to give you a better understanding of the culture and history of Copenhagen. The museum brings together obscure and personal stories about Copenhagen and its people.

name: Copenhagen Opera House
description: This magnificent modern building can be enjoyed from the outside, by taking a guided tour or you can attend a performance. Another way of seeing the structure is from a boat on one of the many boat tours in Copenhagen as the building stands on the island of Holmen on the shore of the harbor.

name: Ha'Penny Bridge
description: Ha'Penny Bridge or Half Penny Bridge crosses Liffey Street Lower to Merchants Arch. The elliptical arched metal bridge originally had a wooden gangway when it was constructed in 1816. The bridge has a 43 meter span, 3 meter width and is 3 meters above the water.

name: St. Patrick's Cathedral
address: Saint Patrick's Close, Dublin, Ireland Corner of Patrick St. and Upper Kevin St.
description: Originally a wooden 5th century St. Patrick's Church was located here on the site said to have been where Saint Patrick baptized converts. In 1191 the church became a cathedral and construction began on the building we see today. The Protestant St. Patrick's Cathedral was completed in 1260.

name: Dublin Castle
description: Dublin Castle was built on a site that had previously been settled by Vikings. It was constructed for King John of England from 1204 to 1230 to defend the city and the King's treasures.

name: Temple Bar
description: The Temple Bar area is on the south bank of the River Liffey and bounded by Liffey street, Dame Street, Westmoreland Street and Fishamble Street. The Temple Bar area is considered the cultural quarter of the city.

name: Trinity College
description: The College of the Holy and Undivided Trinity of Elizabeth is the only college of the University of Dublin. It was founded in 1592 and is one of seven ancient colleges in the UK and one of the best colleges in the world as well as Ireland's oldest college.

name: Guinness Storehouse
description: The Guinness Storehouse is located in the St. James's Gate Brewery; it is housed in a seven-storey historic building. The Guinness experience takes you through the company's history and role in the Irish culture.

name: Kilmainham Gaol
description: From the 1780s to 1920s this gaol was the site of several major events in Ireland's history. Many of the leaders of the Irish rebellion were held here and some were even executed here by the English and later by the independent Irish nation. The gaol was constructed in 1796.

name: Grafton Street
address: Grafton St. runs from St. Stephen's Green to College Green, Dublin, Ireland
description: Grafton Street is Dublin's most famous shopping street; it runs from St. Stephen's Green to College Green. The street is lined with historic buildings and points of interest as well as many high-end shops, spas, service stores, theatres, galleries, cafes, bars, hotels and restaurants.

name: St. Stephens Green
description: This rectangular 22 acre park opened to the public in 1880. It is known for the many Victorian elements and the Victorian Era park layout which has survived all these years. The Victorian layout was funded by Sir A.E.Guinness of the famous brewing family.

name: Little Museum of Dublin
address: 15 St. Stephen's Green, near the corner of Dawson St. Dublin 2, Ireland
description: The museum is located on the first floor of a beautiful Georgian building. The collection is comprised of artifacts dating between 1900 and 2000 and originating in Dublin. The items include photographs, artifacts, letters, advertisements, postcards, household items, art and memorabilia.

name: Book of Kells and Old Library
address: Trinity College, College St., Dublin 2, Ireland
description: The Book of Kells is an illuminated manuscript of the Biblical New Testament Gospels in Latin and created in a British or Irish Columban monastery dating back to c.800AD. It is believed to have been created on the island of Iona off the west coast of Scotland and completed in the Abbey of Kells.

name: The Old Jameson Distillery
address: Bow St., Smithfield Village, Dublin 7, Ireland

name: Christ Church Cathedral
description: The church has an elevated location in the historic area of the city. It is an Anglican Church and one of only 2 Protestant cathedrals in the city.

name: National Gallery of Ireland
description: The Irish National Gallery holds a world-class collection of Irish and European fine art. In 1852 William Dargan initiated the idea for a major exhibition on Leinster Lawn in Dublin. The exhibition proved so popular that it sowed the seeds for a permanent exhibition.

name: Phoenix Park
address: Main Gates on Parkgate St. and Castleknock Gate.
description: Dublin's Phoenix Park covers 1,750 acres and is enclosed by a 11km long wall; it is one of Europe's largest enclosed parks. The vast green lung of Dublin holds many different areas and attractions. The land began as a royal hunting park in 1662 which required an enclosing wall. It became a public park in 1745.

name: Malahide Castle
address: Malahide Castle & Gardens, Malahide Co. Dublin, Ireland
description: This picturesque castle looks like something out of a fairytale. The castle estate covers 1.1km² and is located just 14km from Dublin. The castle and gardens have been home to the Talbot family for more than 800 years (1185-1975); it is one of the oldest castles in the country.

name: General Post Office
description: The building was constructed in 1814 and is the headquarters of the Irish Postal Service – An Post. The classical building is on Dublin's O'Connell Street and is an architectural attraction as well as a symbol of the failed 1916 Easter Rising.

name: Custom House
description: Dublin's Custom House is located on the north bank of the River Liffey. It was completed in 1791 and was built opposite the Dublin Corporation City Merchants & Brewers building. The Irish Parliament approved the construction although it was a controversial choice.

name: The Ark
description: This cultural center was specifically built with children in mind. It is located in the Temple Bar area of Dublin and focuses on all the visual and performing arts for kids aged 2 to 12. The areas covered include theatre, literature, film, dance, music and more.

name: EPIC The Irish Emigration Museum
address: The chq Building, Custom House Quay, Dublin 1.
description: EPIC is a modern museum in Dublin’s Docklands that tells the moving and unforgettable story of the 10 million Irish people who left their homeland – and how they influenced and shaped the world. The world’s only fully digital museum features 1,500 years of Irish history in its atmospheric vaults.

name: Temple Bar Gallery
description: This contemporary art gallery and artists' studio complex is located in the Temple Bar Cultural Quarter. The gallery and studios were the first artist-led project of its kind. It was founded by Jenny Haughton in a renovated former shirt factory.

name: The Gate
address: 1 Cavendish Row, Pamell Square, Dublin 1, Ireland
description: The Gate theatre company was established in 1928 by Hilton Edwards and Micheal MacLiammoir. The theatre building is a magnificent 18th century structure as well as a new wing which is home to the Gate Lab which is used for research and workshops.

name: Edinburgh Castle
address: The Royal Mile, Edinburgh, Castle Hill,  City of Edinburgh EH1, UK
description: On the top of the massive Castle Rock, in the center of the city sits Edinburgh Castle. The rock has been settled by humans since the 2nd century and there has been a castle on the summit since the 12th century. Until 1603 (when England, Scotland and Ireland were united) the castle was the official royal residence.

name: Royal Mile
address: Royal Mile, Edinburgh, EH1 2PB, Scotland (Castlehill, Royal Mile, High Street, Canongate)
description: The Royal Mile is likely to be your first stop on a visit to Edinburgh. The central street runs from Edinburgh Castle to Holyrood Park and was constructed on the ridge of a long-extinct volcano.

name: St. Giles Cathedral
address: 329 High Street, Edinburgh, City of Edinburgh EH1 1PN, UK
description: In the year 854 the first mention of a parish church in Edinburgh was recorded. It is possible that this original church was in use for several centuries before being dedicated in 1243. It was then re-consecrated and named after the city’s patron saint. St Giles’ was a 7th century hermit living in France.

name: Princes Street Gardens
address: Princes Street, Edinburgh, New Town, Edinburgh, EH2 2YJ, UK
description: This historic park is situated in a valley with the Edinburgh Castle at one end. The gardens were first established in the 1770s and in the 1820s. When Nor Loch was drained to make way for the New Town an additional section of the gardens was created.

name: The Scotch Whisky Experience
address: 354 Castlehill, Royal Mile, Edinburgh, EH1 2NE, UK
description: Scotland is famous for its whisky and this attraction offers you a fun amusement-park-like way to learn about how whiskey is made, its history and even to have a taste. Visitors travel through a distillery on a 10 minute “barrel ride” in a moving carriage which looks like a whiskey barrel.

name: Writers' Museum
address: Lady Stairs House, Lady Stairs Close, Lawnmarket, Edinburgh, EH1 2PA, UK
description: This unique museum is housed in Lady Stair’s House on the Royal Mile. The remarkable castle-like house was built in 1622 for Sir Walter Grey. The house gets its name from the Close (lane) where it is located on Lady Stair’s Close.

name: National Museum of Scotland
address: Chambers Street, City of Edinburgh EH1 1JF, UK
description: This museum is one of four museums under the title of National Museums of Scotland. The museum is housed in two connected buildings. The two buildings are very different, one modern and the other a 19th century structure. The buildings which house the museum are an attraction in themselfs.

name: Greyfriars Kirk
address: Greyfriars Place, Edinburgh, Edinburgh, Midlothian EH1 2QQ, UK
description: Greyfriars Church is a landmark building in the heart of the Old Town where it has stood since 1620. For 4 centuries the church has played a role in the city’s history and the history of Scotland. Today the church is still a place of worship but is also a concert venue and museum.

name: Holyrood Palace
address: Canongate, The Royal Mile, Edinburgh, EH8 8DX, UK
description: Holyrood Palace is the British Monarch’s home when she is in Scotland. It is located at the opposite end of the Royal Mile from Edinburgh Castle. Today it is mostly used for official state events, as the Queen’s home for one week in summer and for other royals to stay during the year.

name: National Portrait Gallery
description: This prestigious museum holds the national collection of portraits and the Scottish National Photography Collection. The museum dates back to 1882 and is housed in a building of the same era which was purpose-built. The museum houses 5 exhibitions, 11 displays and almost 30 events each year.

name: The Real Mary King's Close
address: 2 Warriston's Close, High Street, Edinburgh, EH1 1PG, UK
description: A visit to this site is with a guided tour only. The tours leave every 15 minutes, you need to arrive 10 minutes early and the tours last an hour. Mary King’s Close (a Close is a small street) runs under the Old Town in Edinburgh. The Close dates back to the 1600s when this was the heart of the bustling city.

name: Museum of Edinburgh
address: HUntly House, 142 Canongate, ROyal Mile, High Street, Edinburgh EH8 8DD, UK
