description: This museum covers the history of the city using artifacts to tell the story of Edinburgh’s people, trades, crafts and kings. Among the precious artifacts is the National Covenant. The museum holds silverware produced by metalworkers called hammermen who were the guild that owned the building now housing the museum.

name: John Knox House
address: 45-43 High Street, Mid Lothian, Edinburgh EH1 1SR, UK
description: This site is part of the Scottish Storytelling Center which stands alongside and is a venue for culture which incorporates contemporary design, entertainment and a look at some medieval architecture.  At the site there is a book shop, café, story wall and heritage activities.

name: Georgian House
address: 6 Charlotte Square, Edinburgh, Edinburgh, City of Edinburgh EH2, UK
description: This beautifully preserved Georgian house is located in the historic New Town on Charlotte Square. The house is the work of architect Robert Adam who also designed the square as a paradigm of the perfect Georgian urban environment.

name: Fraumunster
description: The Fraumunster church dates back to the 9th century when the abbey for women was established by Louis the German specifically for his daughter Hildegard. Here women were given refuge and were protected.

name: Grossmunster
description: Legend has it that this church stands on the site of three ancient graves. The graves were believed to belong to three 3rd century saints who refused to renounce their faith even after being tortured with boiling oil and being made to drink molten lead.

name: Kunsthaus
description: The art held in this modern art museum spans from the Middle Ages to contemporary art and comes from across the globe but with an emphasis on Swiss artists. The collection covers paintings, sculptures, prints, drawings, photography and video art.

name: Museum Rietberg
description: Unlike other Swiss museums which focus on Swiss art and European art this museum is devoted to Asian, American, African and Oceanian art. It is also one of the largest museums in the country. The Rietberg Museum is situated in Rieterpark a 69,000m² green oasis in the center of Zurich.

name: Lake Zurich
address: Southeast of the city of Zurich
description: An elongated body of water flows from Linth River in the southeast up passed Rapperswil Dam and continues to flow northwesterly until it reaches the city of Zurich and flows out into Limmat River.

name: Zurich Opera House
description: The Zurich Opera House replaced the Aktientheatre which burnt down in 1890. When it first opened the Opera House was called the Stadttheater Zurich and was designed by Ferdinand Fellner and Hermann Helmer. The Stadttheater opened its doors in 1891 and operated until 1925 when it was renamed the Zurich Opera House.

name: Bahnhofstrasse
description: Considered one of the world’s most exclusive shopping avenues, Zurich’s main downtown street, Bahnhofstrasse is a traffic free area and hugely popular among tourists and locals alike.

name: Rhine Falls
description: Located around one hour out of Zurich, near the town of Schaffhausen in the north of Switzerland, the Rhine Falls are Europe’s largest falls, thrilling visitors with its huge water volume.

name: Salzburg Cathedral
description: Salzburg Cathedra is located in Domplatz or Cathedral Square, together with the Residenz and St. Peter's Abbey. Bishop Virgil instigated the construction of the original cathedral on Roman ruins in 767.

name: Schloss Mirabell
description: Unlike most of the grand architecture of Salzburg which is concentrated in the Old Town, Mirabell Castle is on the road between the main railway station and the Old Town.

name: Mozart Birthplace
description: Together with the Sound of Music Salzburg is also famous for being the birthplace of Amadeus Mozart, one of the world's greatest composers of all time. There are two major sites in Salzburg dedicated to Mozart – his birthplace (Hagenauerhaus) and his former home.

name: Mozart Residence
description: Having been born in 1756 at 9 Getreidegasse and spent his childhood there up until 1773, Mozart then moved to a different Salzburg residence until 1781 when he left to spend the rest of his life in Vienna.

name: University of Salzburg Church
description: The Collegiate Church (Kollegienkirche or Universitatskirche) was built as a church for the Salzburg University, also called the Paris Lodron University which was founded in 1622 by Prince Archbishop Paris Lodron. The university is a non-campus institution and occupies several buildings in Salzburg's Old City.

name: Salzburg Museum
description: The Salzburg Museum is housed within the New Residenz in Mozart Square opposite the Residenz; the museum uses modern techniques to display historic artifacts and art and has won several awards.

name: Panorama Museum
description: This museum holds a 130m² panoramic (cyclorama) painting by J.M Sattler (1786-1847) of the city of Salzburg and the immediate vicinity as it would have looked 200 years ago in 1829. The round painting has a circumference of 26 meters and so you feel like you have literally stepped into the painting.

name: Schloss Hellbrunn
description: This grand palace complex is a baroque villa located south of Salzburg at the foot of Mt. Hellbrunn. The palace dates back to 1619 when it was constructed as a summer day home (there is no bedroom as it was used only during the day) for the Prince-Archbishop Markus Sittikus von Hohenems.

name: Alcázar
address: Patio de Banderas, s/n. 41004 Seville, Seville, Spain
description: Seville’s royal palace complex is an architectural wonder made up of Mudejar and Gothic styles. At the center of the complex is King Pedro I’s palace which was constructed in 1364. The palace began as one of the many building projects embarked on by the Moorish dynasty which came to power in 1161.

name: Catedral de Sevilla & Giralda Tower
address: Avenida de la Constitucion s/n, 41004 Seville, Spain
description: Seville’s Cathedral of Saint Mary of the See is a large Gothic-style structure, the 3rd largest church in the world and a UNESCO site. The cathedral was built to be as opulent and beautiful as possible to show off the city’s wealth. The cathedral was completed in 1506 after 101 years in construction.

name: Barrio de Santa Cruz
description: Santa Cruz is a “barrio” or neighborhood and Seville’s former Jewish quarter in the medieval old city. The neighborhood is delineated by Calle Santa Maria La Blanca; Jardines de Murillo; Calle Mateas Gago and Real Alcazar.

name: Metropol Parasol
address: Pl. de la Encarnación, s/n, 41003 Sevilla, Spain
description: The “mushroom of the incarnation” is an ultra-modern large structure in Seville’s Plaza de la Encarnacion and it is the largest wooden structure in the world. It consists of two concrete columns housing the structure’s elevators which provide access to a lookout point.

name: Plaza de España
address: Av de Isabel la Católica, 41004 Sevilla, Spain
description: This famed public square is located in front of the University of Seville near the entrance to Maria Luisa Park. It was one of the many areas constructed for the 1929 Ibero-American World Fair Expo. During the Expo there was a structure built to represent each of the visiting nations and Plaza de Espana was the Spanish site.

name: Parque María Luisa
address: Paseo de las Delicias, s/n, 41013 Sevilla, Spain
description: This large green space is in the southern part of the city and runs along the bank of the Guadalquivir River. It is full of exotic trees, historic structures, Moorish fountains, orange trees, palms, flower beds, ponds, a round-about and artistically created benches.

name: Basilica de la Macarena
description: This magnificent cathedral is located in the historical neighborhood of Macarena just north of the city center. The cathedral is best known as home to “The Virgin of Hope” or Nuestra Senora de la Esperanza also called La Macarena.

name: Archivo de Indias
address: Avenida de la Constitucion, 3 (Edificio de la Lonja), 41071 Seville, Seville, Spain
description: The General Archive of the Indies is located in Seville’s ancient merchants’ exchange the Casa Lonja de Mercaderes. Here precious archives are kept relating to the history of the Spanish Empire both in the Americas and in the Philippines.

name: Museo del Baile Flamenco
address: Calle Manuel Rojas Marcos, 3, 41004 Seville, Seville, Spain
description: The Museum of Flamenco Dance is a museum as well as a performance venue. There are daily flamenco shows in the central patio of the museum. The flamenco museum uses advanced technology and interactive displays to cover the origins and evolution of flamenco dancing.

name: Torre del Oro
address: Paseo de Cristobal Colon, 41001 Seville, Spain
description: The Tower of Gold is a landmark structure which got its name from the golden reflection it has in the adjacent river. Another tale tells of the golden tower originally being covered with golden tiles.

name: Plaza de América
address: Plaza America, 3, Parque Maria Luisa, 41013 Seville, Spain
description: This large public square is at the southern end of Maria Luisa Park. The square is flanked by the Museum of Popular Art in a neo-Mudejar building; the Archaeological Museum in a neo-renaissance building and the neo-Gothic Royal Pavilion all magnificent historic buildings.

name: Piazza dei Signori
description: The Lords Square was once the heart of the Scaligeri family's Verona during the Middle Ages. The square is one of the most beautiful in the city; all the historic buildings which surround the space are connected by elegant 14th century arches and logos. The square leads onto the Piazza delle Erbe an historic marketplace.

name: Piazza delle Erbe
description: Verona's Market Square has a history dating back to the ancient Roman era when the space functioned as the forum, a public area for markets, civil events and chariot races.

name: Castelvecchio
description: Verona's historic castle was a product of the Della Scala family dynasty under Cangrande II when he ruled Verona during the Middle Ages. The compact military structure is quite plain and was constructed of red brick in 1356. It is a good example of the Gothic structures built at that time.

name: Verona Cathedral
description: Verona's first cathedral Duomo Santa Maria Maticolare dates back to 380AD when it was consecrated by St. Zeno and stood north of the present site. The building was expanded in the 5th century and we can still see part of the mosaic flooring from these original structures beneath the Church of St. Elena and Canons' Cloisters.

name: Arena di Verona
description: This Roman era amphitheatre located in Piazza Bra; the Arena is one of the world's greatest examples of a complete piece of Roman architecture. The arena was originally built in 30AD outside of the Verona city walls and hosted sports events and theatrical performances.

name: Castel San Pietro
address: Piazzale Castel S. Pietro, 37129 Verona VR, Italy
description: Considered the founding spot of Verona, the green hill on which is perched Castel San Pietro can trace its history back to the 7th century BC.

name: Stockholm Old Town
address: Stockholm Visitor Center, Sergels Torg 5, Stockholm
description: Stockholm Old Town or Gamla Stan is centuries old and the actual heart of Stockholm. While it has been there since the 13th century, many of the buildings seen today are from the 18th and 19th centuries. It has everything that a charming old town would have – cozy houses, warm alleys, cobbled streets, and more.

name: Royal Palace of Stockholm
description: The Royal Palace of Stockholm is considered one of the biggest and most magnificent palaces in all of Europe. It is the official home of the king and queen of Sweden. As mentioned here, it is only the official residence; the palace where they actually stay is the Drottningholm Palace.

name: The Vasa Museum
description: Vasamuseet or the Vasa Museum is a maritime museum and the most popular museums in Scandinavia. It is located on Djurgården Island and was opened to the public in 1990. The museum is owned by the Swedish National Maritime Museums (SNMM).

name: Stockholm City Hall
description: The City Hall or Stadhuset is one of the most important buildings in Stockholm and therefore a very popular tourist attraction. This is the venue of the Nobel Prize Banquet that is held on 10th December annually.

name: ABBA Museum
description: This museum is dedicated to the biggest pop supergroup from Sweden, a name etched in public memory: ABBA. ABBA, comprising Agnetha, Björn, Benny, and Anni-Frid , delivered some of the biggest hits in pop history from 1972 to 1983.

name: Museum of Photography
description: The Swedish Museum of Photography is Sweden’s center for contemporary photography. It is a popular tourist attraction these days and was inaugurated in May 2010. Located at Stadsgarden, Fotografiska has numerous exciting sections that you can explore at leisure.

name: Nobel Museum
description: Do not miss out on a visit to the Nobel Museum in Stockholm. This museum has information and exhibitions relating to the Nobel prize, its founder Alfred Nobel, the Nobel laureates through the years, and their efforts.

name: Stockholm Cathedral
description: Stockholm Cathedral is a medieval cathedral that is the oldest church in Stockholm. It is located in the Gamla Stan section of the city. The cathedral is right next to the Royal Palace and an important and popular tourist attraction in Stockholm.

name: Stortorget
address: Near Kungliga Slottet, Gamla Stan, Stockholm
description: Stortorget, or The Big Square in English, is a public square in Gamla Stan, which is central Stockholm’s old town area.

name: Drottningholm Palace
description: One of the most popular tourist attractions in Stockholm is Drottningholm Palace. Built in the 17th century by architect Nicodemus Tessin the Elder, it showcases a combination of multiple architectural influences. It is the permanent home of the royal family and has been declared by UNESCO to be a World Heritage Site.

name: Museum of Medieval Stockholm
description: The Museum of Medieval Stockholm is a fascinating place that you cannot afford to miss when you are in Stockholm. It has been constructed at the site of a major archaeological excavation that was commissioned in the 1970s – 1978 to 1980 – and incorporates some findings from the digs into its displays.

name: Stockholm National Museum
description: Stockholm National Museum, or Nationalmuseum in Swedish, is one of the most popular tourist attractions in the city. Established in 1792, it is Sweden’s national gallery.

name: Prins Eugens Waldemarsudde
address: Prins Eugens väg 6, Djurgården. Stockholm, Sweden
description: Prins Eugene Waldemarsudde or Cape of Waldemar is a museum on Djurgården in central Stockholm. The building was originally the home of Prince Eugen of Sweden, who was a well-known painter himself.

name: Nordic Museum
description: With a display of more than 500,000 exhibits, the Nordic Museum is the biggest cultural history museum in all of Sweden. The beauty of this museum is the exhibit range – exclusive pieces, daily use items, and more, with individual stories of their own right from the 16th century.

name: Fjallgatan
description: Fjällgatan is a historic neighborhood in Stockholm that is known for its beauty and also the magnificent view it offers. Affectionately called the balcony, the area is high up on the edge of a cliff, which means you get one of the best views of Stockholm city when you are up there.

name: Djurgården
description: The island of Djurgården is located very near central Stockholm. This island is rich in monuments and galleries that reflect the rich history and culture of Sweden. Some of the biggest and most popular attractions in Stockholm are in Djurgården; that is why more than 10 million visitors come here annually.

name: Via San Gregorio Armeno
address: Via San Gregorio Armeno, Naples, Italy
description: Not to be confused with the church San Gregorio Armeno which gives this street its name. This narrow cobbled alley between Via dei Tribunali and Via San Biagio dei Librai is also known as Christmas Alley. On both sides of the alley are artists ‘workshops and stores producing and selling nativity scenes or presepi.

name: Spaccanapoli
address: From Piazza Gesu Nuovo - Via Benedetto Croce, Via S. Biagio dei Librai, Via Vicaria Vecchia
description: This street is 6 meters wide and runs for 2km from Piazza Gesu Nuovo where it is called Via Benedetto Croce, changes name to Via S. Biagio dei Librai and continues across Via Duomo becoming Via Vicaria Vecchia going out of the old town.

name: Naples Cathedral
description: The Duomo di Santa Maria Assunta or Duomo di San Gennaro is a medieval cathedral established in the 4th century but the baptistery is the only surviving part of the original structure. The present building is in the Gothic-style and was completed in 1323.

name: Pio Monte della Misericordia
description: This church holds several valuable works of art. Its most famous piece is The Seven Works of Mercy by Caravaggio which hangs above the high altar. The church is also home to work by Carlo Sellitto, Luca Giordano, Battistello Caracciolo and Fabrizio Santafede.

name: National Archaeological Museum
description: This museum is housed in a 17th century house and holds a rich collection of Roman artifacts from Pompeii, Stabiae and Herculaneum as well as an Egyptian collection. The ancient art includes works produced in the Roman era, Greek era and Renaissance era.

name: Piazza del Plebiscito
description: This Naples public square dates back to the 19th century and is named after the plebiscite (referendum) in 1863 which led to Naples joining Unified Italy. The square was planned as a tribute to the Emperor Napoleon by Murat, king of Naples and brother-in-law of Napoleon.

name: Castel Nuovo
address: Via Vittorio Emanuele III, 310, Piazza Municipio, 80133 Napoli, Italy
description: This large medieval New Castle or Maschio Angioino is located opposite the Piazza Municipio and was built in 1279 when the capital of the Kingdom of Naples was Palermo and Naples was the secondary royal residence. Charles I of Naples moved the capital to Naples and had a new castle constructed which was completed in 1279.

name: Royal Palace Naples
description: The Palazzo Reale was constructed under the Spanish rule of King Phillip III around 1600 and went on to be the residence of Charles III of Spain, Austrians, Bourbons and then the Savoy Kings. The palace was initially designed by Domenico Fontana.

name: Pompeii
address: Porta Marina, Piazza Anfiteatro, Piazza Esedra
description: A visit to the iconic UNESCO site of Pompeii from Rome or Naples is a must for most travelers. Visitors come to see the archaeological remains (scavi) left of the Roman city which was covered in lava when Mount Vesuvius erupted in 79AD. Pompeii refers to the archaeological park as well as to the town.

name: Galleria Umberto I
address: Galleria Umberto I, 83, Via San Carlo, 80132 Napoli, Italy, 4 entrances: To the right off Via Toledo as you come from Piazza del Plebiscito, Via Giuseppe Verdi, Via Santa Brigida, and Via San Carlo
description: This shopping center is in a magnificent building with a Latin Cross layout. In fact from aerial views you can see the distinct cross with the dome at the point where the two branches of the cross meet. The longer part of the cross is 138 meters long and the shorter crossbeam is 108 meters long.

name: Mt. Vesuvius
address: Vesuvius National Park, Via Palazzo del Principe, 80044 Ottaviano, NA, Italy
description: Mount Vesuvius is best remembered as the volcano which left Pompeii covered in lava when it erupted in 79AD. It is located just a half hour drive from Naples in the Vesuvius National Park and is usually visited as part of a day trip from either Naples or Rome. A day trip to Mt. Vesuvius can be coupled with a visit to Pompeii.

name: Castel dell Ovo
address: Via Eldorado 3, Passaggio Castel dell'Ovo, 3, 80132 Napoli, Italy
description: The Egg Castle is one of the oldest fortified castles in the world and the oldest castle in Naples. It holds a majestic location overlooking the sea on the former island of Borgo Marinaro which is now a peninsula. A 1st century Roman villa, Castellum Lucullanum predates the castle.

name: San Domenico Maggiore
address: Piazza San Domenico Maggiore, 8A, 80134 Napoli, Italy, entrance to cloister on Vico San Domenico Maggiore
description: San Domenico Maggiore is both the name of a church and of the city square where it is located. The square features an obelisk topped by a statue of San Domenico di Guzman who established the Dominican Order.

name: Teatro di San Carlo
address: Theatre- Via San Carlo 98, 80132, Naples, Italy, MeMus - Piazza del Plebiscito, Piazza Trieste e Trento, Naples, Italy
description: This is a stunningly beautiful theatre connected to the Royal Palace with classic European opulence. It was built in 1737 under King Charles of Bourbon to provide the city with a “modern” theatre with outstanding acoustics and predating Milan’s La Scala.

name: Museum of Contemporary Art
description: MADRE is the name used to refer to this contemporary art museum. It was established by the Donnaregina Foundation for Contemporary Arts as part of the effort to promote culture in the Campania Region.

name: San Lorenzo Maggiore
description: This site is an historic church, a museum and excavated subterranean indoor Roman market beneath the church, Macellum of Naples all at the same location.

name: Cimitero delle Fontanelle
address: Via Fontanelle 80, Naples, Italy, Piazza Fontanelle alla Sanita 154
description: Fontanelle Cemetery is an ancient underground ossuary. In the early 16th century room in the church graveyards was becoming scarce and authorities looked for a solution. They removed the bones in the church graveyards of the deceased from previous years to make room for newly interred bodies.

name: Capodimonte Museum
description: The core of this museum’s collection is made up of the Farnese Collection and the Bourbon Collection. Farnese (1468-1549) became Pope Paul III and cultivated a rich collection of art and antiques.

name: The Old Town
description: The history of La Vieille Ville, Geneva's Old Town, can be traced back 2,000 years. It is where you will find many of Geneva's most interesting attractions and sites like the Barbier-Mueller Museum, the St. Pierre Cathedral, the International Museum of the Reformation, The Art and History Museum and the Tavel Mansion.

name: Jet d'Eau
description: Perhaps the most recognizable landmark in Geneva and the site which features on the city's tourist leaflets. The jet d'Eau is a large fountain which spurts up out of Lake Geneva at the point where the lake empties into Rhone River. It is also one of the tallest fountains in the world.

name: The Flower Clock
description: L'horloge Fleurie is a flower bed designed with the numbers and shapes of a clock, with the mechanical workings of clock hands marking time. The clock mechanism is hidden beneath the ground under the clock face.

name: St. Pierre Cathedral
description: The Prince-Bishop of Geneva established the St. Pierre Cathedral in the 12th century. Archaeological findings beneath the church show evidence of a previous structure dating back to the 4th century, Roman Empire mosaics, an 11th century crypt and three earlier churches.

name: The Reformation Wall
description: The Reformation Wall commemorates the significant events and personalities who were pivotal in the reformist movement. The wall is also called the Reformation Monument and the Mur de la Reformation. Geneva has a strong connection with Protestantism and was the hub of Calvinism in the 16th century.

name: Palais des Nations
description: The Palace of Nations was built specifically to be the headquarters of the League of Nations, between 1929 and 1936, but since 1946 it has been the headquarters of the United Nations. Switzerland only became a member of the UN in 2002.

name: Lake Geneva
description: The city of Geneva is located on the southwest shores of Lake Geneva (Lake Leman) at the point where the lake flows into the Rhone River in the Rhone River Valley. The crescent-shaped lake is the largest natural body of freshwater in Switzerland with a northern shore of 95km and a southern shore of 72km.

name: Leaning Tower of Pisa
description: The iconic Torre pendent di Pisa is a landmark site and the city’s top attractions. The leaning tower is located in Cathedral Square (Square of Miracles) together with three other monument buildings. Construction began in 1173 and continued over the course of 200 years due to interruptions by local wars.

name: Cattedrale Pisa
address: Piazza del Duomo, 11-17, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy
description: This is one of the four monuments on Cathedral Square, the heart of the city and the first place tourists should head to. The magnificent Santa Maria del Fiore Cathedral towers above the Pisa skyline and is a large Gothic structure, the 4th largest in the world.

name: Piazza dei Miracoli
description: The Cathedral Square or Square of Miracles is the religious center of the city and the site of Pisa’s top attraction, the Leaning Tower. The square is surrounded by walls and as you enter you are met with an open green lawn and four monumental white structures.

name: Baptistery
description: The Pisa Baptistery of Saint John (Baptistery di San Giovanni)is one of the buildings on the Piazza dei Miracoli. The present structure replaced an earlier baptistery.

name: Camposanto
address: Piazza del Duomo, 23, 56126 Pisa PI, Italy
description: This monumental cemetery is one of the four top attractions in the Piazza del Duomo or Piazza dei Miracoli (Cathedral square).The monuments in this square together represent the heart of the city’s religious life. The sacred burial ground (Camposanto) was established in 1277 and completed in 1464.

name: Piazza dei Cavalieri
address: Piazza dei Cavalieri, 56126, Pisa, off of Via Dalmazia.
description: This is Pisa’s second main square, it was a political hub in the Middle ages and later became the headquarters of the Order of the Knights of Saint Stephen. Today locals come to the square mainly to attend the adjacent Scuola Normale di Pisa which is part of Pisa University.

name: Santa Maria della Spina
description: This is a small church on the banks of the River Arno dripping with Gothic features like an elaborate wedding cake. The church was originally constructed on the left bank of the river but in 1230 was moved to the right bank where it stands today. The church was painstakingly dismantled and transported across the river.

name: Opera Museum
description: Note: The museum is currently closed for renovation. This is one of several historic buildings around the Piazza del Duomo. It dates back to the 13th century and until the 17th century it was the residence of the canons of the Cathedral when it became Diocesan Seminary at Academy of Fine Arts.

name: Sinopie Museum
description: This museum is conveniently located at the heart of Pisa’s main attractions on Cathedral Square. The building which houses the museum was constructed in 1257 as Spedale Nuovo di Santo Spirito, a hospital to care for pilgrims and sick or abandoned children. The museum is located in one of the renovated wings of the building.

name: Church of São Francisco
address: Rua do Infante Dom Henrique 95, 4050-492 Porto, Portugal
description: Igreja de Sao Francisco is Porto’s most famous church. The Gothic style church has interior baroque decoration although its exterior is Gothic style with a rose window.

name: Porto Cathedral
description: Se Do Porto is a fortress-like cathedral where Prince Henry the Navigator was baptized and King John I and Princess Philippa of Lancaster wed in the 14th century.

name: Clerigos Tower
address: Rua de Sao Filipe de Nery, 4050-546 Porto, Portugal
description: The Clerigos Tower stands beside the Clerigos Church or Church of the Clergymen. The Torre dos Clerigos bell tower was completed in 1763 and the adjacent church were built in the baroque style in 1732-1750 for the Brotherhood of the Clerigos. The tower and church were designed by Italian architect Nicolau Nasoni.

name: Livraria Lello Bookshop
description: Visitors come to this iconic bookstore for the books and also to see the gorgeous building. The store building was designed by Francisco Xavier in the neo-Gothic style. The bookstore was purpose-built and opened in 1881 by the Lello brothers, Jose and Antonio.

name: Church of Santa Clara
description: The Igreja de Santa Clara is truly a masterpiece in rococo and baroque architecture and decoration. The façade may seem plain but in the 17th century the interior of this 15th century church was transformed into a beautiful work of art with intricate woodwork, gilding and stonework.

name: São Bento Train Station
address: Estacao de Sao Bento, Praca Almeida Garrett, 4000-069, Porto, Portugal.
description: Catching a train is not the only reason to visit this station. It is not only a major gateway to city but also a tourist attraction. The station was constructed on the site of a former convent, Convent of Sao Bento de Ave-Maria.

name: Caves Cálem
address: Avenida Diogo Leite 344, Vila Nova de Gaia, 4400-111, Portugal.
description: Calem is just one of the Port wine caves you can visit across the river in Vila Nova de Gaia; it is also one of the most popular.

name: Vila Nova de Gaia
address: Vila Nova de Gaia, Porto, Portugal.
description: Gaia is a city south of Porto on the opposite side of the Douro River; together with 12 other municipalities it makes up the Porto Metropolitan Area. The cities of Porto and Gaia have a shared history in wine making and you can visit the two on one trip. To reach Gaia simply drive or walk across the Dom Luis Bridge.

name: Sea Life Porto
address: 1 Rua Particular do Castelo do Queijo, 4100-379, Porto, Portugal.
description: This is one of Merlin Entertainment’s famous SEA LIFE franchise aquariums and it boasts all the same high standard of experiences and close encounters with marine life. The site has 32 aquariums which are divided into 12 environments including fresh water, tropics and the Atlantic. More than 5,600 aquatic creatures live here.

name: FC Porto Museum
address: Estadio do Dragao, Via Futebol Clube do Porto 10, 4350-415 Porto, Portugal.
description: The Porto Football Club is one of the best in the world and visitors to Porto can take a tour of the team’s home stadium as well as visit a museum focused on FC Porto’s history and achievements. The tour is not for everyone, but if you are an avid football fan then this could be the highlight of your trip.

name: Hallgrímskirkja
description: The Church of Hallgrimur is the Evangelical Lutheran parish church of Reykjavik. Its distinct design has made it a landmark on the Reykjavik skyline but its history is also fascinating. The church is a national monument and dedicated to Hallgrimur Petursson (1614-1674), a religious poet who wrote the Passion Hymns.

name: The Sun Voyager
description: Solfar is an outdoor stainless steel sculpture of a dream boat; a Viking ship; a vessel transporting souls; a tribute to the sun and a solar voyager. It was created by Jon Gunnar Arnason (1931-1989) to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the city in 1990.

name: Geyser Geothermal Area and Strokkur
description: The geothermal area of Haukadalur and the Strokkur geyser are highlights of the Golden Circle tourist route. Here  you can see bubbling mud pits and hot spring water bursting out of the ground. Haukadalur is located in a valley north of Laugarvatn Lake on the slopes of Laugarfjall Hill.

name: Thingvellir National Park
address: Thingvellir National Park, Blaskogabyggo, 801 Selfoss, Iceland
description: The Thingvellir National Park is one of the three major attractions on the Golden Circle tourist route, located about 45km northeast of Reykjavik. The park is a UNESCO site and holds deep historic and cultural significance for the Icelandic people.

name: Silfra
address: Thingvallavatn Lake, Thingvellir National Park, 801 Selfoss, Iceland
description: Silfra is a deep water-filled rift between the subterranean continental plates located on the edge of Thingvallavatn Lake in Thingvellir National Park about 60km from Reykjavik. It is a world-class dive site of overwhelming beauty.

name: National Museum of Iceland
description: Not to be confused with the National Gallery of Iceland, this museum’s permanent exhibition explores the history and heritage of Iceland. It gives insight into the island’s history from settlement days to present day.

name: Skogafoss
description: This waterfall is often included in a tour of the south coast of Iceland. The waterfall is fed by the Skoga River and pours over the cliffs which once formed the edge of the sea.

name: Vik Black Sand Beach
description: Vik i Myrdal can be visited as part of a tour of southern Iceland from Reykjavik. It is the country’s most southerly village and one of the wettest; located about 180km from the capital. Vik is between the Myrdalsjokull glacier and the sea and sits on the Katla volcano which last erupted in 1918.

name: National Gallery of Iceland
description: The focus of this museum’s permanent collection is 19th- 20th century works by Icelandic artists but there are a number of pieces by international artists. The museum’s Icelandic collection is the country’s most treasured collection of this kind. International artists on display include Picasso.

name: Seljalandsfoss
description: Thousands of years ago the sea along the southern coast of Iceland crashed against high cliffs; over the years those cliffs slowly receded and today they stand about 5km from the sea parallel to the coastal road and separating the coastal Lowlands from the Highlands.

name: Gullfoss Waterfall
description: The Gullfoss Waterfall (Icelandic for Golden Falls) is within the small Gullfoss National Park; it is one of three major attractions on the Golden Circle tour route. Gullfoss is actually two waterfalls which each make a spectacular drop at right angles to each other spanning the upper part of the Hvita River.

name: Blue Lagoon
description: As you approach this famous spa you walk along a path through natural black lava formations, then enter a modern facility with pristine change rooms, spa treatments and lockers for your belongings. The colors in the spa building are subdued browns, gray, blue and cream.

name: Arbaer Open-Air Museum
description: This museum is part of the Reykjavik City Museum together with several other sites. The open-air museum was opened in 1957 on the site of a former farm.  20 historic structures were brought together from across the country and arranged around a square forming a small village, town square and farm.

name: Whale Watching
address: Tours leave from Reykjavik Old Harbor, Reykjavik, 101, Iceland
description: Whale watching excursions are offered from Reykjavik Old Harbor; the whale watching season is from May to August. Even in the winter there are companies which will take you out on the regular whale watching route but will warn you that it is very unlikely that you will see the whales.

name: Perlan
description: Perlan (The Pearl) sits above Reykjavik on the Oskjuhlio Hill, its structure has a distinct dome that has become a landmark of the city skyline. Perlan was built in 1991 on the site of hot water storage tanks which have held geothermal warmed water for decades.

name: Northern Lights
address: Reykjavik, Iceland - Away from city lights and cloudy skies.
description: Perhaps one of the most sought after experience for tourists visiting Iceland the Northern Lights or Aurora Borealis are an elusive natural phenomenon of bright colorful lights in the night sky.

name: Vikin Maritime Museum
description: The Maritime Museum is one of several museums run by the Reykjavik City. Fittingly located in a renovated former fish factory in the Old Harbor of Reykjavik this museum focuses on the maritime history of the city.  The museum has five distinct sections each looking at an aspect of Icelandic maritime history.

name: Icelandic Horse Riding
description: The Icelandic or Viking horses are a unique breed; they are short, stocky and good natured horses with lush long manes. Tourists can visit a horse farm not far from Reykjavik for a short ride or even make long horseback excursions. The Icelandic horse is one of the oldest breeds in the world.

name: Jokulsarlon Lagoon
address: Jokulsarlon Lagoon, 781 Höfn í Hornafirði, Iceland
description: The Jokulsarlon Lake is on the edge of the Vatnajokull National Park in southeast Iceland between Hofn and Skaftafell. It can be included in a tour of the south coast. Thousands of years ago the Breioamerkurjokull glacier started to melt and recede away from the Atlantic Ocean leaving the melted water in its wake.

name: Skalholt Church
description: This church is sometimes included in the Golden Circle tour with famous attractions like the Gullfoss waterfall, geyser area and Thingvellir National Park. It can also be included in a tour of the south coast.

name: Volcano House
description: The Volcano House is an informative, entertaining and family friendly place to learn about volcanoes. It is dedicated to this purpose and achieves it with a mineral collection and two documentaries about different volcanoes.

name: Nice Old Town
address: Castle Hill to the east; Sea to the south; Place Garibaldi to the north and Promenade du Paillon to the west
description: This quaint area is one of the highlights of Nice. The area is known for its dynamic atmosphere both night and day. The ideal way to see Nice’s Old Town is to wander through the lanes stopping here and there for a coffee to look at one of the old buildings or stores.

name: Promenade des Anglais
address: Along the coast of the  Bay of Angels from Old Nice to Quai des Etats Unis, the heart of the promenade is where the house numbers are lowest.
description: The Promenade des Anglais or English Promenade in Nice runs along the beachfront of the Bay of Angels and is one of the most important parts of the city. The promenade runs from the airport in the west to Old Nice and the Quai des Etats Unis in the east.

name: Castle Hill-Colline du Chateau
address: Rue des Ponchettes, Rue de Foresta, Montee Montfort, 06300, Nice
description: Castle Hill overlooks the city of Nice and gets its French name Colline du Chateau due to the remains (very few can still be seen) of a castle which once stood here in the early 1700s. It is easily accessible from central Nice and is rated as the top attraction in the city.

name: Nice Cathedral
description: Nice Cathedral otherwise known as Basilique-Cathedrale Sainte-Marie et Sainte-Reparate de Nice was completed in 1699 after 50 years of construction and stands in the Old Town of Nice. This listed Historic Monument was constructed on the site of an earlier 13th century church.

name: Museum of Modern and Contemporary Art
description: The MAMAC building is an attractively shaped structure of a buildings connected on all three floors by glass-covered bridges across the Paillon River.

name: Russian Orthodox Cathedral
address: Avenue Nicolas II (Blvd. Tzarevitch), 06000, Nice, France
description: The Russian Orthodox Cathedral of St. Nicholas seems out of place in Nice with its typical Russian-style onion domes and bright colored exterior décor like St. Basil’s in Moscow. However the Russians have deep roots in the Nice community.

name: Marc Chagall Museum
address: Avenue du Docteur Menard, Cimiez, 06000 Nice
description: This is a National Museum devoted to the work of artist Marc Chagall (1887-1985). The museum was created during Chagall’s lifetime and the artist contributed to the design and concept of the museum, specifically the garden which was designed by Henri Fish.

name: Matisse Museum
address: 164 Avenue des Arènes de Cimiez, 06000 Nice, France
description: The Matisse Museum is situated in the Cimiez neighborhood of Nice, it is close to the Hotel Regina where artist Henri Matisse once lived. Matisse lived in Nice from 1918 to 1954. The building which houses the museum is Villa des Arenes, a 17th century home in the Genoese style.

name: St. Bartholomew's Cathedral
address: Frankfurt Cathedral, Domplatz 14, 60311 Frankfurt am Main, Germany
description: Frankfurt’s Roman Catholic Gothic church is officially known as the Cathedral of Saint Bartholomew (Kaiserdom Sankt Bartholomaus) or Frankfurt Cathedral (Frankfurter Dom). Its impressive 95 meter tower and spire dominate the city skyline, and it is considered the largest religious building in Frankfurt.

name: Römer
description: The Romer, or town hall, is considered one of Frankfurt’s most important historic buildings, named for the central building, Zum Romer which means ‘at the Roman’ – in reference to the Roman settlements which existed in the area before the founding of the city itself.

name: St. Paul's Church
description: Built between 1789 and 1833, Paulskirche (St. Paul’s Church) began as a Lutheran church but went on to become the seat of the first freely elected German parliament. It became a symbol of the German democratic movement, with the first Germany National Assembly inaugurated within the church’s walls in May 1848.

name: Goethe House
address: Großer Hirschgraben 23, 60311 Frankfurt am Main, Germany
description: Located on Grosser Hirschgraben in Frankfurt, Goethehaus (Goethe House) is the place where the German writer and statesman, Johann Wolfgang Goethe, was born and grew up in the mid-1700s.

name: Main Tower
description: Built in the late 1990s, Main Tower is the 4th tallest building in Germany and the only skyscraper in Frankfurt with a public viewing deck. Main Tower soars 56-storeys (5 of them underground) and, when it trademark antenna spire is taken into account, 240 m high.

name: Palmengarten
address: Innenstadt, Siesmayerstraße 61, 60323 Frankfurt am Main, Germany
description: One of the largest botanical gardens in Germany is the Palmengarten in Frankfurt am Main, spread over 22 hectares of land. The gardens were opened to the public in 1871 with private funding by the architect Heinrich Siesmayer.

name: Senckenberg Natural History Museum
description: Naturmuseum Senckenberg is one of Germany’s largest natural history museums, showcasing the evolution of life and biodiversity. Senckenberg is an extremely popular place to visit, with around half a million people walking through its doors each year.

name: Hauptwache
description: Frankfurt’s Baroque Hauptwache (which means Main Guard) was designed by Johann Samhaimer in 1729, and started off by serving as the seat of the city’s defense authorities.

name: Historical Museum
description: Frankfurt’s Historisches Museum (Historical Museum) contains a collection of cultural and historical objects which pertain the city’s history, as well as that of greater Germany. The museum was founded in 1878 and is the oldest of its kind in the city to be financed by the municipality.

name: Frankfurt Zoo
description: Frankfurt’s famous zoo is home to more than 4,500 animals from 500 species, and provides a wonderful spot to visit in the heart of what is otherwise a busy metropolis. The zoo is spread over 11 hectares and serves as both a home to its resident animals and a modern nature and conservation center.

name: Main Square
address: Rynek Glowny, Stare Miasto, Krakow, Poland
description: Main Square or Main Market Square is like the epicenter of Krakow and one place that every tourist has to visit when he visits Krakow. It was designed in 1257 and has remained more or less the same since then in terms of the layout and structure.

name: St. Mary's Basilica
description: St. Mary’s Basilica in Krakow, also known as the Church of Our Lady Assumed into Heaven, is located next to the Old Town district’s famous Main Market Square. The church was first constructed in the 13th century and was later rebuilt in the 14th century.

name: Cloth Hall
description: The Cloth Hall is easily one of the most well-known attractions in Krakow. Believed to have originated during the Renaissance period, you could call it one of the earliest shopping malls and is located in the main market square that is part of Krakow’s Old Town and has been a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1978.

name: Wawel Castel
description: Wawel Castle is a 3-storeyed Gothic castle in Krakow that was built by Casimir III the Great during his reign between 1333 and 1370, with extensions and modifications being made by successors.

name: Wawel Cathedral and Museum
description: Located right next to Wawel Castle on Wawel Hill, the Wawel Cathedral in Krakow is over 1000 years old and a Polish national sanctuary. A number of Polish monarchs’ coronations have happened here. It is also the place chosen by the Polish royalty over the ages to bury their deceased.

name: Krakow Barbican
address: Basztowa Street, Old Town, 30-547 Krakow, Poland
description: There are a range of different attractions to check out when you visit Krakow, one of that is different and interesting is the Kraków Barbican. The Kraków Barbican is a fortified outpost that was once that was built towards the end of the 14th century, around 1498.

name: Jewish District
address: Jewish District, Kazimierz, Szeroka 24, Krakow 30-527, Poland
description: The Jewish District, commonly known as Kazimierz, is one of the most interesting districts of Krakow and has associated with it a wealth of history and culture. It was the epicenter of all things Jewish in Krakow till the German invasion during World War II.

name: Rynek Underground
description: The Rynek Underground museum is a hi-tech museum that was opened to the public in September 2010. Work on the museum started in 2009 after an excavation in 2005 led to the discovery of tunnels beneath the Main Market Square of Krakow’s Old Town district.

name: Oskar Schindler's Factory
description: One of the most moving and also very popular attractions in Krakow is Oskar Schindler’s Factory. This factory is today a modern museum that showcases the myriad experience that Krakow had under Nazi occupation during World War II and is a branch of the Historical Museum of the City of Krakow.

name: Galicia Jewish Museum
description: The Galicia Jewish Museum is a memorial museum that was created to commemorate the sufferings of the Jews in Poland right up to the Holocaust. It is also a celebration of the cultures and traditions of the Jewish community in Poland, especially the region of Galicia in what was earlier the Austro-Hungarian region.

name: Auschwitz-Birkenau
description: One of the most heart-rending aspects of World War II was the slaughter of millions of Jews in the Nazi concentration camps.

name: Planty Park
description: Planty Park is one of the biggest parks in Krakow. It is so big that it is spread across 52 acres and completely circles the Old Town district of Krakow and comprises 30 gardens and lots of flowerbeds and lawns, along with beautiful sculptures.

name: Old Synagogue
description: The Old Synagogue in Krakow’s Kazimierz district is the oldest surviving synagogue in Poland and ranks among some of the oldest synagogues in all of Europe. Originally built in the 15th century, it was reconstructed and given a Renaissance-style makeover after it was caught in a fire in 1557.

name: Wieliczka Salt Mine
address: Wieliczka Salt Mine, Tourist Route ul. Daniłowicza 10, 32-020 Wieliczka, Poland
description: With more than a million visitors a year, the Wieliczka Salt Mine is one of the most popular attractions in all of Poland. It has within it 12 objects that feature on the World Cultural and Natural Heritage list of the UNESCO.

name: Town Hall Tower
description: The Town Hall Tower in Krakow is a huge Gothic tower that was constructed towards the end of the 13th century. This tower is unique because it leans ever so slightly – 55 centimeters – and is made of brick and stone.

name: Collegium Maius
description: The Collegium Maius or Grand College is the oldest building of Jagiellonian University, which itself is more than 650 years old and located in the Old Town area of Krakow. Collegium Maius was built just 36 years after Jagiellonian University was founded.

name: National Museum
description: The National Museum in Krakow is the first national museum in Poland and the largest museum that was open to the Polish people. It was established through a resolution passed by the Krakow City Council on 7th October, 1879. Over the years it has won numerous awards from reputed organizations in prestigious competitions.

name: Kosciuszko Mound
description: The Kosciuszko Mound was built to commemorate the renowned national leader of Poland, Tadeusz Kosciuszko.

name: Remuh Synagogue and Cemetery
description: The Remuh Synagogue is located in the Kazimierz district of Krakow and has the Old Jewish Cemetery, also called Remuh Cemetery, right next to it. It is the smallest active synagogue in Krakow and was built by the family of Rabbi Moses Isserles, a famous Polish rabbi, in 1553.

name: Sanctuary of Divine Mercy
address: Sanktuarium Bozego Milosierdzia, ul. Siostry Faustyny 3, 30-608 Krakow, Poland
description: The Sanctuary of Divine Mercy is a fascinating attraction in the Lagiewniki District of Krakow that draws millions of worshippers and visitors annually.

name: Piazza Maggiore
description: Tourists arriving in Bologna usually head first for this picturesque and historic public square and find themselves passing here several times on their stay in the city. Piazza Maggiore (Major Square) is bordered by the 5th largest cathedral in the world as well as ornate renaissance palaces.

name: Fontana di Nettuno
address: Piazza del Nettuna adjacent to Piazza Maggiore
description: Neptune’s Fountain can be seen in the middle of Piazza del Nettuno, adjacent to Piazza Maggiore it is one of the city’s recognizable landmarks. Flemish artist Giovanni da Bologna (Giambologna) created the fountain and its statues over the course of three years from 1563 to 1566.

name: Basilica di San Petronio
description: This church was named in honor of the city’s patron saint, St. Petronio and is Bologna’s main church it also holds the saint’s relics. Construction was begun in 1390 according to the designs of Antonio di Vincenzo. Later plans were proposed by Arduino degli Arriguzzi that would make the church larger than St.

name: Basilica di Santo Stefano
description: Saint Stephan’s Basilica is part of a religious complex which encompasses seven buildings and is also called the “Complex of Seven Churches.” The church faces onto Piazza Santo Stefano and was traditionally built by Saint Petronio, the patron saint of Bologna in the 5th century over the site of an earlier Roman temple.

name: Museo della Storia di Bologna
address: Palazzo Pepoli, Via Castiglione 8, Bologna, Italy
description: This museum takes you through the history and culture of Bologna introducing you to the leading historical figures from the city and the major events which changed the course of the city’s history. In the entrance area there is a 1:1 scale copy (the original is in the Vatican) of the 1575 Great Map of Bologna fresco.

name: Roman Bridge
description: Puente Romano crosses the Guadalquivir River, it originated in the 1st century AD but has been rebuilt several times since then. The Roman Bridge would have been part of the Augusta route which connected Roma to Cadiz.

name: Mezquita Catedral de Córdoba
description: In the Mosque Cathedral or Cathedral of St. Mary of the Assumption of Cordoba we can trace many of the significant changes that have occurred in Cordoba’s religious history. The majority of the art and architecture we see today comes from the 8th century Islamic architects of the former mosque.

name: Calleja de las Flores
address: Calleja de las Flores, 14003 Cordoba, Spain; off Calle Victor Bosco and Calle Blanco Belmonte.
description: This quaint alley way is located in the Jewish Quarter of Cordoba, in front of the northern façade of the Mosque and leads into a small plaza. From the plaza there are great views of the Cathedral tower.

name: Alcázar de los Reyes Cristianos
address: Calle de las Caballerizas Reales, s/n 14004 Cordoba, Spain
description: The ancient fortress of Alcazar of the Christian Monarchs or Alcazar of Cordoba served as the court of royals for 160 years following its constructed by Alfonso XI in 1328. The complex stands on the site on an earlier 8th century caliphate residence and still retains elements of the Moorish remains.

name: Historical Center of Cordoba
address: Boundaries of the historical center: the River Guadalquivir to the south (including Roman Bridge and Calahorra Tower); Calle San Fernando to the east; the commercial center to the north; to the west including Alcazar and San Basilio district.
description: Cordoba’s “golden years” began in the 8th century after the Moors had conquered the city and established about 300 mosques, palaces and public buildings. They built intricately designed and decorated structures to rival even those of Constantinople and Damascus.

name: Roman temple of Cordoba
description: In the 1950s the remains of a Roman temple were discovered in Cordoba during a building project undertaken on the city Hall. The temple stands where today’s Claudio Mercelo and Capitulares streets meet.

name: Los Patios del Alcazar Viejo
address: Route starts at Calle San Basilio 14, Cordoba, Spain.
description: The Alcazar Viejo neighborhood, also known as San Basilio is famous for its beautiful patios. It is possible to take an organized walking tour of the various patios in this area or to go exploring them yourselves.

name: Alhambra
address: Calle Real de la Alhambra, s/n, 18009 Granada, Spain
description: Among all the attractions in Granada, one that stands out is the Alhambra. It is an imposing fortress with palaces in it on top of a hill and spread across 140,000 square meters. This amazing structure is divided into 3 parts: the Nazrid palaces, the battlements or Alcazaba, and the gardens or Generalife.

name: Generalife
description: The name Generalife means garden of the architect. This palace was the summer palace and country estate of the Nasrid Emirs. The palace and gardens were built during the 13th century.

name: Granada Cathedral
description: Built in the heart of the city, Granada Cathedral is one of the best examples of Spanish style Renaissance architecture. The cathedral was built in 1523 by Queen Isabella at the site where the Main Mosque was. This was after they had captured Granada from the Nasrid rulers.

name: Alcaiceria
description: Alcaicería is the place to come to for the experience of an Arabic market right in the middle of Europe. The term Alcaicería translates to ‘House of Caesar’; it originated from the fact that the permission the Arabic traders got for opening the market was from Emperor Justinian.

name: Royal Chapel of Granada
address: Calle Cárcel Baja, 19, 18001 Granada, Granada, Spain
description: The Capilla Real, or the Royal Chapel, is built side by side to the Granada Cathedral and both have an immense slice of history attached to them. They were both constructed at a site that original housed the Main Mosque.

name: Albayzin
address: Camino Viejo del Fargue, 18010 Granada, Granada, Spain
description: There are many attractions to explore in Granada, and one you should not miss is Albaicín. Declared a World Heritage Site in 1984, Albaicín translates to ‘quarter of the falconers’ and is called the Moorish Quarter. The first Siri court was constructed right here in the 11th century.

name: Sacromonte
description: One of the most scenic neighborhoods in Granada is the Sacromonte neighborhood. This is an area with multiple geographical elements, including meadows, rivers, and mountain views. The area is multi-ethnic as well: there are Spaniards, of course, and then there are gypsies, Jews, and Arabs too.

name: Al Ándalus Arab Baths
description: There are a number of exciting attractions in Granada. Baños Arabes are some of the Arab style baths that you find quite a bit in Granada. These come with history attached to them and are today managed by professionals.

name: Plaza Nueva
description: Contrary to what the name suggests, Plaza Nueva is one of the oldest squares in Granada. The plaza runs along the Daro River with fantastic views on both sides. Originally the square was constructed to cover up the Daro River itself; the river flows under it now as well.

name: Sierra Nevada National Park
description: The Sierra Nevada National Park or Parque Nacional de Sierra Nevada is a national park in Spain’s south-east, between the Almeria and Granada provinces. Covering an area of 85,883 hectares, it is Spain’s largest national park.

name: Chapel Bridge
description: Chapel Bridge is one of the town’s most recognizable landmarks. It is a covered wooden pedestrian bridge which crosses the Reuss River diagonally connecting the Old Tower on the right bank with the new town on the left and spanning 170 meters.

name: Old Town
description: Lucerne’s Altstadt is one of the most beautiful in Europe. You can explore the Old Town on foot meandering through the quaint pedestrian-only streets and stopping in the Old Town squares. The Old town boasts some wonderful hotels, restaurants and stores.

name: Lake Lucerne
address: Schifffahrtsgesellschaft des Vierwaldstattersees, Werftestrasse 5, 6005, Luzern, Switzerland.
description: Lake Luzern (Lucerne or Vierwaldstattersee or Lac des Quatre-Cantons) is the jewel in the crown of the city of Lucerne. It is the 4th largest lake in Switzerland which twists and turns so that it possible to refer to its different sections and branches individually.

name: Mount Pilatus
address: PILATUS-BAHNEN AG Schlossweg 1, Kriens, Lucerne 6010, Switzerland. (Pilatus Cogwheel Railway: Alpachstad-Kulm; Panoramic Gondola: Kriens-via the Krienseregg-Frakmuntegg)
description: Mt. Pilatus overlooks Lucerne; it is a picture-perfect Swiss mountain with several summits including the highest peak, Tomlishorn 2,128 meters above sea level; Oberhaupt, which is off-limits to tourists as it holds weather stations and a military radar system plus the Esel peak (2,119m).

name: Swiss Museum of Transport
description: This is one of the most popular attractions in Switzerland; the museum explores the history of transport and mobility through interactive exhibits and real vehicles, planes, helicopters, motorbikes, train cars, train engines, boats and more. All forms of transport and communication are covered.

name: Jesuit Church
description: The Lucerne Jesuit Church is the largest baroque church north of the Alps. The church was built as a response by the Catholics in Lucerne to the Swiss Reformation.

name: Nature Museum
address: Natur-Museum Luzern, Kasernenplatz 6, CH - 6003, Luzern, Switzerland.
description: The Nature Museum of Lucerne is the only Swiss museum dedicated only to natural history. The museum dates back to the 18th century and displays riveting and informative displays about animals and plants from Central Switzerland.

name: Mount Rigi
address: Mount Rigi Switzerland. (Information Desk: Bahnhofstrasse 7, Postfach, CH-6354 Vitznau)
description: The locals refer to Mount Rigi as the Queen of the Mountains because it is the perfect mount for recreation all year round. The mount is located on the edge of the Pre-Alps between Lake Lucerne, Lake Lauerz and Lake Zug. It appears to be a free standing mountain and is visible from all parts of the valley.

name: Richard Wagner Museum
description: The former home of German composure and musician Richard Wagner has been converted into a museum and now displays a collection of his works. Wagner and his second wife, Cosima lived with their children in this beautiful house situated on a headland projecting onto Lake Lucerne from 1866 to 1872.

name: Oslo Opera House
description: The Oslo Opera House is located in Oslo’s Bjørvika neighborhood at the head of the Oslo Fjord. This impressive structure has a grand 1,100 rooms and is the home of the Norwegian National Opera and Ballet and the National Opera Theater.

name: Viking Ship Museum
description: Vikingskipshuset or the Viking Ship Museum is a popular tourist attraction located in Bygdøy.  The museum’s exhibits are focused primarily on historic implements and artifacts taken from the archaeological finds at Tune, Gokstad, and Oseberg. The museum itself is part of the University of Oslo’s Museum of Cultural History.

name: Royal Palace
description: The Royal Palace of Oslo is a monument that has served as the official residence of Norway’s King Oscar I. It is also the official residence of the country’s current ruler, King Harald V. It was built in the 19th century, with work on the palace completed in 1849.

name: Fram Museum
description: Fram Museet or Fram Museum is an attraction dedicated to the Norwegian polar exploration. It was built in May 1936 in honor of three famous Norwegian polar explorers: Fridtjof Nansen, Roald Amundsen, and Otto Svedrup.

name: City Hall
description: Rådhuset, the City Hall of Oslo is a popular attraction among visitors and an important landmark for the local people of the city. The building is made of concrete and has a brick face, giving it an imposing and grand look, with 2 towers, one of which has a beautiful clock face.

name: Oslo Cathedral
description: Oslo Domkirke or the Oslo Cathedral is one of the most significant historical and cultural landmarks in Oslo. It is located at Stortorvet Square and dates back to the 17th century. Work on the structure began in 1694, and continued until 1697 when it was consecrated and unveiled to the public.

name: Vigeland Museum
description: The Vigeland Museum is an Oslo attraction specifically focused on the life and works of Gustav Vigeland. Situated just south of Vigeland Park, the museum is located in the apartment that served as artist’s studio and home from 1924 until his death in 1943.

name: Nobel Peace Center
description: Nobels Fredssenter or the Nobel Peace Center is a museum dedicated to the Nobel Peace Prize. Situated close to the City Hall in the heart of Oslo, the museum was inaugurated on June 11, 2005 by King Harald V. It was later redesigned by British architect David Adjaye, who retained the old wooden structure behind the new walls.

name: Astrup Fearnley Museum of Modern Art
description: Astrup Fearnley Museet is a museum of contemporary art in Oslo that was established in 1993. Today it is a critical cog in the art institution scene of Norway’s capital. The museum was designed by Renzo Piano, one of the most well-known architects in the world.

name: Aker Brygge
description: Aker Brygge is a cool neighborhood in Oslo that is popular not only among tourists but also locals for the wide variety it presents in terms of shopping, dining, and entertainment on the whole.

name: Vigeland Sculpture Park
description: The Vigeland Sculpture Park in Kirkeveien, Oslo, is hugely popular and the largest sculpture park created by a single artist in the world. It contains the works of Gustav Vigeland and was opened in 1947.

name: Kon-tiki Museum
description: The Kon-Tiki Museet in Oslo’s Bygdøy peninsula was built in commemoration of Thor Heyerdahl’s epic expedition across the Pacific Ocean in 1947. Named after the balsawood raft used in his journey, the museum started out in 1950 as a small wooden building.

name: Oslo Fjord
description: The Oslo Fjord is one of the most popular tourist attractions in Oslo. Located just off the mainland, the fjord consists of hundreds of small islands, all of which combined stretch to a little over a hundred kilometers long.

name: The National Gallery
description: The National Gallery of Oslo is one of the most important attractions in Norway. Immensely popular among tourists as well as locals, the museum contains the single biggest collection of Norwegian art from the Romantic Era. It was founded in 1837, and is currently a part of the National Museum of Art, Architecture, and Design.

name: Munch Museum
description: When you have a painter of the caliber and fame of Edward Munch it is only natural to have a museum dedicated to his life and works, and that is what Munchmuset or Munch Museum is.  It is located in Tøyen and was opened to the public in 1963.

name: National Museum of Contemporary Art
description: The Museum of Contemporary Art in Oslo has been a part of Norway’s National Museum of Art, Architecture, and Design since 2003. It was opened in 1999, and features a remarkably diverse array of exhibits with more than 5,000 individual pieces on display.

name: Historical Museum
description: The Museum of Cultural History in Oslo is one of the biggest cultural history museums in Norway. It is located on the Bygdøy Peninsula and includes the Historical Museum and also the Viking Ship Museum.

name: Alcazaba
description: The Alcabaza of Malaga is an 11th century citadel built by the Hammudid dynasty. It is built on a hill positioned at the center of Malaga and commands grand views of the port.

name: Gibralfaro Castle
description: The castle of Gibralfaro is located on a high hill overlooking the city, commanding spectacular views of the area. The Castillo was originally built by Abd ar-Rahman I, the Cordoban emir of the 8th century.  In the 14th century, it was expanded by the Sultan of Granada, Yusef I, with double walls added.

name: Málaga Cathedral
address: Cathedral of Málaga, Calle Molina Lario, 9, 29015 Málaga, Málaga, Spain
description: Built between 1528 and 1782, the Malaga Cathedral towers 276 feet high – the second highest cathedral in Andalusia. This Roman Catholic temple of worship was constructed on top of an old mosque following orders of the King after the Christian armies conquered Arab territory in the late 1400s.

name: Picasso Museum
address: Calle San Agustín, 8-10, 29015 Málaga, Málaga, Spain
description: One of the world’s most famous artists, Pablo Picasso was born in Malaga, Spain in 1881 and a museum was created to display his paintings, based on Picasso’s own desire to see his work presented in his birth-city.

name: Roman Theatre
description: Considered the oldest monument in Malaga, the Roman Theater (el Teatro Romano) was built under the rule of Emperor Augustus in the first century BC and was in operation until the third century AD.

name: Centre Pompidou Malaga
address: Pasaje Doctor Carrillo Casaux, s/n Muelle Uno, Puerto de Málaga
description: The first offshoot of the famous Parisian 20th century art museum, Centre Pompidou outside of France is the Pompidou Center in Malaga, Spain.

name: Glass Museum
address: Plazuela Santísimo Cristo de la Sangre 2, Málaga 29012
description: Considered one of Malaga’s hidden jewels, the Glass and Crystal Museum opened up in 2009 in an 18th century palacio in the city’s center. This museum is home to around 3000 pieces spanning multiple centuries, from ancient Egyptian times to the 20th century.

name: Malagueta Beach
address: Paseo Marítimo Pablo Ruíz Picasso, s/n, 29016 Málaga, Spain
description: Playa e la Malagueta (Malagueta Beach) runs along Malaga’s Levante breakwater of the city’s port. This sandy spot is very near the city center and stretches for over 2.5 kilometers. At 60 meters wide, the beach is a popular spot for locals and tourists, who spend many sunny days of the year swimming or sunbathing.

name: Plaza de Toros
description: Malaga’s Plaza de Toros (bullring) is known as La Malagueta, located in the city’s eastern district. This ring, designed by the architect Joaquin Rucoba, was built in 1874 and the first event was held a couple of years later.

name: Automobile Museum
address: Av de Sor Teresa Prat, 15, 29003 Málaga, Spain
description: Malaga’s Automobile Museum is located in the stunning Fabrica de Tabacos (tobacco factory) building which was constructed in 1927.

name: Walls of Dubrovnik
description: The Walls of Dubrovnik are some of the most important features in a city which definitely has no shortage of historically significant attractions. The walls have been standing ever since the city was founded, which dates them back to pre-7th century.

name: Pile Gate
address: Ul. Vrata od Pila, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia
description: Pile Gate serves as the main entry point into Dubrovnik, and it is where most every local tour of the city starts off. Considered the city’s transport hub, the gate was constructed on the western wall in 1537 in order to provide secure entry to the city’s defenders fighting against foreign invaders.

name: Dubrovnik Cathedral
description: Also known as the Cathedral of the Assumption of the Virgin, Dubrovnik Cathedral is a popular Dubrovnik attraction that dates back to the 6th or 7th century, according to varying accounts.

name: Orlando’s Column
description: Orlando’s Column is recognized as Dubrovnik’s oldest preserved public sculpture. Carved out of stone, this impressive column is located under the City Bell Tower on Luza Square and is carved by Antun Dubrovcanin in 1418.

name: Rector's Palace
description: The Rector’s Palace at Dubrovnik is a Gothic-style structure built sometime during the 14th century. Over the years, renovation and restoration work performed on the building resulted in the incorporation of Renaissance and Baroque architectural styles.

name: St. Blaise Church
description: Dedicated to Dubrovnik’s patron saint, St. Blaise Church was originally built in the Romanesque style in the 14th century. After incurring extensive damage during the Great Earthquake of 1667, the church was rebuilt in the Baroque style in the 18th century. The work took place over a period of eight years, from 1706 to 1714.

name: Franciscan Monastery
description: Belonging to the Order of the Friars Minor, the Franciscan Church and Monastery is a large religious complex located at the Placa on Dubrovnik’s main street. Construction on the church started in the 13th century, with a new phase of construction undertaken in the 14th century.

name: Dubrovnik Cable Car
address: Ul. kralja Petra Krešimira IV 10A, 20000, Dubrovnik, Croatia
description: Dubrovnik is a picturesque city that offers a wealth of stunning attractions and numerous points of visual interest, and there is no better way to enjoy them all than by via cable car.

name: Fort Lovrijenac
address: Skalini dr. Marka Foteza, Dubrovnik, Croatia
description: Fort Lovrijenac is one of the most recognizable landmarks in the coastal city of Dubrovnik. Located atop a 37 meter high rock face directly overlooking the sea, the fort is also a historically important landmark due to the critical role it played in the city’s past.

name: Lokrum Island
description: Lokrum is a must-see destination for anyone who visits Dubrovnik. Located just over half a kilometer out to sea from Dubrovnik, Lokrum is a small, picturesque island on the Adriatic Sea. The island boasts of a rich and colorful history, having at one time served as the holiday home of Maximilian, the Archduke of Austria.

name: Trsteno Arboretum
description: Located a mere 24 kilometers away from Dubrovnik in Trsteno, the Trsteno Arboretum is an amazing attraction that you cannot afford to miss. It is the oldest arboretum in Croatia. It was set up towards the end of the 15th century by the House of Gozze, a local family of nobility, as its summer residence.

name: Sponza Palace
description: Also known as Divona, the Sponza Palace is an impressive palace from the 16th century in Dubrovnik. The palace gets its name from ‘spongia’, which is Latin for the place where rain water collects.

name: Mljet Island
description: Mljet Island is a very beautiful natural attraction that many say is the best wooded island of the entire Adriatic region. This island became a part of the Republic of Dubrovnik back in 1345 and, after changing hands a few times, was part of Croatia in 1991.

name: Old Town
description: One of the most popular and also the easiest of places to locate in Dubrovnik is the city’s Old Town. The size of this location is small, which makes it ideal to explore it on foot at your leisure.

name: Elaphiti Islands
description: The Elaphiti Islands–also known simply as the Elaphites–is a popular tourist destination located northwest of Dubrovnik. Technically an archipelago, the islands cover a land area of approximately 30 square kilometers, large parts of which remain green throughout the year.

name: Maritime Museum
description: The Maritime Museum is one of the important museums of Dubrovnik that is worth visiting. The museum was founded in 1949 by the Yugoslav – now Croatian – Academy of Sciences and Arts. It has occupied the first and second floors of St. John’s Fort since 1952.

name: Korcula Island
description: The island of Korcula is considered by many to be one of the most beautiful in the Adriatic region, and it is easy to see why.

name: Torres de Serranos
description: Spain’s third largest city, Valencia, is also a thriving tourist destination. The port city boasts of a rich heritage which is why thousands of visitors throng the city every year. Some of the major attractions include landmarks like the Torres de Serranos or Serranos Towers, just south of Turia Gardens.

name: Central Market
address: Plaça de la Ciutat de Bruges, s/n, 46001 València
description: In Valencia you can experience the eating habits and preferences of Spanish people, up close. For this, you ought to head to the amazing central market locally referred to as Mercado Central.

name: City of Arts and Sciences
address: Av. del Professor López Piñero, 7, 46013 València
description: On a visit to Valencia you cannot miss exploring the magnificent City of Arts and Sciences even if you miss a few other places. Set up on the former Turia River bed, the City of Arts and Sciences is comprised of six areas. Its construction started in 1996 and designed by ace architect Santiago Calatrava.

name: Ceramics Museum
description: The National Museum of Ceramics and Decorative Arts in Valencia deserves a special mention when compared with the city’s other great museums. It is evident from the name that the museum showcases ceramics including Valencian ceramics, along with artifacts made of porcelains and decorative arts.

name: Valencia Bullring
description: The common belief is that if you haven’t been to a bullfighting arena in Spain then you haven’t really experienced true Spanish culture at all. Plaza de Toros de Valencia or the Valencia Bullring is just the place to experience this culture.

name: Turia Gardens
address: Avenida Manuel de Falla, s/n, 46018 Valencia, Spain
description: Valencia is blessed by Mother Nature in several ways and boasts of massive greenbelts that include Turia Gardens or Jardines del Turia. It is one of Spain’s largest urban parks formed after the Turia River overflowed in 1957 and the waters were diverted south of the city.

name: Museum of the History of Valencia
description: The Museum of the History of Valencia or Museo De Historia De Valencia is a multi faceted museum built in 1850 by progressive Spanish urban planner Ildefonso Cerdá, and Leodegario Marchessaux. The building was designed by Calixto Santa Cruz and was commissioned in 2001.

name: Albufera Nature Park
description: While a lot of tourists visit the historic city of Valencia in Spain to explore its grandiose citadels and amazing museums, it has much more in store. Nature lovers and outdoor enthusiasts also have much to look forward to on a visit to this port city.

name: Grosse Cloche de Bordeaux
address: Rue Saint-James, near Cours Victor Hugo, Bordeaux, France
description: This famous bell was a 15th century addition to the remains of the 13th century Porte Saint-Eloi. It was also called Gate of St. James as many pilgrims passed through here following the St. James’ Way on route to  Santiago de Compostela. The bell would be rung to warn residents of fires, foreign attacks or important events.

name: Monument aux Girondins
description: This beautiful monument commemorates the Girondists who were originally a political party within the first National Convention from 1791 to 1795 of the new French Republic. Most of the Girondists were from Bordeaux.

name: Pont de Pierre
address: From left bank Cours Victor Hugo to right bank Quai Deschamps by Stalingrad station.
description: Bordeaux’s stone bridge connects the historic city center on the left bank of the Garonne River to La Bastide on the right bank. It was commissioned by Napoleon but only inaugurated during the Bourbon Restoration in 1822. It was the first bridge to span the river in Bordeaux.

name: Grand Théâtre Bordeaux
address: Place de la Comedie, 33025 Bordeaux, France
description: The theatre is also called Victor Louis’ Palace after the designer who also created the Palais Royal and Theatre Francais in Paris. The grand, elegant landmark is considered one of the most beautiful in Europe. It was designed during the reign of Louis XVI and the first plans were laid out in 1773; it was opened in 1780.

name: Cathédrale Saint-André
address: 66 Rue Trios Conils, Place Pey-Berland, 33000 Bordeaux, France
description: The Cathedral of St. Andrew is a Gothic-Romanesque church which was one of the stops along the Way of St. James; a pilgrimage route through northern Spain to Santiago de Compostela. The church is part of Bordeaux’s UNESCO area. Construction began in the 11th century but from the start the structure was beset with problems.

name: Bar a Vin de la Maison
description: Bar a Vin simply means Wine Bar so be careful not to confuse this one with the many other wine bars in Bordeaux as this one is special! This wine bar is situated in the Maison du Vin de Bordeaux which houses the Conseil Interprofessionnel du Vin de Bordeaux (CIVB).

name: Chateau Pape-Clement
address: 216 Avenue Docteur Nancel Penard, 33600 Pessac, France
description: This Bordeaux winery is located in Pessac just a few kilometers southwest of Bordeaux city. This is the oldest wine estate in Bordeaux and dates back to 1300. The wine estate was given as a gift to Bertrand de Goth, future Pope Clement V, on his appointment as Archbishop of Bordeaux.

name: Musée du Vin et du Négoce
address: Cellier des Chartrons, 41 Rue Borie, 33000 Bordeaux, France
description: At this site you can tour the wine cellars of Cellier des Chartrons and see historical artifacts and illustrations to help you understand the Bordeaux wine trade, viniculture and winemaking. The tour ends with a wine tasting session.

name: Senate Square
description: Senate Square or Senaatintori is part of the oldest section of Helsinki. The Square and its immediate vicinity is the site of many of the city's most important historical and cultural landmarks.

name: Market Square
description: Market Square is one of eight market squares in Helsinki. Also known as Helsinki Market, it is the largest market in the city along with Hakaniemi Market Square. These two markets represent the food and produce hub of Helsinki, with the main market square being an especially popular attraction among tourists.

name: Helsinki Cathedral
description: Helsinki Cathedral is a religious structure and tourist attraction that stands over Market Square. Commonly referred to as the Lutheran Cathedral, the cathedral was known as St. Nicholas Church and Great Cathedral at various points in its history.

name: Ateneum
