description: Ateneum is one of the most famous art museums in Finland, and the center of Finnish art. The museum serves as a storehouse for images that encapsulate the collective memory of the people of the country.

name: Finnish National Museum
description: The Finnish National Museum is one of the most important museums in Finland. It was designed by a team comprised of Herman Gesellius, Armas Lindgren and Eliel Saarinen, who in 1902 won the contract to build the museum after an architectural competition.

name: Suomenlinna Island
description: Suomenlinna Island is a popular Finnish attraction that is visited by as many as 900,000 people every year. Its main feature is a fortress known as the Castle of Finland, which technically isn't really a castle.

name: Parliament House
description: Eduskuntatalo is the assembly house of the Finnish parliament. Located near the Helsinki post office, the building dates back to 1931 and is distinguished by its pink granite exterior. The interior of the building is dominated by a large domed hall, where the 200-member parliament holds its meetings.

name: Kiasma
description: Kiasma is the contemporary art museum of Finland. It was constructed over a period of five years from 1993 to 1998, and is located on Helsinki’s Mannerheimintie Street. The name “Kiasma” is derived from the Finnish word for chiasma, which is defined as “an anatomical intersection or decussation”.

name: Helsinki Zoo
description: Helsinki Zoo is an island zoo that is the only one of its kind in the country. With a collection that includes more than 150 types of animals and nearly a thousand different plant species, the zoo is a popular attraction that draws local residents and tourists by the thousands every year.

name: Design Museum
description: Design Museum is a specialist museum devoted entirely to the various facets of design in Finland. The country has a rich and colorful design heritage, and this is perfectly exemplified by the museum’s diverse collections and the building itself.

name: Olympic Stadium
description: Helsinki's Olympic Stadium was built in 1938 and was designed by Yrjö Lindegren and Toivo Jäntti in the functionalistic style. The site of the 1952 Summer Olympic Games, the stadium continues to be an important Finnish national landmark, not only with regard to sporting events, but to cultural and musical events as well.

name: Seurasaari
description: Seurasaari is an open-air museum located on a verdant island located just a short distance away from Helsinki's city center.

name: Finlandia Hall
description: Finlandia Hall is a multipurpose venue that is used for holding a wide variety of events wherein accessibility, tranquility, and world-class facilities are primary requirements.

name: Central Park
description: Helsinki's Central Park covers a thousand hectare land area that stretches from Töölönlahti Bay in Haltiala all the way to the northern border of Helsinki, a distance of over ten kilometers. Around the city center, it consists mainly of urban outdoor recreational areas and forested lands.

name: Piazza del Campo
address: Piazza del Campo, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: Also known as ‘il Campo’, the Piazza del Campo is a sloping piazza that has been the heart and soul of the social and civic life of Siena since the middle of the 12th century.

name: Siena Cathedral
description: The Siena Cathedral was designed and constructed between 1215 and 1263 and is a popular tourist attraction in Siena. It i was designed by Nicola Pisano, a master in the Gothic style; his son Giovanni did the plans for the lower half of the façade.

name: Torre del Mangia
address: Piazza del Campo, 1, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Torre del Mangia is an imposing tower located along the Piazza del Campo in Siena. This elegant and imposing tower stands 102 meters tall and is a popular tourist attraction in Siena.

name: Palazzo Pubblico
address: Piazza del Campo, 1, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Palazzo Publico, as the name suggests is a palace in Siena that was built to be the offices of the republican government (the Podesta and the Council of Nine). It was built in 1297 and is located along the Piazza del Campo.

name: Santa Maria della Scala
address: Piazza del Duomo, 3, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: Also called the Hospital, Santa Maria della Scala is today a museum in Siena and one place that tourists like to visit when they are here. It is considered one of the first hospitals in Europe and also one of the oldest surviving hospitals in the world.

name: Battistero di San Giovanni
address: Via di Città, 36, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Battistero di San Giovanni (Baptistry of St. John in English) is an important religious building and popular tourist attraction in Siena, Italy. Built between 1316 and 1325 by Camaino di Crescentino, this beautiful structure has a Gothic façade of which the upper section is incomplete.

name: Pinacoteca Nazionale
address: Via S. Pietro, 46, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Pinacoteca Nazionale was inaugurated in 1932 and is a popular attraction among tourists visiting Siena. It is a national museum that has a significant collection of works of Italian artists from the late Medieval and Renaissance period.

name: Basilica di San Domenico
description: Also known as Basilica Cateriniana San Domenico, the Basilica di San Domenico is an important basilica in the heart of Siena and also a very popular tourist attraction. The church is associated with the veneration of St. Catherine.

name: Piazza del Mercato
description: The Piazza del Mercato is a popular market square in Siena that is favored not just by the visitors but by the local population as well. It is a covered market square that allows people to shop unhindered regardless of whether there is sunshine or rain.

name: Church of San Martino
address: Via del Porrione, 41, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Church of San Martino is located in central Siena and was built in the 12th century. This Roman Catholic Church was later rebuilt and enlarged in size and structure sometime in the 16th century. In the 17th century a Baroque façade was added and then in 1738 a bell tower was added too.

name: Santa Maria dei Servi
address: Via Val di Montone, 4, 53100 Siena SI, Italy
description: The Church of Santa Maria dei Servi is an amazing Roman Catholic Church in the Romanesque style. It stands at what was earlier the Church of San Clement. The first church was completed in the 13th century but there were expansions made till almost the 16th century.

name: Glasgow Cathedral
address: Glasgow Cathedral, Castle Street, Glasgow, G4 0QZ
description: Dating from the period that came before the Scottish Reformation from the late 12th century and onwards, Glasgow Cathedral is an impressive building whose history is intricately linked with the city’s. The cathedral is also known as High Kirk of Glasgow, St. Mungo’s Cathedral or St.

name: Botanic Gardens
address: 730 Great Western Rd, Glasgow G12 0UE, United Kingdom
description: The world-acclaimed Glasgow Botanic Gardens is one of Scotland’s gems, with a history dating back to 1817. The gardens were originally run by the Royal Botanic Institution of Glasgow and were used to host concerts and other city events.

name: Glasgow Green
description: The oldest park in the city, Glasgow Green was built in the 15th century after the land was granted by King James II to Bishop William Turnbull and the people of the city.

name: Riverside Museum
description: For a true look into the history of Glasgow from its maritime past to the mid-20th century, visit the award-winning Riverside Museum at Pointhouse Place. The museum is home to 3,000 transport-related objects, ranging from paintings to vintage cars in nine different display areas.

name: City Hall
description: The historic city Hamburg, deemed as one of the major tourist destinations in Germany, has plenty of attractions for visitors. If you find the naval past and relics of the port city mesmerizing, there is much more in store.

name: St. Michael's Church
description: St. Michael's Church is one of the prime attractions and a major landmark in Hamburg. With a seating capacity of 2500 it is the largest church in the city. It is one of the city’s five Lutheran churches and is considered one of the finest examples of Hanseatic Protestant baroque churches.

name: Hamburg Museum
description: Hamburg is one of the few cities where art and trade not only coexist, but also thrive. The city has a number of museums dedicated to art and history that includes the Hamburg Museum, also known as the Museum für Hamburgische Geschichte. The 19th century museum relocated to its present place around 1922.

name: Alter Elbtunnel
address: Bei den St. Pauli-Landungsbrücken, 20359 Hamburg, Germany
description: The Alter Elbtunnel is also known as the old St. Pauli Elbe tunnel. The tunnel connects the central area of Landungsbrücken on the northern bank of the River Elbe to Steinwerder on the southern bank. The tunnel dates back to 1911 and remains an integral part of the city’s history.

name: HafenCity
description: The amazing and historic city of Hamburg is one of the prime tourist destinations of Europe. HafenCity -the still developing quarter located on Elbe River Island Grasbrook is hailed as a futuristic and a tourist friendly zone that will cater to the rising population of the city and growing footfall too.

name: Warehouse District
description: Hamburg, one of the iconic and famous cities in Germany has always enticed tourists with its landmarks and relics. Along with its churches, amazing ship museums and beautiful lakes you ought to consider exploring the historic Warehouse District.

name: Rickmer Rickmers
description: Hamburg Port is home to many museum ships and Rickmer Rickmers is one of the major attractions. The three-mast steel vessel with a green and red exterior has cast anchor in Hamburg port permanently after exploring the seven seas for nearly 90 years. Its origins can be traced back to 1896.

name: Reeperbahn
description: Reeperbahn is a street known more as Hamburg’s prime location for nightlife and entertainment. It is located in St. Pauli district and is famous for hosting the Reeperbahn Festival. To get a taste of Hamburg’s glitzy nightlife you must definitely visit Reeperbahn.

name: Port of Hamburg
description: The grand historic city Hamburg in Germany is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Europe. Germany’s 2nd biggest city has plenty of sightseeing for visitors. However, your tour of Hamburg is hardly complete if you do not explore the port.

name: Museum Harbor
description: The city of Hamburg boasts of a number of museums, and each of these has a unique character. Museum Harbor is one such popular destination that is situated in the Oevelgönne district of Hamburg on the new Elbe tunnel. The new Elbe tunnel is a 3.5 km long tunnel draining into the river Elbe.

name: Titanic Belfast
description: Everyone knows the tragic story of the Titanic on some level, thanks largely to the Hollywood portrayal – but very few know the full story. Titanic Belfast is the biggest Titanic museum on the planet and one of the most impressive architectural masterpieces in Belfast.

name: Ulster Museum
address: Ulster Museum, Botanic Gardens, Belfast, BT9 5AB
description: Set on the beautifully lush grounds of the Ulster Botanic Gardens, and only one mile from the city centre, The Ulster Museum is the perfect stop-off point, whether you’re travelling alone, in a group or with the family.

name: Belfast Botanic Gardens & Palm House
address: College Park, Botanic Avenue, Belfast, County Antrim, BT7 1LP
description: If you’re looking for one of the most beautiful areas in Belfast, the Belfast Botanic Gardens & Palm House are a site to behold.

name: Albert Memorial Clock Tower
description: Described as Belfast’s very own Leaning Tower of Pisa by Fred Heatley, and rivalling Big Ben for stature and Times Square for its purpose, the Albert Memorial Clock Tower is a bastion of Belfast’s identity. The clock tower began construction in 1865 and was finally completed in 1870 to much pomp and celebration.

name: SS Nomadic
address: Hamilton Dock, Queens Road, Belfast BT3 9DT
description: The famous White Star Line ships have a proud history – and luckily for all of us, one of them has been fully restored for us to admire in all her glory. The SS Nomadic is the last remaining vessel and is on display to the public in the Hamilton Dock – right where she was born.

name: Belfast Castle
description: Whether you’re a history buff or just interested in observing some of Ireland’s most famous landmarks, the Belfast Castle should definitely be on your list of places to visit. Situated on an outcrop named Cave Hill, and overlooking the city below, the castle is steeped in tradition and a fair amount of superstition.

name: City Hall
description: Belfast City Hall has been in operation since 1906 as Belfast City Council's official civic headquarters. Situated in the centre of Donegall Square, and constructed of white Portland stone, the building stands as a testament to the influence of the British Empire.

name: Crumlin Road Gaol
description: Having recently completed its renovations, this 19th century heavily constructed prison is now open to visitors for the first time in its history. The prison has housed thousands of prisoners over the years since it was opened in 1846. The prison was finally shut down in 1996.

name: Cave Hill Country Park
description: Cave Hill Country Park, awarded the Green Flag Award, which recognizes the best open spaces in the United Kingdom from 2009 to 2015, is where you will find an abundance of cultural and outdoor activity.

name: Shankill Road
description: You’ll find culture in most cities, but you will struggle to find something as raw and real as the culture imbued in Shankill Road. It’s a part of Northern Irish culture that was built on pain, death, and finally, healing.

name: Titanic's Dock and Pump House
address: NI Science Park, Queen’s Road, Queen’s Island, Belfast, BT3 9DT
description: On a 7-acre site, you’ll find the Titanic Dock and Pump House. For anyone visiting Belfast, this is one stop you should make.

name: Stormont Parliament Buildings
description: The Stormont Parliament Buildings are the home of the Northern Ireland Assembly which was established in the Good Friday Agreement of 1998 – a watershed moment for the people of Northern Ireland and to the stability of the nation.

name: Falls Road
description: Falls Road, or more commonly referred to as ‘The Falls Road’ by locals, is one of the most interesting and culturally rich areas of Northern Island. As the main road running through West Belfast, all the way from Divis Street to the city centre, the road was originally a quiet country lane.

name: Waterfront Hall
description: Every major world city has its own version of a conferencing and entertainment centre. Waterfront Hall, situated at Lanyon Place in Belfast is one of the best on the globe.

name: Carrickfergus Castle
description: If you’re seeking a truly authentic historical experience, Carrickfergus Castle needs to be on your to-visit list. Situated on the shores of the beautiful Belfast Lough, this castle is one of the most well maintained medieval buildings in Northern Island.

name: Manchester Town Hall
description: The Manchester Town Hall is a municipal building in Manchester which is also one of the biggest tourist attractions. The architecture is neo- gothic and is a marvelous sight to see. It is home to majority of the local government departments. The first civic office building in Manchester was actually located in King Street.

name: Manchester Cathedral
description: The Manchester Cathedral is located in Manchester, England and in terms of the Anglican Diocese of Manchester, it is the mother church. It also served as seat of the Bishop of Manchester and the city's parish church.

name: Museum of Science and Industry
description: If you happen to be visiting Manchester and wish to explore some interesting places then the Museum of Science and Industry is definitely one place of interest that many travelers recommend. The city of Manchester is of course intrinsically connected with both science and industry.

name: National Football Museum
address: Urbis Building, Cathedral Gardens, Todd St, City Centre, Manchester M4 3BG, UK
description: The National Football Museum was originally in Deepdale in Preston, Lancashire but was moved in 2012 to the Urbis building in Manchester city center where it now stands tall.

name: Manchester Art Gallery
description: The Manchester Art Gallery dates all the way back to 1823 when the Royal Manchester Institution was formed. It was where the main part of the gallery, which is now on Mosley Street, used to be on display. The Royal Manchester Institution opened its doors to public after a decade since its manifestation.

name: Albert Square
description: Albert Square is a public square situated a few foot steps away from Manchester Town Hall in the center of Manchester City. This whole area used to be packed with houses and was once derelict land.

name: Manchester Museum
address: The University Of Manchester, Oxford Rd, Manchester M13 9PL, UK
description: The Manchester museum isn't only one of the best museums in Manchester City but is the leading museum in all of the United Kingdom that was founded back in 1867. Some of its earliest items were collected by the Manchester Society of Natural History which was formed in 1821.

name: Old Trafford
address: Sir Matt Busby Way, Stretford, Manchester M16 0RA, UK
description: The Stadium of Old Trafford really needs no introduction no matter from where you are in the world. It is the home stadium of Manchester United Football Club with a seating capacity of 75,643. The stadium is located in Old Trafford in Greater Manchester.

name: Museum of Transport
address: Boyle St, Cheetham, Manchester M8 8UW, UK
description: The Museum of Transport as the name suggests is a museum which effectively collects and preserves artifacts that can be deemed as historic in the transportation sector. It is owned by the Transport for Greater Manchester and is located in the Cheetham Hill area of Manchester in a bus depot which adds to the nostalgia.

name: Etihad Stadium
address: Ashton New Rd, Manchester M11 3FF, UK
description: The Etihad Stadium which is was originally known as the City of Manchester Stadium is located in Manchester City and is the home stadium of Manchester City Football Club who in recent years has enjoyed immense success in the English Premier League and the FA cup both.

name: Sirmione
description: Situated on a narrow peninsula which juts out 4km into the water, the town is dominated by Scaligera Castle which is surrounded by quaint alleyways. You can enjoy lakeside views from terraces or sun yourself on the beach. The peninsula has many olive and cypress trees and at the tip of the peninsular is the Grotte de Catullo.

name: Desenzano
description: Located west of Sirmione, Desenzano is the largest town on the shores of Lake Garda. The town began as a Roman port which now makes up the town's Porto Vecchio (Old Port) or old town. This area has small cafes and a popular market on Tuesdays. There is a network of narrow lanes and a 12th century castle overlooking the town.

name: Como Cathedral
description: The local basilica took more than 400 years to complete, and by 1740 it had been worked on by numerous artists and influenced by a range of architectural styles. The cathedral has a Gothic style marble façade with a beautiful rose window; on either side of the window are statues of two sons of Como from the 1st century.

name: Isola Bella
description: This island off the coast of Stresa in Lake Maggiore was transformed from a rocky barren piece of land to a blossoming garden by the Borromeo family who owned the island from 1500s. The beautiful gardens are coupled with magnificent baroque architecture of several buildings.

name: Isola Madre
description: This island in Lake Maggiore is one of the Verbano Islands it is mostly covered in thick foliage with an imposing square Palazzo. The Borromeo family started transforming the island into a paradise in 1502. The palace was started forty years later under the direction of Pellegrino Tibaldi.

name: Lake Orta
description: Orta is a medieval town on the shores of northern Italy's most romantic lake, Lake Orta. The quaint town has narrow cobbled streets and cute stores and restaurants. Although not as famous as its neighboring lake, Lake Maggiore this lake is a hidden gem.

name: Bellagio
description: Bellagio is located at the point where the lake splits into its two lower branches. Better known as the Pearl on the Lake, this small picturesque town offers narrow cobbled streets lined with exclusive boutiques and unique stores.

name: Villa Carlotta
description: The 17th century neoclassical villa's statue and art collection is renowned it includes Cupid and Psyche, The Last Kiss of Romeo and Juliet and pieces by Hayes, Canova and Thorwaldsen. The villa gardens are spectacular and cover 14 acres. Three terraces run between the villa and the lake, joined by grand staircases.

name: Varenna
description: The remains of a castle overlook this strip of land along the lakeside. Here you can see bird of prey displays daily. The famous Raku pottery is made and sold in a nearby store.

name: Gardaland
address: Via Derna, 4, 37014 Castelnuovo del Garda Verona, Italy
description: Italy's largest  and first amusement park is on the shores of the lake near Pescheria which is connected to the park by regular free shuttle buses. Other theme parks in the area include the Movie Land Studios and the Medieval Times where you can see knights joisting.

name: Villa Balbianello
description: This 17th century villa was constructed for Cardinal Durini, the luxurious interiors house a collection of items from various polar expeditions. The building has appeared in a number of films including Star Wars and Casino Royale. Visitors can take a guided tour of the gardens and house.

name: Old Port
description: The heart and soul of the city of Marseilles is its Old Port (Vieux-Port). This area was the natural harbor of Marseille since Greek settlers landed in the cove in the 6th century BC, setting up a trading post which continued to operate throughout the centuries.

name: Cathedrale de la Major
address: 1 Place de la Major, 13002 Marseille, France
description: One of the most important national monuments in France, the Cathedrale Sainte-Marie Majeure, is located in Marseille.

name: Basilique Notre-Dame de la Garde
description: Dominating Marseille’s skyline is the 19th century Romano-Byzantine basilica, an opulent Catholic church that sits at the city’s highest natural elevation spot on the south side of the Old Port.

name: Abbaye Saint-Victor
description: Saint Victor was a Roman soldier who became a Christian martyr, and the 11th century abbey in Marseilles is named for him.

name: The Panier
description: Marseille’s oldest district is known as The Panier (the Basket), named as a nod to the area where the marketplace (agora) stood in the time when the Greeks ruled the city.

name: Château d'If
description: One mile off the coast of Marseille you will find the island of If (French for Yew tree), on which is located the fortress known as the Chateau d’If. The island itself is just 3 hectares and is the smallest in the Frioul archipelago.

name: Marseille History Museum
description: The idea of le Musee d’Histoire de Marseille was first conceived when the site on which it sits was excavated in the mid-1960s ahead of the building of the Centre de la Bourse shopping center.

name: La Corniche
description: Located in Marseille’s 7th Arrondissement, La Corniche is a 5 km stretch of picturesque seaside roadway that hugs the Mediterranean coast. From La Corniche, you will be able to see superb views of the seas, the four Frioul islands (Promegues, Ratonneau, If and Tiboulen), as well as old villas and white sandy beaches.

name: Vallon des Auffes
description: The picturesque fishing village of Vallon des Auffes is situated in Marseille’s 7th arrondissement, constituting traditional fisherman cabins and fishing boats.  The village is named for the alfa (auffe) grass which is used to make fishing nets and rope.

name: Calanques National Park
description: The Parc national des Calanques is considered the jewel in the crown of the Bay of Marseille.

name: Diocletian’s Palace
address: Ul. kralja Petra Krešimira lV 8, 21000, Split, Croatia
description: One of the major attractions in the city of Split, is Diocletian’s Palace, an imposing Roman ruin built in 305 AD. At the time, the region was the Illyrian province of Rome. The ruins of the palace are among the most valuable buildings on the Adriatic coast from the Roman era.

name: Cathedral of St. Domnius
description: One of the most well preserved Roman buildings is the imposing Cathedral of St. Domnius in Split, Croatia. The cathedral is named after a 3rd century Bishop of Salona, and is now the seat of the Archdiocese of Split-Makarska. It is recognized as the world’s oldest Catholic cathedral with its structure dating back to 305 AD.

name: Marjan Hill
description: Marjan is one of the unique hills in the city of Split in the Dalmatia region. What is different about the hill is that it is covered by a dense pine forest and surrounded by the city and the sea. Way back in the 3rd century it was a park and is now a popular recreation area.

name: Split Archaeological Museum
description: Located a short walk north of the town center in Split is the Archaeological Museum, the oldest museum in Croatia. The original structure was founded in 1820. The building that houses the museum was designed by F. Ohmann and A. Kirstein, two Viennese architects and was constructed between 1912 and 1914.

name: Meštrović Gallery
description: The Ivan Mestrovic Gallery is one of the most famous art museums in Split dedicated to the 20th century sculptor. The gallery itself is a monument of art in addition to showcasing a number of significant works by Mestrovic.

name: Peristyle Square
description: Peristyle Square is the central square and heart of Diocletian’s Palace that exudes its own unique beauty. Emperor Diocletian is believed to have appeared at the square and have his subjects approach him.

name: Bacvice Beach
description: The Bacvice Beach, is mostly frequented by the locals and you may not see so many tourists here as you would throughout the rest of the city of split. It is a great way for you and your loved ones to get sun kissed and interact with some friendly locals.

name: Split City Museum
description: The city of Split has a rich and prestigious history and culture and some excellent parts of this has been preserved in Papalic Palace where the Split City Museum is located. The birth of the museum itself is associated with the inauguration of the library back in 1911.

name: The Beatles Story
address: Britannia Vaults, Albert Dock, Liverpool L3 4AD, United Kingdom
description: The world’s biggest permanent exhibition that is devoted solely to the British boy-band, the Beatles, is found in Liverpool. The Beatles Story is actually located across two separate sites.

name: Liverpool Cathedral
description: In 1903, a 22 year old architect by the name of Giles Gilbert Scott was commissioned to design the Liverpool Cathedral, a Church of England Cathedral of the Diocese of Liverpool.  Plans were approved for building with a single central tower and flanked by two transepts in 1910.

name: Albert Dock
description: The complex of warehouses and buildings on Liverpool waterfront is known as Albert Dock and has a history that dates back to 1839.  The original dock was designed by the architect Jesse Hartley and was officially opened by Prince Albert in July 1846.

name: The Cavern Club
address: 10 Mathew St, Liverpool L2 6RE, United Kingdom
description: One of Liverpool’s top tourist destinations is the Cavern Club, the place where the famous band, the Beatles’ musical identity was truly formed. Located on Mathew Street in a converted warehouse cellar, the Cellar Club became the most published pop music venue in the world when Beat Music exploded on the scene in the 1960s.

name: Liverpool One
address: 5 Wall St, Liverpool L1 8JQ, United Kingdom
description: The complex of shops, restaurants and entertainment near to Liverpool’s waterfront is known as Liverpool One. There are over 170 shops, bars and restaurants that make up five superb districts in the heart of the city center.

name: Radio City Tower
address: 1 Houghton St, Liverpool L1 1RL, United Kingdom
description: For a spectacular view of Liverpool, visit Radio City Tower (aka St.

name: Eleanor Rigby
description: Eleanor Rigby is the fictional character made famous in one of the Beatles’ most well-known songs by the same name. The song pays tribute to ‘all the lonely people’ in the city.

name: World Museum
address: William Brown Street, Liverpool L3 8EN, United Kingdom
description: One of the oldest museums operated by National Museums Liverpool, the World Museum was opened in 1853 in the city’s Ropeworks District. Seven years later, it moved to its present site on William Brown Street.

name: Walker Art Gallery
address: William Brown St, Liverpool L3 8EL, United Kingdom
description: One of Europe’s finest collections of art is found in the Walker Art Gallery, which has been displaying works for over 140 years.

name: Penny Lane
description: One of the most famous songs by the iconic band, the Beatles was inspired by the Liverpool street, Penny Lane. Two of the band’s members, Paul McCartney and John Lennon would meet regularly in Penny Lane in order to catch the bus into town.

name: Anfield
address: Anfield Rd, Liverpool L4 0TH, United Kingdom

name: U-Boat Story
address: Woodside Ferry Terminal, Birkenhead CH41 6DU, United Kingdom
description: The German U-534 submarine was attacked by the Royal Airforce during WWII and sank to the bottom of the sea just off the Danish coast. For 40 years it lay there until it was salvaged in 1993.

name: Spaceport
address: Victoria Pl, Wallasey CH44 6QY, United Kingdom
description: For an experience that is truly out of this world, visit Spaceport where you can take an inspirational trip through space and science. Located at Seacombe Ferry Terminal in Wallasey, Merseyside, Spaceport offers fun, interactive displays, a cosmic coaster space ride, dome shows and more.

name: Suburban Baths
description: The Suburban Baths are located in Pompeii, Italy. Pompeii (located in the Italian region of Campania) was destroyed on August 24, 79 AD when Mount Vesuvius erupted, burying the entire city (along with Herculaneum) and consequently preserving them.

name: Place des Terreaux
description: One of Lyon’s monumental public squares the Place des Terreaux is located at the foot of La Croix-Rousse Hill and is part of a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is a rectangular pedestrian square close to many stores, restaurants and cafes.

name: Gallo-Roman Museum Lyon
address: Gallo-Roman Museum de Lyon, 17 Rue Cleberg, 69005, Lyon.
description: On the slopes of Fourviere Hill which was once home to the Roman city of Lugdunum is a museum dedicated to the Gallo-Roman history of the area. It was on this hillside that the Romans built an amphitheatre and the Odeon both of which are now part of a UNESCO site.

name: Bellecour Square
description: The large, central square of Place Bellecour measures 312 meters by 200 meters and is one of the biggest completely open squares in Europe; the biggest pedestrian-only square in Europe and the 3rd largest square in France. Place Bellecour is part of a UNESCO historical site.

name: Museum of the Confluences
description: As the name suggests this museum is located at the point where the Rhone and Saone Rivers meet at the southern end of the Presqu’ile (peninsula). It is a science center and anthropological museum housed in a stunning modern building designed in the “deconstructivist-style” with an exterior of stainless steel and glass.

name: Old Town Lyon
description: Vieux Lyon is in the 5th arrondissement of Lyon and is the largest Renaissance district of the city and one of the largest Renaissance neighborhoods in Europe. The Old Town was the first historic district in France to be given protection under the Malraux Law protecting French cultural sites; it is also a UNESCO site.

name: Museum of Miniatures and Cinema
address: Maison des Avocats, 60 Rue Saint Jean, 69005, Lyon, France
description: Dan Ohlmann created this unique museum out of two exclusive collections  - one of miniature scenes and the other of cinema. The miniature collection consists of miniature scenes of daily life crafted by master miniaturists.

name: Monte Carlo Casino
description: The Casino de Monte-Carlo is a grand palace-like building which houses the casino, Grand Theatre of Monte Carlo and the offices of Monte Carlo Ballet. The casino resort complex is run by the Societe des Bains de Mer de Monaco which also owns restaurants, sports clubs, hotels and nightclubs in Monaco.

name: Monaco Harbor
address: Route de la Piscine, Monte Carlo 98000, Monaco.
description: One of the fascinations with Monaco is seeing how the rich live; one of the best ways of doing that is going down to Monaco harbor and seeing the lineup of super expensive yachts. The luxury yachts are packed in to Monaco harbor each more beautiful than the next.

name: Oceanographic Museum
description: This museum of marine science is part of the Oceanographic Institute and was established in 1910 by Prince Albert I; for 31 years (1957-1988) the museum was run by famous ocean explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau.

name: Monaco Old Town
description: The Old Town of Monaco is part of Monaco City (Monaco Ville), one of the four quarters of Monaco together with La Condamine, Fontvielle and Monte Carlo. Vieux Monaco (Old Town of Monaco) is a great place to take a walk and enjoy the quaint streets, small shops and hidden eateries.

name: Palermo Cathedral
description: Cattedrale is one of the most notable examples of Arab-Norman architecture in Sicily. The Palermo cathedral features a remarkable marble shell that houses an array of geometric patterns.

name: Piazza Pretoria
description: Piazza Pretoria, also known as square of Shame, is at the limits of the district of Kalsa, near the corner of Cassaro with Via Maqueda, just a few meters from the Quattro Canti, the exact center of the historic city of Palermo .

name: La Martorana
description: The church of Santa Maria dell'Ammiraglio–known as Chiesa della Martorana or the more common La Martorana–is a famous Palermo landmark known for its gorgeous 12th-century mosaics. Although it was designed in the Byzantine style, the church incorporates a noticeable Arabic influence in its design.

name: Quattro Canti
description: Quattro Canti or Four Corners, is a Palermo intersection that marks the city’s historical district. Located where Corso Vittorio Emanuele crosses Via Maqueda, the crossroads is situated in the area that has traditionally been the city's business and cultural center.

name: Palazzo dei Normanni
description: Palazzo dei Normanni is one of two palaces and nine civil and religious structures in Palermo. Also known as Palazzo Resale, the palace’s name translates into English as “Palace of the Normans”. Currently the seat of the regional government of Sicily, the palace has served as a government building for centuries.

name: Teatro Massimo
description: The Teatro Massimo Vittorio Emanuele–also known simply as Teatro Massimo–is a 1,300-seat opera house known for its Neo-classical architectural design and its excellent acoustic qualities.

name: Cappella Palatina
description: The Palatine Chapel (Italian: Cappella Palatina), is the royal chapel of the Norman kings of Sicily situated on the ground floor at the center of the Palazzo Reale in Palermo, southern Italy.

name: Porta Nuova
description: Porta Nuova is a monumental city gate of Palermo. It represents the entrance of the Cassaro (the main and most ancient street of the city) from Corso Calatafimi (the way to Monreale) and is located beside Palazzo dei Normanni, royal palace of Palermo.

name: Ljubljana Cathedral
description: Stolnica Sv. Nikolaja is a beautiful Baroque church in Ljubljana’s old town on Cyril and Methodius Square. Originally a Romanesque church stood at this site and was first documented in 1262 however in 1361 it was damaged by fire.

name: Central Market
address: Vodnikov trg, Ljubljana 1000, Slovenia (also Pogacarjev Square and Plecnik's Colonnade)
description: This historic market was designed by Joze Plecnik in the 1930s. It is located in the center of the city and runs from Dragon Bridge to the Triple Bridge.

name: Neboticnik
description: Neboticnik is the Slovenian word for skyscraper and this tall building has a café, restaurant/bar and terrace running around the café from where you can get views across the city. The high-rise is in the center of the city and has 13 stories reaching a height of 70.35 meters.

name: Dragon Bridge
address: Zmajski Most, Resljeva ul., Ljubljana, Slovenia.
description: Zmajski Most is a picturesque bridge and symbol of Ljubljana. The bridge was completed in 1901 replacing the Butcher Bridge which had stood at the same spot since 1819. The Dragon Bridge was the city’s first reinforced concrete structure; concrete was chosen over the most popular stone because it was cheaper.

name: National Museum of Slovenia
address: Presernova cesta 20, Ljubljana 1000, Slovenia (entrance from Muzejska ulica)
description: This museum shares its building with the Slovenian Museum of Natural History and is Slovenia’s largest and oldest cultural and scientific institution founded in 1821. The building was constructed in 1888 and is an attraction in itself with magnificent architecture.

name: Congress Square
description: Kongresni Trg has been the site of many historic events and has always been the heart of the city. Great leaders have addressed the public here and protests and celebrations have been held here. The remains of Roman town walls and a bronze Roman statue, “The Emona Citizen” were found here and can be seen in the square’s park.

name: City Museum of Ljubljana
description: The City Museum consists of a permanent exhibition entitled The Faces of Ljubljana. The exhibition focuses on the city as a residential, political, economic, administrative and creative center. It takes a look at the lives of the people who live in Ljubljana, present and past.

name: Piazza Castello
description: Piazza Castello is the main square of Turin, the heart of the historic center of the city, to bring together the four main roads: the pedestrian Via Garibaldi, Via Po, Via Roma and Via Micca.

name: Palazzo Carignano
address: Via Accademia delle Scienze, 5, 10123 Torino, Italy
description: The Palazzo Carignano is a historical building in the centre of Turin, Italy, which houses the Museum of the Risorgimento. It was a private residence of the Princes of Carignano, after whom it is named. It's rounded façade is different from other façades of the same structure. It is located on the Via Accademia delle Scienze.

name: Museo Egizio
address: Via Accademia delle Scienze, 6, 10123 Torino, Italy
description: The Museo Egizio is an archaeological museum in Turin, Italy, specialising in Egyptian archaeology and anthropology. It houses one of the largest collections of Egyptian antiquities with more than 30,000 artefacts. In 2015 it received about 772,900 visitors.

name: National Museum of Cinemac & Mole Antonelliana
description: The National Museum of Cinema (Museo Nazionale del Cinema) located in Turin, is an Italian motion picture museum, fitted out inside the Mole Antonelliana tower. It is operated by the Maria Adriana Prolo Foundation, and the core of its collection is the result of the work of the historian and collector Maria Adriana Prolo.

name: Turin Cathedral
description: Turin Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Torino; Cattedrale di San Giovanni Battista ) is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Turin, northern Italy. Dedicated to Saint John the Baptist (Italian: San Giovanni Battista), it is the seat of the Archbishops of Turin.

name: Royal Palace of Turin
description: The Royal Palace of Turin (Italian: Palazzo Reale di Torino) is a historic palace of the House of Savoy in the city of Turin in Northern Italy. It was originally built in the 16th century and was later modernized by Christine Marie of France (1606–63) in the 17th century, with designs by the Baroque architect Filippo Juvarra.

name: Parco del Valentino
description: Parco del Valentino (also known as Valentino Park) is a popular public park in Turin, Italy. It is located along the west bank of the Po river. It covers an area of 500,000m², which makes it Turin's second largest park (Turin's largest park, the 840,000m² Pellerina Park, is Italy's most extended urban green area).

name: Villa della Regina
address: Strada Comunale Santa Margherita, 79, 10131 Torino, Italy
description: The Villa della Regina is a palace in the city of Turin, Italy. It was originally built by the House of Savoy in the 17th century. The original structure was designed in early 1615 by the Italian soldier, architect and military engineer, Ascanio Vitozzi.

name: Pont St-Bénezet
description: The Pont St-Bénezet is a famous bridge from the medieval times that is an important attraction in Avignon. The bridge was originally built between the years 1177 and 1185 on the Rhone, connecting Villeneuve-les-Avignon and Avignon.

name: Pope's Palace
description: The Palais des Papes or Papal Palace is the largest Gothic palace in the world.

name: Musée du Petit-Palais
description: The Musée du Petit-Palais is a fabulous museum and art gallery in Avignon that is located next to the Palais des Papes. The museum is located in a 14th century building and opened its doors to the public in 1976.

name: Musée Lapidaire
address: Chapelle des Jésuites, 27, rue de la République, Avignon, France
description: The Musée Lapidaire is a fantastic archaeology museum located in the Jesuit College Chapel in the heart of Avignon since 1933. The museum’s beauty is matched by the architectural style of the building it is housed in – the classical Baroque style.   Explore the Musée Lapidaire and its superb range of exhibits.

name: Musée Angladon
description: The Musée Angladon is situated right in the middle of Avignon. This beautiful museum is located in an 18th century building that was designed to be a house museum by Jean Angladon and Paulette Martin.

name: Pont du Gard
address: 400 Route du Pont du Gard, 30210 Vers-Pont-du-Gard, France
description: The Pont du Gard is an ancient 3-level Roman aqueduct across the Gradon River around 25 kilometers to the west of Avignon. It was built way back in 19 BC by the son-in-law of Augustus, Marcus Agrippa and had a road bridge as well that was in use till 1996.

name: Alcázar of Toledo
address: Calle de la Union, s/n, 45001 Toledo, Spain
description: The Alcazar of Toledo is a stone fortification that is a sight worth seeing. Right at the highest point of the city, it stands breathtakingly beautiful and tall. The Alcazar, today, has been reopened to the public and serves as a large military museum.

name: Toledo Cathedral
description: Toledo Cathedral is a prominent Roman Catholic Church and the seat of the Metropolitan Archdiocese of Toledo. The Toledo Cathedral happens to be one among the three high Gothic cathedrals of the 13th century and is a prime example of Gothic style and architecture in all of Spain.

name: Monastery of San Juan de los Reyes
address: Calle de los Reyes Católicos, 17, 45002 Toledo, Spain
description: While the Cathedral of Toledo hogs all the limelight, the Monastery of San Juan de los Reyes is also a tourist attraction which is really worth a visit. The spot itself is simply beautiful and natural. There is access to Wi-Fi which you can then use to connect and listen to the audio book.

name: Mirador Del Valle
description: Mirador Del Valle is a beautiful point from where you can enjoy the magnificent view of the Tagus River and entire city of Toledo. This view point is located at the top of the valley of River Tagus and offers a panoramic view of the city. It offers magnificent vistas of the medieval houses, Alcazar castle and churches.

name: Cologne Cathedral
description: Cologne Cathedral is one of the most imposing religious landmarks dear to the people of Cologne. The Roman Catholic cathedral is the seat of the Archbishop of Cologne and is one of the finest examples of German Catholicism and Goth architecture.

name: Fragrance Museum
description: If you have a penchant for perfumes, then you ought not miss the chance to visit the Fragrance Museum of Cologne. This museum treats all aroma lovers to some of the most scintillating fragrances from around the world.

name: Cologne City Hall
description: The Cologne City Hall is one of the most iconic landmarks in one of the largest cities of Germany, Cologne. It is a historical building which draws in tourists from all corners of the globe and from all walks of life.

name: Hohenzollern Bridge
description: The Hohenzollern Bridge is a bridge over the river Rhine in the city of Cologne. The bridge is both a railway and street bridge which is only accessible to rail and pedestrian traffic. Around 1,200 trains run through this bridge daily, linking Köln Hauptbahnhof and Köln Messe/Deutz stations.

name: Rheinauhafen District
description: The Rheinauhafen, literally Rheinau harbor, is a 15.4 hectare urban regeneration project in Cologne. Situated on the River Rhine between the Southern Railway Bridge and Severin Bridge, this historic old town is the newly designed waterfront complex and one of the major attractions of the city.

name: Isola Bella
address: Isola Bella, 98039 Taormina, Province of Messina, Italy
description: Isola Bella (Sicilian: Ìsula Bedda) is a small island near Taormina, Sicily, southern Italy.

name: Palace of the Parliament
description: Known as “the People’s House,” the magnificent Palace of the Parliament, located in Dealul Arsenalului in central Bucharest, is renowned for being the largest administrative building in the world by weight and size, coming in ahead of the United States Pentagon.

name: Stavropoleos Monastery
description: The Stavropoleos Monastery is a grand Eastern Orthodox monastery for nuns located in the historic Old City of Bucharest.

name: Revolution Square
description: Bucharest’s historic Revolution Square, located in the Calea Victoriei in the city center, boasts a long and fascinating revolutionary history. It houses a number of breath-taking historic buildings, and has heard countless history-changing speeches that have inspired both patriotism and revolt.

name: National Museum of Art
description: Bucharest’s National Museum of Art is Romania’s largest and most spectacular art collection. It is located in the city’s Royal Palace in Revolution Square, built in 1812 and subsequently transformed into a royal residence following a series of acquisitions in 1859.

name: Romanian Peasant Museum
address: Șoseaua Pavel Dimitrievici Kiseleff 3, București 011341, Romania
description: Located in Soseaua Kiseleff near the Piata Victoriei, the Romanian Peasant Museum is an impressive display featuring over 100 000 artifacts, including fabric and textiles, dress, ceramics and religious icons, that demonstrate rural life in Romania.

name: Great Synagogue
description: Bucharest’s Great Synagogue, also known as the Great Polish Synagogue, has served as the heart of Ashkenazi Jewish life in Romania for over a century. Erected in 1845 by the Polish-Jewish community, the building comprises a rather plain rococo exterior.

name: National Museum of Romanian History
description: The National Museum of Romanian History, located in the Calea Victoriei in Bucharest, houses a spectacular array of exhibits that tell the fascinating story of Romanian history from pre-historic times and the ancient Geto-Dacian era, right through to the 19th century monarchy, 20th century communism and the present day.

name: Cotroceni Palace
description: The Cotroceni Palace has been the official residence of the President of Romania since 1991, following the Romanian Revolution of 1989 that saw the end of Nicolae Ceaușescu’s Communist Party regime.

name: Jewish Museum
description: Founded in 1978 by the Chief Rabbi Mozes Rosen (1964-1994), the Jewish History Museum offers a vast display of exhibitions that tell the story of the Jewish community in Romania, with particular emphasis on their role in society, and their contributions to Romanian culture.

name: Bellu Cemetery
description: Bucharest’s Bellu Cemetery is the final resting ground of some of Romania’s most notable citizens, making it the largest and most famous cemetery in the country. Greeting visitors to Bellu Cemetery is the quote: “Glory on Earth, Happiness in Heavens”.

name: The Art Collections Museum
description: Housed in the elaborate neoclassical Casa Romanit Palace in the Calea Victoriei, the Art Collections Museum, or Museum of Art Collections, boasts an impressive number of European and Romanian art collections comparable only to Bucharest’s National Art Museum.

name: Manuc's Inn
description: Manuc’s Inn Manuc’s Inn is an historic hotel building, and the oldest operating hotel in Bucharest. Representing an eclectic mix of Eastern European architectural styles, the hotel is located opposite the ruins of Curtea Veche, the historic palatial home of the Wallachian Prince Vlad III Dracula.

name: Romanian Kitsch Museum
description: The word “kitsch” refers to an artwork that has been created in poor taste, something conspicuously vulgar or theatrically sentimental that evokes a slight nauseous feeling on the part of the viewer.

name: Romanian Athenaeum
description: Located in central Bucharest, the ornate neoclassical Athenaeum is Romania’s largest and most impressive concert hall.

name: Carol Park
description: Dedicated to King carol I of Romania on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of his coronation, Carol Park is a vast public park area located in south-central Bucharest containing immaculate French gardens spanning a total area of 36 hectares. Part of the gardens climb Filaret Hill, and surround the majestic Lake Filaret.

name: Kretzulescu Church
description: Located in central Bucharest’s historic Calea Victoriei, adorning the corner of Revolution Square, Kretzulescu Church is a preserved 18th century Eastern Orthodox Church done in the Brâncovenesc architectural style popular at the time.

name: CEC Palace
description: Founded in 1864, CEC Bank (Casa de Economii si Consemnatiuni) is the oldest banking institution in Romania. Thus if any bank were to be housed in a grand palace, it is this one.

name: Herăstrău Park
description: Herăstrău Park is a public park and gardens area spread across 187 hectares of northern Bucharest, encompassing the vast Lake Herăstrău, the build-up from the Colentina River. The name Herăstrău, meaning “saw” or “sawmill”, derives from the myriad sawmills once powered by the river’s powerful current.

name: Mogoșoaia Palace
description: Mogoșoaia Palace, the former palatial home of the 18th century Wallachian prince, Constantin Brâncoveanu, is located a mere 10 km outside of greater Bucharest. It is an ornate structure resembling a fusion of Venetian and Ottoman elements, an architectural style that came to be known as the Romanian or Brâncoveanu style.

name: Trieste Cathedral
description: Trieste Cathedral (Italian: Basilica cattedrale di San Giusto Martire), dedicated to Saint Justus, is a Roman Catholic cathedral and the main church of Trieste, in northern Italy. It is the seat of the Bishop of Trieste. In 1899 Pope Leo XIII granted it the status of a basilica minor.

name: Castello Normanno-Svevo
address: Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 4, 70122 Bari, Italy
description: The Castello Svevo (Swabian Castle) is a castle in the Apulian city of Bari, Italy. Built around 1132 by Norman King Roger II, it is currently used for exhibitions.

name: Bari Cathedral
description: Bari Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Bari or Cattedrale di San Sabino) is the cathedral of Bari, in Apulia, southern Italy, senior to, though less famous than, the Basilica of St Nicholas (Basilica di San Nicola) in the same city.

name: Basilica di San Nicola
description: The Pontifical Basilica di San Nicola (Basilica of Saint Nicholas) is a church in Bari, southern Italy that holds wide religious significance throughout Europe and the Christian world. The basilica is an important pilgrimage destination both for Roman Catholics and Orthodox Christians from Eastern Europe.

name: Ross Castle
address: Ross Castle, Ross Rd, Ross Island, Killarney, Co. Kerry, Ireland
description: Ross Castle, located within the Killarney National Park was built circa 15th century by the ruling O’Donoghues Mor (Ross) clan.  The castle is built in the typical style of medieval castles of its time, comprising of a main tower house and thick walls.

name: Innisfallen
description: In the middle of Lough Leane, one of the three Irish Lakes of Killarney, you will find Innisfallen (meaning Faithlinn’s Island in Ireland).  The island is most famous for the archaeological ruins of the Innisfallen Abbey, an early Christian monastery founded by St.

name: St. Mary's Cathedral
address: Cathedral Pl, Inch, Killarney, Co. Kerry, Ireland
description: The 19th century Roman Catholic cathedral, St. Mary’s (also known as the Cathedral of our Lady of the Assumption) is located in Killarney, County Kent. Designed by the English architect, Augustus Welby Pugin, St.

name: Torc Waterfall
description: At the base of Torc Mountain in Ireland’s Killarney National Park lies Torc Waterfall. The falls form part of the 200 km Kerry Way circular trail, the longest of Ireland’s National Waymarked Trails.

name: Gap of Dunloe
description: The narrow mountain pass that lies between the Irish McGillycuddy’s Reeks range and Purple Mountain is known as the Gap of Dunloe (Bearna an Choimin in Irish). The area encompasses five famous lakes that are connected by the River Loe, namely Coosaun Lough, Cushnavally Lake, Auger Lake, Black Lough and Black Lake.

name: Killarney National Park
address: 3, Fair Hill, Ardshanavooly, Killarney, Co. Kerry, Ireland
description: At the foot of the highest mountain range in Ireland, McGillycuddy’s Reeks, you will find the famous Lakes of Killarney. The 26,000 acre area that encompasses the point where the mountains meet the lake shores, woodlands and waterfalls is known as Killarney National Park.

name: Kenmare
description: Kenmare is a jewel of a holiday town located in the Southwest of Ireland, nestling in the heart of Kenmare Bay. The town has a rich history, beginning with its founding in 1670, and still manages to maintain its charm and picturesque beauty.

name: Killorglin
description: The scenic town of Killorglin is situated on the Iveragh Peninsula and forms part of the Ring of Kerry and the Wild Atlantic Way. The town stands on the River Laune, world famous for its salmon fishing, and up on a hill that stands to the south of Castlemaine Harbor headwaters.

name: Sneem
description: The charming village of Sneem lies between Kenmare and Waterville in the Ring of Kerry, one of Ireland’s most scenic drives.

name: Glenbeigh
description: A popular tourist destination for visitors to the ring of Kerry is Glenbeigh, a town tucked into the Seefin Mountains. The name in Irish, Gleann Beithe means Valley of the Birch Trees.  Commonly referred to as the Jewel in the Ring of Kerry, Glenbeigh is famous for its magnificent scenery.

name: Aghadoe Cathedral
description: Believed to have been originally a pagan religious site, Aghadoe Cathedral overlooks the beautiful Lakes of Killarney.

name: The Port
description: “The Port” is the term used to refer to the main port of Livorno, which serves as the take-off point for Pisa and Florence. Although Livorno has its share of impressive attractions, tourists can get a lot more out of their travel experience by heading off toward Pisa, which is fairly accessible from the port.

name: Basilica of Saint-Sernin
description: Basilique Saint-Sernin de Toulouse is the largest Romanesque church in Europe. Originally built through the 11th to 13th centuries, the church was once a part of a Benedictine abbey that used to house pilgrims. It is still an important pit stop en route the Camino de Santiago annual pilgrimage that culminates in Spain.

name: Musée des Augustins
description: The Musée des Augustins is a museum of fine arts located in the French city of Toulouse. The museum is situated in a former Augustins monastery which dates back to the 14th century, with exhibits displayed in the original setting of the church, the sacristy, and the chapter house.

name: Canal du Midi
description: The Canal du Midi is a waterway in southern France that was constructed to connect the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea. The canal is 241 kilometers long and is considered nothing less than a civil engineering marvel of the 17th century.

name: Toulouse Cathedral
description: The Toulouse Cathedral or the Cathédrale Saint-Étienne de Toulouse is a national monument of France and also the seat of the Archbishop of Toulouse.

name: Museum of Old Toulouse
description: The Museum of Old Toulouse or Vieux-Toulouse is housed in a preserved mansion called Hôtel Dumay. It once belonged to Antoine Dumay, doctor to the Queen Marguerite de Valois, who was the first wife of Henri IV. It was built in 1590 using a pink brick façade and rock work on the main floors.

name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
description: The Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao is housed in a spectacular building that is itself a work of art. The museum was designed by Frank Gehry and was built in 1993 – 1997. The 24,000 square meter building has been designed to make the best use of abundant natural light.

name: Plaza Nueva
address: Plaza Nueva, S/N, 48005 Bilbo, Bizkaia, Spain
description: Plaza Nueva, or the Plaza Barria, has 64 arches and was built in the neoclassical style. With buildings surrounding the square, access is via the arches. The square is similar to other Spanish plazas that are typically found all over the country. The Plaza Nueva was completed in 1851.

name: Mercado de la Ribera
description: The Mercado de la Ribera is a marketplace that was built in 1929 in the same location as markets had been held since the 14th century. La Ribera was designed by the Pedro Ispizua, an architect ahead of his time who made good use of natural light and large open interior spaces.

name: Las Siete Calles
description: The medieval neighborhood of Bilbao, Las Siete Calles, or Seven Streets in English is also known as Casco Viejo, Old Town, and is located in the Ibaiondo district. The name of the neighborhood describes the part of town that used to be enclosed by walls until the end of the 19th century.

name: Bilbao Cathedral
address: Plaza de Santiago, 1, 48005 Bilbo, Bizkaia, Spain
description: Construction began on the Catedral de Santiago, or St. James’ Cathedral, in 1379, starting out as a parish church.

name: Königsallee
description: Konigsalle is a tree-lined urban boulevard with a canal running at the center. It is one of the busiest upscale shopping streets in Dusseldorf. A major attraction of the boulevard is the landscaped canal that runs along its center.

name: Rheinturm
description: Visible from all corners of Dusseldorf, Rheinturm is the tallest building in the city. It is also known as the Rhine Tower and was constructed between 1979 and 1981. It is a telecommunication tower of the city and carries aerials various radio and TV transmitters.

name: Rheinuferpromenade
description: Rheinuferpromenade or the Rhine River Promenade is considered one of the most beautiful esplanades of the city of Dusseldorf. It connects the old traditional town of the city with the modern and is said to reflect the vibrant spirit of the locals.

name: Basilica di Santa Croce
address: Via Umberto I, 3, 73100 Lecce LE, Italy
description: Basilica di Santa Croce (Italian, Church of the Holy Cross) is a Baroque church in Lecce, Apulia, Italy, completed in 1695. Walter VI of Brienne had founded in the current church's location a monastery in the 14th century.

name: Roman Amphitheatre
description: Built in the 2nd century and situated near Sant'Oronzo Square, was able to seat more than 25,000 people. It is now half-buried because other monuments were built above it over the centuries. The theatre is currently used for different religious and arts events.

name: Lecce Cathedral
address: Piazza del Duomo, 73100 Lecce LE, Italy
description: Lecce Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Lecce; Cattedrale dell'Assunzione della Virgine) is the cathedral of the city of Lecce in Apulia, Italy, dedicated to the Assumption of the Virgin Mary. It is the seat of the Archbishop of Lecce. The cathedral was first built in 1144, but underwent repairs in 1230.

name: Sassi di Matera
description: The Sassi di Matera are two districts (Sasso Caveoso and Sasso Barisano) of the Italian city of Matera, Basilicata, well-known for their ancient cave dwellings. The Sassi originate from a prehistoric troglodyte settlement and are suspected to be among the first human settlements in Italy.

name: Matera Cathedral
description: Matera Cathedral (Italian: Duomo di Matera; Cattedrale di Santa Maria della Bruna e di Sant'Eustachio) is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Matera, Basilicata, Italy. It is dedicated to the Virgin Mary under the designation of the Madonna della Bruna and to Saint Eustace.

name: Nuremberg Castle
description: Nuremberg Castle is one of the biggest tourist attractions in Nuremberg. It is a collection of fortified buildings, dating back to medieval ages. The castle has served as the residence for several German kings.

name: Nuremberg Transport Museum
description: Nuremberg Transport Museum encompasses two distinct museums that include the Deutsche Bahn’s DB Museum and the Museum of Communications. The Nuremberg Transport Museum is considered one of the oldest technical history museums in Europe.

name: Hauptmarkt
description: Hauptmarkt is among the most visited hotspots in Nuremberg. This large market square is located in the city center and offers many attractions. It is situated on land that was once marsh areas. The land was later used a settlement area for Jews, who came to Nuremberg in the 12th century.

name: Schöner Brunnen
description: Schöner Brunnen or Beautiful Fountain dates back to the 14th century. The fountain is located close to the town hall in Nuremberg. It was built between 1385 and 1396 by Heinrich Beheim. It is an important part of the city’s Historical Mile.

name: Altstadt Basel
address: The Old Town spans the Rhine with the Altstadt Grossbasel on the west bank and the Kleinbasel on the east bank. Start exploring in MarktPlatz.
description: Basel’s Old Town spans the Rhine and is divided into Grossbasel Altstadt and Kleinbasel Alstadt. It is the historic center of the city and one of the best preserved Old Towns in Europe. The picturesque buildings are in diverse architectural styles and their pristine condition is unparalleled.

name: Tinguely Museum
address: Paul Sacher-Anlage 2, Postfach 3255, CH 4002 Basel, Switzerland
description: The impressive building which houses the Tinguely Museum is located in Solitudepark on the bank of the Rhine and was designed by Mario Botta. The museum houses the works of Jean Tinguely (1925-1991). Tinguely was one of Switzerland’s most prominent artists of the 20th century.

name: The Euromast
description: Opened in 1960 after twenty-four years of construction, Rotterdam’s Euromast observation tower is one of Europe’s highest structures, and the tallest structure in the Netherlands. If you are in the Netherlands, a visit to the Euromast is not to be missed.

name: Market Hall
address: Dominee Jan Scharpstraat 298, 3011 GZ Rotterdam, Netherlands
description: As it is known locally, “Markthal” or Market Hall is an open-air market located at the historical Binnenrotte next to the Blaak Station. Market Hall is the largest open-air marketplace in Rotterdam.

name: Kunsthal
description: Kunsthal is a 3300 square meter (36,000 sq. ft) building unlike any other traditional art museum. It has no permanent collection, but instead houses a wide variety of temporary exhibits ranging from 20th century masters to current contemporary art.

name: Maritime Museum Rotterdam
description: The Maritime Museum is located in the city center of Rotterdam in the area of Leuvehaven, between Central Station and the Erasmusbrug. The museum was designed by Dutch architect Wim Quist and first opened its doors in 1986.

name: Old Harbor
description: Built in the year 1350, the Old Harbor or “Oude Haven” is the oldest harbor in Rotterdam. The harbor is a unique synthesis of the old and new.

name: Rotterdam City Hall
description: As one of the few original buildings still standing after World War II, Rotterdam’s City Hall is a miraculous symbol of Dutch survival. Along with City Hall, the other known public buildings to avoid damage during the war were the main post office, and the stock exchange.

name: SS Rotterdam
description: The 228 meter long steamship, the SS Rotterdam, otherwise known as “La Grande Dame”, was built in Rotterdam and served loyally as a cruise ship for the Holland-America Line for over forty years. Its main route was from Rotterdam to New York transporting emigrants to a better life.

name: Erasmus Bridge
description: At a height of 139m (456 ft), the Erasmus Bridge (Erasmusbrug in Dutch) is one of the tallest and most recognizable structures in Rotterdam. The bridge, which was named after the Christian renaissance humanist, Desiderius Erasmus, is 802m long (2,631 ft) and was completed in 1996.

name: Aix Cathedral
address: Cathédrale Saint-Sauveur, Place des Martyrs de la Resistance, Aix-en-Provence, 13100 France
description: Aix en Provence Cathedral or Aix Cathedral or the Holy Savior Cathedral took from the 5th century to the 15th century to complete and so it has several architectural styles and art work from a number of period in history. The highlight of the cathedral art is the Burning Bush Triptych by Nicolas Fromen.

name: Roman Baths
description: The Roman Baths complex in Bath is the city’s top attraction. The site of the historic Roman public bathhouse is below street level while the buildings above ground date back to the 19th century.

name: Bath Abbey
description: Bath Abbey (Abbey Church of Saint Peter and Saint Paul) is a landmark structure in the city of Bath. It was established as a Benedictine monastery in the 7th century and extended in the 10th, 12th and 16th centuries. In the 1860s the Abbey underwent restoration.

name: Pulteney Bridge
description: Pulteney Bridge is one of the most esthetic bridges in the world and one of four rare historic bridges with stores built above it on the entire length of the bridge. The bridge was built in 1774 for William Pulteney and designed by Robert Adam.

name: Royal Crescent
description: The Royal Crescent in Bath is an iconic row of Georgian terraced houses which are built in an elegant semi-ellipse curve, or crescent facing an open green lawn. This Bath landmark was designed by John Wood the Younger and constructed between 1767 and 1775.

name: Royal Victoria Park
address: Royal Victoria Park, Bath BA1 2LZ, UK
description: The Royal Victoria Park spreads across 57 acres in the city of Bath. The park was first opened to the public in 1829 with a ceremony attended by the honored guest, 11 year old Queen Victoria. The park was the first to bear the Queen’s name and the park has a commemorative obelisk dedicated to Queen Victoria.

name: Museum of Bath Architecture
address: The Countess of Huntingdon’s Chapel, The Paragon, The Vineyard, Bath BA1 5NA, UK
description: The Museum of Bath Architecture looks at Bath’s architectural history and the transformation of Bath from a provincial town to the brilliant Georgian city that it is today. The museum is housed in the Countess of Huntingdon’s Chapel, a Grade II historic building constructed in 1765.

name: Binnenhof
description: The Binnenhof (Inner Court) is the historical and current centre of politics in the Netherlands. All matters of politics were, and continue to be discussed in this complex of buildings. The buildings are in the city centre of The Hague, Netherlands, next to the picturesque Hofvijver Lake.

name: Madurodam
address: George Maduroplein 1, 2584 RZ Den Haag, Netherlands
description: Madurodam is a miniature park in the Scheveningen district. The park features a range of model replicas of historical cities, famous Dutch landmarks, and large developments. Madurodam opened its gates in 1952 and it has become one of the most famous places in the Netherlands.

name: Mauritshuis
description: The Mauritshuis Museum is in the city centre of The Hague. The 17th century Mauritshuis was originally used as a residence and hotel for upper class patrons. Today the Mauritshuis is a museum that boasts a compact yet world-famous art collection from the Dutch Golden Age.

name: Peace Palace
description: ‘Het Vredespaleis’ (The Peace Palace) is one of the most photographed buildings in The Hague. Construction of the Peace Palace was finished in 1913; a time when the ideas of pacifism and world peace were flourishing.

name: Escher Museum
address: Lange Voorhout 74, 2514 EH Den Haag, Netherlands
description: Maurits Cornelis Escher was a graphic artist, who created art works that depict impossible situations and optical illusions. Millions of people all over the world have been impressed and astonished by Escher’s art. ‘Escher in the Palace’ (Escher in het Paleis) is a permanent exhibition of Escher’s work.

name: The Prison Museum
description: The Prison Gate Museum ('Gevangenpoort') was originally an entrance gate to the castle of the Counts of Holland. Subsequently, the building was used as a prison to the Court of Holland. Since 1882, the medieval prison has been a museum that tells a tale of crime and punishment.

name: Noordeinde Palace
description: Noordeinde Palace, with its stylish landscaped garden, is one of The Hague’s hidden gems. It is located along the street Noordeinde. You are welcome to take pictures from the street, however, the palace itself is not open to the public, as it is currently used as a working palace.

name: King's College Chapel
description: King’s College Chapel stands on the Cambridge University campus, and is an active place of worship for College scholars. The chapel is a masterpiece of late-Gothic architecture. Construction began in 1446 during the reign of King Henry VI who established both the college and the chapel.

name: Kings College
address: King's College, King's Parade, Cambridge, CB2 1ST. UK
description: King’s College is one of 31 colleges which make up the University of Cambridge. Each college is self-governing and has its own buildings and grounds on the Cambridge University campus. The colleges are divided into “old colleges” established between 1284 and 1596 and “new colleges established since then.

name: Mathematical Bridge
address: Queens' College, Silver Street, Cambridge CB3 9ET, UK
description: The Mathematical Bridge (officially the Wooden Bridge or Queen’s Bridge) is a footbridge that spans the River Cam about 30 meters northwest of Silver Street Bridge on the grounds of Cambridge University’s Queen’s College. The bridge was constructed by James Essex the Younger in 1749 according to designs by William Etheridge.

name: Trinity College
address: Trinity College, Cambridge University, Cambridge, CB2 1TQ, UK
description: Trinity College is one of the 31 colleges that make up Cambridge University. Each of these colleges is self-governing and has its own grounds and buildings on Cambridge campus.

name: St. John's College
address: St. John's College, Cambridge University, Cambridge CB2 1TP
description: St. John’s College is one of the 31 colleges which make up Cambridge University. It was founded by Lady Margaret Beaufort, mother of Henry VII and the foundation charter was established in 1511. The college has about 900 students.

name: The Backs
address: Queen's Road, Cambridge, Cambridgeshire, CB3 9AH, UK
description: The Backs is an area where a number of University of Cambridge colleges “back” onto the River Cam. The area referred to as The Backs covers both sides of the river. The Backs are located east of Queen’s road roughly from Magdalene Bridge to Silver Street Bridge.

name: The Round Church
address: Round Church Vestry, Bridge Street, Cambridge CB2 1UB, Cambridge CB2 1UA, UK
description: The 12th century Round Church in Cambridge is the 2nd oldest building in the city and one of England’s four surviving round churches. Located at the junction of Bridge Street and Round Church Street the church design was inspired by the Holy Sepulcher Church in Jerusalem.

name: Museum of Cambridge
description: The Museum of Cambridge is not one of the eight University of Cambridge museums but rather an independent museum housed in the former White Horse Inn. The timber-framed building itself is fascinating and functioned as a coaching inn from the 17th century.

name: Jesus Green
address: Jesus Green, Chesterton Road, Cambridge, Cambridgesire CB5 8AQ, UK
description: Jesus Green is a relaxing riverside park in north central Cambridge, north of Jesus College and bordered by the River Cam and Park Parade; Victoria Avenue runs through the park. The park is divided by rows of horse chestnut trees and London plane trees; there are wide open lawns.

name: Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes
description: The Sanctuary of Our Lady of Lourdes or the Domain (as it is most commonly known) is an area of ground surrounding the Catholic shrine (Grotto) to Our Lady of Lourdes in the town of Lourdes, France. The Sanctuary is a destination for pilgrimage; sick pilgrims are reputed to be miraculously healed by Lourdes water.

name: The Apes of Gibraltar
description: The Barbary Macaque population in Gibraltar is the only wild monkey population in the European continent. Although most populations in Africa are facing declining populations due to hunting and deforestation, the population of Barbary monkeys in Gibraltar is growing.

name: Gibraltar Museum
description: The Gibraltar Museum is a national museum of history, culture and natural history located within the city centre of the British overseas territory of Gibraltar.

name: SS Great Britain
address: Great Western Dockyard, Gas Ferry Rd, Bristol BS1 6TY, UK
description: The SS Great Britain was created by Isambard Kingdom Brunel in 1843. The ship was unique in being the longest passenger ship in the world and being the first iron steamer fitted with a screw propeller. The ship combined technology, innovation and power and changed ship-building history.

name: Bristol Cathedral
description: Bristol Cathedral opened its doors in 1148 under the name St Augustine’s Abbey. Following the Dissolution of the Monasteries in 1539 the church became the seat of the newly appointed Bishop of Bristol. Over the years various parts of the structure were added or changed.

name: Clifton Suspension Bridge
description: The Clifton Suspension Bridge spans the River Avon and Avon Gorge connecting Clifton to Leigh Woods. The bridge was created by Hawkshaw and Barlow but they based their plans on the designs of Isambard Kingdom Brunel (1806-1859). The bridge was initially built in 1864.

name: At-Bristol
address: Anchor Rd, Harbourside, Bristol BS1 5DB, UK
description: For the past 17 years At-Bristol science museum has inspired and fascinated visitors making science accessible to all. In 2017 At-Bristol got a new name “We the Curious” and the mission statement became to create a culture of curiosity removing boundaries between science, people, ideas and art.

name: Ashton Court Mansion
address: Ashton Court Estate, Long Ashton, Bristol BS41 9JN, UK
description: The Ashton Court Mansion and estate near Bristol are listed historical properties. The first manor home to stand at Ashton Court was in the 11th century. Between the 16th and 20 the centuries the property was owned by the Smyth family.

name: Castle Park
address: Castle Park, Broad Weir, Bristol, BS1 3XB, UK
description: Castle Park (Castle Green) is a large green space in Bristol bordered by Broad Weir, High Street, the Floating Harbour, Castle Street and Penn Street. The park is the site of the remains of Bristol Castle including the vaults, walls and keep. In the park there is a bandstand where musical events are regularly held.

name: National Sea Life Centre
address: The Waters Edge, 3 Brindleyplace, Birmingham B1 2HL, UK
description: The National Sea Life Centre, Birmingham has over 60 displays of sea and fresh water life and houses more than 2,000 creatures from around the world. The largest of the tanks holds 1 million liters of sea water and is home to giant green sea turtles, tropical reef fish and blacktip reef sharks.

name: Birmingham Back to Backs
description: Birmingham Back to Backs is a museum consisting of several restored 19th century courtyard homes once occupied by the city’s working class. The homes have been fitted out and furnished to recreate the living conditions of the 19th century ordinary people who worked to make Birmingham great.

name: Museum of the Jewellery Quarter
address: 75-80 Vyse St, Hockley, Birmingham B18 6HA, UK
description: The Museum of the Jewellery Quarter is housed in the former family-run factory of Smith and Pepper which produced gold jewellery here for more than 80 years. When operations ended in 1981 the factory was left as it was and unbeknown to the owners they preserved this slice of history for generations to come.

name: National Motorcycle Museum
address: Coventry Road, Bickenhill, Hampton in Arden, Solihull B92 0EJ, UK
description: The National Motorcycle Museum is on the J6 island of the M42 highway near Solihull and covers 8 acres. The museum was founded by Roy Richards using his own personal collection of motorcycles as the core of the museum collection. The museum holds the world’s largest and finest collection of British-made motorcycles.

name: Brighton Palace Pier
description: The iconic Brighton Palace Pier was designed by Richard St George Moore and opened in 1899. The pier stretches out into the sea 0.52km and is home to classic Victorian pleasure pier structures. It is hailed as one of the finest piers in the world.

name: Royal Pavilion
description: The Royal Pavilion was created in 1787 by architect Henry Holland as a seaside home for George, Prince of Wales. He transformed the royal home to a neo-classical villa called Marine Pavilion. Then in 1815 the Prince hired John Nash to redesign the property in an opulent Indo-Saracenic style.

name: Brighton Museum & Art Gallery
address: Royal Pavilion Gardens, 12A Pavilion Parade, Brighton BN1 1EE, UK
description: Brighton Museum & Art Gallery is located in the gardens of the Royal Pavilion in a space completed in 1805 and intended to be tennis courts but later used as cavalry barracks. The museum and gallery have occupied their current building since 1902.

name: The Lanes
