description: The Lanes are an historic quarter in Brighton originally part of the Brighthelmstone settlement. Here you will find a maze of quaint narrow lanes and alleyways lined with unique stores, edgy boutiques, quirky specialist shops, funky restaurants, antique stores, galleries and tearooms.

name: Sea Life Brighton
address: Marine Parade, Brighton, East Sussex, BN2 1TB
description: Sea Life Brighton is situated opposite the iconic Brighton Pier; it is housed in one of the oldest aquarium buildings constructed in the world constructed in 1872. Today the site has been modernized and offers all the thrills and excitement that the Sea Life brand is known for.

name: Hove Park
description: Hove Park in the city of Brighton & Hove covers almost 40 acres. A paved path runs around the circumference of the park for about 1.89km. The park has several other paths, areas of open grass, tall trees, flower beds, sports facilities and public sculptures.

name: Brighton Beach
description: There is 8.7km of unbroken shingle (pebble) beach along Brighton’s coast. There are four main Brighton beaches; from east to west they are Hove Beach; Palace Pier Beach (Central Beach or Brighton Beach); Kemp Town Beach and Brighton Naturist Beach (Black Rock) by the marina.

name: Regency Square
description: Regency Square, Brighton faces the seafront opposite British Airways i360. Originally the site was called Belle Vue Field and would host fairs, parades and traveling shows. In 1793 a large military encampment was set up on the land in response to the threat from France.

name: Cardiff Castle
description: Cardiff Castle is a Wales’ heritage attraction nestled among lush parklands within the city of Cardiff. The castle holds 2,000 years of history dating back to when it was a Roman fort founded in the 50s AD.

name: National Museum Cardiff
description: The National Museum Cardiff holds collections of art, geology, archaeology, zoology, botany and natural history as well as being a venue for special events, temporary exhibitions and touring exhibitions. It is housed in the Cardiff Civic Centre in the center of the city.

name: Cardiff Bay
description: In the 1790s mining in Wales spurred the industrial revolution in Cardiff and the expanding industry needed new ways of transporting the precious coal and iron. By the 1830s construction began on a number of docks. The first was Bute West Dock then Bute East Dock; Roath Dock and in 1907 the Queen Alexandra Dock.

name: Wales Millennium Centre
address: Bute Pl, Cardiff, Cardiff Bay CF10 5AL, UK
description: The Wales Millennium Centre is a state-of-the-art performance venue in the Cardiff Bay area. The complex covers 7.5 acres and it was first opened in 2004.

name: Sanssouci Palace & Park
description: Sanssouci is one of the most charming destinations in Postdam and one of the very first palace museums in Germany. With influences of Rococo style of architecture the museum stands prominently in the middle of the Park Sanssouci.

name: Dutch Quarter
description: The Dutch quarter or the Holländisches Viertel consists of two story red brick houses which were built between 1734 and 1742. Despite its location in the heart of Potsdam, the Dutch quarter never fails to make you feel like you are in the Netherlands. The facades are designed in Dutch style.

name: New Palace
description: Situated on the western side of the Sanssouci Park, the New Palace is a structure built in the 18th century. Considered as the final Prussian baroque palace, the construction of the building was commenced at the end of the Seven Years war to celebrate the success of Prussia.

name: Cecilienhof
description: Cecilienhof Palace is significant in the pages of history as the most revered decisions shaping the world was taken here when the allied powers met after the end of Second World War.

name: Babelsberg Park
description: Located in the north-eastern part of the city of Potsdam, Babelsberg Park is one of the biggest parks in the city. It is built over an area of 11.4 hectare and is bordered by the Tiefen Lake connected to the River Havel. Peter Joseph Lenne created this park on a rolling terrain inclined towards the lake.

name: Brandenburg Gate
description: Brandenburg Gate was built by Frederick the Great towards the end of the Seven Years’ War. The gate was meant to symbolize the king’s victory while its design was inspired from Roman triumphal arch. The Roman influence is clearly visible as the gate features double columns in the Corinthian style.

name: Old Market Square
description: The Old Market Square is a historical center in the Potsdam region. The square is typically the area that is exactly in front of the St. Nicholas Church. The market square is surrounded by numerous buildings that bear historical importance.

name: Santiago de Compostela Cathedral
address: Praza do Obradoiro, s/n, 15704 Santiago de Compostela, A Coruña, Spain
description: The Cathedral of Santiago de Compostela is well-known as the burial site of St. James the Great, a biblical apostle of Jesus Christ. Due to this, the cathedral is also considered as the traditional culmination point of the Camino de Santiago pilgrimage route since the Middle Ages.

name: Toulon Cathedral
address: 55 Place de la Cathédrale, 83000 Toulon, France
description: Toulon Cathedral (French: Cathédrale Notre-Dame-de-la-Seds de Toulon; Notre-Dame-de-la-Sède de Toulon), also known as Sainte-Marie-Majeure, is a Roman Catholic church located in Toulon, in the Var department of France. It is a national monument.

name: Tyne Bridge
address: A167, Gateshead, Newcastle upon Tyne NE8 2BH, UK
description: The Tyne Bridge is a beautiful through arch bridge that spans the River Tyne between Swing Bridge and Gateshead Millennium Bridge connecting the city of Newcastle to the town of Gateshead. It is a steel arch bridge with concrete towers on each bank of the river. The bridge spans 162m with a total length of 389m.

name: Quayside
description: Quayside in Newcastle runs along the north bank of the River Tyne and the south bank in Gateshead across the water. Quayside played an important role in Newcastle’s industrial history and was once a busy commercial dock. Today Quayside has been gentrified and offers visitors a street market; cultural venues and new housing.

name: Newcastle Cathedral
address: St. Nicholas Sq, Newcastle upon Tyne NE1 1PF, UK
description: The first church to be built on the Newcastle Cathedral site was during the Norman era (11th century) and probably made of wood. It was rebuilt in stone in the 12th century and damaged by fire in the following years. Changes were made to the structure in the 14th century allowing more natural light to enter the church.

name: Leeds City Museum
description: The Leeds City Museum is located on Millennium Square and occupies the former Mechanics’ Institute designed by Cuthbert Brodrick who also designed the Leeds Town Hall. The museum originally opened (at a different location) in 1819.

name: Museo de Zaragoza
description: Zaragoza Museum (Spanish: Museo de Zaragoza), also called provincial museo de Zaragoza (Provincial Museum of Zaragoza) and Museo de Bellas Artes de Zaragoza (Museum of Fine Arts of Saragossa) was opened in 1911 at No.

name: Museo Goya - Colección Ibercaja - Museo Camón Aznar
address: Calle Espoz y Mina, 23, 50003 Zaragoza, Spain
description: The Goya Museum - Ibercaja Collection - Camón Aznar Museum is a museum of fine arts located on Espoz y Mina Street, 23 in Zaragoza (Aragón, Spain). The museum houses more than a thousand works. [ 1 ] Among all, there are more than five hundred that are more significant are exposed in their permanent rooms.

name: Rocher de la Vierge
description: The rock of the Virgin is a tourist natural curiosity shaped like a long hull of ship, overhung by a statue of the Virgin. It is an emblematic monument of the city of Biarritz in the Pyrénées-Atlantiques.

name: Mont Blanc
description: Mont Blanc (pronounced [mɔ̃ blɑ̃]) or Monte Bianco meaning "White Mountain", is the highest mountain in the Alps and the highest in Europe west of Russia's Caucasus peaks. It rises 4,808 m (15,774 ft) above sea level and is ranked 11th in the world in topographic prominence.

name: Lake District National Park
address: Old Station Yard, Threlkeld, Keswick CA12 4TT, UK
description: The Lake District, also known as the Lakes or Lakeland, is a mountainous region in North West England. A popular holiday destination, it is famous for its lakes, forests and mountains (or fells), and its associations with William Wordsworth and the other Lake Poets and with Beatrix Potter and John Ruskin.

name: Puerto Banús
description: Puerto José Banús, more commonly known simply as Puerto Banús, is a marina located in the area of Nueva Andalucía, to the southwest of Marbella, Spain on the Costa del Sol. It was built in May 1970 by José Banús, a local property developer, as a luxury marina and shopping complex.

name: La Encarnación
address: Plaza de la Iglesia, 29601 Marbella, Málaga, Spain
description: The Iglesia de la Encarnación (Church of the Incarnation) is a church in Marbella, southern Spain.

name: Blackpool Tower
description: Blackpool Tower is a tourist attraction in Blackpool, Lancashire, England, which was opened to the public on 14 May 1894. Inspired by the Eiffel Tower in Paris, it is 518 feet (158 metres) tall and is the 120th tallest freestanding tower in the world.

name: Madame Tussauds Blackpool
description: Madame Tussauds Blackpool is a wax museum located in Blackpool, United Kingdom. The attraction opened in 2011, replacing the previous Louis Tussauds waxworks. It features over 80 wax figures of famous celebrities, film and television characters, athletes and musicians.

name: Sea Life
description: There are more than 2,000 aquatic animals to be seen at Sea Life in Blackpool. The fascinating creatures are divided into 50 different displays. You will be able to explore sea life underwater without having to get into the sea.

name: Hill Top
description: Hill Top is a 17th-century house in Near Sawrey near Hawkshead, in the English county of Cumbria. It is an example of Lakeland vernacular architecture with random stone walls and slate roof. The house was once the home of children's author and illustrator Beatrix Potter who left it to the National Trust.

name: Beatrix Potter Gallery
address: Main St, Hawkshead, Ambleside LA22 0NS, UK
description: The Beatrix Potter Gallery is a gallery run by the National Trust and situated in a 17th-century stone-built house in Hawkshead, Cumbria, England. It is dedicated to presenting original book illustrations by Beatrix Potter.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: Without a doubt the most important landmark in Sydney and perhaps the most important in all of Australia, the Sydney Opera House is a performing arts center with stunning architecture. The Opera House is a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Darling Harbour
description: Darling Harbour Precinct is located 10 minutes from the city center and is a lively area with stores, restaurants, attractions and entertainment but the site has a long and fascinating history. The harbor is named after Lieutenant-General Ralph Darling who was Governor of NSW from 1825 to 1831.

name: Sydney Tower
description: The Sydney Tower is the tallest free-standing structure in the city and the 2nd tallest observation tower in the Southern Hemisphere. It is the city's tallest structure and the 3rd tallest in the country. The tower is 309 meters tall and accessed through Pitt Street Mall.

name: Sea Life Sydney Aquarium
description: 13,000 sea creatures from 650 species live at this large aquarium. The impressive design of the building resembles a wave and is one of the world's largest aquariums.

name: The Rocks
description: The Rocks was the traditional home of the Gadigal Aboriginal people and the site of the first European landing in 1788. The Rocks precinct is located on the southern shore of Sydney Harbour.

name: Sydney Harbour Bridge
address: Sydney Harbour Bridge, Sydney NSW, Australia
description: One of the iconic symbols of the city is this aesthetically pleasing structure which spans Sydney Harbour. The "coat hanger" as it is affectionately nicknamed, was erected in 1932 after 6 years in the making.

name: Museum of Sydney
address: Corner Bridge Street & Philip Street,  Sydney NSW 2000
description: The building which houses the Museum of Sydney was built on the ruins of Australia's first Government House, the home of NSW's first Governor, Arthur Phillip constructed in 1788. The remains of the historic building were discovered in 1983 and fittingly the museum which stands on this site is devoted to the history of Sydney.

name: Australian Museum
description: This museum has led the way in scientific research and collections of rare and unusual specimens of natural history and anthropology since 1827. This is the oldest museum in the country. The museum is housed within a Greek revival style building built in 1857.

name: National Maritime Museum
description: Located in Darling Harbor this museum holds the relics, documents and seafaring crafts of Australian maritime history. The museum was constructed over 20 years ago as part of a redevelopment program in the harbor.

name: Bondi Beach
description: Bondi Beach is the name of a Sydney suburb and the adjacent beach which has gained iconic status among surfers and beach lovers. The name Bondi comes from the Aboriginal word "Boondi" which means water breaking over rocks. Europeans settled here and started building homes between 1905 and 1935.

name: Powerhouse Museum
description: Powerhouse Museum is a branch of the Museum of Applied Arts and Sciences and gets its name from the museum building which is a former electric tram power station.

name: Sydney Harbour National Park
description: Thanks to this National Park the foreshore lands and islands in and around Sydney Harbour are protected by law.

name: St. James Church
description: Sydney's Anglican parish church is located on King Street it was first consecrated in 1824 and is one of several colonial buildings in the historic precinct of Macquarie Street. The church was designed by Francis Greenway, an English architect who became a convict sent to Australia for forgery. St.

name: Sydney Observatory
description: This working museum on Observatory Hill became an astronomical observatory in 1858. It is a listed heritage site in The Rocks district. Its original role was primarily to provide time using a time-ball tower. The tower would drop a ball at exactly 13:00 every day so that the residents could set their timepieces accordingly.

name: Federation Square
description: Fed Square is in the heart of Melbourne at the corner of Swanston and Flinders Streets. Fed Square is built on a level above busy railway lines. The area is made up of St. Paul's Court and The Square which are open squares as well as the covered Atrium. The Atrium is 5 stories high with glazed walls and exposed metal.

name: Eureka Tower
description: Eureka Tower is a Melbourne skyscraper in the Southbank precinct on the southern bank of the Yarra River. Eureka towers 297.3 meters from the ground and was named after the Eureka Stockade rebellion which took place during the gold rush in Victoria (1854).  The colors used on the exterior are symbolic of the rebellion.

name: St Pauls Cathedral
address: Cnr. Flinders Street and Swanston Street, Melbourne VIC 3000
description: Melbourne's Anglican St. Paul's Cathedral is located on the corner of Flinders and Swanston Street opposite Fed Square. The Neo-Gothic building was constructed between 1880 and 1931 and replaced an earlier place of worship which stood on the same site.

name: National Gallery of Victoria
description: NGV was founded in 1861; it is the oldest public art museum in the country and holds more than 68,000 works of art. The museum has two buildings in the city's art district only a short distance from each other.

name: Melbourne Aquarium
address: Corner Flinders Street and King Street,  Melbourne VIC 3000
description: Located on King Street is the Melbourne Sea Life Aquarium. The large modern facility is divided into zones each highlighting a specific form of sea life. The aquarium is home to more than 10,000 creatures. The aquarium focuses on creatures from the Southern Ocean and Antarctic.

name: Queen Victoria Market
address: 155 Victoria Street (Cnr. Elizabeth St. and Victoria St.),  North Melbourne VIC 3051
description: Melbourne's market was established in 1878; the market is open 5 days a week and closed Mondays and Wednesdays.

name: Royal Botanic Gardens
description: Lieutenant Governor Charles La Trobe established the Melbourne Botanic Gardens in 1846 and oversaw its transformation from a swamp land to a world-class landscaped garden.

name: Shrine of Remembrance
description: Melbourne's Shrine of Remembrance is Victoria's way of honoring those who have served in the country's armed forces during war time and peace time. Here all visitors can learn about the contribution Australian service people have made.

name: Melbourne Museum
description: Melbourne Museum is devoted to the culture, history, natural environment and people of Victoria. The museum is located in Carlton Gardens; it is the largest museum in the Southern Hemisphere and has won several awards for excellence.

name: St Patricks Cathedral
description: Melbourne's St. Patrick's Cathedral is the mother church of the Catholic Archdiocese of the city. The Gothic-Revival architecture of the Cathedral makes it one of the most attractive churches in the country as well as Australia's tallest and largest church.

name: Melbourne Zoo
description: The Melbourne Zoo is located in the city center and is home to more than 300 species from across the globe. The zoo is active in animal conservation and this message is brought across in the exhibits which try to recreate the animal's natural habitats.

name: National Sports Museum
address: Gate 3,  Olympic Stand,  Melbourne Cricket Ground, Brunton Ave., Richmond, East Melbourne VIC 3002 (within Yarra Park)
description: The National Sports Museum is located at the MCG (Melbourne Cricket Ground). The museum holds a collection of sporting memorabilia which highlights the greatest moments in Australian sporting history. In all there are over 3,000 artifacts on display.

name: Luna Park
description: The Melbourne Luna Park is an amusement park located on Port Phillip Bay next to St. Kilda Beach. It opens weekdays, school holidays and public holidays throughout the year from 11:00 to 20:00.

name: ArtVo Immersive Art Gallery
address: 26 Star Cres, Level, Harbour Town, Docklands, Victoria 3008
description: The first of its kind in the Southern Hemisphere, a new Melbourne art gallery is allowing visitors to step beyond the red velvet rope and get up close and personal with some of the world’s most mind-bending artwork.

name: Sky Tower
address: 72 Victoria St W, Auckland, Auckland 1010, New Zealand
description: The Sky Tower stands at 328 meters and is New Zealand’s tallest man-made structure and the tallest man-made structure in the southern hemisphere. The building serves as a telecommunications tower and is part of SKYCITY Auckland, a complex which includes a casino and hotel as well as the observation deck.

name: Albert Park
description: This park is a 3 minute drive from Downtown Auckland, bordered by Kitchener Street, Wellesley Street, Princes Street and Bowen Avenue. It is one of the city’s most important parks because of its central location, distinctive character and long history.

name: Auckland Domain
address: 20 Park Road, Grafton, Auckland, New Zealand.
description: This is one of Auckland’s oldest and largest parks stretching 75 hectares in the central suburb of Graton. The park was created in the 1840s around the crater of the extinct Pukekawa Volcano.

name: Auckland Museum
address: Auckland Domain, Parnell, Auckland 1010, New Zealand
description: The Auckland War Memorial Museum holds a collection focused on New Zealand history including military history and natural history with the emphasis on the Auckland region. The museum is housed in an iconic neo-classical building which stands on the remains of an extinct volcano in the Auckland Domain Park.

name: Auckland Art Gallery
address: Cnr. Kitchener and Wellesley Streets, Auckland
description: The country’s leading art museum is housed in an iconic building with exhibition space on four levels. The original building was completed in 1887 in the French Renaissance style and was extended in 1916. The building has a distinct six storey corner clock tower.

name: Kelly Tarlton's Sea Life Aquarium
address: 23 Tamaki Drive, Orakei, Auckland 1010, New Zealand
description: Have fun at this huge attraction which holds 30 exhibits, 80 different species of marine life and 8 new themed zones. The aquarium building’s unique design includes conveyer belt-like moving walkways which slowly move visitors through the exhibit areas.

name: Devonport
address: Devonport, Auckland, New Zealand; ferries leave Auckland from Ferry Terminal, 99 Quay Street, Auckland and arrive at the Devonport Wharf, 1 Queen Parade.
description: Devonport is a suburb in north Auckland; a historic seaside village with loads of charm and plenty to discover. Devonport is the site of a navy base which has influenced the suburb’s character. The biggest draw to Devonport is the harbor side restaurants and bars with its picturesque scenery.

name: Rangitoto Island
address: Catch ferry to the island from: Ferry Terminal, 99 Quay Street, Auckland
description: Rangitoto Island was created in the Hauraki Gulf about 700 years ago by volcanic eruptions; it is the youngest of 48 Auckland volcanic cones. The circular island rises 260 meters from the water surface; it covers 2311 hectares and is rich in 200 species of plants and trees including the largest Pohutukawa forest in the world.

name: Tiritiri Matangi Island
address: 360 Discovery Ferry leaves from Auckland 139 Quay Street, City Ferry Terminal, Pier 4 and from Gulf Harbor Marina.
description: This island is a wildlife sanctuary just 4km off the coast of the Whangaparaoa Peninsula in the Hauraki Gulf. The Maori people were the first to settle here and the Europeans arrived in the early 19th century.

name: Auckland Zoo
address: 99 Motions Rd, Western Springs, Auckland 1022, New Zealand
description: This zoo covers 40 acres and has been open since 1922. There are 138 species of animals from all across the globe. In all there are more than 875 animals here which makes it the largest collection of animals in New Zealand. Animals include mammals, birds, reptiles, amphibians, fish and invertebrates.

name: Waiheke Island
address: Waiheke Island, Hauraki Gulf, Auckland, 1081, New Zealand.
description: This is the most popular of the Hauraki Islands and the second largest. It is easily accessible by ferries which run throughout the day from Auckland and Devonport. The island has won many accolades as the “best” island, destination, etc.

name: Bethells Beach
description: Bethells Beach is in the Waitakere Ranges about 30km northwest of Auckland at the mount of the Waitakere River. Sand dunes separate the beach from three dune-impounded lakes – Lake Waiataru, Lake Kawaupaka and Lake Wainamu.

name: Kings Park & Botanic Garden
address: Fraser Ave, Kings Park WA 6005, Australia
description: This huge park covers 4.06km² and is one of the largest inner city parks in the world. It is located on the edge of Perth’s central business district. The site has a rich history dating back to the Aboriginal people and early colonialists as well as playing an important role in contemporary culture.

name: Fremantle Markets
address: Fremantle markets, Corner South Terrace and Henderson Street, Fremantle, WA, 6959, Australia.
description: The Fremantle Market has been around since 1897 when people would arrive at the Victorian buildings which functioned as a wholesale market until the 1950s. From the 50s to 70s the buildings were used for packing and distribution and then in 1975 the buildings were restored.

name: Perth Mint
address: Perth Mint, 310 Hay Street, CBD, East Perth WA 6004, Australia
description: The Perth Mint is the country’s official bullion mint which dates back to 1899. The main attraction of this site is the Gold Exhibition which uses the latest exhibition techniques to bring the history of Western Australian gold to life using audio visuals and concept design.

name: Round House
address: Round House, Arthur Head, Captain Ln, Fremantle WA 6160, Australia
description: The Round House (which actually has 12 sides) is the oldest surviving public building in the state; it was first opened in 1831, eighteen months after the British Swan River Colony settlement was established in 1829. The structure was purpose-built to detain convicted criminals and it was used for this purpose until 1886.

name: Fremantle Prison
description: Fremantle Prison is Western Australia’s only UNESCO World Heritage Site. The 15 acre former prison includes cell blocks, gate houses, security walls, underground tunnels and cottages. Convict labor was used to build the complex which was completed in 1859. The prison remained in use until 1991.

name: Aquarium of Western Australia
description: The Aquarium of Western Australia is one of the country’s largest aquariums and has the largest single aquarium tank as well as the largest walk-through tunnel underwater in the Shipwreck Coast aquarium and one of the largest living coral reef exhibits in the world.

name: Bell Tower
address: The Bell Tower, Riverside Dr, Barrack Square, Perth WA 6000, Australia
description: The 82.5 meter high Bell Tower stands in Barrack Square overlooking Swan River. The tower has a unique design chosen from participants in a design competition and the structure also holds a treasure trove of interesting historic artifacts as well as a famous set of bells.

name: Art Gallery of Western Australia
address: Perth Cultural Center, Perth, WA, 6000 Australia
description: The Western Australia Art Collection is housed in this art museum at the Perth Cultural Center. The main gallery building was built in 1977 and features elements of Bauhaus architecture with a Brutalist exterior. At the time of construction the architectural design was considered innovative.

name: Swan Valley
address: Swan Valley Visitor Center, Corner Meadow and Swan Streets, Guildford, WA, 6055, Australia.
description: Twenty-five minutes from Perth is Swan Valley, a region between Guildford and Bells Rapids around the upper area of Swan River and bordered on the eastern side by the Darling Scarp. Swan Valley was the site of some of the earliest European settlements and you can still see historic homes, old pubs and ancient churches.

name: Perth Zoo
address: 20 Labouchere Road, South Perth WA 6151, Australia
description: Just 5 minutes from Perth’s CBD is this huge zoo which opened in 1898. It is spread over 17 hectors and is home to more than 1258 animals representing 164 species. In addition to the animals the grounds hold a botanical garden. The grounds of the zoo are split into three zones each home to animals from different environments.

name: Rottnest Island
description: Take a day trip to this island paradise. Rottnest is a low lying island covering 19km² about 18km off shore from Fremantle. It is a protected area due to its pristine eco-system, bird life, flora and fauna. Several species of birds nest by the shallow salt lakes of the island.

name: Caversham Wildlife Park
address: Caversham Wildlife Park, Whiteman Park, Whiteman, WA, 6068, Australia (enter from Lord Street or Beechboro Road; car park 8 in the Village is the closest one to the Wildlife Park)
description: Caversham Wildlife Park is a family owned and run home for Australian animals; there are approximately 200 species and more than 2,000 animals, reptiles and birds. It is the largest privately owned collection of indigenous animals in Western Australia.

name: Cottesloe Beach
description: Cottesloe Beach is the most popular beach in Perth; located half way between the city center and Fremantle. The beachside community of Cottesloe is known for its laid back lifestyle and village atmosphere which people have been enjoying for 100 years.

name: Nambung National Park
address: Namburg National Park, WA 6521, Australia (access the park via the Indian Ocean Drive or Cervantes Road)
description: This Park is near the small town of Cervantes, 200km from Perth. The park runs along the coast and is bordered in the north by the Southern Beekeeper’s Nature Reserve and in the south by the Wanagarren Reserve.

name: Shoalwater Islands Marine Park
address: 153 Arcadia Drive, Shoalwater Bay, Rockingham, Western Australia, 6169, Australia (ferries leave from Mersey Point)
description: The Shoalwater Islands Marine Park is a 6,540 hectare area off-shore of the Shoalwater suburb stretching from the northern point of Cape Peron to the southern point of Becher Point just 45 minutes from Perth.

name: Wave Rock
address: Wave Rock Road, Hyden, WA, 6359, Australia
description: This natural rock formation resembles a tall breaking wave, hence its name. It was formed 2700 million years ago and stands 14 meters high and is 110 meters long. The Wave has different colored streaks running down the rock formed by rain washing chemical deposits down the wave.

name: Scarborough Beach
address: Scarborough Beach Road and the Esplanade, Scarborough, Stirling, WA, 6019, Australia
description: Another of Perth’s amazing beaches, Scarborough Beach in western Perth on the SunSet Coast has white sand facing the Indian Ocean.  Scarborough is a small suburb 14km from Perth city center. The Scarborough suburb has a large British expat community and was named after the UK beach resort of the same name.

name: Roma Street Parkland
description: This 16 hectare park lies in the center of Brisbane; it is the world’s most expansive subtropical parkland in a city center. Within the park there are a number of themed gardens, playgrounds, pathways, boardwalks, waterways and public art.

name: South Bank Parklands
address: South Bank Parkland, Stanley St, South Brisbane QLD 4101, Australia
description: As the name suggests this park is located at South Bank on the former site of Brisbane’s World Expo which took place in 1988.

name: Brisbane City Hall & Museum of Brisbane
description: This is three attractions rolled into one. You can see the City Hall, the Brisbane Museum which is housed here and take a tower tour of the Brisbane City Hall Clock Tower. The City Hall is a Heritage Listed building constructed in the 1920s and 1930s.

name: Mount Coot-tha Lookout
address: Sir Samuel Griffith Drive, Mount Coot-tha, Brisbane, Queensland, Australia.
description: For more than a century locals and visitors to Brisbane have been coming here to enjoy the scenic views from the elevated location on Mt. Coot-tha. The mount is part of the Taylor Mountain Range and is located just 7km west of Brisbane’s city center and is a listed Heritage Site.

name: Wheel of Brisbane
address: Cultural Forecourt, Russell Street, South Bank Parklands South Brisbane QLD 4101, Australia
description: For the best views of the city take a ride in this high state-of-the-art Ferris wheel. The Wheel of Brisbane is located in the South Bank Parklands. The observation wheel takes you 60 meters in the air in an enclosed capsule or gondola.

name: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary
address: 708 Jesmond Rd, Fig Tree Pocket QLD 4069, Australia
description: This koala sanctuary was the first of its kind in the world opened in 1927 and the largest. It is home to 130 koalas in addition to another 100 Australian species who also call this sanctuary home. The park has lush gardens and a natural setting spread over 18 hectare.

name: Brisbane River
address: Brisbane River; CityCat Ferry: North Quay, South Bank 3, Maritime Museum, Thornton Street, Eagle Street Pier, Holman Street, Dockside, Sydney Street Terminal.
description: Any trip to Brisbane should include some time spent on the river. The river is the longest in south east Queensland (344km) and runs from Mount Stanley through Brisbane and into Moreton Bay.

name: Queensland Museum
address: Corner of Grey and Melbourne Streets, South Bank, South Brisbane QLD 4101, Australia
description: The state museum has four campuses Townsville, Toowoomba, Ipswich and this branch in South Brisbane in the heart of the city’s cultural precinct. The museum was founded in 1862 and aims to highlight Queensland’s past, its cultures, history and people.

name: Story Bridge
address: Story Bridge, Bradfield Highway, Brisbane, QLD, Australia
description: This iconic Brisbane bridge is a heritage listed site and spans the Brisbane River. The bridge is Australia’s longest cantilever bridge; it is a continuation of the Bradfield Highway which connects Kangaroo Point to Fortitude Valley.

name: Museum of Brisbane
address: 3rd level, Brisbane City Hall, Corner of Adelaide and Ann Street, QLD, Australia. (entrance through the King George Square foyer)
description: This museum focuses on the history of the city and is located in the City Hall building which is in itself an attraction and landmark structure. The museum is managed by the City of Brisbane and is the custodian of the city’s art collection.

name: Moreton Island National Park
address: Moreton Island, Queensland, Australia. Accessed via ferry from 14 Howard Smith Drive, Port of Brisbane, QLD, 4178.
description: Moreton Island is located just 40km off shore from Brisbane and is reached by ferry. Ferries leave daily and carry both pedestrians and vehicles. It is necessary to book the ferry crossing ahead of time.

name: Skyrail Rainforest Cableway
description: Take this cable car ride for an unforgettable journey through Australia’s World Heritage listed Tropical Rainforests; the oldest surviving rainforest in the world. The cableway spans 7.5km and crosses the McAlister Range going through Barron Gorge National Park between Smithfield and Kuranda.

name: Cairns Botanic Gardens
address: Collins Avenue, Edge Hill, Cairns, Queensland, Australia 4870
description: This is one of the top rated attractions in Cairns and you don’t need to travel far to see it as it is located 5km from the Cairns city center. The garden was first mentioned in documents dating back to 1876.

name: Tjapukai Aboriginal Cultural Park
address: Corner of Captain Cook Hwy and Cairns Western Arterial Road, Caravonica, QLD, 4878,  Australia (by Skyrail)
description: This site is advertised as being “where Australia begins.” It is easily accessible and an authentic site where you can learn about the Aboriginal culture and the culture of the Torres Strait Islanders which dates back 40,000 years. The attraction focuses on the traditions and culture of the local Djabugay people.

name: Northern Beaches
description: In addition to the lush rainforests and the gorgeous Great Barrier Reef the Cairns region is known for its beautiful beaches. A vacation in Queensland should include some time enjoying the pristine white sands and translucent waters.

name: Rainforestation Nature Park
description: Spread over 100 acres this site is just five minutes from Kuranda village center. It is part of the World Heritage Rainforest. The center aims to give visitors an insight into the indigenous flora, fauna and culture. While at the Rainforestation you can take an Army Duck Rainforest Tour on an amphibious WWII army duck (DUKW).

name: Kuranda Scenic Railway
address: Cairns Station, Bunda Street, Cairns, Queensland, Australia.
description: This railway runs from Cairns, stopping at Freshwater and Barron Falls then reaching its final point in Kuranda. The railway was originally constructed in 1886 and operated as a passenger train.

name: Kuranda Koala Gardens
address: Heritage Markets, Rob Veivers Drive, Kuranda QLD 4881, Australia
description: See some of the region’s unique animals in the heart of Kuranda. The star of this attraction is the koala. Visitors can see the koalas in their recreated natural environment and even have the opportunity to hold them and have their photos taken cuddling a koala.

name: Australian Butterfly Sanctuary
address: 8 Rob Veivers Dr, Kuranda Village, QLD 4881, Australia
description: This is the largest butterfly free-flight aviary in the Southern Hemisphere; it is home to more than 2000 butterflies.

name: Cairns Wildlife Dome
address: The Reef Hotel Casino, 35-41 Wharf St, Cairns City QLD 4870, Australia
description: A natural setting has been recreated under a giant 20 meter high dome so that activities can take place in all weather. Human visitors and animals can mingle within a recreated rainforest. The site is located on top of the Reef Hotel Casino.

name: Daintree Rainforest National Park
address: 2333 Cape Tribulation Road, Diwan, QLD, Queensland, 4873, and 212R Mossman Gorge Road, QLD 4873
description: About an hour north of Cairns is this tropical rainforest; it covers 1,200km² and is the largest continuous area of tropical rainforest in Australia. The rainforest’s two main sections can be entered from Mossman Gorge 80km north of Cairns and Cape Tribulation 110km north of Cairns.

name: Hartley's Crocodile Adventures
address: Captain Cook Highway, Wangetti Beach, Queensland, 4879, Australia
description: This is an award winning eco-tourism site spread over 10 hectares and part of a World Heritage site. The land has been restored and renovated including the construction of 2100 meters of boardwalks and pathways through the natural environment so that visitors can get up close to animals in their natural environment.

name: Green Island
description: Green Island is a coral cay (low sand island on a coral reef) within the Great Barrier Reef Marine Park, a UNESCO site, just 27km off shore from Cairns. The island was created about 6,000 years ago; it is home to over 120 native plant species, colorful bird life and incredible marine life.

name: Wildlife Habitat Port Douglas
address: Corner Port Douglas Road and Captain Cook Hwy, Port Douglas, QLD 4877, Australia
description: The Wildlife Habitat is located in Port Douglas, about an hour drive from Cairns; you can visit independently or with an organized tour. This is an award winning attraction where visitors can see a wide variety of Australian flora and fauna.

name: Fitzroy Island
description: 25km east of Cairns is the idyllic Fitzroy Island, a 45 minute ferry ride away. The island is also called Koba or Gabar. Much of the island is off-limited to visitors and is protected under the National Conservation Act but the western side is open to those seeking paradise and there is a protected national park.

name: Great Barrier Reef
address: Great Barrier Reef, Queensland, Australia. Tours leave from the Pier Marina, Pier Point Road, Cairns, Queensland, Australia.
description: Perhaps the top reason for visiting Cairns is to explore the Great Barrier Reef. It is the world’s largest reef with almost 3,000 individual reefs, about 900 islands and thousands of underwater plants and tropical fish. The reef stretches for more than 2,300km covering an area of 344,400km².

name: Botanic Gardens
description: Nestled beside the Avon River, set in over 21 hectares of pristine nature, and located right in the middle of New Zealand’s Christchurch, the Botanic Gardens are a true haven for locals and visitors alike. The Gardens were opened in 1863 in honour of Prince Albert’s marriage to Princess Alexandra of Denmark.

name: Canterbury Museum
description: If you’re looking for a cultural experience in Canterbury, whether you’re travelling alone or with the entire family, the Canterbury Museum is a great addition to your itinerary. The museum is built on the principles of cultural diversity and respect, and tells a beautiful story of the history of the region.

name: Cathedral Square
description: Cathedral Square plays an important role in the lives of the residents of Christchurch. Situated right in the middle of the city, the square suffered a fair amount of damage during a spell of earthquakes between September 2010 and February 2011, where over 160 lost their lives across the area.

name: Christchurch Art Gallery
description: Founded in 1932, the Christchurch Art Gallery can be found in the centre of the city’s cultural precinct and is the biggest art institution of its kind on New Zealand’s South Island. The gallery has great importance to the heritage of New Zealand’s native people and the arts community as a whole.

name: International Antarctic Centre
description: Known as the ‘coolest place in Christchurch’, this is one destination you do not want to miss. Whether you’re travelling alone on business, or with the family, it’s an eye-opening experience for all ages. The Centre is fully interactive, and is highly recommended for educational purposes.

name: Willowbank Wildlife Reserve
description: Christchurch is renowned for its beautiful landscapes and cultural sites, yet many visitors are unfamiliar with its nature parks. If you find yourself in this part of the world, Willowbank Wildlife Reserve, in close proximity to Christchurch International Airport, is a great way to spend an entire day with the entire family.

name: Orana Wildlife Park
description: Christchurch is renowned for its rich culture, magnificent views and surrounding nature, but not much attention is given to its wildlife attractions. This is where Orana Wildlife Park stands out as a must-see destination for when you’re in New Zealand.

name: Christchurch Gondola
address: 10 Bridle Path Rd, Heathcote Valley, Christchurch 8022
description: The city of Christchurch is beautiful at any time of year, but seeing it from the ground does not do it justice.

name: Port Hills
description: Have you ever wondered what it’s like to stand on the site of a volcano that erupted millions of years ago, changing the very landscape? The Port Hills, a range in Christchurch, is situated between the city and the Lyttelton port and divide the two areas in a beautiful way.

name: Quake City
address: Re:START Mall, 99 Cashel St, Christchurch Central, Christchurch 8011
description: The earthquake that shook the city of Christchurch in 2011 was one of the worst natural disasters that the country of New Zealand ever faced. Almost 200 people were killed, with many thousands injured. The destruction of property was immense. However, with any tragedy there is also a shining light.

name: Mona Vale
description: If you’re looking to escape the bustle of Christchurch, the Mona Vale Gardens are a true gem. Just a few minutes’ drive from the city centre, the grounds cover almost 6 hectares of pristine land. The grounds are divided up into different lawn areas, each with their own character.

name: SkyPoint Observation Deck
address: Level 77 of Q1 Resort, 9 Hamilton Ave, Surfers Paradise, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: The SkyPoint Observation Deck is located in the tallest residential tower in Australia. It is found on the 77th and 78th levels of the Q1 hotel, giving visitors the height advantage to see far into the distance. The Observation Deck is 230m high and allows for 360-degree views of the Gold Coast.

name: Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary
description: The Currumbin Wildlife Sanctuary is a popular outdoor attraction located on the Gold Coast, Australia. Since 1947, Australian animals have found sanctuary in the large enclosures that make Currumbin so much more than a zoo. There are many varied activities to enjoy in the 67-acre park with over 1,400 animals.

name: Sea World
address: Seaworld Dr, Main Beach, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Sea World, the biggest marine theme park in Australia, is located in Main Beach on the Gold Coast. The park is well designed to give you an excellent opportunity to view sea creatures, and enjoy extra thrills on the theme park rides for both kids and adults.

name: Springbrook National Park
address: Carricks Road, Springbrook, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Springbrook National Park dominates the skyline of the Gold Coast. A plateau was created when a volcanic explosion took place 20 million years ago, preparing the scene for the now green and luscious forest.

name: Purling Brook Falls
address: Forestry Road, Springbrook, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Purling Brook Falls is the largest waterfall in the Springbrook National Park. Springbrook is situated south-west of Surfers Paradise in the lush green of the Gold Coast hinterland. The 110-meter waterfall cascades down into the rainforest valley with ferns and palms providing a green backdrop.

name: Warner Bros. Movie World
address: Pacific Motorway, Oxenford, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: There are only a few movie theme parks that exist out of the United States, and Warner Bros. Movie World in Queensland is one of them. The movie theme park opened in 1991, and has brought with it the excitement of Hollywood to Australia’s Gold Coast. There is something for everyone at Warner Bros.

name: Coolangatta
description: Situated at the end of the Queensland Gold Coast is Coolangatta, a suburb named after a schooner of the same name was wrecked there in 1846. Coolangatta’s strip of beach marks the end of the Gold Coast, and the town is at the edge of Queensland on the border with Tweed Heads in New South Wales.

name: Burleigh Head National Park
address: Goodwin Terrace, Burleigh Heads, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Burleigh Head National Park is located in the Gold Coast Queensland. The park may cover only 74 acres yet it comes with habitats ranging from dense rainforest to the rocky foreshore along the coast. The park is filled with volcanic rock that was formed millions of years ago when the Tweed Volcano was active.

name: Lamington National Park
description: Lamington National Park is a subtropical rainforest located in the Gondwana Rainforests, a protected heritage area. The 21,176 hectare park has over 160 kilometers of walking trails that allow you to immerse yourself in nature. The park is known for its waterfalls, wildflowers, and rare wildlife.

name: Wet'n'Wild Gold Coast
address: Pacific Motorway, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Wet’n’Wild Gold Coast is located in Oxenford near the Warner Bros. Movie World theme park. The water park is open all year round, with heated pools and slides in winter. Wet’n’Wild has something for everyone from the extreme rides in the H2O Zone, to Thrill Rides, and Family Fun.

name: Tamborine National Park
address: Cedar Creek, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: Between 20 and 23 million years ago, volcanic eruptions took place, beginning a process that created fertile ground. Over the years, a rain forest grew in what is now known as the Tamborine National Park. The park forms part of the large area of lush green in the Gold Coast.

name: Australian Outback Spectacular
address: Pacific Motorway, Oxenford, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
description: The Australian Outback Spectacular gives you a chance to experience the old Australian Outback with a show and a special Aussie BBQ as part of a 3-course meal. The shows change from time to time while retaining the basic theme telling iconic Australian legends of stock men and women as they work and play.

name: Hinze Dam
description: The Hinze Dam is located in the Gold Coast Hinterland south west of Nerang. The dam has a 207-square meter catchments area, which then pools into Advancetown Lake, a 3,700-acre reservoir. The original dam was completed in 1976 with expansions in 1989 and 2011.

name: Table Mountain National Park
address: Table Mountain, Cape Town, South Africa; Lower Cable Car Station, Tafelberg Road, Cape Town.
description: Table Mountain watches over Cape Town, an ever-present symbol of the city and together with Signal Hill it forms a semicircle around the city facing Table Bay. Table Mountain is a flat-topped mountain; when the clouds roll over the mountain it is like a tablecloth being spread out on a table.

name: Bo kaap
address: Bo Kaap, Cape Town, South Africa.  Iziko Bo Kaap Museum: 71 Wale Street, Bo Kaap, Cape Town.
description: Bo Kaap is a colorful neighborhood once a mixed-race township called the Malay Quarter. The Bo Kaap district is built on the steep slopes of Signal Hill and the cobbled stone streets are lined with brightly colored houses. Not your usual pastel colors but vibrant grass green, Barbie pink, sunshine yellow and post box red.

name: Boulders Beach
address: Kleintuin Road, Simon's Town, Cape Town, 7975, South Africa
description: Boulders Bay in Simon’s Town holds more than one attraction; there are three beautiful beaches including Boulders Beach, 1 penguin viewing area and 3 boardwalks. The beach is sheltered from wind by the bay and has soft sand. Perhaps the most exciting attraction here is the colony of more than 3,000 African Penguins.

name: Cape of Good Hope Nature Reserve
address: Cape Point Road, Cape Peninsula, Cape Town, 8001, South Africa
description: An hour’s drive from downtown Cape Town is one of the most picturesque nature reserves in the country which is part of the Table Mountain National Park and a UNESCO site. The reserve encompasses 7,750 hectares and has dramatic scenery, hike paths and pristine beaches.

name: Castle of Good Hope
address: Cnr. Of Castle and Darling Street, Cape Town, 8001, South Africa
description: This pentagon shaped fortress dates back to the 17th century and originally stood on the edge of Table Bay before land reclamation; today it is inland. The castle is considered the best preserved example of a Dutch East India Company fort it is also the oldest colonial building in South Africa.

name: Kirstenbosch National Botanical Garden
address: Rhodes Drive, Newlands, Cape Town, 7700, South Africa
description: These gardens are considered to be among the most beautiful in the country. The acclaimed gardens are on the slopes of Table Mountain in the heart of the Cape Floristic Region. The gardens were established in 1913 and today are part of the UNESCO listed Table Mountain National Park.

name: Two Oceans Aquarium
address: 40 Dock Rd, V & A Waterfront, Cape Town, 8001, South Africa
description: This amazing aquarium is located on the water’s edge on the W&A Waterfront where the Indian Ocean and Atlantic Ocean meet. Water from the sea is pumped into the aquarium exhibits. The aquarium has large glass windows and see-through tunnels where you can feel as if you are inside the tanks with the fish.

name: District Six Museum
address: 25A Buitenkant St, Zonnebloem, Cape Town, 8001, South Africa
description: District Six was established as a mixed race district in 1867 it was a community of artisans, immigrants, merchants and freed slaves. The colorful district had strong links to the city and port but as the 20th century began marginalization occurred and people began to be extracted and relocated according to race.

name: Robben Island
address: Robben Island, 7400, South Africa; Ferries leave from: Nelson Mandela Gateway, V&A Waterfront, Cape Town 8002.
description: This famous island is located in Table Bay; it covers an area of 5.07km and has flat terrain due to ancient erosion. Mention of the island was first recorded by Portuguese sailors in 1498.

name: Clifton Beach
address: Clifton Beach, Victoria Road, Clifton, Cape Town, South Africa
description: Clifton Beach is one of several magnificent beaches in Cape Town; located on the Atlantic coastline. Clifton Beach is in the affluent residential neighborhood of Clifton where you can find some of the country’s most expensive real estate. For this reason it is known as South Africa’s French Riviera.

name: Lion's Head
address: Lions Head, Cape Town, South Africa; entrance via Signal Hill Road at Base of Forestry Road via Kloof nek Road. You will see the car park and hike trail starts from there.
description: For stunning views of Cape Town take a hike up Lion’s Head. Lion’s Head is situated along side Table Mountain and is connected to Signal Hill (the Lion’s Rump) facing out to sea and Robben Island. It is part of the Table Mountain range providing a backdrop to the city.

name: Groot Constantia
address: Groot Constantia Estate, Groot Constantia Rd, Constantia, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa
description: Wine tasting is an integral part of any visit to Cape Town and this winery and vineyard is among the most popular wineries in the wine country. They have been producing wine for the last 300 years. Groot Constantia is a fully working farm and the producer of a wide range of estate wines.

name: South African Jewish Museum
address: 88 Hatfield Street, Gardens 8001, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: Visitors enter through the Old Synagogue, South Africa’s oldest synagogue built in 1863. A bridge connects the synagogue to the museum representing the gangway crossed by many Jewish immigrants who arrived in South Africa from Europe. The museum design was based on the proportions of King Solomon’s Mines.

name: Duiker (Seal) Island
address: Duiker Island, False Bay, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: Just 5.km off the coast of False Bay is this 5 acre island which is home to a colony of approximately 64,000 cape fur seals. The island is 800 meters long, 50 meters wide and juts out of the sea only 7 meters. Seal Island is actually called Duiker Island.

name: The Old Biscuit Mill
address: Old Biscuit Mill, 373-375 Albert Road, Woodstock, Cape Town, 7915, South Africa
description: The Old Biscuit Mill in the Woodstock neighborhood is a place where you can dine; see art work, shop for designer items and visit trendy markets. During the Apartheid era Woodstock remained integrated and became a “grey” area with working class colored and black residents moving into the area in the 70s and 80s.

name: Heart of Cape Town Museum
address: Groote Schuur Hospital, Block E, Main Road, Observatory, Cape Town
description: This museum is part of a museum complex in the Observatory neighborhood. It is housed in the Groote Schuur Hospital and focuses on the historic first human heart transplant performed by Doctor Christiaan Barnard at this hospital in 1967.

name: The Cape Wheel
address: The Cape Wheel, Dock Road, V & A Waterfront, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: The huge observatory wheel on the V & A Waterfront is similar to giant Ferris wheels like the London Eye; it offers panoramic views as you take the 360° ride in an enclosed air-conditioned capsule. There are 30 of these capsules each with large windows to give you the maximum viewing experience.

name: World of Birds
address: World of Birds Wildlife Sanctuary, Valley Road, Hout Bay, 7806, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: This is Africa’s largest bird park and is home more than 3,000 birds and animals representing 400 species. The park covers 100 landscaped gardens and walk-through aviaries.

name: Rhodes Memorial
address: Rhodes Memorial St, Table Mountain (Nature Reserve), Cape Town, South Africa
description: Cecil Rhodes (1853-1902) has become a controversial figure in post-Apartheid South Africa; he was a British born South African mining magnate, businessman, politician, colonist and also the Prime Minister of the Cape Colony from 1890 to 1896. He was a strong believer in British Imperialism and founded Rhodesia (now Zimbabwe).

name: Camps Bay Beach
address: Victoria Road, Camps Bay, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: Camps Bay is a trendy, prestigious neighborhood just 10 minutes from Cape Town city center on the Atlantic coastline with the backdrop of the twelve Apostles mountain range it also has one of the largest and most beautiful beaches. It is the St.

name: Signal Hill
address: Signal Hill, Cape Town, South Africa. Observation Point: via Kloof Nek Road.
description: Signal Hill connects Kloof Nek to Lion Head separating the City Bowl from the suburb of Sea Point and is one of the mounts protectively surrounding Cape Town inland facing the sea. It has also been known as Lion’s Rump or Flank (to go with Lion’s Head) and is a famous spot for watching the sunset.

name: Chavonnes Battery Museum
address: Clock Tower Precinct, V & A Waterfront, Cape Town, South Africa. (Opposite Nelson Mandela gateway)
description: This museum is on the site of the former fortifications of 18th century Cape Town; the fortifications were connected to the Castle of Good Hope which was built in 1725 by the Dutch East India Company. The battery was named after Maurits Pasques de Chavonnes, who served as governor of the Cape from 1714 to 1721.

name: St. George's Cathedral
address: 5 Wale Street, Cape Town, South Africa. (corner of Adderley, Government Avenue and Wale Street)
description: Cape Town is home to South Africa’s oldest cathedral. The idea for the church was born in 1827. The colonial government donated the land and the foundation stone was laid in 1830. The design was based on St. Pancras’ Church in London and the first service was held in 1834.

name: South African National Gallery
address: Government Avenue, Company's Garden, Cape Town, 8000, South Africa
description: The permanent exhibition of this museum focuses on symbols of South Africa and highlights the scope of art in South Africa. It is the country’s main art museum with a collection of African, Dutch, Flemish and French art mainly from the 17th to 19th century.

name: Vergelegen Wine Estate
address: Vergelegen Estate, Lourensford Road, Somerset West, 7129, Cape, South Africa.
description: A trip to Cape Town is not complete without an excursion into the wineland of the Cape. Vergelegen Estate is one of the most prestigious and famous of the wineries you can visit. The winery offers wine cellar tours, wine tastings and tours of the heritage sites and gardens.

name: Langa Township
address: Jan Smuts Drive, N2 and N7, Cape Town, South Africa.
description: Langa is Cape Town’s oldest township; in South Africa a township is an undeveloped urban living area usually dating back to the Apartheid era when townships were for non-whites only. Langa was established in 1923 when the Urban Areas Act forced non-white South Africans to live in separate locations from whites.

name: Djemaa el Fna Square
address: Jemaa El Fna Square, Medina, Marrakech, Morocco
description: The central square and market place in Marrakesh’s medina quarter is also called Djema el-Fna and Djemaa el-Fnaa. Back in 1050 it was the site of public executions (hence the name which means assembly of death) but today it is a hive of activity 24/7.

name: Koutoubia Mosque
description: Marrakesh’s largest mosque is located near Djemaa el-Fna square it is considered one of the most beautiful and proportioned mosques in existance. The Almohad conquered Marrakesh in 1150 and construction began on the mosque which was built on at the same place as an earlier Almoravid mosque.

name: Medina (Old Town) of Marrakech
description: The Old Town of Marrakesh is called the Medina Quarter. It is the most exciting place to be in the city and where you will probably spend a lot of your time. Several of the city’s most important landmarks are within the medina Quarter and the entire quarter is a UESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Bahia Palace
address: 5 Rue Riad Zitoun el Jdid, Marrakesh,40000, Morocco
description: The Bahia Palace and gardens were built in two stages by two men – father and son with the goal of featuring the finest Islamic and Moroccan style architecture and decoration making it one of the greatest palaces of its time.

name: Ben Youssef Medersa
description: The Medresa Ben Youssef was an Islamic college constructed during the Almoravid era (14th century) by the Marinid Sultan Abu al-Hassan and named after the Almoravid ruler Sultan Ali ben Youssef who reigned 1448-1458.

name: Majorelle Garden
address: Jardin Majorelle, Rue Yves St Laurent, Marrakech, Morocco
description: This garden was created over the course of forty years by French painter Jacques Majorelle (1886-1962). The park is one of the top attractions of Marrakesh; it has many shady paths meandering between tall trees and passed exotic plants. There are water features, streams and pools of water lilies and lotus flowers.

name: Marrakech Museum
address: Place Ben Youssef, Medina, Marrakesh, Morocco
description: This is a small museum with interesting architecture and a display of art including contemporary art. The museum is run by the Omar Benjelloun Foundation and housed in the Dar Menebhi Palace built by Mehdi Menebhi in the late 19th century.

name: Saadian Tombs
address: Rue de La Kasbah, Marrakesh, Morocco
description: The Saadian Dynasty or Saadi Dynasty ruled Morocco from 1554 to 1659 starting with the first Saadi Sultan, Mohammed ash-Sheikh and ending with the reign of Sultan Ahmad el-Abbas. Sultan Ahmed el Mansour had the tombs built during his reign and it became the burial ground for him and his descendants.

name: El Badi Palace
address: El Badi Palace, Place des Ferblantiers, Medina, Marrakesh, Morocco.
description: The “incomparable palace” has not survived in its entirety but it is still possible to see the ruined remains. The palace was commissioned by Saadian ruler Ahmad al-Mansur in the 16th century. The palace was built using money from retributions paid by the Portuguese after the War of the Three Kings.

name: Photography Museum
address: 46 Rue Souk Ahal Fassi, Kaat Ben Nahid, Medina, Marrakesh, 400030, Morocco
description: La Maison de la Photographie presents a collection of photographs taken in Morocco from the 1870s to 1950s. The museum is located in the Medina, Marrakesh’s Old City in a renovated funduq (a merchants’ inn). In all there are approximately 4,000 historic photos which illustrate the history of photography in Morocco.

name: The Jewish Quarter
description: The Jewish Quarter of Marrakesh is where for centuries the Jewish community lived and worked side by side with their Muslim neighbors. In cities across Morocco there are Jewish Quarters which exist like a city within a city.

name: The Berber Museum
address: Jardin Majorelle, Rue Yves Saint Laurent, Marrakech, Morocco
description: The Berber Museum lies in the compound of the Majorelle Garden.  This museum provides it's visitors with a peek into the Berber culture. The exhibition is divided into three sections: Domestic Life and Traditional Skills which the rich diversity of Berber traditional skills such as wood, pottery, metalwork and basket weaving.

name: Tiskiwin Museum
address: Musee Tiskiwin, 8 Rue de la Bahia, 40000, Marrakesh, Medina, Morocco.
description: The Musee Tiskiwin, Bert Flint Museum or Maison Tiskiwin is one of the most beautiful museums in the city. Through the rooms of the museum you can experience the various stops along the Sahara to Marrakesh trade route and gain an insight into the culture of each of the trade posts along the way.

name: Marrakech Ramparts
description: The walls of the Old City (Medina) of Marrakesh are built from orange-red clay (pise) and chalk giving them a pink tinge that has earned the city its nickname of the Red City. The walls were commissioned by Ali Ben Yousef of the Almoravid Dynasty and constructed in the 12th century to protect the city from attacks.

name: Menara Gardens
description: Menara Gardens and Pavilion are popular with locals and visitors who come here to escape the heat of the city and enjoy the oasis of greenery. The original gardens were planted in the 12th century during the reign of Almohad ruler Abd al-Mu’min.

name: Oukaimeden Valley
description: Oukaimeden is the site of one of the most popular and successful ski resorts in Africa and the highest ski lift on the continent. It is located 80km from Marrakesh in the Atlas Mountains. The ski slopes here reach heights of 2600-3200 altitude.

name: Jaffa Port
description: Jaffa Port is an ancient port, one of the oldest in the world that has played a significant role in history from the time of the Bible to today.  It is the place where Jonah set of from in the famous story of Jonah and the Whale.  It was also mentioned in the New Testament as well as in Greek mythology.

name: Jaffa Bazaar
address: little alleys between Yefet Street and Jerusalem Blvd
description: Located in this ancient port city near to the famous Clock Tower are a couple of alleyways that lead to the open air bazaar and flea market.

name: Tel Aviv Museum of Art
address: 27 Shaul Hamelech Blvd, Tel Aviv-Yafo, Israel
description: Envisioned by Tel Aviv’s first mayor, Meir Dizengoff, the Tel Aviv Museum of Art has grown into the largest art museum in the country. It is an impressive showcase of the works of old masters as well as the largest collection of Israeli art and contemporary culture.

name: Tel Aviv Promanade
address: Runs the length of the Tel Aviv beaches from north to south.
description: During the British Mandate Regime, around 1939, the British prohibited bathing at the beaches causing them to become neglected and abandoned.

name: Tel Aviv Port
description: Recently transformed into one of the hottest places to visit in Tel Aviv, the Port is a large center of entertainment filled with trendy stores, cafes and playgrounds and a splash park.  At night it is the epicenter of night life filled with large variety of bars and nightclubs to choose from.

name: Beit Hatfutsot
address: Tel Aviv University campus, Klauzner 15, Tel-Aviv

name: Rabin Square
description: Formerly known as Kings of Israel Square, Rabin Square is a large public area in the city center used for parades, political rallies, demonstrations and other types of public events.  After the assassination of Israel’s Prime Minister Yizhak Rabin in 1995, it was renamed the Rabin Square to honor his memory.

name: Clock Tower
description: One of Jaffa’s most recognized landmarks, the Clock Tower is located in a central square featuring 4 different clocks.  The Clock Tower was built by a Turkish Sultan in 1906 using contributions from both Arab and Jewish residents of the city.

name: Tel Aviv Beaches
description: Tel Aviv is famous for its 13 beautiful beaches spanning across 8.7 miles of magnificent views, blue horizons and stunning sunsets.  The climate of Tel Aviv allows for an extended official beach season starting in the beginning of May and ending at the end of October every year.

name: Western Wall
description: Considered one of the holiest sites in Judaism, the Western Wall is located in the Jewish Quarter of Jerusalem’s Old City.

name: Via Dolorosa
address: Via Dolorosa St, Old City, Jerusalem, Israel
description: Via Dolorosa (meaning the Way of Sorrows) is located in Jerusalem’s Old City and is believed to be the very path along which Jesus walked as approached his crucifixion. Christians have been coming to the city for many centuries to walk the same path as Jesus Christ.

name: Church of the Holy Sepulchre
address: Suq Khan e-Zeit and Christian Quarter Road. | Christian Quarter, Jerusalem, Israel
description: The most famous church in the world is undoubtedly the Church of the Holy Sepulchre which lies in Jerusalem’s Old City in the Christian Quarter.  The Church is also known as the Church of the Resurrection or the Church of Anastasis. The site is known as the place where Jesus Christ was crucified and buried.

name: Tower of David and Citadel
address: Tower of David – Museum of the History of Jerusalem, Jaffa Gate,
description: Located in the Old City of Jerusalem near to the Jaffa Gate, the Tower of David and Citadel has, for centuries, symbolized the city’s famous skyline.

name: Dome of the Rock
address: Near Temple Mount (Haram al-Sharif), Jerusalem, Israel
description: The golden dome which has come to symbolize Jerusalem’s famous skyline is the Dome of the Rock - a shrine on the Temple Mount that is located in the Old City.  This UNESCO World Heritage Site was completed in 691 CE and built on the site of the Roman Jupiter Capitonlinus Temple.

name: Israel Museum
address: Derech Ruppin 11, Hakyria, Opposite the Knesset, Jerusalem 9171002, Israel
description: Hailed as one of the world’s leading art and archaeology museums, the Israel Museum in Jerusalem boasts over half a million objects relating to the Bible, Jewish life, archaeology in the Holy Land and local and international art.  The Israel Museum was founded in 1965 and was designed by Alfred Mansfeld and Dora Gad.

name: Dominus Flevit Church
description: On the western slopes of Jerusalem’s Mount of Olives you will find the Church of Dominus Flevit (“The Lord Wept” in Latin). The tear-drop shaped church was designed and built by the Italian architect, Antonio Barluzzi, and was completed in 1955.

name: The Jewish Quarter
description: The Jewish Quarter is one of four quarters that make up Jerusalem’s walled Old City and dates back at least to the time of Christ.

name: City of David
description: The archaeological site of the City of David (Ir David in Hebrew) presents visitors with a fascinating glimpse into ancient Jerusalem as it looked in the years before the Jews were exiled to Babylon.

name: Yad Vashem
description: The Jewish state’s official memorial to the victims of the Nazi Holocaust is located on the slope of Mount Herzl in Jerusalem next to the Jerusalem Forest.

name: Bible Lands Museum
address: 21 Shmuel Stefan Wise Street, Museum Row, Jerusalem 9104601, Israel
description: Established in 1992, the Bible Lands Museum places into historical context those people who are mentioned in the Bible, including the ancient Canaanites, Egyptians and Philistines.  This archaeology museum exhibits literally hundreds of fascinating displays in 20 different sections.

name: The Christian Quarter
description: The second largest of the four quarters that make up the Old City of Jerusalem is the Christian Quarter. Narrow, winding alleys feed into slightly broader streets in this area that is considered one of the holiest in the Christian religion.

name: Mehane Yehuda Market
description: In the heart of Jerusalem lies the Mahane Yehuda Market, a bustling marketplace that manages to incorporate the ambience and authenticity of yesteryear Jerusalem with the last word in modern culinary establishments.

name: Armenian Quarter
description: Since the early days of Christianity, the Armenians have played an important role in Jerusalem, and the capital once boasted a thriving Armenian population.

name: The Davidson Center
address: Ma'alot ha-Rav Shlomo Goren St, Jerusalem, Israel
description: One of the largest and most significant archaeological parks in Israel is situated in the Old City of Jerusalem.  In the Jerusalem Archaeological Park, you will find the Davidson Exhibition and Virtual Reconstruction Center, which offers you a concise look into the history of Jerusalem.
